original: gal te spyi tha dad pa nyams su myong ba yin na de'i tshe dran pa 'di rigs kyi /
analyzed: gal te spyi tha dad pa nyams su myong ba yin na de'i tshe dran pa 'di rigs kyi /
translated: If you experience a different universal, then this memory is reasonable.

original: ji srid du khyed cag gang dag gis 'di nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i spyi mi 'dod de /
analyzed: ji srid du khyed cag gang dag gis 'di nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i spyi mi 'dod de /
translated: But you do not assert that a universal different from form and so on is experienced.

original: gzugs la sogs pa nyams su myong ba la gzugs la sogs pa'o snyam par 'gyur gyi bum pa'o snyam du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa nyams su myong ba la gzugs la sogs pa'o snyam par 'gyur gyi bum pa'o snyam du ni ma yin no //
translated: When form and so on are experienced, the thought form and so on arises, but the thought pot does not arise.

original: nyams su ma myong ba dran par mi rigs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: nyams su ma myong ba dran par mi rigs pa ma yin nam /
translated: But is it not illogical to remember what was not experienced?

original: de ji ltar spyi'i yul can gyi dran pa'i shes pa 'di skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar spyi'i yul can gyi dran pa'i shes pa 'di skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How could this memory consciousness that has a universal as its object arise?

original: de ni med de /
analyzed: de ni med de /
translated: That is not so.

original: gang gis der 'gyur ba gzugs la sogs pa las gzhan spyi sngar myong ba yin no zhes ni mi brjod kyi /
analyzed: gang gis der 'gyur ba gzugs la sogs pa las gzhan spyi sngar myong ba yin no zhes ni mi brjod kyi /
translated: We do not say that a universal different from form and so on is experienced there.

original: 'on kyang chu la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i don bya ba byed pa gzugs la sogs pa de dag nyid tshogs pa dang bum pa zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang chu la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i don bya ba byed pa gzugs la sogs pa de dag nyid tshogs pa dang bum pa zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: But the collection of those forms and so on that perform the action of apprehending water and so on is called a pot.

original: dbang po'i shes pas so sor nyams su myong ba de dag la ji lta ba bzhin du brda byas pa'i khyad par bum pa zhes dran pa skye'o zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pas so sor nyams su myong ba de dag la ji lta ba bzhin du brda byas pa'i khyad par bum pa zhes dran pa skye'o zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: and the memory ‚Äúpot‚Äù arises, which is a special designation that corresponds to the experience of the sense consciousness.

original: yang na spyi ni brtags pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na spyi ni brtags pa yin te /
translated: Or else, the universal is imagined,

original: rtog pa'i shes pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir rig pa nyams su myong ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa'i shes pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir rig pa nyams su myong ba nyid yin no //
translated: because it is the nature of a conceptual consciousness, it is the experience of awareness.

original: de lta bas na ci'i phyir de'i dran pa mi 'thad /
analyzed: de lta bas na ci'i phyir de'i dran pa mi 'thad /
translated: Therefore, why is it not tenable that it is the object of memory?

original: de'i phyir rang rtsom par byed pa'i cha shas kyi dbyibs kyi khyad par dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di gzhi ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang rtsom par byed pa'i cha shas kyi dbyibs kyi khyad par dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di gzhi ma grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this reason, ‚Äúbecause it possesses the special shape of the parts that compose it,‚Äù is not established.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i chos can ni ma grub phyir na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i chos can ni ma grub phyir na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because the subject that is described is not established.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i dbang po gnyis kyis gzung bar bya ba'i chos can ma grub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i dbang po gnyis kyis gzung bar bya ba'i chos can ma grub pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the subject that is apprehended by the two sense faculties, as described, is not established.

original: rgyu'i phyir gzhi'i phyogs gcig ma grub pas gtan tshigs ma grub bo //üîΩdes na de ltar na khyad par can dang / khyad @171a * //
analyzed: rgyu'i phyir gzhi'i phyogs gcig ma grub pas gtan tshigs ma grub bo // des na de ltar na khyad par can dang / khyad @171a * //
translated: The reason is unestablished because one part of the basis is not established.

original: par dang / gzhi ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa rnam pa gsum bstan to //
analyzed: par dang / gzhi ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa rnam pa gsum bstan to //
translated: Thus, the reason is unestablished in three ways: because of the unestablished whole, because of the unestablished distinction, and because of the unestablished basis.

original: slob dpon gyis bstan pa'i ma grub pa rnam pa bzhi pa ni dbyibs kyi khyad par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //üîΩgang zhig mthong bas byed pa po ma mthong ba dag kyang blo dang ldan pa'i rgyu rtogs par 'gyur ba lha khang la sogs pa la dbyibs kyi khyad par gang zhig rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis blo dang ldan pa'i skyes bu'i byed pa sngon
analyzed: slob dpon gyis bstan pa'i ma grub pa rnam pa bzhi pa ni dbyibs kyi khyad par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // gang zhig mthong bas byed pa po ma mthong ba dag kyang blo dang ldan pa'i rgyu rtogs par 'gyur ba lha khang la sogs pa la dbyibs kyi khyad par gang zhig rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis blo dang ldan pa'i skyes bu'i byed pa sngon
translated: The master [DignƒÅga] presents a fourth type of unestablished reason:üîΩThe shape of a temple and so on is established in the world as the effect of an intelligent agent, because it is a shape that is observed to exist when there is an intelligent agent and is not observed to exist when there is not.

original: du 'gro ba can nyid du 'jig rten na grub pa yin no //
analyzed: du 'gro ba can nyid du 'jig rten na grub pa yin no //
translated: The shape of a temple and so on is established in the world as preceded by the activity of an intelligent agent, because it is a shape that is observed to exist when there is an intelligent agent and is not observed to exist when there is not.

original: gal te de lta bur gyur pa lus dang / shing dang / ri la sogs pa bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la gtan tshigs nyid du khas len na /
analyzed: gal te de lta bur gyur pa lus dang / shing dang / ri la sogs pa bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la gtan tshigs nyid du khas len na /
translated: If you accept that such a thing is the logical reason in regard to the subject, which is to be established as a body, a tree, a mountain, etc.,

original: de'i tshe khyed cag gi 'dod pa'i bsgrub bya 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe khyed cag gi 'dod pa'i bsgrub bya 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: then at that time the probandum, which you accept, would be established.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis shin tu rnam par phye ba'i 'bras bu ni rgyu la 'khrul pa med de /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis shin tu rnam par phye ba'i 'bras bu ni rgyu la 'khrul pa med de /
translated: The effect, which is very well distinguished by the positive and negative concomitances, is not mistaken in regard to the cause,

original: de rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that it would be causeless.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i dbyibs kyi khyad par ni shing la sogs pa la grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i dbyibs kyi khyad par ni shing la sogs pa la grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Such a particular shape is not established in a tree, etc.

original: dbyibs zhes bya ba'i ming tsam grub pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: dbyibs zhes bya ba'i ming tsam grub pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: It is only the mere name ‚Äúshape‚Äù that is established.

original: chos ni rang bzhin gyis phan tshun don gzhan nyid du gnas na yang sgra tsam gyis tha mi dad par gtan tshigs nyid du len pa na mngon par 'dod pa'i bsgrub bya sgrub par nus pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: chos ni rang bzhin gyis phan tshun don gzhan nyid du gnas na yang sgra tsam gyis tha mi dad par gtan tshigs nyid du len pa na mngon par 'dod pa'i bsgrub bya sgrub par nus pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Even though phenomena exist as different objects by virtue of their own nature, when one accepts a mere sound as the logical reason, without distinguishing it, one is not able to establish the probandum that one desires.

original: bsgrub bya las bzlog pa yang de yod par 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub bya las bzlog pa yang de yod par 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no contradiction in the existence of the opposite of the probandum.

original: dper na chos can grog mkhar la rdza mkhan gyis byas pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba la /
analyzed: dper na chos can grog mkhar la rdza mkhan gyis byas pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba la /
translated: For example, in the proof that an anthill is the product of a potter,

original: 'jim pa'i rnam par gyur pa tsam gtan tshigs nyid du khas blangs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni spyi'i don to //
analyzed: 'jim pa'i rnam par gyur pa tsam gtan tshigs nyid du khas blangs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni spyi'i don to //
translated: the mere transformation of clay is accepted as the reason. This is the general meaning.

original: yan lag gi don yang brjod par bya ste /üîΩgang mthong blo dang ldan rtogs pa //
analyzed: yan lag gi don yang brjod par bya ste / gang mthong blo dang ldan rtogs pa //
translated: The subsidiary meaning should also be stated.üîΩThe shape that is seen by the intelligent person is the reason.

original: zhes bya ba ni dbyibs gang zhig mthong ba yod na blo dang ldan pa'i rgyu rtogs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dbyibs gang zhig mthong ba yod na blo dang ldan pa'i rgyu rtogs te /
translated: The word seen means that when the shape is seen, the intelligent person understands the cause,

original: rjes su dpog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩlus dang ri sogs zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rjes su dpog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to // lus dang ri sogs zhes bya ba la /
translated: that is, infers it.

original: lus ni lus so //
analyzed: lus ni lus so //
translated: The word body refers to the body.

original: ri ni ri bo'am shing ngo//
analyzed: ri ni ri bo'am shing ngo//
translated: The word mountain refers to a mountain or a tree.

original: sogs pa'i sgras rgya mtsho la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras rgya mtsho la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The word etc. includes the ocean and so on.

original: ji lta bur 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni blo dang ldan pa sngon du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: ji lta bur 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni blo dang ldan pa sngon du 'gro ba'o //
translated: The word as desired means preceded by the intelligent person.

original: sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'o //üîΩji ltar rigs she na /
analyzed: sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'o // ji ltar rigs she na /
translated: The word sƒÅdhana means proof.

original: rjes su 'gro dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: How is it proper? He says, Because of concomitance, etc.

original: 'bras bu gang zhes bya ba ni du ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu gang zhes bya ba ni du ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The word that refers to the effect, such as smoke, etc.

original: gang gis @171b zhes bya ba ni me la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis @171b zhes bya ba ni me la sogs pa'o //
translated: The word by which refers to the cause, such as fire, etc.

original: de mthong zhes bya ba ni du ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu mthong ba yod na'o //
analyzed: de mthong zhes bya ba ni du ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu mthong ba yod na'o //
translated: The word seeing refers to the existence of the seeing of the effect, such as smoke, etc.

original: de nges zhes bya ba ni me la sogs pa nyid du'o //üîΩgal te de lta na 'di la yang de kho na bzhin du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de nges zhes bya ba ni me la sogs pa nyid du'o // gal te de lta na 'di la yang de kho na bzhin du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: The word certainty refers to the certainty of fire, etc.

original: dbyibs kyi khyad par de lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩ'o na dbyibs kyi sgra'i spyi grub pa gang yin pa de nyid gtan tshigs su 'gyur ro zhe na //
analyzed: dbyibs kyi khyad par de lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / 'o na dbyibs kyi sgra'i spyi grub pa gang yin pa de nyid gtan tshigs su 'gyur ro zhe na //
translated: If it is so, then this also will be just like that. He says, The particular shape, etc.

original: de lta bu ni rab brjod na'ang //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de lta bu ni rab brjod na'ang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If it is so, then the establishment of the universal of the word 'shape' will be the reason. He says, Even though such, etc.

original: de lta bu ni sgra tsam gyis tha mi dad pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu ni sgra tsam gyis tha mi dad pa'o //
translated: The word such refers to the non-difference by mere word.

original: rdza mkhan gyis ni byas pa bzhin //
analyzed: rdza mkhan gyis ni byas pa bzhin //
translated: Like that made by the potter, etc.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: üîΩüîΩ

original: 'ji ba'i rnam par 'gyur ba tsam nyid ces bya ba lhag ma'o //üîΩde lta bas na de ltar dbyibs kyi khyad par ni ma grub la /
analyzed: 'ji ba'i rnam par 'gyur ba tsam nyid ces bya ba lhag ma'o // de lta bas na de ltar dbyibs kyi khyad par ni ma grub la /
translated: The rest is self-evident.üîΩThus, the difference in shape is not established.

original: dbyibs tsam yang ma nges pa yin na zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbyibs tsam yang ma nges pa yin na zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: And if shape itself is not ascertained, then the opponent‚Äôs reductio argument is not established.

original: chos kyi khyad par zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi ltag chod rjod par byed de /
analyzed: chos kyi khyad par zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi ltag chod rjod par byed de /
translated: The opponent‚Äôs reductio argument is stated in the lines beginning, ‚ÄúIf you say that the difference in the sound is due to the difference in the sound itself.

original: 'di ni 'bras bu dang mtshungs pa'i ltag chod yin no //üîΩ'di ltar sgra ni mi rtag ste /
analyzed: 'di ni 'bras bu dang mtshungs pa'i ltag chod yin no // 'di ltar sgra ni mi rtag ste /
translated: This is a reductio argument that is similar to the effect.

original: byas pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa la /
analyzed: byas pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa la /
translated: For example, someone says, ‚ÄúSound is impermanent, because it is produced.‚Äù

original: ltag chod smra ba klan ka byed de /
analyzed: ltag chod smra ba klan ka byed de /
translated: The opponent, who is making a reductio argument, criticizes this, saying,

original: ci 'di bum pa la sogs par gtogs pa'i byas pa nyid gtan tshigs su brjod dam /üîΩci sgrar gtogs pa'am /
analyzed: ci 'di bum pa la sogs par gtogs pa'i byas pa nyid gtan tshigs su brjod dam / ci sgrar gtogs pa'am /
translated: ‚ÄúAre you stating as the reason ‚Äòthe fact that it is produced, which is included in such things as the pot‚Äô?üîΩOr is it ‚Äòthe fact that it is produced, which is included in sound‚Äô?

original: 'on te gnyi gar gtogs pa yin grang /
analyzed: 'on te gnyi gar gtogs pa yin grang /
translated: Or is it ‚Äòthe fact that it is produced, which is included in both‚Äô?

original: phyogs dang po ltar na gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: phyogs dang po ltar na gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin te /
translated: If it is the first, then the reason is not established.

original: 'di ltar chos gzhan gzhan du 'jug pa ni med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos gzhan gzhan du 'jug pa ni med do //
translated: For in this way, one phenomenon cannot be included in another.

original: gnyis pa la yang dpe sgrub byed dang bral ba yin la /
analyzed: gnyis pa la yang dpe sgrub byed dang bral ba yin la /
translated: The second is also devoid of an example and proof.

original: gsum pa la yang skyon de dag nyid yod pa yin pa'i phyir 'di 'bras bu dang mtshungs ba zhes bya ba'i ltag chod yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gsum pa la yang skyon de dag nyid yod pa yin pa'i phyir 'di 'bras bu dang mtshungs ba zhes bya ba'i ltag chod yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: The third is also subject to the same faults. Therefore, this is a reductio that is similar to the conclusion.

original: ji skad du 'bras bu nyid gzhan gyi shan gyis grub par bstan pa gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu dang mtshungs pa'o zhes smras pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji skad du 'bras bu nyid gzhan gyi shan gyis grub par bstan pa gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu dang mtshungs pa'o zhes smras pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it was said, ‚ÄúWhatever is taught to be established by the power of another is similar to the conclusion.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir 'bras bu nyid kyi spyi bzung nas mi rtag pa nyid rjes su dpog par 'dod kyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'bras bu nyid kyi spyi bzung nas mi rtag pa nyid rjes su dpog par 'dod kyi /
translated: Because one wishes to infer impermanence by apprehending the universal of product,

original: khyad par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: khyad par ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the particular.

original: des na spyi'i sgo nas sgrub byed du 'dod la /
analyzed: des na spyi'i sgo nas sgrub byed du 'dod la /
translated: Therefore, the proof is asserted in terms of the universal.

original: chos kyi khyad par rnam par rtog pa'i sgo nas lan 'debs pa gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu dang mtshungs pa'i ltag chod ces rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: chos kyi khyad par rnam par rtog pa'i sgo nas lan 'debs pa gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu dang mtshungs pa'i ltag chod ces rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Whatever answer is given by way of conceptualizing a particular quality of an object is posited as a reductio that is similar to the conclusion.

original: 'di yang chos kyi khyad par gyis rnam par rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang chos kyi khyad par gyis rnam par rtog pa yin no //
translated: This is also a conceptualization of a particular quality of an object.

original: de phyir ltag chod yin no //
analyzed: de phyir ltag chod yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is a reductio.

original: de yis ngo bo min las log / ces bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs pa'o //üîΩgang byas pa @172a * //
analyzed: de yis ngo bo min las log / ces bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs pa'o // gang byas pa @172a * //
translated: The response to that is: ‚ÄúIt is excluded from what is not its nature.‚Äù

original: nyid tsam mi rtag pa nyid sgrub par byed do zhes bya ba 'di ni rigs te /
analyzed: nyid tsam mi rtag pa nyid sgrub par byed do zhes bya ba 'di ni rigs te /
translated: It is not correct to prove that mere what is produced is impermanent,

original: de la de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is a relation of the nature of identity in that.

original: rang rtsom par byed pa'i cha shas kyi dbyibs kyi khyad par can nyid tsam gyi sgrub par byed pa 'di la 'di mi rigs te /
analyzed: rang rtsom par byed pa'i cha shas kyi dbyibs kyi khyad par can nyid tsam gyi sgrub par byed pa 'di la 'di mi rigs te /
translated: This proof of mere what has the distinction of shape of the parts that make it up is not correct,

original: dbyibs kyi spyi la ni bzlog pa la gnod par byed pa me dpas 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbyibs kyi spyi la ni bzlog pa la gnod par byed pa me dpas 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because in the case of the universal shape, the relation is not established by the reason that refutes the opposite.

original: gang zhig dmigs pas byed pa ma mthong yang byas pa'i blor 'gyur ba de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa grub pa'i khyad par gang zhig ma grub pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig dmigs pas byed pa ma mthong yang byas pa'i blor 'gyur ba de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa grub pa'i khyad par gang zhig ma grub pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: It is thought that the relation of the nature of arising from that is not established, because although one sees that which is observed, one does not see the activity, and one thinks that what is produced is the mind.

original: ci ste de las byung ba'i 'brel pa'i khyad par spangs nas spyi nyid rtags su brjod pa de'i tshe 'khrul pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ci ste de las byung ba'i 'brel pa'i khyad par spangs nas spyi nyid rtags su brjod pa de'i tshe 'khrul pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: But if, having abandoned the specific relation that arises from that, one expresses the universal itself as the reason, then it is mistaken.

original: du ba'i bdag nyid skya bo dag / ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: du ba'i bdag nyid skya bo dag / ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says, ‚ÄúThe pale color of smoke,‚Äù and so on.üîΩThe pale color of smoke is seen to not occur without fire.

original: du ba'i bdag nyid kyi skya bo'i dngos po me med na mi 'byung bar mthong ba zhes bya ba de tsam gyis skya bo'i sgras brjod par bya ba tsam gyi spyi yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: du ba'i bdag nyid kyi skya bo'i dngos po me med na mi 'byung bar mthong ba zhes bya ba de tsam gyis skya bo'i sgras brjod par bya ba tsam gyi spyi yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of that, the mere universal that is the mere object of expression by the word ‚Äúpale‚Äù is the reason.

original: kha ba las kyang me de rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha ba las kyang me de rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, fire is understood even from snow.

original: 'o na ji ltar 'bras bu dang mtshungs pa ltag chod du brjod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar 'bras bu dang mtshungs pa ltag chod du brjod ce na /
translated: Well, then, how is it said that it is a reductio that is similar to the effect?

original: spyir 'brel pa la gang gi tshe //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: spyir 'brel pa la gang gi tshe //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In general, with regard to relations,üîΩwhen the universal of smoke is the reason,

original: bsgrub bya dang lhan cig sgrub par byed pa'i chos spyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma 'jug pas 'brel pa grub na yang gang du chos kyi khyad par la brten nas klan na byed pa de ni ltag chod yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub bya dang lhan cig sgrub par byed pa'i chos spyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma 'jug pas 'brel pa grub na yang gang du chos kyi khyad par la brten nas klan na byed pa de ni ltag chod yin no //
translated: If the relation is established by the application of a valid cognition that harms the opponent‚Äôs position in general, then it is a reductio.

original: 'di la ni spyir 'brel pa ma grub la /
analyzed: 'di la ni spyir 'brel pa ma grub la /
translated: But in this case, the relation is not established in general.

original: gang la dbyibs la khyad par gyi 'brel pa yod pa dam grub pa'i phyir 'di ltag chod ma yin no //
analyzed: gang la dbyibs la khyad par gyi 'brel pa yod pa dam grub pa'i phyir 'di ltag chod ma yin no //
translated: And in the case where the relation is established by the specific shape, it is not a reductio.

original: 'on te 'brel pa med kyang spyi go bar byed pa yin na /
analyzed: 'on te 'brel pa med kyang spyi go bar byed pa yin na /
translated: But if, even though the relation is not established, the universal is understood,

original: de'i tshe ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩgal te rnam pa gzhan du na //
analyzed: de'i tshe ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir / gal te rnam pa gzhan du na //
translated: then it would follow, absurdly, that anything could prove anything.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says, ‚ÄúIf it were otherwise, then . . .‚Äù

original: de lta na mtho ris dang / phyogs dang / sa dang / ngag dang / mig dang / 'od zer dang / rdo rje dang / chu rnams kyang go'i sgras brjod par bya ba tsam yin pa'i phyir khu yu'i be'u la sogs pa bzhin du rva can du rjes su dpog par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na mtho ris dang / phyogs dang / sa dang / ngag dang / mig dang / 'od zer dang / rdo rje dang / chu rnams kyang go'i sgras brjod par bya ba tsam yin pa'i phyir khu yu'i be'u la sogs pa bzhin du rva can du rjes su dpog par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, it follows that heaven, direction, earth, speech, eye, light ray, vajra, and water would be mere expressions by the word ‚Äúgo,‚Äù and like a calf of a cow, they would be inferred to have horns.

original: 'di snyam du byas pa la sogs pa bzhin du dbyibs kyi khyad par ldan pa 'di yang blo dang ldan pa'i rgyu sngon du 'gro ba nyid kyis 'brel pa yod pa nyid do snyam du sems na /üîΩgal te 'di la @172b 'brel pa ni //
analyzed: 'di snyam du byas pa la sogs pa bzhin du dbyibs kyi khyad par ldan pa 'di yang blo dang ldan pa'i rgyu sngon du 'gro ba nyid kyis 'brel pa yod pa nyid do snyam du sems na / gal te 'di la @172b 'brel pa ni //
translated: If you think that like a product, this particular shape is also related to the prior cause of an intelligent agent,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains: If there is no relationüîΩbetween the intelligent agent and the product,üîΩhow could the product arise from the intelligent agent?

original: 'on kyang 'brel pa de nyid ma grub pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir 'on kyang rtag gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'brel pa de nyid ma grub pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir 'on kyang rtag gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If there is no relation between the intelligent agent and the product, how could the product arise from the intelligent agent?

original: khyed cag gis blo dang ldan pa sngon du 'gro ba nyid tsam bsgrub par 'dod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: khyed cag gis blo dang ldan pa sngon du 'gro ba nyid tsam bsgrub par 'dod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: However, you do not assert that the mere prior existence of an intelligent agent is established.

original: 'on kyang dbang phyug ces bya brtag pa gcig pu thams cad shes pa'i blo rtag pa'i rten srid pa thams cad kyi rgyu blo dang ldan pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de sngon du 'gro ba can 'di bsgrub par 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang dbang phyug ces bya brtag pa gcig pu thams cad shes pa'i blo rtag pa'i rten srid pa thams cad kyi rgyu blo dang ldan pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de sngon du 'gro ba can 'di bsgrub par 'dod pa yin te /
translated: However, the so-called ‚Äúƒ™≈õvara‚Äù is a permanent cognition that knows everything, the basis of all things, the cause of all things, and the intelligent entity that precedes this creation.

original: de nyid rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is the basis of the dispute.

original: de lta bur gyur pa de yang grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa de yang grub pa ma yin no //
translated: But that is not established.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: bsgrub bya mtshang bas khyab pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub bya mtshang bas khyab pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the pervasion of the probandum by the reason is not established.

original: bum pa la sogs pa chos mthun pa nyid kyi dpe la ji skad du bshad pa'i bsgrub bya'i chos ma tshang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa chos mthun pa nyid kyi dpe la ji skad du bshad pa'i bsgrub bya'i chos ma tshang ba'i phyir /
translated: Because the example of a pot, etc., which is similar to the property of the subject, lacks the complete probandum property as explained.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i bsgrub bya'i chos kyi gtan tshigs la khyab pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i bsgrub bya'i chos kyi gtan tshigs la khyab pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the reason is not pervaded by the probandum property in that way.

original: dpe 'ga' zhig la yang ji skad du bshad pa'i bsgrub bya'i chos dang gtan tshigs 'brel pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dpe 'ga' zhig la yang ji skad du bshad pa'i bsgrub bya'i chos dang gtan tshigs 'brel pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In some examples, there is no relationship between the property to be established and the reason as they have been explained.

original: 'di nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says,

original: 'di ltar skar khung zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'di ltar skar khung zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúFor example, a window,‚Äù and so on.

original: gzhan yang gtan tshigs ma grub pa dang ma nges pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad de /
analyzed: gzhan yang gtan tshigs ma grub pa dang ma nges pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad de /
translated: Moreover, the reason is not only unestablished and indefinite,

original: 'on kyang 'gal pa yang yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'gal pa yang yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: but also contradictory.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya bsgrub bya las bzlog pa'i chos kyis khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya bsgrub bya las bzlog pa'i chos kyis khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says, ‚ÄúFor this very reason,‚Äù and so on. For this very reason means because of the pervasion by the property opposite from the probandum.

original: yang gi sgras ni sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis ma grub pa dang ma nges pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi 'gal ba yang yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: yang gi sgras ni sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis ma grub pa dang ma nges pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi 'gal ba yang yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù explains that the reason is not only unestablished and indefinite in the manner previously explained, but also contradictory.

original: 'on te bzlog pa la 'brel ba yod na 'gal bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'on te bzlog pa la 'brel ba yod na 'gal bar 'gyur na /
translated: But if there is a relationship with the opposite, then there is contradiction.

original: blo dang ldan pa sngon du 'gro ba tsam la yang 'brel pa med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: blo dang ldan pa sngon du 'gro ba tsam la yang 'brel pa med pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it the case that mere prior possession of intelligence is not related to the effect?

original: de ji ltar de'i khyad par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar de'i khyad par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How could it be a specific cause of that?

original: blo dang ldan pa tsam rgyu la //
analyzed: blo dang ldan pa tsam rgyu la //
translated: The opponent says: The mere cause of possession of intelligence

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: dbang phyug rgyu smra ba khyod kyis blo dang ldan pa'i rgyu tsam dang 'brel par brjod la /
analyzed: dbang phyug rgyu smra ba khyod kyis blo dang ldan pa'i rgyu tsam dang 'brel par brjod la /
translated: You, the proponent of ƒ™≈õvara as the cause, say that mere possession of intelligence is related to the effect.

original: gzhan du spyi dang yang 'brel pa ma grub na /
analyzed: gzhan du spyi dang yang 'brel pa ma grub na /
translated: But if it is not established that the general cause is related to the effect,

original: ji ltar dngos po rnams dbang phyug gi rgyu can du 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po rnams dbang phyug gi rgyu can du 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: how could it be established that things are caused by ƒ™≈õvara?

original: de lta bas na khyed cag gis 'dod pa blo dang ldan pa sngon du 'gro ba tsam grub pa nyid du khas blangs nas /
analyzed: de lta bas na khyed cag gis 'dod pa blo dang ldan pa sngon du 'gro ba tsam grub pa nyid du khas blangs nas /
translated: Therefore, you accept that mere prior possession of intelligence is established as the cause.

original: khyed cag gis 'dod pa'i bsgrub bya'i @173a * //
analyzed: khyed cag gis 'dod pa'i bsgrub bya'i @173a * //
translated: But you do not accept that the effect

original: khyad par las gnyis pa mi rtag ba du ma'i rnam par shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi mtshan nyid 'dod pa las bzlog pa'i bsgrub par bya ba gnyis pa gang yin pa de la kho bo cag gis bsgrub bya'i khyad bar dang / gtan tshigs kyi 'brel pa gsal bar brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: khyad par las gnyis pa mi rtag ba du ma'i rnam par shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi mtshan nyid 'dod pa las bzlog pa'i bsgrub par bya ba gnyis pa gang yin pa de la kho bo cag gis bsgrub bya'i khyad bar dang / gtan tshigs kyi 'brel pa gsal bar brjod pa yin no //
translated: In particular, we have clearly stated the specific probandum and the relation of the reason to the specific probandum, which is the opposite of the assertion that the characteristic of the consciousness that is the basis of the many impermanent things is the second probandum.

original: ji ltar 'di gsal bar brjod ce na /üîΩrtag pa rim dang rim ma yin //
analyzed: ji ltar 'di gsal bar brjod ce na / rtag pa rim dang rim ma yin //
translated: How is this clearly stated?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is stated in the lines:üîΩ‚ÄúThe permanent does not act in succession or non-succession.‚Äù

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa rtag pa'i dngos po rnams ni 'bras bu byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa rtag pa'i dngos po rnams ni 'bras bu byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The permanent things such as God do not produce effects,

original: rtag ba ni rim dang cig car dag gis don byed par 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag ba ni rim dang cig car dag gis don byed par 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is contradictory for the permanent to act either in succession or simultaneously.

original: de lta bas na mi rtag pa kho na don gyi bya ba byed de /
analyzed: de lta bas na mi rtag pa kho na don gyi bya ba byed de /
translated: Therefore, only the impermanent produces effects.

original: de dag kyang skad cig re rer rang bzhin gzhan dang gzhan 'byung ba yin pas mi rtag pa nyid dang / du ma nyid kyi blo dang ldan pa'i byed pa po grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang skad cig re rer rang bzhin gzhan dang gzhan 'byung ba yin pas mi rtag pa nyid dang / du ma nyid kyi blo dang ldan pa'i byed pa po grub pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, since they arise as other natures in each moment, they are impermanent, and the agent is established as having many cognitions.

original: gang yang dbang phyug rtag pa gcig pu'i blo dang ldan pa nyid du dam bcas pa de yang rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang yang dbang phyug rtag pa gcig pu'i blo dang ldan pa nyid du dam bcas pa de yang rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Also, the assertion that ƒ™≈õvara is permanent and has a unitary cognition is contradicted by inference.

original: yul rnams rim can zhes bya ba la sogs ba smos so //
analyzed: yul rnams rim can zhes bya ba la sogs ba smos so //
translated: To demonstrate this, he says, ‚ÄúThe objects are sequential,‚Äù and so on.

original: shes bya rim can zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshad ma ston te /
analyzed: shes bya rim can zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshad ma ston te /
translated: He shows the valid cognition by saying, ‚ÄúThe objects of cognition are sequential,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang rim pa can gyi shes bya'i yul can gyi shes pa de ni rim gyis 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: gang rim pa can gyi shes bya'i yul can gyi shes pa de ni rim gyis 'byung ba yin te /
translated: The cognition that has sequential objects of cognition arises sequentially.

original: dper na lha spyin la sogs pa'i me lce la sogs pa'i yul can gyi rnam par shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na lha spyin la sogs pa'i me lce la sogs pa'i yul can gyi rnam par shes pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the consciousness that has the objects of Devadatta‚Äôs flame and so on.

original: dbang phyug gi shes pa yang shes bya rim can gyi yul can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: dbang phyug gi shes pa yang shes bya rim can gyi yul can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The cognition of God also has a sequential object. This is a reason based on nature.

original: 'di ni thal ba bsgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni thal ba bsgrub pa yin te /
translated: This is a reductio argument.

original: des na gtan tshigs gzhi ma grub pa nyid du dogs par mi bya'o //
analyzed: des na gtan tshigs gzhi ma grub pa nyid du dogs par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, you should not fear that the reason is not established.

original: spyi la sogs ba'i tshig gi don gyi yul can gyi lha spyin la sogs pa'i shes pa ni sgrub par byed pa'i chos dang bral ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: spyi la sogs ba'i tshig gi don gyi yul can gyi lha spyin la sogs pa'i shes pa ni sgrub par byed pa'i chos dang bral ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The cognition of Devadatta, which has as its object a general property and so on, is devoid of the property to be proven.

original: me lce la sogs ba'i yul can dper brjod do //
analyzed: me lce la sogs ba'i yul can dper brjod do //
translated: The example is the cognition of a flame and so on.

original: yang 'di la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang 'di la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the valid cognition that contradicts this?

original: brjod pa / gal te rim pa dang ldan pa'i yul gyi dbang phyug gi shes ba de sna tshogs su snang ba skye bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: brjod pa / gal te rim pa dang ldan pa'i yul gyi dbang phyug gi shes ba de sna tshogs su snang ba skye bar 'gyur na /
translated: We say: If the cognition of God, which has a sequential object, were to arise as a variety,

original: de'i tshe rim pa can du grub ba nyid do //
analyzed: de'i tshe rim pa can du grub ba nyid do //
translated: then it would be established as sequential.

original: gal te mi skye na de'i tshe nye ba'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir de shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te mi skye na de'i tshe nye ba'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir de shes pa ma yin no //
translated: If it does not arise, then it is not a cognition because it has no proximate object.

original: yul med na yang 'byung ba skye ba khas blangs pa'i tshad ma nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul med na yang 'byung ba skye ba khas blangs pa'i tshad ma nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is no object, then the valid cognition that accepts the arising of elements is undermined.

original: zhig @173b ba dang ma skyes pa'i yul can la yul med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni 'dir gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma'o //üîΩgang yang / chos mi mthun pa rdul du 'dod //
analyzed: zhig @173b ba dang ma skyes pa'i yul can la yul med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni 'dir gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma'o // gang yang / chos mi mthun pa rdul du 'dod //
translated: The consequence is that the subject, which is destroyed or not yet arisen, would have no object. This is the undermining valid cognition in this case.üîΩAlso, the statement, ‚ÄúThe dissimilar example is asserted to be the atom,‚Äù

original: ces gang brjod pa de yang chos mi mthun pa'i dpe la bsgrub bya'i chos ldog pa med pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ces gang brjod pa de yang chos mi mthun pa'i dpe la bsgrub bya'i chos ldog pa med pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: is stated in order to show that the property of the probandum is not absent in the dissimilar example.

original: kho bo cag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: kho bo cag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To that, the response is ‚ÄúWe do not assert that the atom is the cause of the coarse.‚Äù

original: yan lag can rgyas par 'gegs par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / bgag zin bas de'i phyir rdza mkhan la sogs ba rdul phra rab kho na'i byed pa po nyid du grub po //
analyzed: yan lag can rgyas par 'gegs par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / bgag zin bas de'i phyir rdza mkhan la sogs ba rdul phra rab kho na'i byed pa po nyid du grub po //
translated: Because the coarse is extensively refuted, and because it has already been refuted, therefore the potter and so on are established as the agents of only the atom.

original: de'i phyir blo dang ldan ba sngon du 'gro ba can bsgrub bya'i chos chos mi mthun par bstan pa'i rdul phra rab dag las ldog pa med pa'i phyir bsgrub bya'i chos ldog pa med pa ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'i skyon yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir blo dang ldan ba sngon du 'gro ba can bsgrub bya'i chos chos mi mthun par bstan pa'i rdul phra rab dag las ldog pa med pa'i phyir bsgrub bya'i chos ldog pa med pa ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'i skyon yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the atoms which are the exemplifications of the probandum in the dissimilar instance are not excluded from being preceded by an intelligent agent, the probandum is not excluded. This is the fault of the dissimilar example.

original: 'di snyam du gal te kho bo cag gis khyad par bsgrub byar 'dod pa yin na de'i tshe chos mthun pa'i dpe bsgrub bya dang bral ba sngar bstan par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gal te kho bo cag gis khyad par bsgrub byar 'dod pa yin na de'i tshe chos mthun pa'i dpe bsgrub bya dang bral ba sngar bstan par 'gyur /
translated: If one thinks, ‚ÄúIf we accept the difference as the probandum, then the similar instance would be devoid of the probandum, as was previously shown.

original: ji tsam du spyir blo dang ldan pa sngon du 'gro ba tsam sgrub ste /
analyzed: ji tsam du spyir blo dang ldan pa sngon du 'gro ba tsam sgrub ste /
translated: We only prove that the general case is preceded by an intelligent agent.

original: de grub pa na shugs kyis dbang phyug lus la sogs pa'i byed pa por 'grub po //
analyzed: de grub pa na shugs kyis dbang phyug lus la sogs pa'i byed pa por 'grub po //
translated: When that is established, then by implication, God is established as the agent of body, etc.

original: bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du de dag gi byed pa po rdza mkhan la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du de dag gi byed pa po rdza mkhan la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: He is not like a potter, etc., the agent of such things as a pot.

original: des ni spyir khyad par gyi mthar thug pa'i phyir dang / lus la sogs pa la yang byed pa po gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir shugs kyis khyad par bzung ba med par yang de dag gi byed pa por dbang phyug kho na yin par grub po snyam du sems na /üîΩgal te spyir na blo ldan pa //
analyzed: des ni spyir khyad par gyi mthar thug pa'i phyir dang / lus la sogs pa la yang byed pa po gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir shugs kyis khyad par bzung ba med par yang de dag gi byed pa por dbang phyug kho na yin par grub po snyam du sems na / gal te spyir na blo ldan pa //
translated: Therefore, since it is the ultimate distinction in general, and since another agent is impossible for the body, etc., it is established that God alone is the agent of those, even without the force of the distinction being grasped.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If you think that, then the verse says, ‚ÄúIf in general, the wise one . . . ,‚Äù etc.

original: de lta na ni grub pa la sgrub pa'i nyes pa yod do //
analyzed: de lta na ni grub pa la sgrub pa'i nyes pa yod do //
translated: In that case, there is the fault of proving what is already established.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ngo bo sna tshogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ngo bo sna tshogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The verse says, ‚ÄúThe variety of entities . . . ,‚Äù etc.

original: ngo bo sna tshogs ni sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten sna tshogs ba'o //
analyzed: ngo bo sna tshogs ni sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten sna tshogs ba'o //
translated: The variety of entities is the variety of sentient beings and the inanimate world.

original: las las skyes zhes bya ba ni thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa'i dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las las byung ba'o //
analyzed: las las skyes zhes bya ba ni thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa'i dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las las byung ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúArises from action‚Äù means it arises from common and uncommon virtuous and nonvirtuous actions.

original: de'i phyir dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las byed pa'i skyes bu blo dang ldan pa rnams 'di'i rgyu nyid du grub pas grub pa la sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las byed pa'i skyes bu blo dang ldan pa rnams 'di'i rgyu nyid du grub pas grub pa la sgrub pa'o //
translated: Therefore, since the intelligent person who performs virtuous and nonvirtuous actions is established as the cause of this, it is established as established.

original: 'o na khyad par bsgrub par bya'o snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na khyad par bsgrub par bya'o snyam na /
translated: If you think that a distinction must be established,

original: rtag gcig blo can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rtag gcig blo can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says ‚Äúthe one who has a permanent, unitary cognition,‚Äù etc.

original: 'di sngar bstan zin na yang mjug bsdu ba'i don du yang mngon par brjod do //
analyzed: 'di sngar bstan zin na yang mjug bsdu ba'i don du yang mngon par brjod do //
translated: Although this was taught previously, it is stated again for the purpose of summarizing.

original: 'di la blo gcig yod pas na blo gcig go //
analyzed: 'di la blo gcig yod pas na blo gcig go //
translated: Since there is one cognition here, there is a unitary cognition.

original: @174a * // 'di ni rtag pa yang yin la blo gcig pa yang yin pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ba'am /
analyzed: @174a * // 'di ni rtag pa yang yin la blo gcig pa yang yin pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ba'am /
translated: Since this is permanent and has a unitary cognition, the sentence is construed in this way.

original: yang na 'di la rtag ba dang gcig pa'i blo yod ces bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang na 'di la rtag ba dang gcig pa'i blo yod ces bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: Or else, it should be construed as ‚Äúthe one who has a permanent, unitary cognition.‚Äù

original: bsgrub byas stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni chos mthun pa'i dpe zhes bya ba'i lhag ma'o //
analyzed: bsgrub byas stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni chos mthun pa'i dpe zhes bya ba'i lhag ma'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEmptiness of the probandum‚Äù is the remainder of the expression ‚Äúan example that is similar.‚Äù

original: 'khrul pa yin zhes bya pa ni gtan tshigs zhes bya ba khong nas dbyung ngo //
analyzed: 'khrul pa yin zhes bya pa ni gtan tshigs zhes bya ba khong nas dbyung ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúDelusion‚Äù is the reason that is implied.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: skar khung la sogs ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: skar khung la sogs ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúWindows, etc.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúWhatever is said about the body, etc.‚Äù

original: gang yang lus la sogs ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la sun dbyung 'di nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang yang lus la sogs ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la sun dbyung 'di nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThis very refutation, etc.‚Äù

original: gzugs la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgrub par byed ba de dag la yang ji ltar rigs par sun 'byin pa 'di nyid brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgrub par byed ba de dag la yang ji ltar rigs par sun 'byin pa 'di nyid brjod par bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of possessing form, etc.‚Äù

original: 'di nyid ces bya ba ni ma grub pa nyid dang / 'brel pa med pa'i phyir 'khrul pa dang / 'brel pa yod na 'gal ba nyid dang / bsgrub bya ma tshang ba dang / spyir grub pa la sgrub pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid ces bya ba ni ma grub pa nyid dang / 'brel pa med pa'i phyir 'khrul pa dang / 'brel pa yod na 'gal ba nyid dang / bsgrub bya ma tshang ba dang / spyir grub pa la sgrub pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis very‚Äù means unestablished, confused because of lack of relation, contradictory if there is relation, incomplete proof, and proof, etc. of what is already established.

original: 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid sems dang ldan pas byin gyis brlabs pa ci 'dra ba de 'dra ba lus la sogs pa de la yang ma grub bo //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid sems dang ldan pas byin gyis brlabs pa ci 'dra ba de 'dra ba lus la sogs pa de la yang ma grub bo //
translated: Thus, the possession of form, etc. is not established in the body, etc. in the same way that it is in the mind, which is empowered.

original: gzugs la sogs pa dang ldan pa tsam dang 'brel ba ma grub pa'i phyir 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dang ldan pa tsam dang 'brel ba ma grub pa'i phyir 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: because mere possession of form, etc. is not established as the relation.

original: 'brel pa yod par khas len na 'dod pa las bzlog ba sgrub pa'i phyir 'gal ba yin la /
analyzed: 'brel pa yod par khas len na 'dod pa las bzlog ba sgrub pa'i phyir 'gal ba yin la /
translated: If the relation is accepted as existing, then there is contradiction, because it is the opposite of what is accepted.

original: chos mthun pa'i dpe bsgrub bya dang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: chos mthun pa'i dpe bsgrub bya dang bral ba yin te /
translated: The example of similarity is devoid of the probandum,

original: rtag pa dang gcig bu'i sems dang ldan pas byin gyis brlabs pa nyid kyis bsgrub bya'i chos rjes su 'gro ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro //üîΩspyir sgrub na grub pa la sgrub la /
analyzed: rtag pa dang gcig bu'i sems dang ldan pas byin gyis brlabs pa nyid kyis bsgrub bya'i chos rjes su 'gro ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro // spyir sgrub na grub pa la sgrub la /
translated: because the probandum, the property to be established, is not established by the mere blessing of the mind that is permanent and singular.üîΩIf it is established in general, then it is established in particular.

original: khyad par ni 'khrul pa ste /
analyzed: khyad par ni 'khrul pa ste /
translated: But if it is established in particular, then it is mistaken,

original: bum pa la sogs pa la gzhan du mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa la gzhan du mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya'o //
translated: because it is seen otherwise in a pot, etc.

original: de ltar gtan tshigs gzhan dag la yang spyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gtan tshigs gzhan dag la yang spyar bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the other reasons should be applied.

original: gang yang sdod nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i sgrub par byed pa smras pa de la yang lhag pa'i sun 'byin pa ni /
analyzed: gang yang sdod nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i sgrub par byed pa smras pa de la yang lhag pa'i sun 'byin pa ni /
translated: As for the proof that was stated, ‚Äúbecause it engages after abiding,‚Äù the additional refutation is this:

original: skad cig 'jig phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
analyzed: skad cig 'jig phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
translated: ‚ÄúBecause things disintegrate moment by moment‚Äù and so on.

original: dngos po thams cad skyes pa'i de ma thag tu 'jig pa nyid kyis skad cig tsam yang mi gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad skyes pa'i de ma thag tu 'jig pa nyid kyis skad cig tsam yang mi gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: Because all things do not endure even for a moment due to their disintegration immediately after arising,

original: ga las sdod nas 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: ga las sdod nas 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: how could they remain and then engage in activity?

original: de lta bas na gtan tshigs phyir rgol ba lam grub bo //
analyzed: de lta bas na gtan tshigs phyir rgol ba lam grub bo //
translated: Therefore, the reason is not established for the opponent.

original: dbang phyug de nyid kyis ma nges pa yang yin te /
analyzed: dbang phyug de nyid kyis ma nges pa yang yin te /
translated: Also, it is not ascertained that God is the creator.

original: gang gi phyir dbang phyug ni rim pa can @174b gyi 'bras bu rnams la sdod nas 'jug pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dbang phyug ni rim pa can @174b gyi 'bras bu rnams la sdod nas 'jug pa yin mod kyi /
translated: Because although God does remain and then engage in activity with regard to sequential effects,

original: 'on kyang 'di sems dang ldan pas byin gyis brlabs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di sems dang ldan pas byin gyis brlabs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: nevertheless, he is not empowered by the mind.

original: thug pa med pas thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thug pa med pas thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that there would be an infinite regress.

original: ci ste ji ltar blo gros bzang pos byas pa bzhin du sems pa med pa can zhes khyad par dang bcas pa gtan tshigs su byed pa de lta na yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa la the tshom za ba nyid kyis ma nges pa nyid mi
analyzed: ci ste ji ltar blo gros bzang pos byas pa bzhin du sems pa med pa can zhes khyad par dang bcas pa gtan tshigs su byed pa de lta na yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa la the tshom za ba nyid kyis ma nges pa nyid mi
translated: But even if you make a reason with a qualification, like ‚Äúwithout thought as it was made by the wise one,‚Äù still, because of doubt about the reversal from the discordant side, it is not definite.

original: zlogs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: zlogs pa kho na'o //
translated: It is not reversed.

original: gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog par byed pa gang yin pa de nyid khyad par du rigs kyi /
analyzed: gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog par byed pa gang yin pa de nyid khyad par du rigs kyi /
translated: It is just that which makes the reason reverse from the discordant side that is suitable as a qualification.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la the tshom zlog par mi byed pa gang yin pa khas blangs na yang med pa dang 'dra ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la the tshom zlog par mi byed pa gang yin pa khas blangs na yang med pa dang 'dra ba nyid yin no //
translated: But if you accept that which does not reverse doubt about the discordant side, it is just as if it did not exist.

original: khyad par dang bcas pa nyid yin na yang sngar bshad pa'i ma grub pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa'i gnas skabs so na 'dug pa yin no //
analyzed: khyad par dang bcas pa nyid yin na yang sngar bshad pa'i ma grub pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa'i gnas skabs so na 'dug pa yin no //
translated: Even if it has a qualification, it remains in the state of the fault of unestablished subject and so on, as explained earlier.

original: gang yang / 'byin pa'i thog mar skyes bu yi //
analyzed: gang yang / 'byin pa'i thog mar skyes bu yi //
translated: Also, the one who says, ‚ÄúThe first to create the world is the person,‚Äù

original: tha snyad ces bya ba la sogs pa de la /
analyzed: tha snyad ces bya ba la sogs pa de la /
translated: and so on,

original: 'jig pa'i tshe na skyes bu rnams//
analyzed: 'jig pa'i tshe na skyes bu rnams//
translated: at the time of destruction, the people

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The above is stated.üîΩ

original: dus phyis rab tu byang ba rnams kyi zhes bya ba'i khyad par de ma grub po //
analyzed: dus phyis rab tu byang ba rnams kyi zhes bya ba'i khyad par de ma grub po //
translated: ‚ÄúThe special case of those who are fully purified later‚Äù is not established.

original: 'di ltar kho bo cag gi lugs kyis 'jig pa'i tshe na skyes bu rnams shes pa dang / dran pa 'jig pa dang / lus dang dbang po dang bral bar gnas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar kho bo cag gi lugs kyis 'jig pa'i tshe na skyes bu rnams shes pa dang / dran pa 'jig pa dang / lus dang dbang po dang bral bar gnas pa ma yin te /
translated: In our system, when the world is destroyed, beings are not born in the realm of consciousness, memory, and so on, and they do not remain without bodies and sense faculties.

original: 'on kyang shes pa gsal ba khyad par du 'phags pa dang ldan pa'i 'od gsal la sogs pa'i lha'i ris de dag tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang shes pa gsal ba khyad par du 'phags pa dang ldan pa'i 'od gsal la sogs pa'i lha'i ris de dag tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: However, they are born in the divine realms of Abhasvara and so on, which possess clear and special consciousness.

original: gang yang dmyal ba la sogs pa'i rnam par smin pa nges pa sgrub par byed pa'i las can de dag ni 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag tu skye bar 'gyur ro zhes 'dod la /
analyzed: gang yang dmyal ba la sogs pa'i rnam par smin pa nges pa sgrub par byed pa'i las can de dag ni 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag tu skye bar 'gyur ro zhes 'dod la /
translated: Those who have the karma to experience the definite ripening of hell and so on are born in other world systems.

original: chags pa'i dus na yang 'od gsal la sogs pa de dag nyid nas shi 'phos nas /
analyzed: chags pa'i dus na yang 'od gsal la sogs pa de dag nyid nas shi 'phos nas /
translated: When the world is formed, they die in Abhasvara and so on and

original: 'dir shes pa dang dran pa mi 'jig pa nyid du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'dir shes pa dang dran pa mi 'jig pa nyid du 'byung ngo //
translated: are born here with consciousness and memory.

original: de lta bas na dus phyis rab tu byang ba rnams kyi zhes bya ba'i khyad par ma grub bo //
analyzed: de lta bas na dus phyis rab tu byang ba rnams kyi zhes bya ba'i khyad par ma grub bo //
translated: Therefore, the distinction ‚Äúof those who are completely purified later‚Äù is not established.

original: gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin te /
translated: The reason is indeterminate,

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa las the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa las the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is doubt about the reversal of the discordant side.

original: gzhan yang gzhan gyis nye bar bstan pa sngon du 'gro btsam sgrub na grub pa la sgrub ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang gzhan gyis nye bar bstan pa sngon du 'gro btsam sgrub na grub pa la sgrub ste /
translated: Moreover, if you prove mere priority of instruction by another, then the proof is established.

original: thams cad kyi tha snyad thog ma med pa ni gzhan gyis nye bar bstan pa sngon du 'gro ba can nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'on te dbang phyug gi mtshan nyid kyi skyes bus nye bar bstan pa sngon du 'gro ba @175a * //
analyzed: thams cad kyi tha snyad thog ma med pa ni gzhan gyis nye bar bstan pa sngon du 'gro ba can nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ro // 'on te dbang phyug gi mtshan nyid kyi skyes bus nye bar bstan pa sngon du 'gro ba @175a * //
translated: Because it is accepted that all conventions have priority of instruction by another.

original: nyid du sgrub na /
analyzed: nyid du sgrub na /
translated: But if you prove priority of instruction by a person who has the characteristics of ƒ™≈õvara,

original: de'i tshe gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid yin te /
translated: then at that time the reason is indeterminate,

original: gzhan du yang tha snyad srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du yang tha snyad srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the convention is possible in another way.

original: dpe yang bsgrub par bya ba dang bral ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: dpe yang bsgrub par bya ba dang bral ba nyid yin no //
translated: The example also is devoid of the probandum.

original: skyon 'di yang spyir sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: skyon 'di yang spyir sngar bshad zin to //
translated: This fault has already been explained in general.

original: gtan tshigs 'gal ba dang dam bcas pa khas blangs pas gnod pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'gal ba dang dam bcas pa khas blangs pas gnod pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The response to that is as follows:

original: kha med pa yi ston pa po //
analyzed: kha med pa yi ston pa po //
translated: The teacher who is without a mouth

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: gal te tha snyad dbang phyug gis bstan pa sngon du 'gro ba can srid pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te tha snyad dbang phyug gis bstan pa sngon du 'gro ba can srid pa yin na /
translated: If conventional existence were preceded by the teaching of God,

original: de'i tshe gtan tshigs mi 'gal bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i tshe gtan tshigs mi 'gal bar 'gyur na /
translated: then at that time the reason would not be contradictory.

original: ji srid du 'di kha dang bral ba'i phyir ston pa por mi rigs la /
analyzed: ji srid du 'di kha dang bral ba'i phyir ston pa por mi rigs la /
translated: But as long as he is without a mouth, it is not logical that he is a teacher.

original: kha med pa de yang lus dang bral ba nyid kyis te /
analyzed: kha med pa de yang lus dang bral ba nyid kyis te /
translated: And that he is without a mouth is due to the fact that he is without a body.

original: lus dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lus dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he is without a body.

original: 'di'i lus dang 'brel pa de yang ci ltar grub ce na /
analyzed: 'di'i lus dang 'brel pa de yang ci ltar grub ce na /
translated: How is his connection with a body established?

original: chos dang chos min med phyir ro //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: chos dang chos min med phyir ro // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because there is no Dharma or non-Dharma.

original: lus kyi rgyu'i chos dang chos ma yin pa dang bral ba'i zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lus kyi rgyu'i chos dang chos ma yin pa dang bral ba'i zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he is without a body because he is devoid of Dharma and non-Dharma, which are the causes of a body.

original: de skad du yang byed pas /
analyzed: de skad du yang byed pas /
translated: And because he is devoid of that,üîΩhe is without a mouth.

original: ji ltar dbang phyug gi blo la tshad ma yod pa de bzhin du chos dang chos ma yin pa la sogs pa'i rtag pa nyid la ni tshad ma yod pa ma yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: ji ltar dbang phyug gi blo la tshad ma yod pa de bzhin du chos dang chos ma yin pa la sogs pa'i rtag pa nyid la ni tshad ma yod pa ma yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: Just as the cognition of ƒ™≈õvara is valid, so too the validity of the eternal Dharma and Adharma, etc.üîΩis established.

original: de lta bas na dang bral ba'i zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bas na dang bral ba'i zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, the meaning of the verse is that ‚Äúthe validity of the Veda is not established.‚Äù

original: de skad du yang byed bar bstan pa sngon du 'gro ba can nyid du ma grub bo //üîΩ'on kyang dbang phyug las tha dad pa'i skyes bu gzhan gyis bstan pa sngon du 'gro ba can nyid yin no //
analyzed: de skad du yang byed bar bstan pa sngon du 'gro ba can nyid du ma grub bo // 'on kyang dbang phyug las tha dad pa'i skyes bu gzhan gyis bstan pa sngon du 'gro ba can nyid yin no //
translated: This is not so, because the authoritativeness of the Veda is not established.üîΩBut the authoritativeness of the Veda is established, because it is the basis of the knowledge of Dharma, etc.

original: de'i phyir 'dod pa la gnod par byed pa'i phyir gtan tshigs 'gal ba yin no //üîΩ'on te dbang phyug ston pa po nyid du khas len par byed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dod pa la gnod par byed pa'i phyir gtan tshigs 'gal ba yin no // 'on te dbang phyug ston pa po nyid du khas len par byed pa de'i tshe /
translated: This is not so, because the authoritativeness of the Veda is not established.üîΩIf the authoritativeness of the Veda is established, then the authoritativeness of the Sm·πõti is established.üîΩBut if the authoritativeness of the Veda is not established, then the authoritativeness of the Sm·πõti is not established.

original: kha med pa nyid du khas blangs pa nyams pas khas blangs pa la gnod do //üîΩ'byung ba che la sogs gsal ba //
analyzed: kha med pa nyid du khas blangs pa nyams pas khas blangs pa la gnod do //üîΩ'byung ba che la sogs gsal ba //
translated: The authoritativeness of the Veda is not established, because it is not the work of a trustworthy person.üîΩThe authoritativeness of the Veda is not established, because it is not the work of a trustworthy person.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i spyor ba la snga ma bzhin du gtan tshigs rnams ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i spyor ba la snga ma bzhin du gtan tshigs rnams ma nges pa yin te /
translated: In this way, the reasons are indeterminate, as before.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no valid cognition that contradicts the discordant side.

original: spyi sgrub na grub pa la sgrub pa nyid dang / khyad par dpe la bsgrub bya med pa zhes bya ba yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: spyi sgrub na grub pa la sgrub pa nyid dang / khyad par dpe la bsgrub bya med pa zhes bya ba yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: If one establishes a universal, then the very establishment is established, and the probandum does not exist in the example, and so on.

original: de ltar dbang phyug sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma rnams rgyas par bkag nas /
analyzed: de ltar dbang phyug sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma rnams rgyas par bkag nas /
translated: Having extensively refuted the valid cognitions that establish ƒ™shvara in this way,

original: da ni khyab pa'i skyon brjod pa'i sgo nas de'i gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma rang gi phyogs bsgrub par bya ba'i don du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni khyab pa'i skyon brjod pa'i sgo nas de'i gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma rang gi phyogs bsgrub par bya ba'i don du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to establish his own position, he teaches the valid cognition that contradicts that by stating the error of pervasion.

original: sgrub byed kun la khyab pa ni //
analyzed: sgrub byed kun la khyab pa ni //
translated: Pervasion in all proofs

original: @175b zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: @175b zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: is not established.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i sgrub par byed pa thams cad la /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i sgrub par byed pa thams cad la /
translated: In all proofs, as they have been explained,

original: bsgrub par bya bas gtan tshigs la khyab ba gang yin pa de ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya bas gtan tshigs la khyab ba gang yin pa de ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal lo //
translated: The pervasion of the reason by the probandum is contradicted by an inference that will be explained.

original: ci ste ci'i phyir dam bca' ba la rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal bar mi brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci ste ci'i phyir dam bca' ba la rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal bar mi brjod ce na /
translated: Why is it not said that the thesis is contradicted by an inference?

original: 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: We think as follows.

original: gal te dam bca' ba sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag yin na /
analyzed: gal te dam bca' ba sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag yin na /
translated: If the thesis is a part of the proof,

original: de'i tshe de'i nyes pa brjod par bya ba yod na /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i nyes pa brjod par bya ba yod na /
translated: then it is possible to state its faults.

original: ji srid du dngos sam brgyud pas 'di bsgrub bya 'grub pa'i yan lag tu 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ji srid du dngos sam brgyud pas 'di bsgrub bya 'grub pa'i yan lag tu 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: But as long as it is not a part of the proof, either directly or indirectly,

original: de lta yin dang sgrub par byed pa'i nyes pa brjod pa'i skabs su dam bca' ba'i skyon brjod pa gang yin pa de ni rgol ba tshar gcad pa'i gnas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang sgrub par byed pa'i nyes pa brjod pa'i skabs su dam bca' ba'i skyon brjod pa gang yin pa de ni rgol ba tshar gcad pa'i gnas su 'gyur ro //
translated: then if one states the faults of the thesis in the context of stating the faults of the proof, that is a ground for the defeat of the proponent.

original: de lta bas na sgrub par byed pa'i sbyor ba la dam bca' ba'i skyon brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na sgrub par byed pa'i sbyor ba la dam bca' ba'i skyon brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should not state the faults of the thesis in the context of stating the faults of the proof.

original: gang la 'ba' zhig tu dam bca' ba dang 'gal ba brjod pa de la de'i sgo nas khyab ba nyid la de sbyor bar byed do zhes gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang la 'ba' zhig tu dam bca' ba dang 'gal ba brjod pa de la de'i sgo nas khyab ba nyid la de sbyor bar byed do zhes gzung bar bya'o //
translated: One should understand that when someone is only accused of contradicting a thesis, then the pervasion is applied to him in that way.

original: yang na de sgrub par byed pa'i sbyor ba las gzhan du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang na de sgrub par byed pa'i sbyor ba las gzhan du blta bar bya'o //
translated: Or else, one should understand that the pervasion is applied to him in the proof of that.

original: ci ste khyab pa'i dus su yang ji ltar rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci ste khyab pa'i dus su yang ji ltar rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba brjod ce na /
translated: But how can one state a contradiction at the time of the pervasion?

original: 'gal ba'i chos kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i chos kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúBy a contradictory property,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'gal ba'i chos kyis zhes bya ba ni tshad mas gnod pas so //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i chos kyis zhes bya ba ni tshad mas gnod pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy a contradictory property‚Äù means by the contradiction of valid knowledge.

original: de tshad mas gnod pa de ni med pa yin pas med pa nyid kyi phyir khyab pa mi rigs te /
analyzed: de tshad mas gnod pa de ni med pa yin pas med pa nyid kyi phyir khyab pa mi rigs te /
translated: That which is contradicted by valid knowledge does not exist, and because it does not exist, the pervasion is not tenable.

original: med pas khyab pa mi 'grub po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: med pas khyab pa mi 'grub po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that the pervasion is not established by a non-existent.

original: gang gis khyab pa la gnod par 'gyur ba'i rjes su dpag pa de yang gang yin zhe na /üîΩskye ba med phyir dbang phyug ni //
analyzed: gang gis khyab pa la gnod par 'gyur ba'i rjes su dpag pa de yang gang yin zhe na / skye ba med phyir dbang phyug ni //
translated: But what is the inference that contradicts the pervasion?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúBecause of non-arising, ƒ™≈õvara,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang skye ba med pa de ni 'ga' zhig gi yang rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: gang skye ba med pa de ni 'ga' zhig gi yang rgyu ma yin te /
translated: That which is not produced is not the cause of anything,

original: dper na nam mkha'i bad ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i bad ma bzhin no //
translated: like the sky-flower.

original: dbang phyug kyang skye ba med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug kyang skye ba med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: And God is not produced. This is the observation of a contradiction with a pervasion.

original: 'di ni thal bar 'gyur ba sgrub par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni thal bar 'gyur ba sgrub par byed pa yin te /
translated: This is an argument by reductio.

original: des na gzhi ma grub par brtsad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: des na gzhi ma grub par brtsad par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should not argue that the reason is not established.

original: gzhan du thams cad cig car 'byung //
analyzed: gzhan du thams cad cig car 'byung //
translated: Everything would occur simultaneously,

original: zhes bya ba ni rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because the cause would be unobstructed in its efficacy.

original: dus gcig tu mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu'i tshogs bzhin du thams cad cig car 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dus gcig tu mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu'i tshogs bzhin du thams cad cig car 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that everything would occur simultaneously, like a collection of effects that are desired at one time.
Here,

original: 'di gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma yin no //
translated: this is the valid cognition that refutes that.

original: yang na 'di don brjod pa tsam yin no //
analyzed: yang na 'di don brjod pa tsam yin no //
translated: Or this is merely the expression of the meaning.

original: thal bar 'gyur ba'i sgrub par byed pa 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: thal bar 'gyur ba'i sgrub par byed pa 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: This is how the argument by reductio should be formulated:

original: gang zhig rgyu ma tshang ba med pa de ni 'byung ba kho na yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig rgyu ma tshang ba med pa de ni 'byung ba kho na yin te /
translated: That which is not incomplete with regard to causes is only produced.

original: dper na tha ma'i gnas skabs su phyin pa'i tshogs pa las rgyu ma tshang ba med pa'i myu gu 'byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na tha ma'i gnas skabs su phyin pa'i tshogs pa las rgyu ma tshang ba med pa'i myu gu 'byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a sprout is produced from a complete assemblage of causes at the final stage.

original: dbang phyug gi rgyu can gyi 'gro ba thams cad du rgyu ma tshang ba med pa yin pa'i phyir cig car 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang phyug gi rgyu can gyi 'gro ba thams cad du rgyu ma tshang ba med pa yin pa'i phyir cig car 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since all transmigrations that have ƒ™≈õvara as their cause are not incomplete with regard to causes, they would arise simultaneously.

original: 'di snyam du dbang phyug 'ba' zhig rgyu ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di snyam du dbang phyug 'ba' zhig rgyu ma yin gyi /
translated: If you think that ƒ™≈õvara is not the sole cause,

original: 'on kyang chos dang chos ma yin pa la sogs pa'i lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu gzhan la ltos nas byed de /
analyzed: 'on kyang chos dang chos ma yin pa la sogs pa'i lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu gzhan la ltos nas byed de /
translated: but that he acts in dependence on other cooperative conditions, such as virtue and nonvirtue,

original: dbang phyug ni rgyu mtshan gyi rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang phyug ni rgyu mtshan gyi rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because ƒ™≈õvara is the causal condition,

original: des na chos la sogs pa rgyu gzhan ma tshang bas rgyu ma tshang ba med pa nyid ma grub po snyam du sems na /
analyzed: des na chos la sogs pa rgyu gzhan ma tshang bas rgyu ma tshang ba med pa nyid ma grub po snyam du sems na /
translated: then since other causes such as virtue are incomplete, it is not established that he is not incomplete with regard to causes.

original: de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: gal te de'i lhan cig byed pa rnams kyis phan gdags par bya ba 'ba' zhig yod na /
analyzed: gal te de'i lhan cig byed pa rnams kyis phan gdags par bya ba 'ba' zhig yod na /
translated: If it is only to be benefited by its cooperating causes,

original: de'i tshe de lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe de lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa yin no //
translated: then it is dependent on its cooperating causes.

original: ji srid du rtag pa'i phyir gzhan gyis khyad par cung zad tsam yang byar med pa de ni lhan cig byed pa dag las thob par bya ba med pa'i phyir ci'i phyir de lta bur gyur pa'i phan pa mi byed pa de dag la ltos /
analyzed: ji srid du rtag pa'i phyir gzhan gyis khyad par cung zad tsam yang byar med pa de ni lhan cig byed pa dag las thob par bya ba med pa'i phyir ci'i phyir de lta bur gyur pa'i phan pa mi byed pa de dag la ltos /
translated: But since it is permanent, it cannot be benefited in the least by anything else. Why do you imagine that it is dependent on its cooperating causes, since it has nothing to obtain from them?

original: gzhan yang gang yang khyed kyi lhan cig byed pa de dag thams cad kyang dbang phyug la rag las te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang yang khyed kyi lhan cig byed pa de dag thams cad kyang dbang phyug la rag las te /
translated: Moreover, all of these cooperating causes that you assert are dependent on God,

original: skye ba can nyid kyis rtag tu nye ba yin pa'i phyir ji ltar gtan tshigs ma grub ba yin /
analyzed: skye ba can nyid kyis rtag tu nye ba yin pa'i phyir ji ltar gtan tshigs ma grub ba yin /
translated: because they are always present, being born. So how can you claim that the reason is unestablished?

original: ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it indeterminate,

original: rgyu ma tshang ba med pa nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu ma tshang ba med pa nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that the non deficiency of the cause would be undermined.

original: rgyu ma tshang ba med pa yang mi skye na khyad par med pa'i phyir thams cad las mi skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu ma tshang ba med pa yang mi skye na khyad par med pa'i phyir thams cad las mi skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If a cause is not incomplete, then since there is no difference, it follows that everything would arise from everything.

original: gsal byed pa na re /
analyzed: gsal byed pa na re /
translated: The Vai≈õe·π£ika says:

original: dbang phyug ces bya ba rtag pa'i dngos po rnams rgyu ma tshang ba med pa rtag tu nye ba yin mod kyi /
analyzed: dbang phyug ces bya ba rtag pa'i dngos po rnams rgyu ma tshang ba med pa rtag tu nye ba yin mod kyi /
translated: Although the permanent entities called ‚Äúƒ™≈õvara‚Äù are the cause of all things, and are always present,

original: 'on kyang cig car mi skyed de /
