analyzed: 'on kyang cig car mi skyed de /
translated: they do not generate things all at once.

original: dbang phyug ni blo sngon du btang nas byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang phyug ni blo sngon du btang nas byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because ƒ™≈õvara acts after first having thought.

original: gang gi phyir gal te dbang phyug yod pa tsam nyid kyis blo sngon du ma song bar yang dngos po rnams skyed par byed pa yin na de'i tshe klan ka der 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gal te dbang phyug yod pa tsam nyid kyis blo sngon du ma song bar yang dngos po rnams skyed par byed pa yin na de'i tshe klan ka der 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: If things were generated by the mere existence of ƒ™≈õvara, without ƒ™≈õvara first having thought, then that would be a fault.

original: gang gi tshe blo sngon du btang ste byed pa de'i tshe skyon med de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe blo sngon du btang ste byed pa de'i tshe skyon med de /
translated: But when he acts after first having thought, then there is no fault.

original: de ni rang gi 'dod pas 'bras bu rnams la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rang gi 'dod pas 'bras bu rnams la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because he engages in the activity of generating effects according to his desire.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no @176b zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no @176b zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore your reason is not established.

original: 'di yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'di yang mi rigs te /
translated: This also is not correct.üîΩIf the so-called ‚ÄúGod‚Äù is a cause that is an unimpeded potency, then even if he is always present, he would not engage in activity because he has no desire.

original: gang gis dbang phyug ces bya ba rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa rtag tu nye na yang de'i 'dod pa med pas 'jug par mi 'gyur ba 'bras bu rnams ni rgyu'i 'dod pa yod pa dang med pa la ltos nas 'jug pa dang ldog pa ni ma
analyzed: gang gis dbang phyug ces bya ba rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa rtag tu nye na yang de'i 'dod pa med pas 'jug par mi 'gyur ba 'bras bu rnams ni rgyu'i 'dod pa yod pa dang med pa la ltos nas 'jug pa dang ldog pa ni ma
translated: The engagement and non-engagement of effects is not dependent on the presence or absence of the desire of the cause.

original: yin no // 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: yin no // 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: dngos po rnams ni rgyu las yod pa'i nus pa yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni rgyu las yod pa'i nus pa yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa yin no //
translated: Things are produced from causes that are the presence or absence of potency.

original: 'di ltar byed pa po 'dod na yang mi nus pa mi skyed la /
analyzed: 'di ltar byed pa po 'dod na yang mi nus pa mi skyed la /
translated: Thus, even if the agent desires, he does not produce what is impossible.

original: mi 'dod na yang sa bon la sogs pa nus pas bskyed do //
analyzed: mi 'dod na yang sa bon la sogs pa nus pas bskyed do //
translated: Even if he does not desire, he produces what is possible, such as a seed.

original: de la gal te dbang phyug ces bya ba'i rgyu 'bras bu skye ba'i dus bzhin du dngos po rnams kyi nus pa thogs pa med pa rtag tu gnas na de ci'i phyir /
analyzed: de la gal te dbang phyug ces bya ba'i rgyu 'bras bu skye ba'i dus bzhin du dngos po rnams kyi nus pa thogs pa med pa rtag tu gnas na de ci'i phyir /
translated: If the so-called ‚ÄúGod‚Äù is a cause that is an unimpeded potency, then like the time when the effect arises, he would always be present.

original: gang gis skye ba'i dus bzhin du cig car skye bar mi 'gyur ba de'i phan pa mi byed pa'i 'dod pa de la ltos /
analyzed: gang gis skye ba'i dus bzhin du cig car skye bar mi 'gyur ba de'i phan pa mi byed pa'i 'dod pa de la ltos /
translated: But since they do not arise simultaneously, as they would if they were to arise at the time of desire, then what is the use of that desire which does not benefit them?

original: gal te cig car 'byung ba yin na de dag gis bdag nyid rgyu ma tshang ba med pa nyid du de ltar bstan pa yin na gang gis na 'dod pa la ltos par 'gyur ba gzhan gyis phan ma btags pa'i dbang phyug kyang ltos pa cung zad kyang
analyzed: gal te cig car 'byung ba yin na de dag gis bdag nyid rgyu ma tshang ba med pa nyid du de ltar bstan pa yin na gang gis na 'dod pa la ltos par 'gyur ba gzhan gyis phan ma btags pa'i dbang phyug kyang ltos pa cung zad kyang
translated: If they were to arise simultaneously, then they would demonstrate the completeness of their own causes. But since they do not arise simultaneously, what is the use of that God who does not benefit them?

original: med pa yin na /
analyzed: med pa yin na /
translated: If he is not dependent on anything else,üîΩthen what is the use of God?

original: gzhan yang blo las ma gtogs pa'i 'dod pa gzhan ni med la /
analyzed: gzhan yang blo las ma gtogs pa'i 'dod pa gzhan ni med la /
translated: Moreover, desire is not different from the mind.

original: dbang phyug gi blo yang khyed kyis rtag pa gcig pur 'dod do //
analyzed: dbang phyug gi blo yang khyed kyis rtag pa gcig pur 'dod do //
translated: And you assert that God‚Äôs mind is permanent and singular.

original: de lta yin dang dbang phyug blo sngon du gtong bar byed pa yin nam /
analyzed: de lta yin dang dbang phyug blo sngon du gtong bar byed pa yin nam /
translated: If that is so, does God have a mind that precedes him?

original: yang ci'i phyir dngos po rnams cig car skye bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir dngos po rnams cig car skye bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Or why do things not arise simultaneously?

original: dbang phyug bzhin du de'i blo yang rtag tu nye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang phyug bzhin du de'i blo yang rtag tu nye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because like God, his mind is always present.

original: gang gi tshe yang 'on te yang de'i blo mi rtag pa nyid du khas len par byed pa de'i tshe yang dbang phyug yod pas yod pa'i phyir te dbang phyug bzhin du rtag tu yod pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i nyes pa de nyid son 'dug pa
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang 'on te yang de'i blo mi rtag pa nyid du khas len par byed pa de'i tshe yang dbang phyug yod pas yod pa'i phyir te dbang phyug bzhin du rtag tu yod pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i nyes pa de nyid son 'dug pa
translated: But when you accept that the mind is impermanent, then the fault that you have stated still applies, namely, that the mind would exist because of the existence of God, and it would always exist just like God.

original: yin no // de lta bas na blo dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i khyad par cung zad kyang mi byed pa kho na'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yin no // de lta bas na blo dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i khyad par cung zad kyang mi byed pa kho na'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because the word ‚Äúintelligent‚Äù does not make any difference at all, the reason is not indeterminate.

original: 'gal ba nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gal ba nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it contradictory,

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it exists in things that are homogeneous.

original: de ltar yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor does it not exist,üîΩbecause it is the opposite of that.

original: de lta bas na bzlog pa'i sbyor ba ni ;
analyzed: de lta bas na bzlog pa'i sbyor ba ni ;
translated: Therefore, the reversed formulation is:

original: gang zhig gang gi tshe mi 'gyur ba de ni de'i tshe rgyu ma tshang ba med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi tshe mi 'gyur ba de ni de'i tshe rgyu ma tshang ba med pa ma yin te /
translated: That which does not change at a certain time does not have all of its causes complete,

original: dper na sbyang na gnas pa'i sa bon gyi gnas skabs kyi skye bzhin pa ma yin pa'i myu gu lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sbyang na gnas pa'i sa bon gyi gnas skabs kyi skye bzhin pa ma yin pa'i myu gu lta bu'o //
translated: like, for example, a seed in the state of being stored, which is not in the process of producing a sprout.

original: dngos po gcig skye pa'i dus na yang sna tshogs thams cad 'byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba khyab par byed pa @177a * //
analyzed: dngos po gcig skye pa'i dus na yang sna tshogs thams cad 'byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba khyab par byed pa @177a * //
translated: Even when one thing is produced, all varieties do not arise.

original: mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the pervasion.

original: sgrub pa la sgrub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: sgrub pa la sgrub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is there a proof of a proof,

original: dbang phyug rgyu yin na rgyu ma tshang ba mi 'thad bar bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang phyug rgyu yin na rgyu ma tshang ba mi 'thad bar bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has already been proven that if God is the cause, it is not tenable that the cause is incomplete.

original: tshad ma gzhan yang /
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan yang /
translated: There is another valid cognition:

original: gang dag rim gyis 'byung ba yang //
analyzed: gang dag rim gyis 'byung ba yang //
translated: Even those that arise sequentially

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩrang rtsom par byed pa'i cha shas kyi dbyibs kyi khyad bar dang ldan pa la sogs pa'i sgrub par byed pa ji skad du bshad pa dag las byung ba'i 'dod pa'i bsgrub bya'i chos kyi yul can blun po rnams de dbang phyug rgyur mngon bar zhen pa rnams
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / rang rtsom par byed pa'i cha shas kyi dbyibs kyi khyad bar dang ldan pa la sogs pa'i sgrub par byed pa ji skad du bshad pa dag las byung ba'i 'dod pa'i bsgrub bya'i chos kyi yul can blun po rnams de dbang phyug rgyur mngon bar zhen pa rnams
translated: are not produced by God,üîΩbecause they arise from their own causes.üîΩThe meaning of the passage beginning with ‚ÄúEven those that arise sequentially‚Äù is as follows.

original: kyi yid ches pa ste /
analyzed: kyi yid ches pa ste /
translated: The fools who are the objects of the thesis that God is the cause, who are attached to the notion that God is the cause, have confidence in the proofs that have been explained, such as the shape of the parts that compose him, and so on.üîΩThey are certain

original: nges pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nges pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: that God is the cause of the effects.

original: 'on te ji skad du nyes pas sun dbyung ba'i phyir de dag las 'dod pa'i bsgrub par bya ba la yid ches pa mi skye ba'i phyir dpe'i chos can ma grub pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te ji skad du nyes pas sun dbyung ba'i phyir de dag las 'dod pa'i bsgrub par bya ba la yid ches pa mi skye ba'i phyir dpe'i chos can ma grub pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn‚Äôt the exemplification of the example not established for them, because they do not believe in the probandum, since they are refuted by faults?

original: 'di ni bden te /
analyzed: 'di ni bden te /
translated: This is true,

original: de nyid kyi phyir blun po yi //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir blun po yi // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: but still, foolsüîΩare not able to distinguish a correct proof from a fallacious proof.

original: blun po rnams ni sgrub pa ltar snang ba 'byed par mi nus pa nyid kyis sgrub par byed pa ltar snang ba dag las kyang de dag yid ches skye ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: blun po rnams ni sgrub pa ltar snang ba 'byed par mi nus pa nyid kyis sgrub par byed pa ltar snang ba dag las kyang de dag yid ches skye ba nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, even from fallacious proofs, they do generate belief.

original: 'on te de lta na yang dpe la bsgrub bya med pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te de lta na yang dpe la bsgrub bya med pa yin te /
translated: But even if that is so, the probandum does not exist in the example,

original: blun po'i yid ches pa de dag gi yang dbang phyug rgyu mtshan gyi rgyur 'dod pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: blun po'i yid ches pa de dag gi yang dbang phyug rgyu mtshan gyi rgyur 'dod pas de'i phyir /
translated: because those fools who believe in that also assert that ƒ™≈õvara is the cause of the reason.

original: de dag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de dag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúEven those who believe in that,‚Äù and so on.

original: de dag kyang zhes bya ba ni blun po'i yid ches pa'o//
analyzed: de dag kyang zhes bya ba ni blun po'i yid ches pa'o//
translated: ‚ÄúEven those who believe in that‚Äù refers to the fools.

original: des byung zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug las byung bar 'dod na /
analyzed: des byung zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug las byung bar 'dod na /
translated: If they assert that it arises from ƒ™≈õvara,üîΩthen it is not the case that the probandum does not exist in the example.

original: sgrub pa brjod pa don med de //
analyzed: sgrub pa brjod pa don med de //
translated: The assertion of a proof is meaningless.

original: sgrub byed rjod pa don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgrub byed rjod pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The assertion of a proof is meaningless.

original: dbang phyug kho na las de dag skye'o snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug kho na las de dag skye'o snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: The idea is that they are produced only from God.

original: dbang phyug sgrub par byed pa brjod pa'i lhan cig byed pa la ltos nas de dag gi skyed par byed pa yin gyi ;
analyzed: dbang phyug sgrub par byed pa brjod pa'i lhan cig byed pa la ltos nas de dag gi skyed par byed pa yin gyi ;
translated: In dependence on the cooperating conditions of the assertion of a proof, God is the producer of those things.

original: 'ba' zhig pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'ba' zhig pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But he is not the sole cause.

original: des na 'di 'bras bu med par mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /üîΩrtag phyir gsos 'debs med pa las //
analyzed: des na 'di 'bras bu med par mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na / rtag phyir gsos 'debs med pa las //
translated: But isn‚Äôt it the case that this proof is meaningless?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Because he is permanent, he does not require anything to revive him.

original: gal te sgrub par byed pa brjod pa 'di dbang phyug 'di'i nus pa med pa'i rang bzhin bsal nas /
analyzed: gal te sgrub par byed pa brjod pa 'di dbang phyug 'di'i nus pa med pa'i rang bzhin bsal nas /
translated: If the assertion of a proof eliminates the nature of God‚Äôs impotence,

original: nus pa skyed pa de'i tshe lhan cig byed par 'gyur na /
analyzed: nus pa skyed pa de'i tshe lhan cig byed par 'gyur na /
translated: and generates his potency, then at that time it would be a cooperating condition.

original: ji srid du rtag ba'i phyir dbang phyug bskyed par bya ba ma yin zhing /
analyzed: ji srid du rtag ba'i phyir dbang phyug bskyed par bya ba ma yin zhing /
translated: But as long as God is permanent, he is not something to be produced.

original: bzlog par bya ba ma yin pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis su zhig gis kyang gsos gdab par bya ba ma yin pas de 'di'i lhan cig byed par mi rigs so //
analyzed: bzlog par bya ba ma yin pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis su zhig gis kyang gsos gdab par bya ba ma yin pas de 'di'i lhan cig byed par mi rigs so //
translated: Since it is not to be reversed, it is not to be nourished by anyone. Therefore it is not tenable that it is the cooperative condition of the effect.üîΩMoreover, how could you conceive of ƒ™≈õvara as a cause, when you do not see his ability to produce effects, but you do see the ability of other causes?

original: gzhan yang ji ltar sgrub @177b par byed pa'i rgyu nus pa yongs su mthong ba las ma gtogs par nus pa yongs su ma mthong ba'i rgyu nyid dbang phyug la yang rtog na khyed cag la ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba kho na ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang ji ltar sgrub @177b par byed pa'i rgyu nus pa yongs su mthong ba las ma gtogs par nus pa yongs su ma mthong ba'i rgyu nyid dbang phyug la yang rtog na khyed cag la ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba kho na ste /
translated: This is a preposterous consequence for you, because if you conceive of ƒ™≈õvara as a cause, you must also conceive of sticks and so on as causes.üîΩThere is no difference between them.

original: gang gi phyir dbang phyug der yongs su rtog na dbyig pa la sogs pa yang brtag par bya ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dbang phyug der yongs su rtog na dbyig pa la sogs pa yang brtag par bya ba nyid yin te /
translated: To explain this, BhƒÅviveka says, ‚ÄúIf you conceive of ƒ™≈õvara as a cause, you must also conceive of sticks and so on as causes.

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩgang dag yod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩ'byung gyur mthong bar zhes kha bskang ngo //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩgang dag yod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩ'byung gyur mthong bar zhes kha bskang ngo //
translated: Why? Because there is no difference between them.‚Äù

original: de'i rgyu gzhan nyid rtog ces bya ba ni ji ltar nus pa yongs su mthong ba'i rgyu dag las 'di'i rgyu gzhan yin pas rgyu gzhan te /
analyzed: de'i rgyu gzhan nyid rtog ces bya ba ni ji ltar nus pa yongs su mthong ba'i rgyu dag las 'di'i rgyu gzhan yin pas rgyu gzhan te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe cause of that is imagined to be another‚Äù means that the cause of that is imagined to be another cause, since it is seen to be a cause that is different from the causes of the power.

original: de'i dngos po ni rgyu gzhan nyid do//
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni rgyu gzhan nyid do//
translated: The state of being another cause is the state of being another.

original: de rtog pa ni rtog pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de rtog pa ni rtog pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: Imagining that is imagining.

original: gang yang / kun gyi byed po nyid grub na //
analyzed: gang yang / kun gyi byed po nyid grub na //
translated: And also, ‚ÄúIf the creator of all were established,üîΩthen all would be known by one who knows him.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de las byed pa po nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de las byed pa po nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to that, it is said, ‚ÄúIf he were the creator, etc.‚Äù

original: thams cad kyi byed pa po nyid yin pa'i stobs kyis 'di thams cad shes par khyed cag gis 'dod de /
analyzed: thams cad kyi byed pa po nyid yin pa'i stobs kyis 'di thams cad shes par khyed cag gis 'dod de /
translated: Since he is the creator of all, by the power of knowing all, you assert that he knows all.

original: des na de bkag pa'i phyir de'i thams cad shes pa yang 'bad pa med par mi dgos par bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: des na de bkag pa'i phyir de'i thams cad shes pa yang 'bad pa med par mi dgos par bsal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, in order to refute that, it is said that his knowledge of all is also refuted without effort.

original: sgrub par byed pa rnams sun ma phyung bar khas blangs nas /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa rnams sun ma phyung bar khas blangs nas /
translated: Without refuting the proofs, it is accepted that

original: skyon gzhan ji skad bshad pa'i nyes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: skyon gzhan ji skad bshad pa'i nyes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚Äúthe other faults are as previously explained.‚Äù

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i nyes pa ni /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i nyes pa ni /
translated: The faults that have been explained

original: rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba'i mthar thug pa rnams so //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba'i mthar thug pa rnams so //
translated: are the ultimate contradictions with inference.

original: 'di la bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di la bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The condensed meaning of this is as follows:

original: sgrub par byed pa de dag las lus dang ri la sogs pa rnams kyi byed pa po blo dang ldan pa yin par grub pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa de dag las lus dang ri la sogs pa rnams kyi byed pa po blo dang ldan pa yin par grub pa yin mod kyi /
translated: Although it is established that the agent of those proofs, such as the body and the mountain, is intelligent,

original: 'on kyang 'di gcig gi rgyu gang yin pa de kho na gzhan gyi yang yin par ma nges pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di gcig gi rgyu gang yin pa de kho na gzhan gyi yang yin par ma nges pa nyid de /
translated: nevertheless, it is not certain that the cause of one is the cause of another.

original: 'bras bu so so la byed pa po yang tha dad pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu so so la byed pa po yang tha dad pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is possible that the agent is different for each effect.

original: skar khung la sogs pa gcig kyang rgyu mar bos byas par mthong bas /
analyzed: skar khung la sogs pa gcig kyang rgyu mar bos byas par mthong bas /
translated: Since one thing, such as a window, is seen to be the cause of light,

original: de'i phyir byed pa po gcig ma grub po //
analyzed: de'i phyir byed pa po gcig ma grub po //
translated: therefore, a single agent is not established.

original: ji srid du byed pa po gcig ma grub pa de srid du /
analyzed: ji srid du byed pa po gcig ma grub pa de srid du /
translated: For as long as a single agent is not established,

original: gang las thams cad shes par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang las thams cad shes par 'gyur /
translated: from what would all be known?

original: 'di la blo gros bzang pos byed pa po gcig bsgrub pa'i phyir tshad ma byed de /
analyzed: 'di la blo gros bzang pos byed pa po gcig bsgrub pa'i phyir tshad ma byed de /
translated: Here, the intelligent one does not act as a valid means of knowledge to establish a single agent.

original: tshangs pa la sogs pa nas sha za'i bar ni gcig gis byin gyis brlabs pa yin te /
analyzed: tshangs pa la sogs pa nas sha za'i bar ni gcig gis byin gyis brlabs pa yin te /
translated: Brahma and so on down to the Pi≈õƒÅcas are blessed by one another,

original: phan tshun khyad par du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun khyad par du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are engaged in mutual distinctions.

original: 'di na gang dag phan tshun khyad par gyis 'jug pa de dag ni gcig la rag las par mthong ste /
analyzed: 'di na gang dag phan tshun khyad par gyis 'jug pa de dag ni gcig la rag las par mthong ste /
translated: Here, those who are engaged in mutual distinctions are seen to be dependent on one another.

original: dper na @178a * //
analyzed: dper na @178a * //
translated: For example,

original: 'jig rten 'di'i grong dang / grong rdal dang / grong khyer dang / yul gyi bdag po rnams ni sa thams cad kyi mi'i bdag po gcig la rag las pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di'i grong dang / grong rdal dang / grong khyer dang / yul gyi bdag po rnams ni sa thams cad kyi mi'i bdag po gcig la rag las pa bzhin no //
translated: the lords of the villages, towns, cities, and countries of this world are dependent on one lord of the earth.

original: de bzhin du klu dang / srin po dang / gnod spyin la sogs pa rnams kyang phan tshun khyad par gyis 'jug pa nyid de /
analyzed: de bzhin du klu dang / srin po dang / gnod spyin la sogs pa rnams kyang phan tshun khyad par gyis 'jug pa nyid de /
translated: Similarly, the nƒÅgas, rƒÅk·π£asas, yak·π£as, and so on are engaged in mutual distinctions.

original: de dag kyang dbang phyug gcig gi gzhan gyi dbang yin no snyam du kho bo cag sems so //
analyzed: de dag kyang dbang phyug gcig gi gzhan gyi dbang yin no snyam du kho bo cag sems so //
translated: We think that they are all dependent on one lord.

original: de 'dis gal te dbang phyug ces bya ba byin gyis rlob pa po gcig gis byin gyis brlabs pa zhes bya ba'i don 'di sgrub par 'dod pa de'i tshe gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: de 'dis gal te dbang phyug ces bya ba byin gyis rlob pa po gcig gis byin gyis brlabs pa zhes bya ba'i don 'di sgrub par 'dod pa de'i tshe gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin te /
translated: If you assert that the meaning of ‚Äúblessed by one called ‚Äòƒ™≈õvara‚Äô‚Äù is established, then the reason is indeterminate,

original: bzlog pa la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med pas 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzlog pa la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med pas 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no valid knowledge that contradicts the opposite, and thus the relation is not established.

original: dpe yang bsgrub par bya ba dang bral ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: dpe yang bsgrub par bya ba dang bral ba nyid yin no //
translated: And the example is also devoid of the probandum.

original: 'on te byin gyis rlob pa po tsam gyis byin gyis brlabs pa yin no zhes sgrub na de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te byin gyis rlob pa po tsam gyis byin gyis brlabs pa yin no zhes sgrub na de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
translated: But if you prove that ‚Äúblessed by a mere blesser,‚Äù then you are proving what is already established for us,

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'jig rten mtha' dag gi gtsug gi nor bus 'gro ba thams cad snying rje'i dbang gis byin gyis brlabs par kho bo cag 'dod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'jig rten mtha' dag gi gtsug gi nor bus 'gro ba thams cad snying rje'i dbang gis byin gyis brlabs par kho bo cag 'dod pa kho na yin te /
translated: because we certainly assert that the Blessed One, the perfect Buddha, the crest jewel of the entire world, blesses all transmigrating beings out of compassion.

original: gang gi stobs kyis de ltar yang dam pa dag mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa'i phun sum tshogs pa sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi stobs kyis de ltar yang dam pa dag mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa'i phun sum tshogs pa sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: By the power of that, the holy ones accomplish the perfection of high status and the perfection of definite goodness.

original: brjod pa'i sgrub byed gzhan 'di yang yin te /
analyzed: brjod pa'i sgrub byed gzhan 'di yang yin te /
translated: This is another proof of that:

original: srid pa bdun ni blo gcig gis sprul pa yin te /
analyzed: srid pa bdun ni blo gcig gis sprul pa yin te /
translated: Seven existences are emanated by one mind.

original: dngos po gcig gi khongs su 'dus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po gcig gi khongs su 'dus pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are included in one thing.

original: khang pa gcig gi nang du gtogs pa'i khang mig bzhin te /
analyzed: khang pa gcig gi nang du gtogs pa'i khang mig bzhin te /
translated: Like the rooms that are included in one house.

original: ji ltar khang pa gcig gi khongs su 'dus pa'i khang mig rnams thig mkhan gyi blo gcig gcig gis byas pa nyid du mthong ba de ltar srid pa bdun yang srid pa gcig gi khongs su 'dus pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar khang pa gcig gi khongs su 'dus pa'i khang mig rnams thig mkhan gyi blo gcig gcig gis byas pa nyid du mthong ba de ltar srid pa bdun yang srid pa gcig gi khongs su 'dus pa yin te /
translated: Just as the rooms that are included in one house are seen to be made by one mind of the architect, in the same way, the seven existences are included in one existence.

original: de'i phyir de dag kyang blo gcig gis byas par nges so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag kyang blo gcig gis byas par nges so //
translated: Therefore, they are also definitely made by one mind.

original: gang 'di dag blo gcig gis sgrub par byed pa de ni srid pa mtha' dag gi thig mkhan gcig pu ste /
analyzed: gang 'di dag blo gcig gis sgrub par byed pa de ni srid pa mtha' dag gi thig mkhan gcig pu ste /
translated: That which is established by one mind is the sole architect of all existences.

original: legs ldan dbang phyug chen po yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: legs ldan dbang phyug chen po yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe great lord Mahe≈õvara is the creator.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the reason is not established.

original: gnas dang khang pa dag ni dngos po gcig ma yin te /
analyzed: gnas dang khang pa dag ni dngos po gcig ma yin te /
translated: A house and its rooms are not one thing,

original: tha snyad zor yang bar bya ba'i phyir mang po dag la ming 'di byas so //
analyzed: tha snyad zor yang bar bya ba'i phyir mang po dag la ming 'di byas so //
translated: because this name is given to many things in order to make the expression easy.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dpe yang sgrub par byed pa dang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dpe yang sgrub par byed pa dang bral ba yin te /
translated: For that very reason, the example is also devoid of the probandum.

original: khang pa gcig tu gtogs @178b pa'i khang mig la sogs pa ni thig mkhan du mas byas par mthong ba'i phyir yang gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: khang pa gcig tu gtogs @178b pa'i khang mig la sogs pa ni thig mkhan du mas byas par mthong ba'i phyir yang gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no //
translated: The reason is also uncertain because it is seen that a house and its rooms, etc., which belong to one house, are made by many carpenters.

original: de bzhin du sgrub par byed pa gzhan dag la yang ji ltar rigs pa sun 'byin pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgrub par byed pa gzhan dag la yang ji ltar rigs pa sun 'byin pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the refutation should be stated in the appropriate manner with regard to other proofs.

original: gang yang / mi mthun blo gzhi yi dngos po //
analyzed: gang yang / mi mthun blo gzhi yi dngos po //
translated: And also, the one who said, ‚ÄúThe basis of the mind that is not in agreement,‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa de la /üîΩde bsgrub bya phyir sgrub smras pa //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa de la / de bsgrub bya phyir sgrub smras pa //
translated: in that regard,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe proof that was stated in order to prove that is not established.‚Äù

original: gal te spyir thams cad shes pa 'ga' zhig yod do zhes sgrub na de'i tshe kho bo cag la khyed kyis sgrub par byed pa 'di mdzes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te spyir thams cad shes pa 'ga' zhig yod do zhes sgrub na de'i tshe kho bo cag la khyed kyis sgrub par byed pa 'di mdzes pa ma yin te /
translated: If you are proving in general that ‚Äúthere is some cognition of everything,‚Äù then this proof is not beautiful for us,

original: grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is the fault of proving what is already established.

original: 'on kyang gang dag thams cad mkhyen pa la skur pa 'debs pa'i rgyal dpog pa de dag la mdzes pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang gang dag thams cad mkhyen pa la skur pa 'debs pa'i rgyal dpog pa de dag la mdzes pa yin no //
translated: But it is beautiful for those who are nihilists about the Omniscient One, such as the LokƒÅyatas.

original: 'on te dbang phyug tu brjod pa'i thams cad shes pa nyid sgrub na de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'on te dbang phyug tu brjod pa'i thams cad shes pa nyid sgrub na de ni mi rigs te /
translated: But if you are proving the omniscience of the one called ƒ™≈õvara, that is illogical,

original: 'brel pa ma grub pas gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'brel pa ma grub pas gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid yin no //
translated: because the relation is not established, the reason is not ascertained.

original: dpe yang bsgrub par bya bas stong pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: dpe yang bsgrub par bya bas stong pa nyid yin no //
translated: And the example is empty of the probandum.üîΩTherefore, this proof is not beautiful for us.

original: de'i phyir kho bo cag la sgrub par byed pa 'di mdzes pa ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir kho bo cag la sgrub par byed pa 'di mdzes pa ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: And also:

original: gang yang sna tshogs par 'byung ba //
analyzed: gang yang sna tshogs par 'byung ba //
translated: The various things that occur

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa chos can gyi khyad par bstan pa de gang du yang nye bar mi mkho ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa chos can gyi khyad par bstan pa de gang du yang nye bar mi mkho ste /
translated: In this way, the specific attributes of the subject are taught, but they are not useful in any way.

original: khyed kyis gzhan mgo rmongs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: khyed kyis gzhan mgo rmongs par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: You have done this only to confuse others,

original: rang gi grub mtha' bsgrags pa 'di byas pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: rang gi grub mtha' bsgrags pa 'di byas pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: and to proclaim your own tenets.

original: 'di ltar rnam pa de lta bu'i chos can gyi khyad par med na yang /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam pa de lta bu'i chos can gyi khyad par med na yang /
translated: In this way, even if the specific attributes of the subject are not like that,

original: gal te sgrub par byed pa ma grub pa la sogs pa'i skyon dang bral ba de'i tshe mngon par 'dod pa'i bsgrub bya 'grub par 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: gal te sgrub par byed pa ma grub pa la sogs pa'i skyon dang bral ba de'i tshe mngon par 'dod pa'i bsgrub bya 'grub par 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: if the proof is free from the faults of being unestablished and so on, then the desired probandum will certainly be established.

original: 'on te sgrub par byed pa ma grub pa la sogs pa'i skyon gyis skyon can yin pa de'i tshe rnam pa de lta bu'i khyad par bzung na yang bsgrub bya mi 'grub pas /
analyzed: 'on te sgrub par byed pa ma grub pa la sogs pa'i skyon gyis skyon can yin pa de'i tshe rnam pa de lta bu'i khyad par bzung na yang bsgrub bya mi 'grub pas /
translated: But if the proof is faulty because of the faults of being unestablished and so on, then even if you hold a specific attribute like that, the probandum will not be established.

original: rnam pa thams cad du khyad par don med do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du khyad par don med do //
translated: Therefore, in every way, the specific attribute is pointless.

original: gang yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs las gtan tshigs zlog par byed pa de nyid khyad par du rigs so //
analyzed: gang yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs las gtan tshigs zlog par byed pa de nyid khyad par du rigs so //
translated: It is quite reasonable to reverse the reason from the discordant side.

original: gzhan yang gtan tshigs gzhi ma grub ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang gtan tshigs gzhi ma grub ste /
translated: Moreover, the reason is not established.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i khyad par gyis khyad par du byas pa'i chos can ni phyir rgol ba la ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i khyad par gyis khyad par du byas pa'i chos can ni phyir rgol ba la ma grub pa yin no //
translated: The subject qualified by the above-mentioned qualifications is not established for the opponent.

original: de lta bas na bstan bcos la grags pa ni chos can du bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na bstan bcos la grags pa ni chos can du bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, what is known in the treatise should not be taken as the subject.

original: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel las dbang phyug brtag pa @179a * //
analyzed: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel las dbang phyug brtag pa @179a * //
translated: This concludes the examination of ƒ™≈õvara in the Commentary on the Compendium of Principles.

original: ste gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: ste gnyis pa'o /
translated: The second chapter.

original: // / gnyi ga'i bya ba dang bral ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / gnyi ga'i bya ba dang bral ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To show the absence of activity of both,

original: de ltar rang bzhin dbang phyug dag / ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar rang bzhin dbang phyug dag / ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said, Thus, the nature of ƒ™≈õvara... and so on.

original: de la grangs can kha cig ni gtso bo 'ba' zhig las 'bras bu tha dad pa 'di dag 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la grangs can kha cig ni gtso bo 'ba' zhig las 'bras bu tha dad pa 'di dag 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: Regarding this, some SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say that these different effects do not arise from the primal substance alone,

original: de ni sems pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni sems pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because that is devoid of intention.

original: sems pa med pa ni byin gyis rlob pa po med pa rang gi 'bras bu rtsom par byed pa ma mthong la /
analyzed: sems pa med pa ni byin gyis rlob pa po med pa rang gi 'bras bu rtsom par byed pa ma mthong la /
translated: But we do not see that a non-intelligent being, without an instigator, can begin to produce its effect.

original: skyes bu byin gyis rlob pa por yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: skyes bu byin gyis rlob pa por yang mi rigs te /
translated: And it is not right to say that God is the instigator of the effect,

original: de'i tshe mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because at that time he would be ignorant of it.

original: 'di ltar blo nges pa'i don nyid skyes bus shes par byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar blo nges pa'i don nyid skyes bus shes par byed de /
translated: For the intellect, which is the very essence of the truth of the matter, is known by the person.

original: 'byin pa'i sngar blo 'di ni mi shes pa kho na ste /
analyzed: 'byin pa'i sngar blo 'di ni mi shes pa kho na ste /
translated: Prior to the production of the effect, this intellect is completely ignorant of it,

original: nam yang don 'ga' yang shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nam yang don 'ga' yang shes pa ma yin no //
translated: and it never knows any object.

original: don mi shes par yang 'ga' yang bya bar mi nus pas 'di byed pa po ma yin no //
analyzed: don mi shes par yang 'ga' yang bya bar mi nus pas 'di byed pa po ma yin no //
translated: And since it is not possible to do anything without knowing the object, it is not the agent.

original: de lta bas na dbang phyug nyid gtso bo la ltos nas 'bras bu tha dad ba'i byed pa po yin gyi 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na dbang phyug nyid gtso bo la ltos nas 'bras bu tha dad ba'i byed pa po yin gyi 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, God, depending on the primal substance, is the agent of the various effects, but not by himself.

original: lha spyin la sogs pa gcig pu skyed par byed pa ni ma yin la /
analyzed: lha spyin la sogs pa gcig pu skyed par byed pa ni ma yin la /
translated: He is not the sole producer of Devadatta, etc.

original: rdza mkhan 'ba' zhig kyang bum pa byed pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rdza mkhan 'ba' zhig kyang bum pa byed pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: And the potter alone is not the maker of the pot.

original: rang bzhin dang dbang phyug dag so sor rgyu yin pa bkag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang dbang phyug dag so sor rgyu yin pa bkag pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the individual natures and ƒ™≈õvara are refuted as causes,

original: dbang phyug dang gtso bo zhes bya ba gnyi ga lhan cig pa 'di yang skye ba can te /
analyzed: dbang phyug dang gtso bo zhes bya ba gnyi ga lhan cig pa 'di yang skye ba can te /
translated: this pair, ƒ™≈õvara and pradhƒÅna, are also not the generators of what is born,

original: skye ba dang ldan pa'i byed pa ste /
analyzed: skye ba dang ldan pa'i byed pa ste /
translated: because they are not the agents of generation that have birth.

original: skyed par byed pa zhes bya bar ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa zhes bya bar ma grub pa'o //
translated: They are not established as generators.

original: 'on te 'di dag so sor byed pa po nyid bkag mod kyi /
analyzed: 'on te 'di dag so sor byed pa po nyid bkag mod kyi /
translated: But even though the individual are refuted as agents,

original: 'on kyang lhan cig pa ma bkag pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'on kyang lhan cig pa ma bkag pa nyid de /
translated: nevertheless, the pair are not refuted as co-originators.

original: mig la sogs pa 'ba' zhig pa rnams ni mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed pa la nus pa med la /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa 'ba' zhig pa rnams ni mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed pa la nus pa med la /
translated: The individual eye, etc. do not have the power to generate visual consciousness,

original: lhan cig pa rnams mi 'gyur ba ni ma yin la zhes dogs pa la /
analyzed: lhan cig pa rnams mi 'gyur ba ni ma yin la zhes dogs pa la /
translated: but the co-originators do not fail to do so.

original: lhan cig de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: lhan cig de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To anticipate this qualm, he says, ‚ÄúThe co-originators, etc.

original: lhan cig pa zhes bya ba ni lhan cig byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: lhan cig pa zhes bya ba ni lhan cig byed pa nyid do //
translated: ‚Äù Co-originators are co-producing causes.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: They are of two types:

original: phan tshun khyab par byed pa'am /
analyzed: phan tshun khyab par byed pa'am /
translated: those that pervade each other,

original: don gcig byed pa yin grang /
analyzed: don gcig byed pa yin grang /
translated: and those that perform the same function.

original: de la re zhig khyad par skyed par byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi lhan cig byed pa nyid kyis brtag pa dang po ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig khyad par skyed par byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi lhan cig byed pa nyid kyis brtag pa dang po ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: First, the hypothesis that the cause is a co-operating condition in the production of a specific effect is not reasonable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: dbang phyug dang gtso bo de rtag pa nyid kyis 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang phyug dang gtso bo de rtag pa nyid kyis 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because God and primal matter are permanent and unchanging.

original: rtog pa gnyis pa yang rigs pa ma yin te zhes skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: rtog pa gnyis pa yang rigs pa ma yin te zhes skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: The second hypothesis is also not reasonable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'bras bu rnams cig car thal bar 'gyur @179b ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu rnams cig car thal bar 'gyur @179b ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the effect would follow immediately,

original: nus pa thogs pa med cing ma tshang ba med pa'i dbang phyug dang gtso bo zhes bya ba'i rgyu rtag tu nye ba nyid kyis rgyu ma tshang ba med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa thogs pa med cing ma tshang ba med pa'i dbang phyug dang gtso bo zhes bya ba'i rgyu rtag tu nye ba nyid kyis rgyu ma tshang ba med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the cause, whether God or primal matter, is always present, its power unobstructed and complete.

original: 'dir yang snga ma bzhin du gang rgyu ma tshang ba med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i thal ba'i sgrub par byed pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang snga ma bzhin du gang rgyu ma tshang ba med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i thal ba'i sgrub par byed pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: Here, as before, the argument is to be formulated as follows: ‚ÄúIf the cause is complete, the effect will be produced immediately, because the cause is complete, like the production of a pot, etc., when the potter, etc., are present.‚Äù

original: ci ste brjod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi lugs kyis gang rgyu ma tshang ba med pa zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa nyid du rjod par byed do //
analyzed: ci ste brjod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi lugs kyis gang rgyu ma tshang ba med pa zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa nyid du rjod par byed do //
translated: But if you say that the reason ‚Äúbecause the cause is not incomplete‚Äù is not established, then the reason is not established.

original: rgyu gnyis po de dag rtag tu nye ba yin mod kyi /
analyzed: rgyu gnyis po de dag rtag tu nye ba yin mod kyi /
translated: The two causes are always present,

original: 'on kyang rim gyis 'bras bu tha dad pa 'di dag la 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on kyang rim gyis 'bras bu tha dad pa 'di dag la 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: but the effect arises gradually.

original: 'di ltar dbang phyug gi lhan cig byed pa ni gtso bo la yod pa'i snying stobs la sogs pa'i yon tan gsum yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dbang phyug gi lhan cig byed pa ni gtso bo la yod pa'i snying stobs la sogs pa'i yon tan gsum yin te /
translated: The cooperating cause of God is the three gunas, sattva, etc., that exist in prakriti.

original: de dag kyang rim gyis 'jug pa'i phyir de'i 'bras bu la yang rim gyis 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang rim gyis 'jug pa'i phyir de'i 'bras bu la yang rim gyis 'gyur ro //
translated: And since they operate gradually, their effect also arises gradually.

original: 'di ltar gang gi tshe rdul shas cher 'phel ba dang ldan pa de'i tshe dbang phyug skye dgu rnams kyi 'byin pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi tshe rdul shas cher 'phel ba dang ldan pa de'i tshe dbang phyug skye dgu rnams kyi 'byin pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: When the quality of rajas predominates, then God is the cause of the creation of living beings,

original: rdul ni 'byin pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul ni 'byin pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because rajas is the cause of creation.

original: gang gi tshe snying stobs shas cher 'phel ba la rten par byed pa'i tshe 'jig rten gnas pa'i rgyur 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe snying stobs shas cher 'phel ba la rten par byed pa'i tshe 'jig rten gnas pa'i rgyur 'gyur te /
translated: When sattva increases, it is the cause of the world remaining.

original: snying stobs ni gnas pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snying stobs ni gnas pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because sattva is the cause of remaining.

original: gang gi tshe mun pa shas che ba'i nus pa dang ldan pa de'i tshe 'gro ba thams cad 'jig pa dang nyams par byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe mun pa shas che ba'i nus pa dang ldan pa de'i tshe 'gro ba thams cad 'jig pa dang nyams par byed par 'gyur te /
translated: When tamas increases, it causes the destruction and degeneration of all beings.

original: mun pa ni 'jig pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mun pa ni 'jig pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because tamas is the cause of destruction.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: skye ba dang ldan rdul la rten //
analyzed: skye ba dang ldan rdul la rten //
translated: ‚ÄúRelying on rajas endowed with birth,

original: snying stobs 'phel ba gnas pa yin //
analyzed: snying stobs 'phel ba gnas pa yin //
translated: Sattva increases and remains.üîΩTouching tamas, beings are born,

original: mun pa la reg skye dgu 'jig / skye med 'byin gnas 'jig pa'i rgyu //
analyzed: mun pa la reg skye dgu 'jig / skye med 'byin gnas 'jig pa'i rgyu //
translated: The cause of non-birth, emergence, and destruction.

original: gsum gyi rang bzhin yon tan ni //
analyzed: gsum gyi rang bzhin yon tan ni //
translated: The qualities have the nature of the three.

original: gsum gyi bdag la phyag 'tshal lo //üîΩzhes smras pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gsum gyi bdag la phyag 'tshal lo // zhes smras pa lta bu'o //
translated: I pay homage to the Self of the three.

original: grag cas bya ba'i sgra ni mi srid pa'i don to //
analyzed: grag cas bya ba'i sgra ni mi srid pa'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúsaid‚Äù means it is impossible.

original: 'dir bshad ces bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed do //
analyzed: 'dir bshad ces bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed do //
translated: Here, he replies with ‚ÄúIt is said‚Äù and so on.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni rang bzhin dang dbang phyug go //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni rang bzhin dang dbang phyug go //
translated: ‚ÄúThose‚Äù refers to intrinsic nature and God.

original: gcig byed tshe zhes bya ba ni 'byin pa dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa dag las gang yang rung ba gcig byed pa'i tshe de las gzhan pa'i 'bras bu gnyis skyed par byed pa'i nus pa ci yod dam /
analyzed: gcig byed tshe zhes bya ba ni 'byin pa dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa dag las gang yang rung ba gcig byed pa'i tshe de las gzhan pa'i 'bras bu gnyis skyed par byed pa'i nus pa ci yod dam /
translated: When one of them is active, that is, when one of them is creating, maintaining, or destroying, what is the capacity of the other two to produce the other two effects?

original: 'on te med ces bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis so //üîΩde la gal te yod na de'i tshe 'byin pa'i tshe yang rgyu ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir gnas pa dang 'jig pa'i bdag nyid @180a * //
analyzed: 'on te med ces bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis so // de la gal te yod na de'i tshe 'byin pa'i tshe yang rgyu ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir gnas pa dang 'jig pa'i bdag nyid @180a * //
translated: Or, do they not have that capacity? These are the two alternatives.

original: kyi 'bras bu gzhan gnyis kyang skye ba bzhin du 'gyur ro //üîΩde bzhin du gnas pa'i dus su yang skye ba dang 'jig pa thob par 'gyur la /
analyzed: kyi 'bras bu gzhan gnyis kyang skye ba bzhin du 'gyur ro // de bzhin du gnas pa'i dus su yang skye ba dang 'jig pa thob par 'gyur la /
translated: If they do have that capacity, then at the time of creation, the other two effects, which have the nature of maintenance and destruction, would arise, because the causes of those two are complete.üîΩSimilarly, at the time of maintenance, creation and destruction would occur.

original: 'jig pa'i dus na yang skye ba dang gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i dus na yang skye ba dang gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: And at the time of destruction, creation and maintenance would occur.

original: de ltar yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: But that is not logical.

original: phan tshun spangs te gnas pa dag ni chos can gcig la dus gcig tu srid par rigs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: phan tshun spangs te gnas pa dag ni chos can gcig la dus gcig tu srid par rigs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is also illogical that mutually exclusive states exist in a single basis at the same time.

original: 'di snyam du 'bras bu gcig po de skye ba'i dus na rang bzhin dang dbang phyug de dag 'bras bu gzhan skye ba la ngo bo gzhan mi nye ste /
analyzed: 'di snyam du 'bras bu gcig po de skye ba'i dus na rang bzhin dang dbang phyug de dag 'bras bu gzhan skye ba la ngo bo gzhan mi nye ste /
translated: If you think that when that single effect arises, the nature and the almighty are not near to another state that would give rise to another effect,

original: des na de'i tshe de dag tu thal bar mi 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: des na de'i tshe de dag tu thal bar mi 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
translated: then at that time, the error of their being many would not occur.

original: de ni ngo bo gzhan zhig gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ni ngo bo gzhan zhig gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to that, Aryadeva says, ‚ÄúIt is not by another state.‚ÄùüîΩ‚Äú

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin dang dbang phyug tu brjod pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin dang dbang phyug tu brjod pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: That‚Äù refers to the cause that is called ‚Äúnature‚Äù and ‚Äúalmighty.‚ÄùüîΩ‚Äú

original: gzhan zhig gis zhes bya ba ni phyis kyi 'bras bu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan zhig gis zhes bya ba ni phyis kyi 'bras bu gnyis pa'o //
translated: By another state‚Äù refers to the second effect that occurs later.

original: gzhan zhig gi ngo bos ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan zhig gi ngo bos ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not by another state.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /üîΩrang gi ngo bo kho nas rgyu yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no ;
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na / rang gi ngo bo kho nas rgyu yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no ;
translated: What is it then?üîΩIt is a cause by its own state alone.

original: /'di snyam du gzhan gyi ngo bos byed pa ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: /'di snyam du gzhan gyi ngo bos byed pa ma yin mod kyi /
translated: You may think, ‚ÄúIt is not that it is a cause by another state.

original: 'on kyang 'bras bu gcig skyed pa'i dus na 'bras bu lhag ma gnyis po skyed pa la 'di la nus pa med de /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'bras bu gcig skyed pa'i dus na 'bras bu lhag ma gnyis po skyed pa la 'di la nus pa med de /
translated: But when it produces one effect, it has no power to produce the remaining two effects.

original: des na de'i tshe 'bras bu gnyis po mi skyed do snyam du sems na /üîΩde yi nus pa dang bral na //
analyzed: des na de'i tshe 'bras bu gnyis po mi skyed do snyam du sems na / de yi nus pa dang bral na //
translated: Therefore, at that time, it does not produce the two effects.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If you think that, it is said, ‚ÄúIf it is devoid of that power . . . ‚Äù and so on.

original: gzhan tshe zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu rtsom pa'i tshe'o //
analyzed: gzhan tshe zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu rtsom pa'i tshe'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAt another time‚Äù means at the time of the composition of the desired effect.

original: 'di snyam du gtso bo las nus pa thams cad nye ba yin mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gtso bo las nus pa thams cad nye ba yin mod kyi /
translated: You may think that all powers are present in the primal substance,

original: 'on kyang gang kho na shas cher 'phel ba nyid rgyu yin par khong du chud par bya'i /
analyzed: 'on kyang gang kho na shas cher 'phel ba nyid rgyu yin par khong du chud par bya'i /
translated: but you should understand that only that which increases to a greater degree is the cause,

original: gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: not the others.

original: des na 'bras bu rnams cig car 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro snyam na /üîΩnus pa'i ngo bo shas cher yang //
analyzed: des na 'bras bu rnams cig car 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro snyam na / nus pa'i ngo bo shas cher yang //
translated: Therefore the effects do not occur simultaneously.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If you think that, it is said, ‚ÄúEven the nature of power is greater . . . ‚Äù and so on.

original: snying stobs la sogs pa shas che ba'i ngo bos 'di ni re zhig rtag go zhes ni brjod par mi rigs te /
analyzed: snying stobs la sogs pa shas che ba'i ngo bos 'di ni re zhig rtag go zhes ni brjod par mi rigs te /
translated: It is not logical to say, ‚ÄúThis is permanent,‚Äù on the basis of the nature of the predominance of sattva and so on.

original: res 'ga' ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: res 'ga' ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because sometimes it is not.

original: de lta yin pas na dngos po 'di 'ga' zhig gi tshe rang bzhin dang dbang phyug tu brjod pa'i rgyu las sam /
analyzed: de lta yin pas na dngos po 'di 'ga' zhig gi tshe rang bzhin dang dbang phyug tu brjod pa'i rgyu las sam /
translated: Since that is so, there are three conceptual thoughts: ‚ÄúThis thing is sometimes a cause called ‚Äòinherent nature‚Äô or ‚Äòƒ™≈õvara,‚Äô

original: rgyu gzhan las sam /üîΩrang dga' ba yin zhes rnam par rtog pa gsum mo //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan las sam / rang dga' ba yin zhes rnam par rtog pa gsum mo //
translated: or it is a cause other than that,üîΩor it is independent.‚Äù

original: de la phyogs dang po la ni shas che ba'i ngo bo de thams cad du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la phyogs dang po la ni shas che ba'i ngo bo de thams cad du 'gyur te /
translated: Regarding that, in the first case, that dominant entity would be everything,

original: rang bzhin dang dbang phyug ces bya ba'i rgyu ni rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis rtag tu nye ba @180b nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang dbang phyug ces bya ba'i rgyu ni rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis rtag tu nye ba @180b nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the cause called ‚Äúinherent nature‚Äù or ‚Äúƒ™≈õvara‚Äù is always present, due to the nature of being permanent.

original: phyogs gnyis pa la yang /üîΩgzhan gyis gzhan dag mi 'dod pa //
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa la yang / gzhan gyis gzhan dag mi 'dod pa //
translated: In the second case,üîΩit is not asserted by others that

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: other things arise from other things.

original: gang gis de gzhan las 'byung ba'i ngo bor 'gyur ba rang bzhin dang dbang phyug las ma gtogs pa'i rgyu gzhan 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis de gzhan las 'byung ba'i ngo bor 'gyur ba rang bzhin dang dbang phyug las ma gtogs pa'i rgyu gzhan 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not asserted that it arises from a cause other than inherent nature or ƒ™≈õvara, from which it would be different.

original: phyogs gsum pa yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa /
analyzed: phyogs gsum pa yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa /
translated: The third case is also illogical.

original: res 'ga' nyid ni srid pa'i phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //üîΩci ste rang dga' ba yin mod /
analyzed: res 'ga' nyid ni srid pa'i phyir // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // ci ste rang dga' ba yin mod /
translated: because sometimes it is possible.

original: res 'ga' ba nyid ni ci 'gal zhe na /
analyzed: res 'ga' ba nyid ni ci 'gal zhe na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúWhat is the contradiction in being sometimes?‚Äù

original: rang las yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rang las yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response is, ‚ÄúIf it were from itself, etc. ‚Äù

original: rang las te rang bzhin las skye ba yin na rgyu med pa can nyid du nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang las te rang bzhin las skye ba yin na rgyu med pa can nyid du nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were from itself, i.e., from its own nature, it would certainly be causeless.

original: 'on te rang bzhin las skye na ji ltar rgyu med par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'on te rang bzhin las skye na ji ltar rgyu med par 'gyur /
translated: But if it arises from its own nature, how could it be causeless?

original: ji srid du rang bzhin kho na nyid de'i rgyu yin par rtogs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ji srid du rang bzhin kho na nyid de'i rgyu yin par rtogs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: As long as its own nature is understood to be its cause.

original: rang la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rang la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The response is, ‚ÄúBecause it is contradictory for it to act on itself. ‚Äù

original: rang rang gi ngo bo la byed pa rgyu'i ngo bor 'gal ba'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di snyam du rgyu med pa nyid yin la rag mod /
analyzed: rang rang gi ngo bo la byed pa rgyu'i ngo bor 'gal ba'i phyir ro // 'di snyam du rgyu med pa nyid yin la rag mod /
translated: It is contradictory for an entity to act on itself as a cause.

original: de lta na yang ci'i phyir res 'ga' bar mi rigs snyam du sems na /üîΩdngos po rnams ni ltos pa yin //
analyzed: de lta na yang ci'i phyir res 'ga' bar mi rigs snyam du sems na / dngos po rnams ni ltos pa yin //
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúLet it be causeless, but why is it not tenable that it is sometimes?‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response is, ‚ÄúThings are dependent. ‚Äù

original: dngos po rnams rang bzhin gzhan la rag las nas 'jug pa ni res 'ga' zhig rigs te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams rang bzhin gzhan la rag las nas 'jug pa ni res 'ga' zhig rigs te /
translated: It is sometimes logical that things operate in dependence on other intrinsic natures.

original: de dag gi yod pa dang med pa dag ni gzhan yod pa dang med pa dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi yod pa dang med pa dag ni gzhan yod pa dang med pa dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because their existence and non-existence are related to the existence and non-existence of others.

original: gang gi phyir gang dag gzhan la rag ma las par 'jug pa de dag ni ltos par bya ba 'ga' zhig kyang med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang dag gzhan la rag ma las par 'jug pa de dag ni ltos par bya ba 'ga' zhig kyang med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because those that operate without depending on others do not exist at all.

original: ci ste res 'ga' bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ci ste res 'ga' bar 'gyur /
translated: How could they sometimes exist?

original: 'on te yang rang la byed pa 'gal ba nyid ji ltar 'grub ce na /
analyzed: 'on te yang rang la byed pa 'gal ba nyid ji ltar 'grub ce na /
translated: But how is it established that it is contradictory for something to act on itself?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response, Aryadeva says

original: dngos po bdag nyid skye ba yin na /
analyzed: dngos po bdag nyid skye ba yin na /
translated: If an entity arises from itself,

original: grub pa zhig gam /üîΩma grub pa zhig skye grang /
analyzed: grub pa zhig gam / ma grub pa zhig skye grang /
translated: is it already existent or not?

original: re zhig grub pa ni ma yin te /üîΩde'i gnas skabs na yang bdag nyid kyang grub pa'i ngo bo las /
analyzed: re zhig grub pa ni ma yin te / de'i gnas skabs na yang bdag nyid kyang grub pa'i ngo bo las /
translated: It is not already existent.

original: tha mi dad pa nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo bzhin du rab tu grub pa'i phyir te yongs su grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo bzhin du rab tu grub pa'i phyir te yongs su grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because at that time, it would be just like its own nature, which is not different from that which is already existent, since it is already established, already accomplished.

original: de lta yin dang bskyed par bya ba med pa'i phyir dngos po 'di gang du byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta yin dang bskyed par bya ba med pa'i phyir dngos po 'di gang du byed par 'gyur /
translated: If that were so, then since there would be no object to be produced, what would this thing be doing?

original: ma grub pa yang ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: ma grub pa yang ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: To show that it is not the case that it is not established, he says:

original: bdag gi de nyid ma grub na //
analyzed: bdag gi de nyid ma grub na //
translated: If the reality of the self is not established,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni spyi'i tshig ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni spyi'i tshig ste /
translated: and so on. ‚Äú Some‚Äù is a general term.

original: rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa ma yin la /
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa ma yin la /
translated: It is not the case that it becomes one‚Äôs own nature,üîΩand it is not the case that it becomes the nature of another.

original: gzhan gyi bdag nyid du gyur pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba'i don @181a * //
analyzed: gzhan gyi bdag nyid du gyur pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba'i don @181a * //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: to ; / bya ba yod na grub pa'i bdag nyid kyi de kho na nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: to ; / bya ba yod na grub pa'i bdag nyid kyi de kho na nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If there is an action, then it would be the reality of an established self,üîΩbecause that is the mere characteristic of establishment.

original: grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni de tsam yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni de tsam yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: This is the thought.

original: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel las gnyi ga brtag pa ste gsum pa'o /
analyzed: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel las gnyi ga brtag pa ste gsum pa'o /
translated: This is the third chapter, the chapter on the examination of both.

original: // / sogs pa'i sgras 'phangs pa rang bzhin smra ba'i rtsod pa ni brjod par bya ba nyung ba nyid kyis go rims la ma brten par sel bar byed pa ni rang bzhin smra ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: // / sogs pa'i sgras 'phangs pa rang bzhin smra ba'i rtsod pa ni brjod par bya ba nyung ba nyid kyis go rims la ma brten par sel bar byed pa ni rang bzhin smra ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The essentialist is one who maintains that things arise from themselves, etc.

original: rang bzhin smra ba ni sogs pa'i sgras dngos su ma 'phangs mod kyi /
analyzed: rang bzhin smra ba ni sogs pa'i sgras dngos su ma 'phangs mod kyi /
translated: Although the word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù does not explicitly suggest the essentialist,

original: 'on kyang rang bzhin rgyur smra ba'i lugs blangs nas bstan pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang rang bzhin rgyur smra ba'i lugs blangs nas bstan pa kho na'o //
translated: nevertheless, it is taught by taking the system of the essentialist who maintains that essence is the cause.

original: de la gang dag dngos po rnams rang nyid las skye ba yin no zhes smra ba de dag rang las byed par 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa bkag nas da ni rang bzhin smra ba 'gegs so //
analyzed: de la gang dag dngos po rnams rang nyid las skye ba yin no zhes smra ba de dag rang las byed par 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa bkag nas da ni rang bzhin smra ba 'gegs so //
translated: There, having refuted those who maintain that things arise from themselves with arguments such as ‚ÄúIt would follow that the agent and object are the same‚Äù, now the essentialist is refuted.

original: de dag ni 'di skad du smra ste dngos po rnams rang las skye ba ma yin zhing gzhan las kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni 'di skad du smra ste dngos po rnams rang las skye ba ma yin zhing gzhan las kyang ma yin no //
translated: They say this: Things do not arise from themselves, nor from another.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Well then, what?

original: rgyu rnams kun la mi ltos par rang dang gzhan gyi rgyu la ltos pa med par zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu rnams kun la mi ltos par rang dang gzhan gyi rgyu la ltos pa med par zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúNot depending on any causes‚Äù means not depending on causes that are either the same or different.

original: 'on te gang dag dngos po rnams rang nyid las skye ba yin no zhes smra ba de dag las 'di dag khyad par ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'on te gang dag dngos po rnams rang nyid las skye ba yin no zhes smra ba de dag las 'di dag khyad par ci yod ce na /
translated: But what is the difference between those who say that things arise from themselves and those who say that things arise from other?

original: de dag rang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de dag rang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúThey also say that things arise from themselves.‚Äù

original: de dag ni rang bzhin du smra ba dag go //
analyzed: de dag ni rang bzhin du smra ba dag go //
translated: ‚ÄúThey‚Äù refers to the essentialists.

original: rang yang zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: rang yang zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom themselves‚Äù means from their own intrinsic reality.

original: yang gi sgras ni gzhan gyi ngo bo yang ngo //
analyzed: yang gi sgras ni gzhan gyi ngo bo yang ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that they also arise from other.

original: snga ma ni rang bzhin rgyur 'dod la /
analyzed: snga ma ni rang bzhin rgyur 'dod la /
translated: The former view asserts that intrinsic reality is the cause.

original: 'di ni de yang mi 'dod do //
analyzed: 'di ni de yang mi 'dod do //
translated: The latter view does not assert that.

original: zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
translated: This is the difference.

original: 'di la rigs pa brjod pa gang zhig yod par mi dmigs pa de ni rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul yin te /
analyzed: 'di la rigs pa brjod pa gang zhig yod par mi dmigs pa de ni rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul yin te /
translated: Whatever is not observed to exist in this way is the object of the convention of nonexistence for those who possess conceptual thought.

original: dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the horn of a donkey.

original: dngos po rnams kyi rgyu yang yod par mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gtan tshigs mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi rgyu yang yod par mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gtan tshigs mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: And the cause of things is not perceived to exist. This is the non-apprehension of a reason in the nature of things.

original: gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: And this reason is not unestablished. In order to demonstrate this, he says:

original: 'dam skyes sogs kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dam skyes sogs kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The lotus, etc.

original: 'dam skyes ni padma'o //
analyzed: 'dam skyes ni padma'o //
translated: The lotus is a flower.

original: de'i ge sar la sogs pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i ge sar la sogs pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The stamens, etc. of that are connected with the words.

original: sogs pa smos pas mgul pa dang / 'dab ma dang / ze 'bru la sogs pa dang / tsher ma'i rno ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas mgul pa dang / 'dab ma dang / ze 'bru la sogs pa dang / tsher ma'i rno ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: By mentioning ‚Äúetc.,‚Äù the stalk, the petals, the pistils, etc., and the sharpness of the thorns, etc., are included.

original: sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni kha dog dang / dbyibs dang / rtsub pa la sogs @181b pa'i bye brag go //üîΩgang gis byed ces bya ba ni sus kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni kha dog dang / dbyibs dang / rtsub pa la sogs @181b pa'i bye brag go // gang gis byed ces bya ba ni sus kyang ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúVarious‚Äù refers to the differences in color, shape, roughness, etc.

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rgyu mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rgyu mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy whom is it made?‚Äù It is not made by anyone, because a cause such as God is not perceived.

original: 'di snyam du phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams kyi rgyu mi dmigs pa'i phyir rgyu med pa can du grub mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di snyam du phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams kyi rgyu mi dmigs pa'i phyir rgyu med pa can du grub mod kyi /
translated: If you think in this way, ‚ÄúExternal things are established as being without a cause because their cause is not perceived.

original: sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa nang gi bdag nyid ci ltar grub snyam du sems na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa nang gi bdag nyid ci ltar grub snyam du sems na /
translated: But how are internal things such as suffering established?‚Äù

original: dper na tsher ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dper na tsher ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: For example, it is like a thorn, etc.

original: gal te mngon sum gyis sdug bsngal la sogs pa rgyu med pa can du ma grub pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum gyis sdug bsngal la sogs pa rgyu med pa can du ma grub pa yin mod kyi /
translated: If suffering, etc. are not established as being without a cause by direct perception,

original: 'on kyang rjes su dpag pas grub pa kho na ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang rjes su dpag pas grub pa kho na ste /
translated: nevertheless, they are established by inference.

original: 'di ltar gang zhig res 'ga' ba de ni rgyu med par nges te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zhig res 'ga' ba de ni rgyu med par nges te /
translated: Thus, whatever is occasional is certainly without a cause,

original: dper na tsher ma rno ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na tsher ma rno ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: like the sharpness of a thorn, etc.

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa yang res 'ga' ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa yang res 'ga' ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: Suffering, etc. are also occasional. This is a natural inference.

original: gang zhig yod pa dang med pa na nges par 'ga' zhig yod pa dang med par 'gyur ba de ni de'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig yod pa dang med pa na nges par 'ga' zhig yod pa dang med par 'gyur ba de ni de'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also unreasonable to say that when something exists or does not exist, something else necessarily exists or does not exist, and therefore is the cause of the former.

original: 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is confused.

original: 'di ltar reg pa yod na mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung la med na mi 'byung ba yin na yang 'di mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar reg pa yod na mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung la med na mi 'byung ba yin na yang 'di mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: For example, when contact exists, visual consciousness arises, and when it does not exist, it does not arise. But contact is not the cause of visual consciousness.üîΩTherefore, since the definition of cause and effect is confused,

original: de lta bas na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid 'di ni 'khrul pa yin pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bas na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid 'di ni 'khrul pa yin pas de'i phyir /
translated: it is established that things arise

original: rgyu rnams kun la mi ltos par //üîΩdngos po skye ba zhes bya bar grub bo /
analyzed: rgyu rnams kun la mi ltos par // dngos po skye ba zhes bya bar grub bo /
translated: without relying on any causes at all.

original: zhe na ; 'dam skyes ge sar zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed do //
analyzed: zhe na ; 'dam skyes ge sar zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed do //
translated: In response to that, the root text says, ‚ÄúThe lotus and its fragrance,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di ni gtan tshigs ma grub pa dang / dam bca' ba'i don mngon sum dang 'gal bar ston te /
analyzed: 'di ni gtan tshigs ma grub pa dang / dam bca' ba'i don mngon sum dang 'gal bar ston te /
translated: This shows that the reason is unestablished and that the meaning of the thesis contradicts direct perception.

original: pad ma'i ge sar la sogs pa'i rgyu mi dmigs so zhes gang smras pa de ni ma grub ste /
analyzed: pad ma'i ge sar la sogs pa'i rgyu mi dmigs so zhes gang smras pa de ni ma grub ste /
translated: But the reason, the nonobservation of the cause of the lotus, such as the seed, is not established.üîΩ

original: mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag gis sa bon dang / 'dam dang chu la sogs pa rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang ldan pas rgyu nyid du nges pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di ltar gang zhig yod pa kho na gang zhig skye la /
analyzed: mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag gis sa bon dang / 'dam dang chu la sogs pa rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang ldan pas rgyu nyid du nges pa'i phyir ro // 'di ltar gang zhig yod pa kho na gang zhig skye la /
translated: But the reason is not established, because it is ascertained that the seed, mud, water, etc. are the cause of the lotus, etc. by the presence and absence of the effect.

original: gang zhig 'gyur bas gang 'gyur ba de ni de'i rgyu nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: gang zhig 'gyur bas gang 'gyur ba de ni de'i rgyu nyid du brjod do //
translated: Thus, when something exists, something else arises, and when something changes, something else changes. That is called the cause of that.

original: de yang de lta bur gyur pa 'dam skyes kyi ge sar la sogs pa'i sa bon la sogs pa bong ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par thob pa la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: de yang de lta bur gyur pa 'dam skyes kyi ge sar la sogs pa'i sa bon la sogs pa bong ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par thob pa la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: And that is ascertained by the presence and absence of the seed, mud, water, etc. of the lotus, etc. which are of that kind, in the acquisition of the state of the seed, etc.

original: yod pa dang med pa dang ldan par mngon sum du mi dmigs pa dag gis nges pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub po //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa dang ldan par mngon sum du mi dmigs pa dag gis nges pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub po //
translated: Therefore, the reason is not established, because it is ascertained by direct perception and non-apprehension of the presence and absence of the effect.

original: gang yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan @182a * //
analyzed: gang yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan @182a * //
translated: And what is the reason for the non-existence of the effect?

original: nyid 'khrul lo zhes smras pa de yang ma grub ste /
analyzed: nyid 'khrul lo zhes smras pa de yang ma grub ste /
translated: The statement I am deluded is also not established.üîΩ

original: reg pa yang gzugs kyi rgyu nyid kyis mig gi rnam par shes pa la yang rgyu mtshan gyi dngos por 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: reg pa yang gzugs kyi rgyu nyid kyis mig gi rnam par shes pa la yang rgyu mtshan gyi dngos por 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But that is not established, because contact is also asserted to be the cause of form and the basis of the eye consciousness.

original: 'di ltar reg pa ni 'byung ba dag la brjod la /
analyzed: 'di ltar reg pa ni 'byung ba dag la brjod la /
translated: Thus contact is said to be the cause of the primary elements,

original: de dag la yang brten nas gzugs la 'jug go //
analyzed: de dag la yang brten nas gzugs la 'jug go //
translated: and form is said to be based on them.

original: de'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa la reg pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi dngos po yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: de'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa la reg pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi dngos po yod pa nyid de /
translated: Therefore the eye consciousness has contact as its basis.

original: dngos dang brgyud pas byas pa'i khyad par 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: dngos dang brgyud pas byas pa'i khyad par 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: The difference is only whether the cause is direct or indirect.

original: kho bo cag gis ni ldog pa tsam rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nges pa'i rgyu nyid du khas ma blangs so //
analyzed: kho bo cag gis ni ldog pa tsam rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nges pa'i rgyu nyid du khas ma blangs so //
translated: We do not assert that mere reversal is the cause of the ascertainment of the relationship of cause and effect.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What do we assert?

original: khyad par can nyid do //üîΩ'di ltar nus pa'i rgyu gzhan gang dag yod na yod la /
analyzed: khyad par can nyid do // 'di ltar nus pa'i rgyu gzhan gang dag yod na yod la /
