translated: We assert that the specific cause is the cause.üîΩThus, if some other potential cause exists, it exists;

original: gang zhig med pas gang mi 'byung ba de ni de'i rgyu yin no zhes smra'i /
analyzed: gang zhig med pas gang mi 'byung ba de ni de'i rgyu yin no zhes smra'i /
translated: if some other potential cause does not exist, it does not exist.

original: gang zhig med par gang mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i ldog pa tsam ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig med par gang mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i ldog pa tsam ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not merely a negation in the form of ‚Äúwithout that, this does not occur.‚Äù

original: de lta ma yin nam bag mar len par 'os pa'i yul du skye ba'i 'bra go //
analyzed: de lta ma yin nam bag mar len par 'os pa'i yul du skye ba'i 'bra go //
translated: Otherwise, it would be mistaken to say that a man is not a suitable husband for a woman,

original: ma bag mar len pa med na med pa'i phyir 'khrul par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma bag mar len pa med na med pa'i phyir 'khrul par 'gyur ro //
translated: because he does not exist without her.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i ldog pa la reg pas 'khrul pa med do //üîΩ'di ltar gal te gzugs la sogs pa nye bar bstan nas /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i ldog pa la reg pas 'khrul pa med do // 'di ltar gal te gzugs la sogs pa nye bar bstan nas /
translated: But there is no mistake in touching on such a negation.üîΩIf it were taught that visual consciousness does not occur without contact,

original: reg pa gcig pu med pa'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ngo zhes de ltar bstan na de'i tshe 'khrul par 'gyur na /
analyzed: reg pa gcig pu med pa'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ngo zhes de ltar bstan na de'i tshe 'khrul par 'gyur na /
translated: after form and so on are presented, then there would be a mistake, because contact alone does not exist.

original: 'di yang bstan par mi nus te /
analyzed: 'di yang bstan par mi nus te /
translated: But this cannot be taught.

original: de'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po la 'khrul pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po la 'khrul pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no mistake in the nature of cause and effect.

original: sa bon la sogs pa dngos po rnams kyi rgyu nyid du nges pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: sa bon la sogs pa dngos po rnams kyi rgyu nyid du nges pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is it certain that seeds and so on are the causes of things,

original: so sor nges pa'i yul dang dus kyang nges pa yin no zhes ston pa ni /üîΩyul dang dus kyi nges pa la 'ang //
analyzed: so sor nges pa'i yul dang dus kyang nges pa yin no zhes ston pa ni / yul dang dus kyi nges pa la 'ang //
translated: And the object and time of each are also ascertained.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The verse ‚ÄúEven in regard to the ascertainment of object and time‚Äù and so on is stated to show this.

original: gal te pad ma la sogs pa de'i rgyu nyid so sor nges pa'i yul dang dus rgyu nyid du mi 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te pad ma la sogs pa de'i rgyu nyid so sor nges pa'i yul dang dus rgyu nyid du mi 'gyur na ni /
translated: If the cause of a lotus and so on were not ascertained as the cause of each object and time,

original: de'i tshe gang 'di rdo la sogs pa'i yul spangs nas chu la sogs pa so sor nges pa'i yul la 'jug pa dang / gang dgun la sogs pa'i dus yongs su spangs nas sog la sogs pa'i dus su 'jug pa der mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de'i tshe gang 'di rdo la sogs pa'i yul spangs nas chu la sogs pa so sor nges pa'i yul la 'jug pa dang / gang dgun la sogs pa'i dus yongs su spangs nas sog la sogs pa'i dus su 'jug pa der mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: then at that time, it would not be the case that it is engaged in an object that is ascertained as water and so on, having abandoned an object such as a rock, and it would not be the case that it is engaged in a time such as spring, having abandoned a time such as winter.

original: 'on kyang yul thams cad dang dus thams cad du pad ma la sogs pa'i dngos po de dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on kyang yul thams cad dang dus thams cad du pad ma la sogs pa'i dngos po de dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: However, those things such as lotuses would arise in all objects and at all times.

original: de ni ltos pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni ltos pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is independent.

original: de lta bas na gang zhig de las gzhan pa'i yul dang dus yongs @182b su spangs nas so sor nges pa'i yul la sogs par nges par 'jug pa de ni ltos pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya bar nges so //
analyzed: de lta bas na gang zhig de las gzhan pa'i yul dang dus yongs @182b su spangs nas so sor nges pa'i yul la sogs par nges par 'jug pa de ni ltos pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya bar nges so //
translated: Thus, it is certain that whatever engages a specific object, etc., having excluded all other objects, etc., is dependent.

original: bsam pa med pa'i dngos po 'di dag ci la ltos shen /
analyzed: bsam pa med pa'i dngos po 'di dag ci la ltos shen /
translated: How can these things that are devoid of thought engage in dependence?

original: de ltos de ltar 'jug pa yin //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ltos de ltar 'jug pa yin // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: They engage in dependence in that way.

original: de bzhin du de las gzhan pa'i yul la sogs pa spangs nas yul la sogs pa nges pa la 'jug pa gang yin 'di nyid ltos pa zhes bya ba'i bsam pa'i bdag nyid can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du de las gzhan pa'i yul la sogs pa spangs nas yul la sogs pa nges pa la 'jug pa gang yin 'di nyid ltos pa zhes bya ba'i bsam pa'i bdag nyid can ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, it is not the case that the very engagement in a specific object, etc., having excluded all other objects, etc., is dependent, which is to say, has the nature of thought.

original: 'di snyam du de la ltos nas 'jug pa de de ltar grub mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di snyam du de la ltos nas 'jug pa de de ltar grub mod kyi /
translated: Although it is established that engagement occurs in dependence on that,

original: 'on kyang de'i 'bras bu nyid du ji ltar nges snyam du sems na /üîΩltos pa 'bras bu nyid du brjod //
analyzed: 'on kyang de'i 'bras bu nyid du ji ltar nges snyam du sems na / ltos pa 'bras bu nyid du brjod //
translated: still, how is it ascertained that it is the effect of that?

original: ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said:üîΩThat dependence is called the effect.

original: de'i 'bras bu nyid gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu nyid gzhan ni med do //
translated: There is no other effect of that.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is it?

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin smra ba'am /üîΩde dag la rang bzhin smra ba'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin smra ba'am / de dag la rang bzhin smra ba'am /
translated: Therefore, they are called ‚Äúessentialists‚ÄùüîΩor ‚Äúthose who speak of essences‚Äù

original: de rang bzhin smra ba zhes bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de rang bzhin smra ba zhes bsdu ba'o //
translated: or ‚Äúthose for whom essences exist.‚Äù

original: gang 'di de ltar 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ltos pa de nyid de'i 'bras bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang 'di de ltar 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ltos pa de nyid de'i 'bras bu zhes bya'o //
translated: That very dependence which has the characteristic of engaging in that way is called ‚Äúthe effect.‚Äù

original: 'di dag gi lta ba gnas pa de yang ji ltar grub ce na /
analyzed: 'di dag gi lta ba gnas pa de yang ji ltar grub ce na /
translated: How is the position of these essentialists established?

original: de ltar 'jug pa'ang mngon sum yin //
analyzed: de ltar 'jug pa'ang mngon sum yin //
translated: ‚Äú That very engagement is also perception‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //üîΩde'i phyir zhas bya ba ni de lta bas na'am /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // de'i phyir zhas bya ba ni de lta bas na'am /
translated: and so on.

original: de dag la ste /
analyzed: de dag la ste /
translated: ‚Äú Therefore‚Äù means ‚Äúbecause of that‚Äù or ‚Äúin that case.‚Äù

original: pad ma la sogs pa la rang bzhin du smra ba dag ces bsdu'o //
analyzed: pad ma la sogs pa la rang bzhin du smra ba dag ces bsdu'o //
translated: ‚Äú Those who speak of essences‚Äù refers to the essentialists.

original: mngon sum gyis ni rab gnod 'gyur //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ni rab gnod 'gyur //
translated: ‚Äú Perception is the most damaging‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa yang gzhan dmigs pa'i bdag nyid yin pas mngon sum gyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa yang gzhan dmigs pa'i bdag nyid yin pas mngon sum gyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: means that non-apprehension is also of the nature of the apprehension of something else, and therefore it is of the nature of perception.

original: gang yang bde ba la sogs pa rnams rgyu med pa can du bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang yang bde ba la sogs pa rnams rgyu med pa can du bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: Someone might argue as follows: In order to prove that such things as pleasureüîΩare without causes, you have said that they are not produced.

original: res 'ga' ba la sogs pa'i sgrub byed brjod pa de ni bsgrub bya las bzlog pa sgrub par byed pa'i phyir 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: res 'ga' ba la sogs pa'i sgrub byed brjod pa de ni bsgrub bya las bzlog pa sgrub par byed pa'i phyir 'gal ba yin te /
translated: Sometimes, the reasoner may say that the reason is ‚Äúbecause of being occasional,‚Äù but that is contradictory, because it proves the opposite of the probandum.

original: ltos pa med pa'i phyir rgyu med pa ni res 'ga' ba nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ltos pa med pa'i phyir rgyu med pa ni res 'ga' ba nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not dependent, it is untenable that the causeless is occasional.

original: dpe yang obsgrub par bya ba ma tshang ba yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: dpe yang obsgrub par bya ba ma tshang ba yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: The example is also incomplete.

original: de ltar re zhig dam bcas pa'i don mngon sum dang 'gal ba dang / gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid du bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig dam bcas pa'i don mngon sum dang 'gal ba dang / gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid du bstan nas /
translated: Thus, first, having shown that the meaning of the thesis contradicts direct perception and that the reason is not established,

original: da ni gtan tshigs grub par khas blangs nas ma nges pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩrgyu yod par ni grub pa la //
analyzed: da ni gtan tshigs grub par khas blangs nas ma nges pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir / rgyu yod par ni grub pa la //
translated: now, in order to demonstrate that the reason is not ascertained, having accepted that the reason is established,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIf the existence of a cause is established,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te mi dmigs pa tsam gtan tshigs nyid du khas len pa de'i tshe ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te mi dmigs pa tsam gtan tshigs nyid du khas len pa de'i tshe ma nges pa yin no //
translated: If mere nonobservation is accepted as the reason, then it is not ascertained.

original: 'di ltar tshad ma med pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshad ma med pa ste /
translated: In that case, there is no valid knowledge.

original: @183a * // tshad ma med pa tsam gyi gtan tshigs kyis don med pa ste mi bdog par nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: @183a * // tshad ma med pa tsam gyi gtan tshigs kyis don med pa ste mi bdog par nges pa ma yin no //
translated: The mere absence of a valid cognition does not ascertain the non-existence of the object.

original: ci'i phyir ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not so?

original: gang phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause the absence of the cause of the effect,‚Äù etc.

original: khyad par byed pa'i rang bzhin dang rgyu ldog na rang gi khyab par bya ba dang 'bras bu ldog par byed de /
analyzed: khyad par byed pa'i rang bzhin dang rgyu ldog na rang gi khyab par bya ba dang 'bras bu ldog par byed de /
translated: When the cause or the nature that produces a distinction is absent, then the effect or the thing distinguished is absent.

original: de la de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba dag gis khyab par bya ba dang 'bras bu dag 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba dag gis khyab par bya ba dang 'bras bu dag 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the effect and the thing distinguished are related by identity and origination from it.

original: tshad ma ni don yod pa'i khyab par byed pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma ni don yod pa'i khyab par byed pa yang ma yin no //
translated: A valid cognition is not the cause of the existence of the object.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it not so?

original: tha dad pa ni yod pa'i phyir tha mi dad pa kho na khyab par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa ni yod pa'i phyir tha mi dad pa kho na khyab par byed pa yin te /
translated: Because the difference exists. Only that which is not different is the cause.

original: dper na shing sha pa'i shing lta bu'o //üîΩtha dad pa ni rgyu nyid kyi khongs su 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dper na shing sha pa'i shing lta bu'o // tha dad pa ni rgyu nyid kyi khongs su 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, a ≈õim≈õapƒÅ is a tree.üîΩThe difference is included in the cause itself.

original: tshad ma dang don yod pa gnyis tha mi dad pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma dang don yod pa gnyis tha mi dad pa yang ma yin te /
translated: A valid cognition and the existence of the object are not non-different.

original: snang ba tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang ba tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the appearances are different.

original: tshad ma don gyi rgyu yang ma yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma don gyi rgyu yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the valid cognition the cause of the object,

original: 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is mistaken.

original: 'di ltar yul dang / dus dang / rang bzhin gyis bskal pa'i don rnams tshad mas yul du ma byas na yang yod par mi 'gal ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ltar yul dang / dus dang / rang bzhin gyis bskal pa'i don rnams tshad mas yul du ma byas na yang yod par mi 'gal ba nyid do //
translated: Thus, it is not contradictory that objects which are separated by place, time, and nature are existent even though the valid cognition does not cognize them as objects.

original: gang med par yang gang byung ba de ni de'i rgyur rigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gang med par yang gang byung ba de ni de'i rgyur rigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And it is not reasonable that what occurs even when something does not exist is the cause of that,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that anything could be the cause of anything.

original: rgyu nyid du khas len na yang rang gi phyogs btang ba yin no //
analyzed: rgyu nyid du khas len na yang rang gi phyogs btang ba yin no //
translated: And if you accept that it is the cause, then you have abandoned your own position.

original: de las byung ba'i phyir yang tshad ma ni don de yod pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i phyir yang tshad ma ni don de yod pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Nor is the valid cognition the cause of the existence of that object because it arises from that.

original: 'di ltar yul du gyur pa'i don nyid las tshad ma byung gi / tshad ma las gzhal bar bya ba'i don ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar yul du gyur pa'i don nyid las tshad ma byung gi / tshad ma las gzhal bar bya ba'i don ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the valid cognition arises from the object which is its object, but the object which is to be cognized does not arise from the valid cognition.

original: ci ste yang 'brel pa med par yang tshad ma don yod pa ldog par khyad par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste yang 'brel pa med par yang tshad ma don yod pa ldog par khyad par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if you say that even without a connection, the valid cognition would be distinguished by the fact that it is the cause of the existence of the object,üîΩthen we reply:

original: gang dngos de lta'i rnam pa min //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang dngos de lta'i rnam pa min // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: That which is a real entity is not of such a form.

original: de lta'i rnam pa min zhes bya ba ni rgyu yang ma yin khyab par byed pa yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de lta'i rnam pa min zhes bya ba ni rgyu yang ma yin khyab par byed pa yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: Here, ‚Äúnot of such a form‚Äù means that it is neither a cause nor a pervader.

original: 'brel pa med pa'i chos log pas ni nges par gzhan log par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa'i chos log pas ni nges par gzhan log par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable that the negation of a phenomenon that is unrelated would necessarily negate another.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it would lead to an absurd consequence.

original: de lta na ni rta log pa na ba lang yang ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni rta log pa na ba lang yang ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were, then when a horse is negated, a cow would also be negated.

original: gzhan yang mi dmigs pa gtan tshigs nyid du khas len pa na skyes bu thams cad kyi dmigs pa log pa'i mtshan nyid len nam /
analyzed: gzhan yang mi dmigs pa gtan tshigs nyid du khas len pa na skyes bu thams cad kyi dmigs pa log pa'i mtshan nyid len nam /
translated: Moreover, when non-apprehension is accepted as a logical reason, is the negation of the object of all persons accepted as the definiendum of non-apprehension,

original: rang gi dmigs pa log ba'i mtshan nyid len grang /
analyzed: rang gi dmigs pa log ba'i mtshan nyid len grang /
translated: or is the negation of one‚Äôs own object accepted as the definiendum of non-apprehension?

original: re zhig dang po ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig dang po ni ma yin te /
translated: First, it is not the negation of the object of all persons.

original: de ni tshu rol mthong bas nges par mi nus pa nyid kyis the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni tshu rol mthong bas nges par mi nus pa nyid kyis the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is uncertain, since it is not possible for one who sees only a part to ascertain it.

original: gang gi phyir skyes bu thams cad kyis rma bya'i mdongs la @183b sogs pa'i rgyu ma mthong ba'i mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba 'di la tshu rol mthong ba rnams kyi tshad ma cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir skyes bu thams cad kyis rma bya'i mdongs la @183b sogs pa'i rgyu ma mthong ba'i mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba 'di la tshu rol mthong ba rnams kyi tshad ma cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Because, in this so-called non-apprehension of the cause of the peacock‚Äôs eye-ornament, etc., by all persons, there is not the slightest valid cognition of those who see only the near side.

original: gang yang rung gis ma mthong ba ste /
analyzed: gang yang rung gis ma mthong ba ste /
translated: It is not seen by anyone.

original: the tshom 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: the tshom 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: It is a confused doubt.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ri'i phug la sogs pa'i nang na yod pa'i d'ur ba dang / rtsva dang / rdo'i dum bu la sogs pa mi dmigs kyang yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ri'i phug la sogs pa'i nang na yod pa'i d'ur ba dang / rtsva dang / rdo'i dum bu la sogs pa mi dmigs kyang yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because, although a rope, grass, a stone, etc., which are inside a mountain cave, etc., are not apprehended, they exist.

original: yod pa mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yod pa mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because it is not contradictory for something to exist.

original: yod pa nyid du nges pa ma yin te the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa nyid du nges pa ma yin te the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not certain that they exist, because there is doubt.

original: gzhan yang 'di ltar khyed la brgal zhing brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di ltar khyed la brgal zhing brtag par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, you should be questioned and investigated in this way:

original: ci dngos po rnams rgyu med pa zhes bya ba'i rang gi phyogs 'di grub par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ci dngos po rnams rgyu med pa zhes bya ba'i rang gi phyogs 'di grub par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: ‚ÄúIn order to establish this position of yours, that things are without a cause,

original: khyed gtan tshigs 'ga' zhig len nam /
analyzed: khyed gtan tshigs 'ga' zhig len nam /
translated: ‚ÄúWill you take some logic?‚ÄùüîΩüîΩ

original: 'on te ma yin /
analyzed: 'on te ma yin /
translated: Do you accept some of the reasons or not?

original: de la gal te mi len pa de'i tshe khyod kyi phyogs mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: de la gal te mi len pa de'i tshe khyod kyi phyogs mi 'grub ste /
translated: If you do not accept them, then your position is not established,

original: tshad ma med par don grub pa yod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma med par don grub pa yod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is impossible to establish a fact without a valid cognition.

original: ci ste len pa de lta na yang khyed kyi phyogs mi 'grub po zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba dang 'brel to //
analyzed: ci ste len pa de lta na yang khyed kyi phyogs mi 'grub po zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba dang 'brel to //
translated: If you do accept them, then your position is not established.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: grub pa de rgyus skyed nyid phyir //
analyzed: grub pa de rgyus skyed nyid phyir //
translated: Because that which is established is produced by a cause.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzhal bya'i yul gyi don grub pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzhal bya'i yul gyi don grub pa ste /
translated: The fact that is to be evaluated is established,

original: nges pa ni rgyu des bskyed par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa ni rgyu des bskyed par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because ascertainment is produced by that cause.

original: de skad du yang slob dpon dpa' bo'i zhal snga nas kyis /üîΩrgyu dang bcas par smra ba rgyu med ces //
analyzed: de skad du yang slob dpon dpa' bo'i zhal snga nas kyis / rgyu dang bcas par smra ba rgyu med ces //
translated: In this regard, ƒÄcƒÅrya ≈ö≈´ra says:

original: dam bca' rang nyid kyis gnod ma yin nam //üîΩci ste'ang gtan tshigs sgrub la snyom las na //
analyzed: dam bca' rang nyid kyis gnod ma yin nam // ci ste'ang gtan tshigs sgrub la snyom las na //
translated: ‚ÄúThe one who advocates that things have a cause is not harmed by the thesis that things are causeless.

original: dam bca' gcig pus 'di la ci zhig 'gyur //üîΩzhes bshad do //
analyzed: dam bca' gcig pus 'di la ci zhig 'gyur //üîΩzhes bshad do //
translated: If you are lazy about establishing the reason, then what is the point of this thesis alone?‚Äù

original: 'di snyam du bdag gis shes par byed pa'i rgyur sbyar gyi /
analyzed: 'di snyam du bdag gis shes par byed pa'i rgyur sbyar gyi /
translated: One might think, I apply the reason in order to make it known,

original: byed pa po ni ma yin no //
analyzed: byed pa po ni ma yin no //
translated: but I am not the agent.

original: des na ci'i phyir bdag gi phyogs sgrub par mi 'gyur snyam du sems na ;
analyzed: des na ci'i phyir bdag gi phyogs sgrub par mi 'gyur snyam du sems na ;
translated: Therefore, why wouldn't my position be established?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To this, the root text says,

original: shes byed gtan tshigs zhes bya ba ni rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i dus na tshul gsum pa'i rtags so //
analyzed: shes byed gtan tshigs zhes bya ba ni rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i dus na tshul gsum pa'i rtags so //
translated: The reason, called the means of knowing, is the evidence with three modes at the time of an inference for oneself.

original: tshig ces bya ba ni gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i tshe'o //
analyzed: tshig ces bya ba ni gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i tshe'o //
translated: The words are at the time of an inference for another.

original: de rab gsal byed ces bya ba ni gtan tshigs de gsal bar byed pa'o ;
analyzed: de rab gsal byed ces bya ba ni gtan tshigs de gsal bar byed pa'o ;
translated: The clear expression is the expression that makes that reason clear.

original: / grub pa'i zhes bya ba ni gzhal bar bya ba'i don nges pa'o //
analyzed: / grub pa'i zhes bya ba ni gzhal bar bya ba'i don nges pa'o //
translated: The establishment is the ascertainment of the object to be evaluated.

original: de lta ma yin na gal te grub pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi dngos por ma grub pa de'i tshe ji ltar de'i shes par byed par 'gyur //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gal te grub pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi dngos por ma grub pa de'i tshe ji ltar de'i shes par byed par 'gyur //
translated: Otherwise, if the reason were not established as a real entity, then how could it make that known?

original: de lta na ni thams cad thams cad kyi shes par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni thams cad thams cad kyi shes par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were, then everything would make everything known.

original: gal te de lta na ji ltar slob dpon gyis @184a * //
analyzed: gal te de lta na ji ltar slob dpon gyis @184a * //
translated: If that is so, how do the masters explain the following?üîΩ

original: byed pa po las shes par byed par mdzad de /
analyzed: byed pa po las shes par byed par mdzad de /
translated: If that is so, how does the master make it known that the agent is the cause of the effect?

original: 'dir yang shes pa'i dbang gis don bstan gyi /
analyzed: 'dir yang shes pa'i dbang gis don bstan gyi /
translated: Here, the meaning of the object is taught by the power of cognition,

original: skyed par byed pa bzhin du yang dag pa'i don gyis ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa bzhin du yang dag pa'i don gyis ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: but not by the correct meaning, as if it were a producer.

original: bsgrub bya skyed par mi byed phyir //
analyzed: bsgrub bya skyed par mi byed phyir //
translated: Because it does not produce the object to be established,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te bsgrub bya'i don skyed par mi byed pa'i phyir 'di shes par byed pa zhes bya ba'i byed pa po ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te bsgrub bya'i don skyed par mi byed pa'i phyir 'di shes par byed pa zhes bya ba'i byed pa po ni ma yin no //
translated: etc. Because it does not produce the object to be established, it is not an agent called a maker.

original: gang yang myu gu la sogs pa'i bsgrub par bya ba skyed bar byed pa de ni byed pa por brjod do zhes bya ba la skyon med do //
analyzed: gang yang myu gu la sogs pa'i bsgrub par bya ba skyed bar byed pa de ni byed pa por brjod do zhes bya ba la skyon med do //
translated: But that which produces the object to be established, such as a sprout, is called an agent. There is no fault in that.

original: 'di thams cad kyis ni slob dpon dpa' bos bshad pa'i skyon gyi thog tu rtsod pa phab pa gang yin pa de'i lan btab pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di thams cad kyis ni slob dpon dpa' bos bshad pa'i skyon gyi thog tu rtsod pa phab pa gang yin pa de'i lan btab pa yin no //
translated: All of this is the reply to the objection that the master ƒÄryadeva raised in his explanation.

original: 'di ltar de la rtsod pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de la rtsod pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The objection is as follows.

original: rgyu med do zhes rgyu dang bcas par smra ba la yang ci'i phyir dam bca' ba la gnod par byed /
analyzed: rgyu med do zhes rgyu dang bcas par smra ba la yang ci'i phyir dam bca' ba la gnod par byed /
translated: Why does the statement of a cause invalidate the thesis that there is no cause?

original: de ni shes par byed pa'i rgyu smra zhing byed pa po ni spong ngo //
analyzed: de ni shes par byed pa'i rgyu smra zhing byed pa po ni spong ngo //
translated: We state a cause that makes it known, but we deny that there is an agent.

original: de'i phyir 'dir lan ni shes par byed pa yang byed pa nyid yin te shes pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir lan ni shes par byed pa yang byed pa nyid yin te shes pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro//
translated: Therefore, the reply here is that that which makes it known is the cause, because it is the cause of knowledge.

original: 'dis ni rang gi tshig dang 'gal bar bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rang gi tshig dang 'gal bar bstan to //
translated: This shows the contradiction with his own words.

original: rgyu med pa nyid la ni sgrub par byed pa'i gtan tshigs 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu med pa nyid la ni sgrub par byed pa'i gtan tshigs 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: As for causelessness, there is no proof at all,

original: khyab pa la mngon sum la sogs pas gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyab pa la mngon sum la sogs pas gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the pervasion is contradicted by perception and so on.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas mjug bsdu ba'i thabs kyis dam bcas pa'i don rjes su dpag pas gnod par ston par byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas mjug bsdu ba'i thabs kyis dam bcas pa'i don rjes su dpag pas gnod par ston par byed do //
translated: Therefore, he concludes with a method of summary, showing that the meaning of the thesis is contradicted by inference.

original: gzhan dag kyang zhes bya ba ni pad ma'i ge sar la sogs pa bsgrub par bya ba'i don gyi yul can gyi shes pa las ma gtogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang zhes bya ba ni pad ma'i ge sar la sogs pa bsgrub par bya ba'i don gyi yul can gyi shes pa las ma gtogs pa rnams so //
translated: ‚ÄúAnd others‚Äù refers to the objects of the probandum, such as the stamen of the lotus, which are excluded from the cognition of the object of the probandum.

original: skye bar nges phyir ro zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i dngos po nye ba na zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: skye bar nges phyir ro zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i dngos po nye ba na zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of the certainty of arising‚Äù is the remainder of the statement, ‚Äúwhen the specific thing is present.‚Äù

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig so sor nges pa'i dngos po nye ba na skye bar nges pa de dag ni rgyu dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig so sor nges pa'i dngos po nye ba na skye bar nges pa de dag ni rgyu dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Those things that are certain to arise when the specific thing is present have a cause,

original: dper na khyed cag gis sgrub par byed pa nye ba na 'byung ba'i bsgrub bya'i don gyi yul can gyi shes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na khyed cag gis sgrub par byed pa nye ba na 'byung ba'i bsgrub bya'i don gyi yul can gyi shes pa lta bu'o //
translated: like, for example, the cognition of the object of the probandum that occurs when the proof is present.

original: pad ma la sogs pa'i dngos po yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: pad ma la sogs pa'i dngos po yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The thing such as the lotus is also like that. This is a natural inference.

original: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel las 'gro ba rang bzhin du smra ba brtag pa ste bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel las 'gro ba rang bzhin du smra ba brtag pa ste bzhi pa'o /
translated: This concludes the fourth chapter of the Commentary on the Compendium of Principles, the examination of the theory of natural origination.

original: // / skye 'jig dag dang mi ldan pa'i //
analyzed: // / skye 'jig dag dang mi ldan pa'i //
translated: The world is not endowed with origination and destruction.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas sgra'i tshangs par smra ba'i gzhung bkod nas sun 'byin par byed do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas sgra'i tshangs par smra ba'i gzhung bkod nas sun 'byin par byed do //
translated: and so on, and then refutes them.

original: de la sgra'i tshangs par smra ba rnams na re /
analyzed: de la sgra'i tshangs par smra ba rnams na re /
translated: The Grammarians say:

original: shar dang nub la sogs pa'i phyogs kyi cha dang bral ba /
analyzed: shar dang nub la sogs pa'i phyogs kyi cha dang bral ba /
translated: The pure state of sound, which is free from the directional parts of east, west, and so on,üîΩis unborn,

original: skye ba med pa /üîΩ@184b 'jig pa med pa /
analyzed: skye ba med pa / @184b 'jig pa med pa /
translated: undying,

original: sgra'i rang bzhin gyi tshangs pa gang yin pa de'i yongs su 'gyur ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po'i tshogs 'di yin no zhes nges par bya'o //
analyzed: sgra'i rang bzhin gyi tshangs pa gang yin pa de'i yongs su 'gyur ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po'i tshogs 'di yin no zhes nges par bya'o //
translated: and is the nature of sound. It is certain that this pure state of sound is the collection of things such as form that are its transformations.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: thog mtha' med pa'i tshangs pa ni //
analyzed: thog mtha' med pa'i tshangs pa ni //
translated: The pure state of sound, which is beginningless and endless,

original: sgra yi de nyid yi ge gang //
analyzed: sgra yi de nyid yi ge gang //
translated: is the reality of sound, which is the syllable.

original: gang las 'gro ba'i tha snyad 'byung /
analyzed: gang las 'gro ba'i tha snyad 'byung /
translated: From it, the conventions of the world arise.

original: don gyi dngos por yongs gyur pa //üîΩzhes bshad de /üîΩde la thog ma ni skye ba'o //
analyzed: don gyi dngos por yongs gyur pa // zhes bshad de / de la thog ma ni skye ba'o //
translated: It is the transformation into the entities of objects.

original: tha ma ni 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: tha ma ni 'jig pa'o //
translated: In this passage, ‚Äúbeginning‚Äù refers to arising, and ‚Äúend‚Äù refers to disintegration.

original: de dag med pa'i phyir thog ma dang mtha' med pa'o //
analyzed: de dag med pa'i phyir thog ma dang mtha' med pa'o //
translated: Since these do not exist, it is beginningless and endless.

original: yi ge zhes bya ba ni aa la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yi ge zhes bya ba ni aa la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúLetter‚Äù is the cause of the letter A, etc.

original: 'dis ni rjod par byed pa'i ngo bos yongs su 'gyur ba bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rjod par byed pa'i ngo bos yongs su 'gyur ba bstan to //
translated: This shows the transformation of the expressive nature.

original: don gyi dngos por zhes bya ba la sogs pas kyang brjod par bya ba'i 'gyur ba bstan to //
analyzed: don gyi dngos por zhes bya ba la sogs pas kyang brjod par bya ba'i 'gyur ba bstan to //
translated: ‚ÄúThe thing that is the meaning,‚Äù etc., shows the transformation of the expressed.

original: tha snyad ces bya ba ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: tha snyad ces bya ba ni khyad par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúConvention‚Äù is a distinction.

original: tshangs pa ni zhes bya ba ni ming yang dag par bsgrags pa'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa ni zhes bya ba ni ming yang dag par bsgrags pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBrahma‚Äù is the proclamation of the name.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di nyid kyi don ston pa ni /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di nyid kyi don ston pa ni /
translated: The meaning of this verse is shown by the following.

original: skye 'jig dag dang mi ldan pa'i //
analyzed: skye 'jig dag dang mi ldan pa'i //
translated: It is not subject to birth and death,

original: zhes bya ba la skye 'jig smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la skye 'jig smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: The mention of birth and death is illustrative.

original: shar dang nub la sogs pa'i phyogs cha dang bral ba zhes bya ba 'di yang 'di ltar rtogs par bya ste /üîΩthog ma dang tha ma nyid kyi cha med cing /
analyzed: shar dang nub la sogs pa'i phyogs cha dang bral ba zhes bya ba 'di yang 'di ltar rtogs par bya ste / thog ma dang tha ma nyid kyi cha med cing /
translated: One should understand that it is also free from the directional parts of east, west, etc.üîΩIt is also shown there to be free from the parts of beginning and end,

original: shar dang nub kyi phyogs cha dang bral ba yang der bstan to //
analyzed: shar dang nub kyi phyogs cha dang bral ba yang der bstan to //
translated: and free from the directional parts of east and west.

original: tshangs pa'i sgra'i rang bzhin ni sgra'i rang gi ngo bo de nyid kyi phyir 'di ni sgra'i de kho na nyid yin pas de ni sgra'i de kho na nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i sgra'i rang bzhin ni sgra'i rang gi ngo bo de nyid kyi phyir 'di ni sgra'i de kho na nyid yin pas de ni sgra'i de kho na nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The nature of Brahma is the essence of sound itself, and this is the reality of sound. Therefore, it is called the reality of sound.

original: 'di ni sgra'i phyin ci ma log pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ni sgra'i phyin ci ma log pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means the unmistaken essence of sound.

original: mchog ni zhes bya ba ni aom gyi bdag nyid de /
analyzed: mchog ni zhes bya ba ni aom gyi bdag nyid de /
translated: Supreme is the nature of Om.

original: aom ni sgra thams cad dang don thams cad kyi rang bzhin yin par grags pas de yang rig byed yin te /
analyzed: aom ni sgra thams cad dang don thams cad kyi rang bzhin yin par grags pas de yang rig byed yin te /
translated: Om is known to be the nature of all sounds and all meanings, and it is also a Vedic sound.

original: 'di ni yi ge dang tshig gi rim pa'i ngo bos gnas pa'i rig byed de rtogs pa'i thabs yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni yi ge dang tshig gi rim pa'i ngo bos gnas pa'i rig byed de rtogs pa'i thabs yin te /
translated: This is the means of understanding the Vedic sound that abides in the form of the sequence of syllables and words.

original: de'i gzugs brnyan gyi tshul du gnas so //
analyzed: de'i gzugs brnyan gyi tshul du gnas so //
translated: It abides in the manner of its reflection.

original: tshangs pa mchog gi bdag nyid de ni mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa'i 'bras bu'i chos rjes su 'dzin pa'i nang gi byed pas mthong ba yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: tshangs pa mchog gi bdag nyid de ni mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa'i 'bras bu'i chos rjes su 'dzin pa'i nang gi byed pas mthong ba yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: That supreme nature of Brahma is seen by the internal agent that sustains the Dharma of the fruits of high rebirth and definite goodness.

original: 'dir yang tshad ma byed de /
analyzed: 'dir yang tshad ma byed de /
translated: Here, it is also a valid means of knowledge.

original: gang zhig gang gi rnam pa dang ldan pa de dag ni de'i rang bzhin yin te /üîΩdper na bum pa dang kham phor dang blug ma la sogs pa 'ji ba'i rnam par 'gyur ba 'ji ba'i rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa dang / 'ji ba'i rang bzhin nyid du @185a * //
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi rnam pa dang ldan pa de dag ni de'i rang bzhin yin te / dper na bum pa dang kham phor dang blug ma la sogs pa 'ji ba'i rnam par 'gyur ba 'ji ba'i rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa dang / 'ji ba'i rang bzhin nyid du @185a * //
translated: Whatever has the aspect of something is of the nature of that.

original: grags pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: grags pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the transformations of clay, such as a pot, a bowl, a dish, etc., are subsequent to the aspect of clay and are renowned as having the nature of clay.

original: dngos po thams cad kyang sgra'i rnam pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad kyang sgra'i rnam pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: All entities have the aspect of sound is a natural inference.

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the reason unestablished.

original: gang gi phyir don thams cad sgra'i rjes su byed par mngon sum nyid kyis grub ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir don thams cad sgra'i rjes su byed par mngon sum nyid kyis grub ste /
translated: Because the fact that all objects are subsequent to sound is established by direct perception.

original: 'di ltar shes pa thams cad don la skye ba na sgra'i rnam pa dang ldan pa kho nar skye ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes pa thams cad don la skye ba na sgra'i rnam pa dang ldan pa kho nar skye ste /
translated: Thus, when all consciousnesses arise in regard to objects, they arise only having the aspect of sound.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: sgra yi rjes 'jug ma gtogs gang //
analyzed: sgra yi rjes 'jug ma gtogs gang //
translated: Apart from that which is subsequent to sound,

original: shes de 'jig rten na yod min //
analyzed: shes de 'jig rten na yod min //
translated: there is no consciousness in the world.

original: shes pa thams cad sgra dang ni //
analyzed: shes pa thams cad sgra dang ni //
translated: All consciousnesses are subsequent to sound.

original: ldan pa bzhin du gnas pa yin //
analyzed: ldan pa bzhin du gnas pa yin //
translated: And abide in the same way as before.üîΩ

original: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: and it is just as if they were endowed with it.

original: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin du gdags pa'i rgyu mtshan yang shes pa'i rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin du gdags pa'i rgyu mtshan yang shes pa'i rnam pa yin no //
translated: The reason for designating the nature of things is the aspect of consciousness.

original: de'i phyir 'di dag sgra'i rnam pa dang ldan pa nyid grub po //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag sgra'i rnam pa dang ldan pa nyid grub po //
translated: Therefore, it is established that these are endowed with the aspect of sound.

original: de grub pa na de'i rang bzhin yin pa nyid kyang grub pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de grub pa na de'i rang bzhin yin pa nyid kyang grub pa kho na ste /
translated: When that is established, then it is established that they have that as their nature,

original: de'i rang bzhin nyid ni de tsam gyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin nyid ni de tsam gyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya'o //
translated: because their nature is just that entity.

original: de la brjod bya zhes bya ba la sogs pas re zhig dam bcas pa'i don sun 'byin par byed do //
analyzed: de la brjod bya zhes bya ba la sogs pas re zhig dam bcas pa'i don sun 'byin par byed do //
translated: In response to that, the opponent first refutes the meaning of the thesis with ‚ÄúThe object of expression, etc.‚Äù

original: 'dis 'gro ba sgra'i rang bzhin du bsgrub par 'dod pa /
analyzed: 'dis 'gro ba sgra'i rang bzhin du bsgrub par 'dod pa /
translated: This is because the opponent wishes to establish that the world has the nature of sound.

original: res 'ga' sgra yongs su gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: res 'ga' sgra yongs su gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Sometimes it is because it has the nature of a transformation of sound,

original: res 'ga' sgra las skyes pa'i phyir yin te /
analyzed: res 'ga' sgra las skyes pa'i phyir yin te /
translated: and sometimes it is because it arises from sound.

original: dper na srog chags rnams ni zas las byung ba yin no zhes bya ba dang / rgyu'i don la rgyu ma yin pa brjod pa'i phyir dang / rgyu las byung ba'i rkyen du brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dper na srog chags rnams ni zas las byung ba yin no zhes bya ba dang / rgyu'i don la rgyu ma yin pa brjod pa'i phyir dang / rgyu las byung ba'i rkyen du brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, ‚Äúliving beings arise from food‚Äù and ‚Äúthe cause is expressed as a condition that arises from a cause.‚Äù

original: de la re zhig phyogs dang po ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig phyogs dang po ni ma yin te /
translated: The first position is not tenable,

original: yongs su 'gyur ba nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because transformation itself is untenable.

original: 'di ltar sgra'i bdag nyid kyi tshangs pa sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bor 'gyur ba na res 'ga' rang nyid kyi sde rang gi ngo bo yongs su btang nas 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar sgra'i bdag nyid kyi tshangs pa sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bor 'gyur ba na res 'ga' rang nyid kyi sde rang gi ngo bo yongs su btang nas 'gyur ba'am /
translated: In this regard, if BrahmƒÅ, who is the nature of sound, were to transform into the nature of blue, and so on, sometimes his own school would abandon his own nature,

original: ma btang nas 'gyur ba yin grang /üîΩde la gal te btang nas zhes bya ba'i dang po'i phyogs la brten pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: ma btang nas 'gyur ba yin grang / de la gal te btang nas zhes bya ba'i dang po'i phyogs la brten pa de'i tshe /
translated: or he would transform without abandoning it.

original: thog mtha' med pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis 'gyur ba med pa nyid mi 'jig pa nyid du khas blangs pa gang yin pa de nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: thog mtha' med pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis 'gyur ba med pa nyid mi 'jig pa nyid du khas blangs pa gang yin pa de nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: If he transforms by abandoning it, then at that time the statement ‚ÄúBrahmƒÅ is beginningless and endless‚Äù would be undermined, because that which is asserted to be beginningless and endless would be destroyed.

original: sngon gyi rang bzhin zhig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon gyi rang bzhin zhig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the destruction of the previous nature.

original: ci ste yongs su ma btang nas zhes bya ba de ma thag pa'i phyogs yin pa de'i tshe sngon po la sogs pa rig par byed pa'i dus na yang ma thos pas kyang sgra rig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste yongs su ma btang nas zhes bya ba de ma thag pa'i phyogs yin pa de'i tshe sngon po la sogs pa rig par byed pa'i dus na yang ma thos pas kyang sgra rig par 'gyur te /
translated: But if it is the position that it is not relinquished, then even at the time of the awareness of blue, etc., sound would be cognized, even though it is not heard,

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rig pa bzhin du de las @185b tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rig pa bzhin du de las @185b tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not different from that, like the awareness of blue, etc.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang las tha mi dad ba de ni de rig pa na rig pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang las tha mi dad ba de ni de rig pa na rig pa yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is not different from something is cognized when that is cognized,

original: dper na sngon po la sogs pa rig pa'i gnas skabs na sngon po la sogs pa de'i bdag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sngon po la sogs pa rig pa'i gnas skabs na sngon po la sogs pa de'i bdag nyid bzhin no //
translated: like, for example, the blue, etc., at the time of the awareness of blue, etc., which have the nature of blue, etc.

original: sgra'i bdag nyid kyang sngon po la sogs pa las tha mi dad do zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: sgra'i bdag nyid kyang sngon po la sogs pa las tha mi dad do zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The nature of sound is not different from blue, etc. This is a reason of nature.

original: de lta ma yin na grub pa dang bde ba tha dad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na grub pa dang bde ba tha dad pa'i phyir /
translated: If it were not so, then because of the difference of establishment and happiness,

original: de'i rang bzhin nyid mi 'grub po zhes bya ba 'di ni 'dir gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin nyid mi 'grub po zhes bya ba 'di ni 'dir gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúits nature itself is not established‚Äù is the valid cognition that refutes that.

original: 'di nyid rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir gang gis thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: 'di nyid rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir gang gis thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: In order to elaborate on just this, he says, ‚ÄúBy what is it that all . . .‚Äù

original: gang gis te /
analyzed: gang gis te /
translated: By what is it that all?

original: gang gi phyir khyed cag gis dngos kho nar 'gro ba sgra'i rang bzhin no zhes rjod par byed do /
analyzed: gang gi phyir khyed cag gis dngos kho nar 'gro ba sgra'i rang bzhin no zhes rjod par byed do /
translated: Because of that, you say that the goer is the nature of sound.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩsgra yi ngo bos ma btang bar //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / sgra yi ngo bos ma btang bar //
translated: Why is that?

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúWithout relinquishing the entity of sound . . .‚Äù

original: gal te dngos su sgra'i rang bzhin du gnas pa yin na de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dngos su sgra'i rang bzhin du gnas pa yin na de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it abides as the nature of sound, what would be the consequence of that?

original: de ltar sngon po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar sngon po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIn that case, blue . . .‚Äù

original: sngon po la sogs pa gcig nyid ces bya ba la /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa gcig nyid ces bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúOne blue‚Äù and so on.

original: sgra dang lhan cig ces bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: sgra dang lhan cig ces bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTogether with sound‚Äù is the remainder.

original: de rig pa'i dus su ni zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa de dag rig pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: de rig pa'i dus su ni zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa de dag rig pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAt the time of the awareness of that‚Äù is at the time of the awareness of that blue and so on.

original: ji ltar 'di rig yod ma yin //
analyzed: ji ltar 'di rig yod ma yin //
translated: How is it that this is not awareness?

original: zhes bya ba ni de yang sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de yang sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is because it is the characteristic that is observed as the nature of blue, etc.

original: rig pa nyid du rigs so snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: rig pa nyid du rigs so snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: It is reasonable to think that it is cognition itself.

original: ci ste 'di rig pa nyid du mi 'dod pa de'i tshe sgra'i rang bzhin bzhin du sngon po la sogs pa yang mi rigs par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste 'di rig pa nyid du mi 'dod pa de'i tshe sgra'i rang bzhin bzhin du sngon po la sogs pa yang mi rigs par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: But if you do not accept that it is cognition itself, then it follows, absurdly, that like the nature of sound, blue, etc. are also unreasonable,

original: gcig gi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig gi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are of the same nature.

original: sngon po la sogs pa rnams ni sgra dang lhan cig gi rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa rnams ni sgra dang lhan cig gi rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The point is that blue, etc. are of the same nature as sound.

original: de lta ma yin na sngon po la sogs pa rnams sgra dang lhan cig chos tha dad par khas len na shin tu tha dad par khas blang bar bya dgos so //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na sngon po la sogs pa rnams sgra dang lhan cig chos tha dad par khas len na shin tu tha dad par khas blang bar bya dgos so //
translated: Otherwise, if you accept that blue, etc. are different phenomena from sound, then you must accept that they are completely different.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'gal ba'i chos dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i chos dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, because they are contradictory phenomena, etc.

original: gcig dus gcig tu rtog pa po gcig la ltos nas 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa ni mi rigs te gcig nyams par thal ba'i phyir ro //üîΩde lta ma yin na gal te 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa yang gcig nyid du 'gyur ba de'i tshe bum pa la sogs pa'i gsal ba tha dad pa brtag par 'dod pa'i gsal ba tha dad @186a * //
analyzed: gcig dus gcig tu rtog pa po gcig la ltos nas 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa ni mi rigs te gcig nyams par thal ba'i phyir ro // de lta ma yin na gal te 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa yang gcig nyid du 'gyur ba de'i tshe bum pa la sogs pa'i gsal ba tha dad pa brtag par 'dod pa'i gsal ba tha dad @186a * //
translated: It is illogical that one thing is both apprehended and not apprehended in dependence on one thinker at one time, because it would follow that one thing would be destroyed.

original: pa gang yin pa der yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa gang yin pa der yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were not so, if something that has contradictory properties were one, then at that time, the different individual things such as pots would not be different individual things, as you assert.

original: yang gi sgra ni tshangs pa'i rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa med pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni tshangs pa'i rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa med pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad ces bya ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means that not only is there no difference in the nature of BrahmƒÅ.

original: gang gi phyir rang gi bdag nyid du rnam par gnas pa de la tha dad pa med de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang gi bdag nyid du rnam par gnas pa de la tha dad pa med de /
translated: Because it is not different from that which exists as its own nature,

original: 'di ni 'gyur ba med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dang / tha dad pa med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba grub pa'i mtha' yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'gyur ba med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dang / tha dad pa med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba grub pa'i mtha' yin no //
translated: it is an established conclusion that it has an unchanging nature and it has a nature that is not different.

original: 'di ltar de ni bum pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid du mi 'dod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni bum pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid du mi 'dod do //
translated: Thus, it is not maintained that the self is without beginning and end in the nature of a pot, etc.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What, then, is it?

original: mchog gi bdag nyid du ste /
analyzed: mchog gi bdag nyid du ste /
translated: It is of the nature of Brahman.

original: bum pa la sogs pa snang bzhin pa na skye ba dang 'jig pa yongs su chad pa'i yul can rnams su dmigs pa tshangs pa yin no //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa snang bzhin pa na skye ba dang 'jig pa yongs su chad pa'i yul can rnams su dmigs pa tshangs pa yin no //
translated: When pots, etc. appear, Brahman is perceived as the object of the cognition that is limited by the arising and cessation of the pots, etc.

original: ma thos kyang sgra gsal bar rig par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i thal bar 'gyur ba smras pa'i gang yin pa de yang gal te tshangs pa'i ngo bo dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur par 'dod pa de'i tshe blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ma thos kyang sgra gsal bar rig par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i thal bar 'gyur ba smras pa'i gang yin pa de yang gal te tshangs pa'i ngo bo dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur par 'dod pa de'i tshe blta bar bya'o //
translated: As for the absurd consequence that you have stated, ‚ÄúOne would know a sound clearly even without hearing it,‚Äù that should be examined if you maintain that Brahman is the nature of the object of perception.

original: gal te yang shin tu phra ba dbang po las 'das pa'i zhes smra ba de'i tshe skyon 'di med do //
analyzed: gal te yang shin tu phra ba dbang po las 'das pa'i zhes smra ba de'i tshe skyon 'di med do //
translated: If you say that it is extremely subtle and beyond the senses, then there is no fault.

original: 'on kyang sngon po la sogs pa yang de'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir de'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin du mi 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i skyon 'di brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang sngon po la sogs pa yang de'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir de'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin du mi 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i skyon 'di brjod par bya'o //
translated: But since blue and so on are also its nature, it follows that it does not apprehend its own nature, just like blue and so on.

original: de lta yin dang tshu rol mthong ba rnams kyis skye ba dang 'jig pa dang ldan pa'i don tsam shes so zhes bya ba'i nges pa 'di mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de lta yin dang tshu rol mthong ba rnams kyis skye ba dang 'jig pa dang ldan pa'i don tsam shes so zhes bya ba'i nges pa 'di mi 'thad do //
translated: If that were so, it would be untenable to state that those with limited vision understand the mere object that possesses arising and disintegration.

original: 'di snyam du ji ltar khyed cag gi skad cig ma nyid las sngon po la sogs pa tha mi dad la /
analyzed: 'di snyam du ji ltar khyed cag gi skad cig ma nyid las sngon po la sogs pa tha mi dad la /
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúJust as in your system, blue and so on are not different from momentariness,

original: sngon po la sogs pa myong na yang mi myong ba de bzhin du sgra'i ngo bo la yang yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa myong na yang mi myong ba de bzhin du sgra'i ngo bo la yang yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: and when blue and so on are experienced, momentariness is also experienced, in the same way, sound‚Äôs nature is also experienced when sound is experienced,‚Äù

original: de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: that is not correct.

original: sngon po la sogs pa rig pa na skad cig ma nyid mi rig pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa rig pa na skad cig ma nyid mi rig pa ni ma yin te /
translated: When blue and so on are cognized, momentariness is also cognized.

original: 'on kyang rtog pa med pa'i shes pas gzung du zin kyang 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis yon tan gzhan sgro btags pa'i phyir ma nges pa yin par brjod do //
analyzed: 'on kyang rtog pa med pa'i shes pas gzung du zin kyang 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis yon tan gzhan sgro btags pa'i phyir ma nges pa yin par brjod do //
translated: However, even though it is apprehended by a non-conceptual consciousness, it is said to be indeterminate because the reason for error superimposes other qualities.

original: des na nyams su myong ba la ltos nas de bzung ba nyid yin la /
analyzed: des na nyams su myong ba la ltos nas de bzung ba nyid yin la /
translated: Therefore, in terms of experience, it is apprehended,

original: nges pa'i shes pa la ltos nas ni ma bzung ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nges pa'i shes pa la ltos nas ni ma bzung ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: but in terms of definitive knowledge, it is not apprehended.

original: shes pa tha dad pas gcig bzung ba dang ma bzung ba nyid ni mi 'gal ba kho na'o //
analyzed: shes pa tha dad pas gcig bzung ba dang ma bzung ba nyid ni mi 'gal ba kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not contradictory for one consciousness to apprehend and not apprehend.

original: de ltar khyed cag gi phyogs la ni sgra bzung ba dang ma bzung bar rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar khyed cag gi phyogs la ni sgra bzung ba dang ma bzung bar rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, in your system, it is not reasonable to say that sound is apprehended or not apprehended,

original: shes pa thams cad rtogs pa dang bcas pa nyid du khas len pa'i @186b phyir dang / shes pa gcig gis kyang de'i bdag nyid thams cad nges pas ma bzung ba'i rang bzhin gzhan mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa thams cad rtogs pa dang bcas pa nyid du khas len pa'i @186b phyir dang / shes pa gcig gis kyang de'i bdag nyid thams cad nges pas ma bzung ba'i rang bzhin gzhan mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because you accept that all consciousnesses are conceptual, and because it is not tenable that another nature is not apprehended by a single consciousness that ascertains all of its natures.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: nges pa rnams kyis ma nges gang //
analyzed: nges pa rnams kyis ma nges gang //
translated: What is indeterminate for the certain ones?

original: de ni ji ltar de dag yul //üîΩzhes bshad do //
analyzed: de ni ji ltar de dag yul // zhes bshad do //
translated: How could they be objects?

original: ci ste rtog pa med pa'i shes pa yang cung zad cig khas len na 'o na /
analyzed: ci ste rtog pa med pa'i shes pa yang cung zad cig khas len na 'o na /
translated: If you accept that there is some cognition that is not conceptual, then you should not say:

original: sgra yi rjes 'jug ma gtogs gang //
analyzed: sgra yi rjes 'jug ma gtogs gang //
translated: Apart from the apprehension of sound,

original: shes de 'jig rten na yod min //üîΩzhes brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: shes de 'jig rten na yod min // zhes brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: there is no cognition in the world.

original: sgra'i rnam pa dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyang 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgra'i rnam pa dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyang 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And the reason ‚Äúbecause it possesses the aspect of sound‚Äù is not established.

original: de lta bas na tshad ma med pa'i phyir dngos po rnams sgra'i bdag nyid du gnas pa rgyu mtshan med pa can kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na tshad ma med pa'i phyir dngos po rnams sgra'i bdag nyid du gnas pa rgyu mtshan med pa can kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, because there is no valid cognition, the fact that things exist as sound by nature is without a cause.

original: gzhan yang dngos po rnams kyi skad cig ma nyid ni tshad ma gzhan las grub pa'i phyir nyams su myong ba yang ma nges pa yin no zhes bstan gyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang dngos po rnams kyi skad cig ma nyid ni tshad ma gzhan las grub pa'i phyir nyams su myong ba yang ma nges pa yin no zhes bstan gyi /
translated: Moreover, because the momentariness of things is established by another valid cognition, the fact that it is experienced is also uncertain.

original: gang gis de rnam par 'jog par byed pa dngos po rnams sgra'i bdag nyid du ga las grub /
analyzed: gang gis de rnam par 'jog par byed pa dngos po rnams sgra'i bdag nyid du ga las grub /
translated: But how is it established that things exist as sound by nature, since it is by that that they are posited?

original: sun 'byin pa'i lan gzhan yang /
analyzed: sun 'byin pa'i lan gzhan yang /
translated: Another reply to the refutation:

original: gal te dngos po so so yi //
analyzed: gal te dngos po so so yi //
translated: If the individual things

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: are not different,

original: sgra'i bdag nyid de yongs su gyur par 'gro ba na don tha dad par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: sgra'i bdag nyid de yongs su gyur par 'gro ba na don tha dad par 'gyur ram /
translated: then the sound itself, when it becomes transformed, would not become a different object.

original: ma yin par 'gyur grang /
analyzed: ma yin par 'gyur grang /
translated: Or, it would.

original: de la gal te tha dad pa med pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin na de'i tshe sngon po la sogs pa thams cad yul gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gal te tha dad pa med pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin na de'i tshe sngon po la sogs pa thams cad yul gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If the position is that they are not different, then all blue and so on would be the same object.

original: yul gcig pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni mtshon pa yin te /
analyzed: yul gcig pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni mtshon pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe same object‚Äù is an illustration.

original: dus dang yongs su 'gyur ba dang / bya ba dang gnas skabs kyi khyad par la sogs pa yang gzung ngo //
analyzed: dus dang yongs su 'gyur ba dang / bya ba dang gnas skabs kyi khyad par la sogs pa yang gzung ngo //
translated: Time, transformation, action, and the distinctions of state and so on are also included.

original: 'di rnams kyang gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyang gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: These would all be the same.

original: gcig gi rnam par rig par yang ste /üîΩso so snang bar 'gyur zhing thob pa yin te /
analyzed: gcig gi rnam par rig par yang ste / so so snang bar 'gyur zhing thob pa yin te /
translated: They would be the cognition of one thing.

original: sngon po la sogs pa thams cad sgra gcig gi ngo bor tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa thams cad sgra gcig gi ngo bor tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They would appear individually and be obtained, because all blue and so on would not be different from the nature of one sound.

original: ci ste sgra'i bdag nyid 'dir rang gi mtshan nyid gsal ba so so tha dad pa nyid du khas len par byed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: ci ste sgra'i bdag nyid 'dir rang gi mtshan nyid gsal ba so so tha dad pa nyid du khas len par byed pa de'i tshe /
translated: But if you accept that the nature of sound is clearly manifest as individual, distinct characteristics,

original: tshangs pa du ma nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshangs pa du ma nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: then BrahmƒÅ would be multiple.

original: dngos po tha dad pa ni du ma'i ngo bo nyid du yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po tha dad pa ni du ma'i ngo bo nyid du yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because distinct things have the nature of being multiple.

original: tha dad pa du ma'i dngos po'i bdag nyid dngos po du ma'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bo gang la yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa du ma'i dngos po'i bdag nyid dngos po du ma'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bo gang la yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The nature of a thing that has the nature of being multiple, the nature of being many things, is what is meant by the phrase ‚Äúthat which has the nature of being multiple.‚Äù

original: de'i dngos po ni de nyid de /
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni de nyid de /
translated: That thing is itself.

original: tshangs pa mchog kyang gcig tu 'dod de /
analyzed: tshangs pa mchog kyang gcig tu 'dod de /
translated: And BrahmƒÅ is asserted to be one.

original: des na dam bca' ba la khas blangs pas gnod pa yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: des na dam bca' ba la khas blangs pas gnod pa yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: Therefore, we think that your thesis is undermined by your own beliefs.

original: nyes pa @187a * //üîΩgzhan yang ; sgra yi rang bzhin rtag nyid ni //
analyzed: nyes pa @187a * // gzhan yang ; sgra yi rang bzhin rtag nyid ni //
translated: Another fault

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: is stated in the lines beginning, ‚ÄúThe nature of sound is permanent.‚Äù

original: sgra rtag pa las 'byung ba nyid de /
analyzed: sgra rtag pa las 'byung ba nyid de /
translated: Sound arises from the permanent.

original: 'gro ba sgra rtag pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin na sgra'i ngo bo bzhin du dngos po rnams kyang rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba sgra rtag pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin na sgra'i ngo bo bzhin du dngos po rnams kyang rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If the nature of sound were permanent, then like the essence of sound, things would also be permanent.

original: de lta yin dang dus thams cad du dngos po rnams sgra dang lhan cig cig car grub pa na ste /
analyzed: de lta yin dang dus thams cad du dngos po rnams sgra dang lhan cig cig car grub pa na ste /
translated: If that were the case, then since things would always be established simultaneously with sound,

original: grub pa'i phyir yongs su 'gyur bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grub pa'i phyir yongs su 'gyur bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: they would not transform.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni de'i phyir gyi don nam de dag ste sngon po la sogs pa de dag rnams kyi cig car te /
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni de'i phyir gyi don nam de dag ste sngon po la sogs pa de dag rnams kyi cig car te /
translated: ‚Äú Those‚Äù has the meaning of ‚Äútherefore‚Äù or ‚Äúthose,‚Äù that is, those blue things and so on.

original: de dag cig car zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag cig car zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: ‚Äú Simultaneously‚Äù is a compound.

original: ci ste cig car ba grub na yang ci'i phyir yongs su 'gyur ba ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste cig car ba grub na yang ci'i phyir yongs su 'gyur ba ma yin zhe na /
translated: But if they are established simultaneously, why don‚Äôt they transform?

original: ngo bo gcig ni zhig 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ngo bo gcig ni zhig 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚Äú The single essence would be destroyed‚Äù and so on.

original: ni'i sgra ni go rims med pa la ni dngos po yongs su 'gyur ba 'grub par mi 'gyur ro zhes rim pa gzhan du bya'o //
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni go rims med pa la ni dngos po yongs su 'gyur ba 'grub par mi 'gyur ro zhes rim pa gzhan du bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúni‚Äù is used to indicate that without order, the transformation of things would not be established. The order is different.

original: de ltar re zhig yongs su 'gyur bas byas pa'i dngos po rnams sgra'i rang bzhin nyid du mi rigs so //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig yongs su 'gyur bas byas pa'i dngos po rnams sgra'i rang bzhin nyid du mi rigs so //
translated: Thus, in this way, it is not logical that things produced by transformation are the nature of sound.

original: phyogs gnyis pa yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the second position is also illogical, he says:

original: ci ste yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ci ste yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúBut if‚Äù and so on.

original: de lta na yang sgra rtag pa nyid kyis 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir de las rim gyis 'bras bu skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang sgra rtag pa nyid kyis 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir de las rim gyis 'bras bu skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even so, because sound is permanent, it is unchanging, and therefore the effect would not arise gradually from it.

original: thams cad la rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir cig car kho nar skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad la rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir cig car kho nar skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the cause is unimpeded and complete in all things, the effect would arise only instantaneously.

original: rgyu ma tshang ba'i phyir 'bras bu sdod pa yin na /
analyzed: rgyu ma tshang ba'i phyir 'bras bu sdod pa yin na /
translated: If the effect is delayed because the cause is incomplete,

original: gang gis cig car bar mi 'gyur ba gal te de ma tshang ba med na des na ci'i phyir gzhan la ltos /
analyzed: gang gis cig car bar mi 'gyur ba gal te de ma tshang ba med na des na ci'i phyir gzhan la ltos /
translated: then why would it not arise instantaneously? If it is not incomplete, then why depend on another?

original: gzhan yang gal te rang bzhin gcig po de las sgra'i rang gi ngo bo gzhan tha dad pa skye bar khas len pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te rang bzhin gcig po de las sgra'i rang gi ngo bo gzhan tha dad pa skye bar khas len pa de'i tshe /
translated: Moreover, if you accept that a different thing, the nature of sound, arises from that single nature,

original: tshangs pa de don gyi ngo bor rnam par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshangs pa de don gyi ngo bor rnam par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not established that Brahma is the transformation of the nature of the object.

original: don gzhan skye ba na gzhan de'i rang bzhin du mi 'jug pa de'i ngo bo rnam par 'gyur ba ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: don gzhan skye ba na gzhan de'i rang bzhin du mi 'jug pa de'i ngo bo rnam par 'gyur ba ni mi rigs so //
translated: When one thing arises, it does not enter into the nature of another, so it is illogical that the nature of that [Brahma] is a transformation.

original: de lta bas na thams cad du yang dam bcas pa'i don brtag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na thams cad du yang dam bcas pa'i don brtag par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, in all cases, the meaning of the thesis should not be investigated.

original: sgra'i rnam pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyang ma grub par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sgra'i rnam pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyang ma grub par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the reason, ‚Äúbecause it possesses the aspect of sound,‚Äù is also unestablished, it is said:

original: de yi ngo bo mi las log / ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de yi ngo bo mi las log / ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Its nature is not different from that.

original: dngos po rnams la ni don dam par ngo bo gcig rjes su 'gro ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams la ni don dam par ngo bo gcig rjes su 'gro ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In reality, entities do not have a single nature that is universal,

original: thams cad rang rang gi ngo bo la gnas pa @187b nyid kyis rigs mthun pa dang mi mthun pa las ldog pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad rang rang gi ngo bo la gnas pa @187b nyid kyis rigs mthun pa dang mi mthun pa las ldog pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because each individual entity, by its very nature, is distinct from things of the same and different kinds.

original: 'di dag la ni rtog pas zhen pa rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pas byas ba rnam pa gcig dang ldan pa nyid rnam par 'jog par byed de /
analyzed: 'di dag la ni rtog pas zhen pa rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pas byas ba rnam pa gcig dang ldan pa nyid rnam par 'jog par byed de /
translated: In these cases, the conceptualization is said to have only one aspect, because it is a conceptualization that is the opposite of the dissimilar class.

original: dper na bum pa dang kham phor dang / blug ma la sogs pa don dam par tha dad pa rnams la yang 'ji ba'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i dngos po las ldog pas byas ba 'ji ba'i bdag nyid du rtog pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bum pa dang kham phor dang / blug ma la sogs pa don dam par tha dad pa rnams la yang 'ji ba'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i dngos po las ldog pas byas ba 'ji ba'i bdag nyid du rtog pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, in the case of a pot, a bowl, a vase, and so on, which are ultimately different, they are conceptualized as having the nature of clay because they are the opposite of things that do not have the nature of clay.

original: de la sngon po la sogs pa 'di dag gis brtags pa de yang sgra'i rnam pa dang ldan pa nyid du srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la sngon po la sogs pa 'di dag gis brtags pa de yang sgra'i rnam pa dang ldan pa nyid du srid pa ma yin te /
translated: In this case, the conceptualization of these blue things and so on cannot possibly have the aspect of sound.

original: sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa rnams la sgra'i ngo bo ma dmigs la /
analyzed: sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa rnams la sgra'i ngo bo ma dmigs la /
translated: The nature of sound is not observed in blue, yellow, and so on.üîΩAnd even when it is not observed, how can the aspect of sound be conceptualized as having the nature of sound by the exclusion of what is not sound?

original: ma dmigs pa na yang ji ltar sgra'i bdag nyid ma yin pa rnam pas bcad pas byas pa'i sgra'i rnam pa dang ldan pa nyid rtog / de phyir rtog pa'ang sa bon med //
analyzed: ma dmigs pa na yang ji ltar sgra'i bdag nyid ma yin pa rnam pas bcad pas byas pa'i sgra'i rnam pa dang ldan pa nyid rtog / de phyir rtog pa'ang sa bon med //
translated: Therefore, even conceptualization is without a seed.

original: ces bya ba ni gtan tshigs ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni gtan tshigs ma grub pa'o //
translated: This is an unestablished reason.

original: gang yang / thams cad yul gcig nyid dang ni //
analyzed: gang yang / thams cad yul gcig nyid dang ni //
translated: Everything is in one object,

original: gcig gi rnam par rig par 'gyur //
analyzed: gcig gi rnam par rig par 'gyur //
translated: And one is cognized in various ways.

original: zhes smras pa de la gzhan kyi lugs kyi dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: zhes smras pa de la gzhan kyi lugs kyi dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: In response to this, the opponent‚Äôs position is anticipated:

original: 'on te tshangs pa'i de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te tshangs pa'i de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: But the reality of BrahmƒÅ is unchanging,

original: ci ste yang tshangs pa'i bdag nyid kyi de kho na nyid mi 'gyur ba dbyer med pa nyid du rtag tu don dam par gnas pa gang yin pa de ni don dam par yongs su 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ci ste yang tshangs pa'i bdag nyid kyi de kho na nyid mi 'gyur ba dbyer med pa nyid du rtag tu don dam par gnas pa gang yin pa de ni don dam par yongs su 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
translated: If the reality of BrahmƒÅ is unchanging, indivisible, and always ultimately existent, then ultimately it does not transform.

original: 'on kyang ma rig pa'i ling tog gis blo'i mig nyams pa rnams sngon po la sogs pa'i dbye bas sna tshogs pa bzhin du rlom mo //
analyzed: 'on kyang ma rig pa'i ling tog gis blo'i mig nyams pa rnams sngon po la sogs pa'i dbye bas sna tshogs pa bzhin du rlom mo //
translated: However, those whose eyes of intelligence are impaired by the cataracts of ignorance imagine it to be diverse due to the categories of blue and so on.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: ji ltar nam mkha' dag pa la //üîΩrab rib kyis bslad skye bo yin //üîΩrab rib sna tshogs dag dang ni //
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' dag pa la // rab rib kyis bslad skye bo yin // rab rib sna tshogs dag dang ni //
translated: In pure space,üîΩPeople with cataracts see various things.üîΩThey imagine

original: ldan pa bzhin du mngon par rlom //üîΩde ltar bdud rtsi 'gyur med pa'i //
analyzed: ldan pa bzhin du mngon par rlom // de ltar bdud rtsi 'gyur med pa'i //
translated: They possess various cataracts.üîΩIn the same way, this unchanging nectar of BrahmƒÅ,
