original: tshangs pa 'di ni ma rig pas //
analyzed: tshangs pa 'di ni ma rig pas //
translated: Due to ignorance,

original: rnyog pa bzhin du 'gyur ba ste //
analyzed: rnyog pa bzhin du 'gyur ba ste //
translated: like water that is stirred up,

original: tha dad ngo bor rnam par 'gyur //
analyzed: tha dad ngo bor rnam par 'gyur //
translated: it is transformed into a different nature.

original: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: Thus, it is explained.

original: des na thams cad yul gcig pa nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na thams cad yul gcig pa nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, it does not follow that everything is the same object,

original: de dag ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the nature of non-existence.

original: rig pa tha dad par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rig pa tha dad par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: Nor is there a difference in awareness,

original: de ni ma rig pas bslad pa byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni ma rig pas bslad pa byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: because that is created by the pollution of ignorance.

original: de la'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de gang gi phyir tshad ma'i dbang gis gzhal bya yod par rnam @188a * //üîΩpar 'jog pa yin la /üîΩde lta bu'i ngo bo'i tshangs pa grub par bya ba'i phyir tshad ma cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: de la'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de gang gi phyir tshad ma'i dbang gis gzhal bya yod par rnam @188a * // par 'jog pa yin la / de lta bu'i ngo bo'i tshangs pa grub par bya ba'i phyir tshad ma cung zad kyang med do //
translated: In response to that, he says, ‚ÄúEven in that,‚Äù and so on. Because the object of comprehension is established as existent by the power of valid cognition,üîΩand in order to establish the validity of that kind of nature, there is not the slightest valid cognition.

original: 'di ltar re zhig de ni mngon sum gyis de grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig de ni mngon sum gyis de grub pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, to begin with, that is not established by direct perception,üîΩbecause direct perception does not exist.

original: sngon po la sogs pa phan pa dang mi phan pa thob pa dang spong ba'i rten las tha dad pa'i sgra'i ngo bo gzhan snang ba ni med la /üîΩmi snang ba yang ji ltar de mngon du phyogs pa'i sems te /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa phan pa dang mi phan pa thob pa dang spong ba'i rten las tha dad pa'i sgra'i ngo bo gzhan snang ba ni med la / mi snang ba yang ji ltar de mngon du phyogs pa'i sems te /
translated: The nature of sound is not seen to be different from the basis of obtaining or abandoning that which is beneficial or not beneficial, such as blue.

original: rigs pa'i lam la gnas pas yod pa nyid du ma nges par 'gyur /
analyzed: rigs pa'i lam la gnas pas yod pa nyid du ma nges par 'gyur /
translated: And if it is not seen, how could it be ascertained to exist by one who abides in the path of reasoning?

original: 'di snyam du shes pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo bzhin du rang rig pa'i mngon sum kho nas de grub pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du shes pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo bzhin du rang rig pa'i mngon sum kho nas de grub pa yin te /
translated: If you think that it is established by reflexive awareness alone, like the nature of consciousness itself,

original: 'di ltar de nyid gsal ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de nyid gsal ba yin te /
translated: then it is clear that it is not.

original: sgra'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / sems pa can gyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: sgra'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / sems pa can gyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems na /
translated: Because it is the nature of sound and because it is the nature of a sentient being.

original: 'di ni rang rig pa dang 'gal te 'di ltar yid gzhan la yang yengs kyang mig gis gzugs lta ba na /
analyzed: 'di ni rang rig pa dang 'gal te 'di ltar yid gzhan la yang yengs kyang mig gis gzugs lta ba na /
translated: This contradicts reflexive awareness because even when the mind is distracted to another object, the eye sees form.

original: mngon par brjod pa dang mi ldan pa sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa nyams su myong ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa dang mi ldan pa sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa nyams su myong ba kho na yin no //
translated: It is only the experience of consciousness of blue and so on that is devoid of expression.

original: 'di ltar rgyas par 'chad par 'gyur ro //üîΩnges na / shes de 'jig rten na yod min //
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyas par 'chad par 'gyur ro // nges na / shes de 'jig rten na yod min //
translated: This will be explained in detail.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de yang bsal ba yin no //üîΩde lta bas na dbyer med pa'i sgra'i rang bzhin gyi tshangs pa mngon sum gyis grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de yang bsal ba yin no // de lta bas na dbyer med pa'i sgra'i rang bzhin gyi tshangs pa mngon sum gyis grub pa ma yin te /
translated: If you say that, then the statement, ‚ÄúThat cognition does not exist in the world,‚Äù and so on, is refuted.

original: de lta bur gyur pa de mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa de mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore the existence of BrahmƒÅ, whose nature is sound, is not established by perception, because such a BrahmƒÅ is not seen.

original: rjes su dpag pas kyang ma yin te /üîΩ'di ltar rjes su dpag pa yin na 'bras bu'i rtags yin pa'am /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas kyang ma yin te / 'di ltar rjes su dpag pa yin na 'bras bu'i rtags yin pa'am /
translated: It is also not established by inference.

original: rang bzhin gyi rtags yin grang /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi rtags yin grang /
translated: If it were established by inference, would the inference be based on an effect or on essence?

original: mi dmigs pa ni dgag pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir sgrub pa la dbang du byed pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni dgag pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir sgrub pa la dbang du byed pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Nonapprehension is not a means of valid cognition because it has a negative object.

original: de la re zhig 'bras bu'i rtags ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig 'bras bu'i rtags ni ma yin te /
translated: First, it is not based on an effect,

original: rtag pa las 'bras bu 'ga' yang mi skye ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rtag pa las 'bras bu 'ga' yang mi skye ba'i phyir te /
translated: because no effect arises from a permanent thing,

original: rtag pa ni rim dang cig car dag gis don byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa ni rim dang cig car dag gis don byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is contradictory for a permanent thing to function sequentially or simultaneously.

original: rang bzhin gyi rtags kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi rtags kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The reason of nature also does not exist,

original: tshangs par brjod pa'i chos can de nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshangs par brjod pa'i chos can de nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the very subject, the one who is said to be pure, is not established.

original: chos can ma grub na de'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i chos rang rgyud du grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos can ma grub na de'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i chos rang rgyud du grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the subject is not established, then the property that is its nature is not established as autonomous.

original: 'o na gzhan rtags su 'gyur ro zhe na /üîΩde dag las ni ma gtogs pa'i //
analyzed: 'o na gzhan rtags su 'gyur ro zhe na / de dag las ni ma gtogs pa'i //
translated: But, it might be said, the other two reasons are available.üîΩThe response to that is stated in the lines:

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Apart from those two,

original: rang bzhin dang 'bras bu las ma gtogs pa gzhan bsgrub bya'i don dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang 'bras bu las ma gtogs pa gzhan bsgrub bya'i don dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because apart from the reason of nature and the reason of effect, there is no other reason that is related to the object to be established.

original: 'brel pa med pa'i rtags @188b kyang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa'i rtags @188b kyang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: A reason that is unrelated is also illogical,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would lead to an absurd consequence.

original: gang yang dngos po rnams sgra'i ngo bo nyid du sgra'i rjes su 'gro ba nyid smras pa gang yin pa de ma grub pa'i phyir dang / brdzun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir don dam pa'i tshangs pa sgra'i ngo bo nyid du sgrub par nus pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gang yang dngos po rnams sgra'i ngo bo nyid du sgra'i rjes su 'gro ba nyid smras pa gang yin pa de ma grub pa'i phyir dang / brdzun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir don dam pa'i tshangs pa sgra'i ngo bo nyid du sgrub par nus pa ma yin la /
translated: Also, whatever is said to be the essence of sound that is concomitant with things is not established, and because it is false, it is not possible to establish the ultimate Brahman as the essence of sound.

original: lung las kyang de grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lung las kyang de grub pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also not established by scripture,

original: de mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is not tenable.

original: gang yang mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i rtags yod mod kyi /
analyzed: gang yang mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i rtags yod mod kyi /
translated: Also, although the reason called non-observation exists,

original: de ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi khongs su gtogs pa yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi khongs su gtogs pa yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: we think that it is included within the category of essential reasons.

original: yang na yod pa sgrub par byed pa brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na yod pa sgrub par byed pa brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, because it is asserted to be a proof of existence.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /üîΩyod pa'i sgrub byed rtag yod min //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir / yod pa'i sgrub byed rtag yod min //
translated: For that very reason,

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe proof of existence is not always existent.‚Äù

original: gzhan yang tshangs pa shes pa tsam gyi don byed par yang mi rung bar shes par gyis shig / de mi rung ba nyid kyis de'i ngo bo med pa ni dngos po med pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang tshangs pa shes pa tsam gyi don byed par yang mi rung bar shes par gyis shig / de mi rung ba nyid kyis de'i ngo bo med pa ni dngos po med pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: Since that is not tenable, the absence of his entity is the characteristic of nonthings.

original: 'di nyid ston pa ni shes pa go rims dang ldan pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di nyid ston pa ni shes pa go rims dang ldan pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To demonstrate just this, he says, ‚ÄúKnowledge that is sequential,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di yang dang po nyid du dbang phyug rtag par bstan zin to //
analyzed: 'di yang dang po nyid du dbang phyug rtag par bstan zin to //
translated: Moreover, at the outset, you have already taught ƒ™≈õvara to be permanent.

original: de las gzhan zhes bya ba blang ba dang dor ba'i rgyu mtshan can sngon po la sogs pa las gzhan tha dad pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de las gzhan zhes bya ba blang ba dang dor ba'i rgyu mtshan can sngon po la sogs pa las gzhan tha dad pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúOther than that‚Äù means that which is the reason for adopting or rejecting something, and it is different from such things as blue. This is the meaning of ‚Äúother than that.‚Äù

original: yang na de las zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: yang na de las zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, ‚Äúthat‚Äù is a conclusion.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúOther than that‚Äù is reality.

original: mo gsham gyi bu dang mtshungs pa zhes bya ba ni mo gsham gyi bu dngos po med pa nyid du rnam par 'jog pa la don bya ba byed par nus pa dang bral ba las ma gtogs pa rgyu mtshan gzhan yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu dang mtshungs pa zhes bya ba ni mo gsham gyi bu dngos po med pa nyid du rnam par 'jog pa la don bya ba byed par nus pa dang bral ba las ma gtogs pa rgyu mtshan gzhan yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúLike the son of a barren woman‚Äù means that the son of a barren woman is posited as a nonentity, and there is no other reason for this than that he is devoid of the ability to perform a function.

original: ci ste 'di skad du /
analyzed: ci ste 'di skad du /
translated: But if you say,

original: tshangs pa mchog gi bdag nyid de ni mngon par ma thob dang nges par legs pa'i 'bras bu'i chos rjes su 'dzin pa'i nang gi byed pa can rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis mthong ngo zhes brjod pa de yang mi 'thad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa la
analyzed: tshangs pa mchog gi bdag nyid de ni mngon par ma thob dang nges par legs pa'i 'bras bu'i chos rjes su 'dzin pa'i nang gi byed pa can rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis mthong ngo zhes brjod pa de yang mi 'thad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa la
translated: ‚ÄúBrahmƒÅ, the supreme self, is seen by yogis who have attained it, who are the internal agents that maintain the result of the Dharma of definite goodness,‚Äù then that is not tenable.

original: / gal te rnal 'byor goms pa'i shes pa la de'i bya ba yod pa yin na de'i tshe rnal 'byor pas de'i ngo bo mthong ngo zhes bya bar 'gyur na 'di ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: / gal te rnal 'byor goms pa'i shes pa la de'i bya ba yod pa yin na de'i tshe rnal 'byor pas de'i ngo bo mthong ngo zhes bya bar 'gyur na 'di ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: If the activity of that self existed for the consciousness of one who is familiar with yoga, then at that time it would be said that the yogi sees its nature. But this is illogical.

original: de tsam du ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam par shes pa la de'i bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de tsam du ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam par shes pa la de'i bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the object does not perform the action of consciousness, as has been explained.

original: 'di snyam du de'i yul can gyi shes pa skyed pas rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis de mthong ba ni ma yin te /üîΩde las ma gtogs @189a * //
analyzed: 'di snyam du de'i yul can gyi shes pa skyed pas rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis de mthong ba ni ma yin te / de las ma gtogs @189a * //
translated: If you think that the yogi does not see it because it generates the consciousness that has it as its object,

original: pa'i rnal 'byor pa dang / rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i rnal 'byor pa dang / rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then it follows that the yogi and the consciousness of the yogi do not exist apart from that object.

original: 'on kyang rnal 'byor gyi gnas skabs na rang gi bdag nyid gsal ba'i ngo bo de gsal ba na rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis mthong bar brjod do snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'on kyang rnal 'byor gyi gnas skabs na rang gi bdag nyid gsal ba'i ngo bo de gsal ba na rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis mthong bar brjod do snyam du sems na /
translated: But if you think that at the time of yoga, when the yogi‚Äôs mind is clear, the yogi sees it because its nature is clear,

original: gal te de lta na sngar rnal 'byor pa ma yin pa'i gnas skabs na de'i ngo bo ji lta bu zhig yin pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te de lta na sngar rnal 'byor pa ma yin pa'i gnas skabs na de'i ngo bo ji lta bu zhig yin pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: then you must explain what its nature was like prior to the time when he was a yogi.

original: gal te rtag tu gsal ba'i ngo bo yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te rtag tu gsal ba'i ngo bo yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: If you say that its nature is always clear,

original: 'o na rnal 'byor pa ma yin pa'i gnas skabs nam yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na rnal 'byor pa ma yin pa'i gnas skabs nam yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: then it follows that the time when he is not a yogi never exists.

original: tshangs pa ni rtag tu bdag nyid gsal ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshangs pa ni rtag tu bdag nyid gsal ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because BrahmƒÅ is always the nature of self-illumination.

original: de lta yin dang thams cad la 'bad ba med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang thams cad la 'bad ba med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, it would follow that everyone would be effortlessly liberated.

original: ci ste yang /
analyzed: ci ste yang /
translated: But if you say,

original: ji ltar khyed kyi rmi lam la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su shes pa gnyis su med pa yin na yang sna tshogs kyi rnam pa 'dzin par snang ngo //
analyzed: ji ltar khyed kyi rmi lam la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su shes pa gnyis su med pa yin na yang sna tshogs kyi rnam pa 'dzin par snang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúJust as in the context of dreams and so on, consciousness is nondual but appears to apprehend aspects of a variety,

original: de bzhin du de gnyis su med pa yin na yang ma rig pa'i dbang gis rgyud rnam par ma dag pa rnams la de ltar snang ba yin no snyam na ;
analyzed: de bzhin du de gnyis su med pa yin na yang ma rig pa'i dbang gis rgyud rnam par ma dag pa rnams la de ltar snang ba yin no snyam na ;
translated: in the same way, even though it is nondual, it appears that way to impure mindstreams due to the power of ignorance,‚Äù

original: de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: that is not correct.

original: gang dag la de de ltar snang bar 'gyur ba de las ma gtogs pa'i rnam par ma dag pa'i rgyud gzhan 'ga' zhig yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang dag la de de ltar snang bar 'gyur ba de las ma gtogs pa'i rnam par ma dag pa'i rgyud gzhan 'ga' zhig yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Because there is no other impure mindstream that exists apart from that which appears in that way.

original: gal te tshangs pa nyid de ltar snang ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te tshangs pa nyid de ltar snang ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúBrahmƒÅ appears that way,‚Äù

original: de lta na 'o na thar pa med par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na thar pa med par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: then it follows that there is no liberation.

original: tshangs pa ni thams cad du gnyis kyi ngo bor snang ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshangs pa ni thams cad du gnyis kyi ngo bor snang ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because BrahmƒÅ is the self that appears as duality in all respects.

original: kho bo cag la ni rnam par dag pa'i shes pa gzhan skye ba'i phyir grol bar rigs pa nyid yin la /üîΩkhyed cag la ni gang gi dbang gis de de ltar snang ba zhes bya bar 'gyur ba /
analyzed: kho bo cag la ni rnam par dag pa'i shes pa gzhan skye ba'i phyir grol bar rigs pa nyid yin la / khyed cag la ni gang gi dbang gis de de ltar snang ba zhes bya bar 'gyur ba /
translated: But it is reasonable that we are liberated because another pure cognition arises.

original: de las ma gtogs pa'i ma rig pa yod pa yang ma yin no ;
analyzed: de las ma gtogs pa'i ma rig pa yod pa yang ma yin no ;
translated: But for you, it is not reasonable that we are liberated because there is no ignorance apart from that which is the cause of the appearance of things in that way.

original: / yang na tha mi dad pa'i ma rig pa de'i dbang gis de nyid de ltar snang ngo zhes bya ba 'di ni legs par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: / yang na tha mi dad pa'i ma rig pa de'i dbang gis de nyid de ltar snang ngo zhes bya ba 'di ni legs par bshad pa'o //
translated: Or else, it is well explained that it appears in that way due to the power of that undifferentiated ignorance.

original: ci ste yang ma rig pa'i dbang gis de gsal ba yin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni de'i ma rig pa'i bdag nyid gsal bar byas pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: ci ste yang ma rig pa'i dbang gis de gsal ba yin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni de'i ma rig pa'i bdag nyid gsal bar byas pa yin no snyam na /
translated: But if you think that it is due to the power of ignorance that it is illuminated, then by this statement you have clarified the nature of your ignorance.

original: gal te de lta na thar ba med par thal ba nyid ches shin tu gsal bar byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de lta na thar ba med par thal ba nyid ches shin tu gsal bar byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then it is very clear that the consequence of the nonexistence of liberation is entailed.

original: gang gis ma rig pa dang bral bas grol bar 'gyur ba rtag pa gcig pu'i ngo bo tshangs pa ma rig pa'i bdag nyid du gnas pa yin na /üîΩde'i bdag nyid kyi ma rig pa dang bral ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis ma rig pa dang bral bas grol bar 'gyur ba rtag pa gcig pu'i ngo bo tshangs pa ma rig pa'i bdag nyid du gnas pa yin na / de'i bdag nyid kyi ma rig pa dang bral ba ni ma yin no //
translated: If the self of BrahmƒÅ, which is permanent and singular, were to exist as the nature of ignorance, then it would not be free from the nature of ignorance.

original: 'on te ma rig pa tha dad par khas len par byed na de lta na yang @189b rtag pa nyid kyi phyir khyad par byar med pa'i tshangs pa la de ni cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i phyir ma rig pa'i dbang gis de ltar snang bar mi rigs
analyzed: 'on te ma rig pa tha dad par khas len par byed na de lta na yang @189b rtag pa nyid kyi phyir khyad par byar med pa'i tshangs pa la de ni cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i phyir ma rig pa'i dbang gis de ltar snang bar mi rigs
translated: If you accept that ignorance is different, then, because it is permanent, it would not make the slightest difference to BrahmƒÅ, who is permanent, so it is not reasonable that he would appear due to the power of ignorance.

original: so // de lta yin dang ma rig pa dang lhan cig de 'brel pa med pa'i phyir 'khor ba med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: so // de lta yin dang ma rig pa dang lhan cig de 'brel pa med pa'i phyir 'khor ba med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were the case, it would follow that samsara would not exist, because he would not be related to ignorance.

original: de ni de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par mi nus so zhes kyang brjod par mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par mi nus so zhes kyang brjod par mi rigs te /
translated: It is also unreasonable to say that he cannot be described as either the same as or different from ignorance.

original: dngos po'i chos la go skabs gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i chos la go skabs gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no other possibility for a phenomenon that is a thing.

original: de lta ma yin na dngos po'i chos nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na dngos po'i chos nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, it would not be the reality of things.

original: dngos po med pa'i dbang gis de de ltar gsal bar yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i dbang gis de de ltar gsal bar yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable that it be clear by the power of non-existence,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would lead to absurdity.

original: kho bo cag la ni de lta bur gyur pa'i don bya ba byed pa'i rang bzhin la yang dngos med ces ming byed na rtsod pa med de /
analyzed: kho bo cag la ni de lta bur gyur pa'i don bya ba byed pa'i rang bzhin la yang dngos med ces ming byed na rtsod pa med de /
translated: For us, there is no dispute about the name ‚Äúnon-entity‚Äù for an entity that has the nature of not performing a function.

original: de kho bo cag la ji lta ba bzhin ma yin par zhen pa'i bag chags nyid ma rig pa yin te /
analyzed: de kho bo cag la ji lta ba bzhin ma yin par zhen pa'i bag chags nyid ma rig pa yin te /
translated: But that non-entity is not as it is imagined by those who are ignorant. The habitual tendency itself is ignorance.

original: bag chags de yang ha cang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bag chags de yang ha cang zhes bya ba la /
translated: And that habitual tendency is ‚Äúexcessive,‚Äù

original: nus pa yang rgyu'i bdag nyid kyi shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: nus pa yang rgyu'i bdag nyid kyi shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa nyid yin no //
translated: because it is the capacity of the nature of consciousness, which is the nature of the cause.

original: des na ma rig pa'i bdag nyid kyi shes pa rgyur gyur pa snga ma snga mas ji lta ba bzhin ma yin par zhen pa'i 'bras bu'i shes pa phyi ma phyi ma skye ba'i phyir ma rig pa'i dbang gis de ltar gsal bar rigs so //
analyzed: des na ma rig pa'i bdag nyid kyi shes pa rgyur gyur pa snga ma snga mas ji lta ba bzhin ma yin par zhen pa'i 'bras bu'i shes pa phyi ma phyi ma skye ba'i phyir ma rig pa'i dbang gis de ltar gsal bar rigs so //
translated: Therefore, because the subsequent effects of consciousness, which are the consciousnesses that conceive of things in a way that does not accord with the way things are, arise from the earlier causes, which are the consciousnesses that have the nature of ignorance, it is logical that they appear in that way due to the power of ignorance.

original: ma rig pa de yang rnal 'byor goms pa'i phyir nus pa med pa'i skad cig gong nas gong du skye ba'i rim gyis bral ba las shes pa'i rgyud rnam par dag pa skye ba'i phyir byang grol thob pa /
analyzed: ma rig pa de yang rnal 'byor goms pa'i phyir nus pa med pa'i skad cig gong nas gong du skye ba'i rim gyis bral ba las shes pa'i rgyud rnam par dag pa skye ba'i phyir byang grol thob pa /
translated: Moreover, because that ignorance is removed through the process of the arising of ever more powerful moments of familiarity with yoga, a continuum of consciousness that is pure arises. Therefore, liberation and omniscience are attained.

original: des na bcings pa dang thar pa'i rnam par gzhag pa rigs pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: des na bcings pa dang thar pa'i rnam par gzhag pa rigs pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the presentations of bondage and liberation are reasonable.

original: khyed la ni de lta bu yod pa ma yin te /üîΩtshangs pa ni rtag pa gcig pu'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyed la ni de lta bu yod pa ma yin te / tshangs pa ni rtag pa gcig pu'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: However, for you, this is not the case.üîΩThis is because BrahmƒÅ is permanent and has the nature of being a singular entity.

original: gnas skabs gnyis med pa'i tshangs pa ni gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnas skabs gnyis med pa'i tshangs pa ni gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since BrahmƒÅ, who does not have two states, is singular,

original: gcig thar pa na thams cad thar par thal bar 'gyur ba dang / gcig ma grol na thams cad kyang ma grol bar thal bar 'gyur ba mi zlogs so //
analyzed: gcig thar pa na thams cad thar par thal bar 'gyur ba dang / gcig ma grol na thams cad kyang ma grol bar thal bar 'gyur ba mi zlogs so //
translated: and it would follow, absurdly, that when one is liberated all would be liberated, and that when one is not liberated none would be liberated.

original: rnal 'byor pa ma yin pa'i gnas skabs na bdag nyid gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma 'di la cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa ma yin pa'i gnas skabs na bdag nyid gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma 'di la cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin la /
translated: There is not the slightest valid cognition that establishes that at the time when one is not a yogi one is by nature luminous.

original: shes pa ni gsal pa'i bdag nyid du rang rig pas grub po //
analyzed: shes pa ni gsal pa'i bdag nyid du rang rig pas grub po //
translated: Consciousness is established by reflexive awareness to be by nature luminous.

original: de ltar sgra'i bdag nyid ni shes pa'i bdag nyid thams cad la rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni bstan zin to //üîΩci ste rnal 'byor pa ma yin pa'i gnas skabs na tshangs pa 'di bdag nyid gsal bar khas len par @190a * //
analyzed: de ltar sgra'i bdag nyid ni shes pa'i bdag nyid thams cad la rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni bstan zin to // ci ste rnal 'byor pa ma yin pa'i gnas skabs na tshangs pa 'di bdag nyid gsal bar khas len par @190a * //
translated: It has already been shown that it is illogical for all that is by nature consciousness to be by nature sound.

original: mi byed na /
analyzed: mi byed na /
translated: If at the time when one is not a yogi one does not accept that one is by nature luminous,üîΩthen what is the difference between the two?

original: de lta na yang sngar med pa'i gsal ba'i bdag nyid de tshangs pa sngar gyi ngo bo ma dor bar phyis rnal 'byor pa'i gnas skabs su ga las byung zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang sngar med pa'i gsal ba'i bdag nyid de tshangs pa sngar gyi ngo bo ma dor bar phyis rnal 'byor pa'i gnas skabs su ga las byung zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: In that case, how could that nature of clarity, which did not exist before, arise later in the state of the yogi without abandoning the previous nature of BrahmƒÅ?

original: de lta bas na khyed kyis sgra'i tshangs pa smra ba ni log par smra ba yin pa'i phyir spros pas chog go //
analyzed: de lta bas na khyed kyis sgra'i tshangs pa smra ba ni log par smra ba yin pa'i phyir spros pas chog go //
translated: Therefore, your assertion that the BrahmƒÅ of sound is a speaker is just idle speculation, because it is false.

original: gtso bo yongs su 'gyur pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngar bshad pa'i skyon gyi lam 'di la yang bsgre bar byed do //üîΩde la / 'bras de yod phyir rgyu yis na //
analyzed: gtso bo yongs su 'gyur pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngar bshad pa'i skyon gyi lam 'di la yang bsgre bar byed do // de la / 'bras de yod phyir rgyu yis na //
translated: And this path of the previously explained faults is also extended by the verse ‚Äúthe transformation of the primal nature,‚Äù and so on.üîΩIn response to that, one should state faults such as the following:üîΩThe effect is not to be produced by the cause because it exists,

original: bskyed bya min te rgyu rig bzhin //
analyzed: bskyed bya min te rgyu rig bzhin //
translated: like the cause itself.

original: de phyir mngon 'dod rgyu min te //
analyzed: de phyir mngon 'dod rgyu min te //
translated: Therefore it is not the cause of what is desired,

original: bsgrub bya med phyir gzhan dag bzhin //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa de lta bu'i skyon brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgrub bya med phyir gzhan dag bzhin // zhes bya ba la sogs pa de lta bu'i skyon brjod par bya'o //
translated: because the object to be established does not exist, like other things.

original: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel las sgra'i tshangs pa brtag pa ste lnga pa'o /
analyzed: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel las sgra'i tshangs pa brtag pa ste lnga pa'o /
translated: This concludes the examination of the BrahmƒÅ of sound, the fifth chapter of the Commentary on the Compendium of Principles.

original: // / rig byed smra ba'i gzhung lugs /
analyzed: // / rig byed smra ba'i gzhung lugs /
translated: The system of the VedƒÅntins

analyzed: grub mtha' nyes par bshad pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs 'god par byed de /
translated: is set forth in the lines beginning ‚ÄúThe philosophical position that is explained as faulty . . .‚Äù

analyzed: de dag ni 'di skad du skyes bu gcig nyid 'jig rten mtha' dag 'byin pa dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa'i rgyu yin la /

analyzed: snal ma rnams la ba thag bzhin //
translated: Like a blanket from threads,üîΩlike water from a water crystal,

analyzed: chu la chu shel ji bzhin dang // lcug ma rnams kyi blag sha bzhin //

analyzed: dbang phyug chos mtshungs zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug dang chos mtshungs pa ste /

analyzed: gnyi ga yang sna tshogs 'byin pa dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: gnyi ga yang sna tshogs pa 'byin pa dang / gnas pa dang / 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi dngos por ni mtshungs so // grub mtha' nyes par bshad pa yi //

analyzed: bal gyi lte ba ni ba thag pa rkyong ngo //
translated: The ‚Äúcenter of wool‚Äù is a wool-bearing plant.

original: 'di dag la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas sun 'byin pa rtsom mo /
analyzed: 'di dag la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas sun 'byin pa rtsom mo /
translated: He begins the refutation with ‚ÄúBut in that case, etc.‚Äù

original: dbang phyug bzhin zhes bya ba ni drug pa'i mtha' can las rang bzhin gyi rkyen yin no //
analyzed: dbang phyug bzhin zhes bya ba ni drug pa'i mtha' can las rang bzhin gyi rkyen yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúLike the creator‚Äù is a genitive tatpurusa compound.

original: de la yang 'di skad du skyes bu ni skye ba dang ldan pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: de la yang 'di skad du skyes bu ni skye ba dang ldan pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: And here one could say, ‚ÄúA person is not the cause of birth,

original: skye ba dang bral ba'i phyir nam mkha'i pad ma bzhin no //
analyzed: skye ba dang bral ba'i phyir nam mkha'i pad ma bzhin no //
translated: because he is devoid of birth, like a sky-flower.

original: de lta ma yin na thams cad cig car bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i nyes pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na thams cad cig car bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i nyes pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: Otherwise, everything would occur simultaneously.‚ÄùüîΩAnd just as others have stated proofs for the existence of the creator, in the same way, the proponents of purusha have stated proofs for the existence of purusha.

original: yang ji ltar gzhan dag gis dbang phyug bsgrub pa'i phyir sgrub par byed pa brjod pa de ltar skyes bu smra ba rnams kyis skyes bu grub par bya ba'i phyir len par byed pa de'i tshe de bzhin du ma grub pa la sogs pa'i skyon brjod par bya'o
analyzed: yang ji ltar gzhan dag gis dbang phyug bsgrub pa'i phyir sgrub par byed pa brjod pa de ltar skyes bu smra ba rnams kyis skyes bu grub par bya ba'i phyir len par byed pa de'i tshe de bzhin du ma grub pa la sogs pa'i skyon brjod par bya'o
translated: But in that case, the faults of unestablished reasons and so on would be applicable.

original: // sun 'byin pa'i rnam pa gzhan yang 'di 'dra'i byed pa de dag ces bya ba la sogs smos te /
analyzed: // sun 'byin pa'i rnam pa gzhan yang 'di 'dra'i byed pa de dag ces bya ba la sogs smos te /
translated: Another kind of refutation is stated in the lines beginning ‚ÄúIf these activities are his.‚Äù

original: rtog pa sngon du gtong ba'i 'jug pa la dgos pa dang ldan pas khyab pa de bas na ci'i phyir skyes bu 'di yang 'gro ba 'god par byed pa 'di 'dra ba byed ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rtog pa sngon du gtong ba'i 'jug pa la dgos pa dang ldan pas khyab pa de bas na ci'i phyir skyes bu 'di yang 'gro ba 'god par byed pa 'di 'dra ba byed ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: Since it is necessary to engage in conceptualization, then why does this person also engage in such activity as setting beings in motion?

original: gal te dbang phyug la sogs pa gzhan gyis bskul bas mi 'dod kyang byed pa de'i tshe 'di rang dbang can du khas blangs pa gang yin pa de nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dbang phyug la sogs pa gzhan gyis bskul bas mi 'dod kyang byed pa de'i tshe 'di rang dbang can du khas blangs pa gang yin pa de nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If, though not desiring to, he acts because he is impelled by another, such as God, then whatever independence he is said to have is undermined.

original: ci ste snying rjes gzhan rjes su gzung ba'i don du byed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: ci ste snying rjes gzhan rjes su gzung ba'i don du byed pa de'i tshe /
translated: But if he acts out of compassion in order to help others,

original: dmyal ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i sems can sprul par byed par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: dmyal ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i sems can sprul par byed par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: then he would not emanate sentient beings who are suffering in the hells and so on.

original: gcig tu bde ba dang ldan pa kho na byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig tu bde ba dang ldan pa kho na byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: He would only emanate those who are completely happy.

original: gzhan yang 'byin pa ste skyed pa'i sngar brtse bar bya ba sems can med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'byin pa ste skyed pa'i sngar brtse bar bya ba sems can med pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, since there are no sentient beings to be compassionate toward prior to creation,

original: rjes su brtse ba gang gi dbang gis 'di byed pa po dang 'byin pa por rtog pa ci la dmigs nas de'i rjes su brtse bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rjes su brtse ba gang gi dbang gis 'di byed pa po dang 'byin pa por rtog pa ci la dmigs nas de'i rjes su brtse bar 'gyur /
translated: What is the object of the compassion that causes him to create and emit?

original: gal te yang 'di rjes su brtse bas byed na lha dang mi la sogs pa gang dag rtag tu mngon par mtho ba dang ldan pa de dag ci'i phyir 'jig par byed de /
analyzed: gal te yang 'di rjes su brtse bas byed na lha dang mi la sogs pa gang dag rtag tu mngon par mtho ba dang ldan pa de dag ci'i phyir 'jig par byed de /
translated: If he creates and emits through compassion, then why does he destroy those gods, humans, and so on who are always endowed with higher status?

original: gang yang sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i rgyud ngan song ba'i sems can de dag nyid 'jig par byed par nges so snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gang yang sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i rgyud ngan song ba'i sems can de dag nyid 'jig par byed par nges so snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: If you think that he definitely destroys those sentient beings of the lower rebirths who are endowed with suffering,

original: ci ste yang rjes su brtse bar bya ba de dag gis ma mthong ba'i chos dang chos ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de la ltos nas 'jig rten bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang ldan par byed do snyam na /
analyzed: ci ste yang rjes su brtse bar bya ba de dag gis ma mthong ba'i chos dang chos ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de la ltos nas 'jig rten bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang ldan par byed do snyam na /
translated: then if he creates the happiness and suffering of the world in reliance on the characteristics of virtue and nonvirtue that are not seen by those who are to be helped by his compassion,

original: de yang yod pa ma yin te /üîΩde lta na ni rang dbang can du khas @191a * //
analyzed: de yang yod pa ma yin te / de lta na ni rang dbang can du khas @191a * //
translated: that is not possible.

original: blangs pa nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: blangs pa nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, you would be accepting that he is not independent.

original: nus pa yin na 'ga' la yang mi ltos pa'am /
analyzed: nus pa yin na 'ga' la yang mi ltos pa'am /
translated: If it is a cause, it does not depend on anything else.

original: nus pa med na ltos nas lha'i 'jig rten du skye ba'i phyir skyes bu 'di de'i rgyu nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nus pa med na ltos nas lha'i 'jig rten du skye ba'i phyir skyes bu 'di de'i rgyu nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not a cause, then, even though it depends on something else, the person is not the cause of the birth of a god.

original: de ma mthong ba na ltos pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de ma mthong ba na ltos pa yin mod kyi /
translated: If you say that it is a cause when it is seen,üîΩthen it is not a cause when it is not seen. It is not reasonable that a cause of suffering should be dependent on something else.

original: 'on kyang yang ma mthong ba'i chos can ma yin pa'i bdag nyid kyi sdug bsngal gyi rgyu gang yin pa de la ltos na brtse ba dang ldan par mi rigs so //üîΩ'on kyang de de la brtse ba'i gzhan dbang du gyur pa nyid la btang snyoms su bya ba nyid du rigs so //üîΩbrtse ba dang ldan pa rnams ni gzhan gyi sdug bsngal gyi rgyu tshol ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang yang ma mthong ba'i chos can ma yin pa'i bdag nyid kyi sdug bsngal gyi rgyu gang yin pa de la ltos na brtse ba dang ldan par mi rigs so // 'on kyang de de la brtse ba'i gzhan dbang du gyur pa nyid la btang snyoms su bya ba nyid du rigs so // brtse ba dang ldan pa rnams ni gzhan gyi sdug bsngal gyi rgyu tshol ba ma yin te /
translated: But if it is a cause when it is not seen, then it is not reasonable that one who has compassion should be indifferent to it.üîΩBut if one who has compassion is not indifferent to it, then he should seek out the cause of the suffering of others.

original: de dag ni gzhan sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'dod pa nyid kyis 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni gzhan sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'dod pa nyid kyis 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But one who has compassion does not seek out the cause of the suffering of others, because he is engaged in the desire to remove the suffering of others.

original: ci ste rjes su brtse bas byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ci ste rjes su brtse bas byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If you say that he is not engaged out of compassion,

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: then why?

original: rtsed mo'i don du'o //
analyzed: rtsed mo'i don du'o //
translated: If you say it is for the sake of play,

original: 'di yang yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: This is also not correct.

original: de lta na ni rtsed mo'i don du bskyed na 'di rang dbang can du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni rtsed mo'i don du bskyed na 'di rang dbang can du mi 'gyur te /
translated: If that were so, then if it were generated for the sake of play, it would not be independent,

original: skye ba dang gnas pa dang / 'jig pa'i bdag nyid kyi rtsed mo'i rnam pa sna tshogs kyi thabs la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba dang gnas pa dang / 'jig pa'i bdag nyid kyi rtsed mo'i rnam pa sna tshogs kyi thabs la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would depend on the various methods of play that have the nature of arising, enduring, and disintegrating.

original: gzhan yang rtsed mo sna tshogs kyi thabs gang dag yin pa de byed pa la gal te 'di nus pa yin na /
analyzed: gzhan yang rtsed mo sna tshogs kyi thabs gang dag yin pa de byed pa la gal te 'di nus pa yin na /
translated: Moreover, if it is able to perform those various methods of play,

original: de'i tshe de dag cig car kho nar byed par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i tshe de dag cig car kho nar byed par 'gyur la /
translated: then it would perform them all at once.

original: 'on te dang por de la nus pa med pa de'i tshe rim gyis kyang byed par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te dang por de la nus pa med pa de'i tshe rim gyis kyang byed par mi 'gyur te /
translated: But if it is initially powerless, then it would not perform them gradually either,

original: mi nus pa'i gnas skabs dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi nus pa'i gnas skabs dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would not be different from a state of powerlessness.

original: gcig dngos po gcig la nus pa'am mi nus pa phan tshun 'gal ba'i chos gnyis rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig dngos po gcig la nus pa'am mi nus pa phan tshun 'gal ba'i chos gnyis rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is illogical for a single thing to have two mutually exclusive properties, either being able to perform something or not being able to perform it.

original: ci'i phyir bya ba 'di 'dra ba rtsom zhes bya ba la sogs pa rtog pa thams cad dbang phyug la yang thun mong yin te /üîΩde'i phyir gang blo gros bzang pos gzhan rjes su gzung ba'i don du dbang phyug 'jug ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bya ba 'di 'dra ba rtsom zhes bya ba la sogs pa rtog pa thams cad dbang phyug la yang thun mong yin te / de'i phyir gang blo gros bzang pos gzhan rjes su gzung ba'i don du dbang phyug 'jug ste /
translated: All such conceptions are also common to the Almighty.üîΩTherefore, the Almighty engages in creation for the sake of caring for others, just as some who have accomplished their own purpose instruct others for the sake of caring for others, even though they have no purpose of obtaining benefit or avoiding harm for themselves.

original: dper na don byas pa thug pa kha cig bdag la phan pa dang mi phan pa thob pa dang spong ba'i don med na yang gzhan rjes su gzung ba'i don du 'doms par byed pa de bzhin du dbang phyug kyang bdag nyid kyi dbang phyug gi 'byor pa
analyzed: dper na don byas pa thug pa kha cig bdag la phan pa dang mi phan pa thob pa dang spong ba'i don med na yang gzhan rjes su gzung ba'i don du 'doms par byed pa de bzhin du dbang phyug kyang bdag nyid kyi dbang phyug gi 'byor pa
translated: Similarly, the Almighty, for the sake of caring for others, engages in creation through the power of his own lordship.

original: ston cing srog chags rnams rjes su 'dzin pa la 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / yang na nus pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na dus ni dpyid la sogs pa mngon par gsal ba la rnam grangs kyis rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i @191b rnam par 'gyur bskyed pa'i rang bzhin yin pa de bzhin du dbang phyug kyang 'byin pa dang
analyzed: ston cing srog chags rnams rjes su 'dzin pa la 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / yang na nus pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na dus ni dpyid la sogs pa mngon par gsal ba la rnam grangs kyis rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i @191b rnam par 'gyur bskyed pa'i rang bzhin yin pa de bzhin du dbang phyug kyang 'byin pa dang
translated: and they teach and care for living beings.üîΩOr, just as the nature of time, such as spring, is to generate the various changes of animate and inanimate beings through its different stages, in the same way, God is the cause of the birth, endurance, and destruction of living beings through his different stages of creation, care, and destruction.

original: / rjes su 'dzin pa dang / sdud pa'i nus pa rnams gsal ba la rnam grangs kyi srog chags rnams kyi skye ba dang / gnas pa dang 'jig pa'i rgyu nyid yin no zhes smras pa de yang 'di nyid kyis lan btab pa yin no //
analyzed: / rjes su 'dzin pa dang / sdud pa'i nus pa rnams gsal ba la rnam grangs kyi srog chags rnams kyi skye ba dang / gnas pa dang 'jig pa'i rgyu nyid yin no zhes smras pa de yang 'di nyid kyis lan btab pa yin no //
translated: This is also the response to that.

original: 'di ltar gzhan rjes su gzung ba'i don du 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di la rjes su 'dzin pa lhur byed pa na 'gro ba gcig tu bde ba dang ldan pa byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di nyid lan yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan rjes su gzung ba'i don du 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di la rjes su 'dzin pa lhur byed pa na 'gro ba gcig tu bde ba dang ldan pa byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di nyid lan yin no //
translated: Thus, the answer to the question, ‚ÄúWhy does he engage in the activity of creation?‚Äù is the same as the answer to the question, ‚ÄúWhy does he create the world?‚ÄùüîΩThe answer to the question, ‚ÄúWhy does he create the world?‚Äù is the same as the answer to the question, ‚ÄúWhy does he engage in the activity of creation?‚ÄùüîΩThe answer to the question, ‚ÄúWhy does he engage in the activity of creation?‚Äù is the same as the answer to the question, ‚ÄúWhy does he create the world?‚Äù

original: nus pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di la yang /üîΩ'byin dang gnas dang sdud pa la //üîΩcig car nus pa gsal ba na //
analyzed: nus pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di la yang / 'byin dang gnas dang sdud pa la // cig car nus pa gsal ba na //
translated: The answer to the question, ‚ÄúWhy does he create the world?‚Äù is the same as the answer to the question, ‚ÄúWhy does he engage in the activity of creation?‚Äù

original: 'gro ba cig car byed par 'gyur //üîΩde lta min na nus gsal min //
analyzed: 'gro ba cig car byed par 'gyur // de lta min na nus gsal min //
translated: The answer to the question, ‚ÄúWhy does he engage in the activity of creation?‚Äù is the same as the answer to the question, ‚ÄúWhy does he create the world?‚ÄùüîΩThe answer to the question, ‚ÄúWhy does he create the world?‚Äù is the same as the answer to the question, ‚ÄúWhy does he engage in the activity of creation?‚ÄùüîΩThe answer to the question, ‚ÄúWhy does he engage in the activity of creation?‚Äù is the same as the answer to the question, ‚ÄúWhy does he create the world?‚ÄùüîΩThe answer to the question, ‚ÄúWhy does he create the world?‚Äù is the same as the answer to the question, ‚ÄúWhy does he engage in the activity of creation?‚ÄùüîΩThe answer to the question, ‚ÄúWhy does he engage in the activity of creation?‚Äù is the same as the answer to the question, ‚ÄúWhy does he create the world?‚Äù

original: dbang phyug 'di ni nus gsal bar //
analyzed: dbang phyug 'di ni nus gsal bar //
translated: The answer to the question, ‚ÄúWhy does he create the world?‚Äù is the same as the answer to the question, ‚ÄúWhy does he engage in the activity of creation?‚ÄùüîΩThe answer to the question, ‚ÄúWhy does he engage in the activity of creation?‚Äù is the same as the answer to the question, ‚ÄúWhy does he create the world?‚Äù

original: rim gyis kyang ni 'thad ma yin //üîΩgal te nus gsal 'di las gzhan //
analyzed: rim gyis kyang ni 'thad ma yin // gal te nus gsal 'di las gzhan //
translated: The answer to the question, ‚ÄúWhy does he create the world?‚Äù is the same as the answer to the question, ‚ÄúWhy does he engage in the activity of creation?‚ÄùüîΩThe answer to the question, ‚ÄúWhy does he engage in the activity of creation?‚Äù is the same as the answer to the question, ‚ÄúWhy does he create the world?‚Äù

original: dngos po gcig tu ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: dngos po gcig tu ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: The answer to the question, ‚ÄúWhy does he create the world?‚Äù is the same as the answer to the question, ‚ÄúWhy does he engage in the activity of creation?‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba'i sun 'byin pa 'di nyid yin no //üîΩdus ni dpyid la sogs pa mngon par gsal ba la rnam grangs kyis 'jug pa la nyes pa 'di nyid yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sun 'byin pa 'di nyid yin no //üîΩdus ni dpyid la sogs pa mngon par gsal ba la rnam grangs kyis 'jug pa la nyes pa 'di nyid yin no //
translated: The answer to the question,

original: grang ba dang dro ba tha dad pa gnyis bstan pa'i dngos po nyid skad cig re re la 'jig pa ni dus zhes bya ba 'di ni phyis ston par 'gyur ro//
analyzed: grang ba dang dro ba tha dad pa gnyis bstan pa'i dngos po nyid skad cig re re la 'jig pa ni dus zhes bya ba 'di ni phyis ston par 'gyur ro//
translated: The difference between cold and hot is the thing itself that is taught, and its momentariness is what is called time. This will be taught later.

original: 'on te 'di 'byin la sogs pa //
analyzed: 'on te 'di 'byin la sogs pa //
translated: But if it is said that the creator and so onüîΩare the cause of the world,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsal byed pa'i lugs kyi dogs pa bsu ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsal byed pa'i lugs kyi dogs pa bsu ba yin te /
translated: this is a response to the objection that the creator and so on are the cause of the world.

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: The theist says:

original: legs ldan byed ni rtsed mo'i don du 'jug pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: legs ldan byed ni rtsed mo'i don du 'jug pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Bhavaviveka does not engage in this debate for the sake of amusement.

original: 'on kyang ji ltar sa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams rang gi 'bras bu la 'jug pa gang yin pa ni rang bzhin nyid de 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang ji ltar sa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams rang gi 'bras bu la 'jug pa gang yin pa ni rang bzhin nyid de 'dra ba yin te /
translated: However, just as the great elements such as earth engage in their own effects, their nature is such that they are the cause of their effects.

original: de bzhin du dbang phyug kyang yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbang phyug kyang yin no zhe'o //
translated: In the same way, God is the cause of the world.

original: de yang 'di mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yang 'di mi rigs te /
translated: This is illogical.

original: de lta na dngos po thams cad de'i bya ba tsam du 'byung ba'i rgyu nus pa ma tshang ba med pa nye ba'i phyir cig car skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na dngos po thams cad de'i bya ba tsam du 'byung ba'i rgyu nus pa ma tshang ba med pa nye ba'i phyir cig car skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, all things would arise simultaneously because the cause that is the mere activity of God and the complete assemblage of conditions would be present.

original: blo dang ldan pa'i khyad par yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes kho bo cag gis dang po nyid du bstan zin to //
analyzed: blo dang ldan pa'i khyad par yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes kho bo cag gis dang po nyid du bstan zin to //
translated: We have already explained above that it is not reasonable to distinguish the intelligent from the unintelligent.

original: gal te de lta na me la sogs pa'i 'bras bu yang ci'i phyir cig car 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na me la sogs pa'i 'bras bu yang ci'i phyir cig car 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If that is so, why don‚Äôt the effects of fire and so on arise simultaneously?

original: rang rgyu'i stobs las byung ba yi //
analyzed: rang rgyu'i stobs las byung ba yi //
translated: They arise from the power of their own causes.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The verse says,

original: de dag gi zhes bya ba ni me la sogs pa'i 'o //üîΩ'ang gi sgra ni dbang phyug @192a /
analyzed: de dag gi zhes bya ba ni me la sogs pa'i 'o // 'ang gi sgra ni dbang phyug @192a /
translated: ‚ÄúTheir own causes‚Äù refers to fire and so on.

original: * // kho nar ma zad ces bya'o //
analyzed: * // kho nar ma zad ces bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means that not only ƒ™≈õvara.

original: nges pa 'di zhes bya ba ni rang gi rgyu'i stobs kyis byas pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa 'di zhes bya ba ni rang gi rgyu'i stobs kyis byas pa'o //
translated: This certainty is due to the power of their own causes.

original: 'di snyam du bal gyi lte ba can ci'i phyir rang gi 'bras bu brgya la sogs pa la ngo bo nyid kyis 'jug pas cig car mi byed na /üîΩbal gyi lte ba'am rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: 'di snyam du bal gyi lte ba can ci'i phyir rang gi 'bras bu brgya la sogs pa la ngo bo nyid kyis 'jug pas cig car mi byed na / bal gyi lte ba'am rang bzhin gyis //
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúWhy doesn‚Äôt a spider, by its own nature, simultaneously produce its effects, such as a web, in one hundred places?‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The verse says,

original: ba thag pa rkyong yang rang bzhin gyis 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ba thag pa rkyong yang rang bzhin gyis 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúA spider, by its own nature, does not extend its thread.‚ÄùüîΩEven though a spider extends its thread, it does not do so by its own nature.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /üîΩsrog chags za bar 'dod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na / srog chags za bar 'dod pa'i phyir //
translated: What then?üîΩBecause he is sometimes the cause of the desire to eat living beings,

original: res 'ga' yin pa'i phyir dang / nges pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: res 'ga' yin pa'i phyir dang / nges pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: and because he is the cause of certainty.

original: 'di ni rtag pa dang gcig pu'i ngo bo ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni rtag pa dang gcig pu'i ngo bo ma yin te /
translated: He is not permanent and single.

original: de la yang rang gi rgyu'i stobs las byung ba'i nus pa res 'ga' ba yin no //
analyzed: de la yang rang gi rgyu'i stobs las byung ba'i nus pa res 'ga' ba yin no //
translated: Even in that case, his power arises from the power of his own cause and is sometimes.

original: ci ste yang brtse bas kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: ci ste yang brtse bas kyang ma yin la /
translated: If you think that he is not compassionate,

original: rtsed mos kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: rtsed mos kyang ma yin te /
translated: and he is not playful,

original: 'on kyang blo dang mi ldan pa gang du 'gro bas ci zhig ltar 'jug pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'on kyang blo dang mi ldan pa gang du 'gro bas ci zhig ltar 'jug pa yin no snyam na /
translated: but rather, he is a non-intelligent being who enters in some way,

original: gal te ji zhig ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te ji zhig ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then he says, ‚ÄúIf he enters in some way, etc.

original: de lta na ni shin tu mi shes pa nyid kyis nya pa la sogs pa tha mal pa'i skyes bu las 'di'i tshig ji ltar rtog pa dang ldan pas gzung bar 'os par 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta na ni shin tu mi shes pa nyid kyis nya pa la sogs pa tha mal pa'i skyes bu las 'di'i tshig ji ltar rtog pa dang ldan pas gzung bar 'os par 'gyur /
translated: In that case, how could his words be accepted as having intelligence, since he is extremely ignorant, like an ordinary person such as a fisherman?

original: blo ldan zhes bya ba ni rtog pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: blo ldan zhes bya ba ni rtog pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIntelligent‚Äù means having intelligence.

original: nya pa ni nya shor ba'o //
analyzed: nya pa ni nya shor ba'o //
translated: The fisherman is the one who loses the fish.üîΩBy this very refutation of the person, one should understand clearly the other designations of the creator of the world, such as the son of Dƒ´ptƒ´.

original: skyes bu sun 'byin pa 'di nyid kyis gang yang dpa' bo'i bu la sogs pa gzhan dag gis 'gro ba'i byed pa por brtags pa de dag kyang gsal bar shes par bya'o zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: skyes bu sun 'byin pa 'di nyid kyis gang yang dpa' bo'i bu la sogs pa gzhan dag gis 'gro ba'i byed pa por brtags pa de dag kyang gsal bar shes par bya'o zhes ston pa ni /
translated: To show this, he says:

original: dpa' bu bdag skyes zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dpa' bu bdag skyes zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The son of Dƒ´ptƒ´, the self-born, and so on.

original: de la dpa' bu ni khyab 'jug go //
analyzed: de la dpa' bu ni khyab 'jug go //
translated: Here, Dƒ´ptƒ´ is Vi·π£·πáu.

original: bdag skyes ni tshangs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag skyes ni tshangs pa'o //
translated: The self-born is BrahmƒÅ.

original: sogs pa'i sgras gzhan gyis 'dod pa'i blo dang ldan pa'i dus gang yin pa de gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras gzhan gyis 'dod pa'i blo dang ldan pa'i dus gang yin pa de gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes the mind of others, which is asserted by some.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: dus kyi 'byung ba min par byed //üîΩdus kyis skye dgu sdud par byed //
analyzed: dus kyi 'byung ba min par byed // dus kyis skye dgu sdud par byed //
translated: He makes time arise.üîΩTime brings beings together.

original: dus kyis gnyid log sad par byed //
analyzed: dus kyis gnyid log sad par byed //
translated: Time awakens those who are asleep.

original: dus ni 'da' bar dka' ba yin //
analyzed: dus ni 'da' bar dka' ba yin //
translated: Time is difficult to transgress.

original: zhes smras pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes smras pa lta bu'o //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: gnyid log pa la zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa'i dus 'jig rten na thim pa zhes bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: gnyid log pa la zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa'i dus 'jig rten na thim pa zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: ‚ÄúThose who are asleep‚Äù means at the time of destruction, the world dissolves.

original: / de lta bur gyur pa blo ngan pas kun du brtags pa gzhan dag kyang sogs pa smos pas bsdu'o //
analyzed: / de lta bur gyur pa blo ngan pas kun du brtags pa gzhan dag kyang sogs pa smos pas bsdu'o //
translated: And so on includes other such bad ideas.

original: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel las skyes bu brtag pa ste drug pa'o /
analyzed: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel las skyes bu brtag pa ste drug pa'o /
translated: This concludes the examination of the person, the sixth chapter of the Commentary on the Differentiation of the Middle and the Extremes.

original: // / bdag gi bya ba dang bral ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩgzhan dag kyang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa @192b smos te /
analyzed: // / bdag gi bya ba dang bral ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir / gzhan dag kyang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa @192b smos te /
translated: To show that it is devoid of activity,üîΩhe says,üîΩOthers also,

original: gzhan dag kyang ni zhes bya ba ni rigs pa can dang / bye brag pa rnams so //
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang ni zhes bya ba ni rigs pa can dang / bye brag pa rnams so //
translated: Others also refers to the NaiyƒÅyikas and Vai≈õe·π£ikas.

original: de dag ni lus dang dbang po dang blo las tha dad pa'i bdag ces bya ba'i rdzas 'dod pa dang / sdang ba dang 'bad pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / shes pa dang / chos dang / chos ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: de dag ni lus dang dbang po dang blo las tha dad pa'i bdag ces bya ba'i rdzas 'dod pa dang / sdang ba dang 'bad pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / shes pa dang / chos dang / chos ma yin pa dang /
translated: They assert a substance called self that is different from the body, the senses, and the intellect, and they assert that it is the cause of desire, hatred, effort, pleasure, pain, cognition, virtue, vice,

original: 'du byed rnams kyi rten 'du ba'i rgyu sems med pa'i ngo bo mi 'jig pa thams cad du 'gro ba /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyi rten 'du ba'i rgyu sems med pa'i ngo bo mi 'jig pa thams cad du 'gro ba /
translated: and the formation of all conditioned things. It is the cause of their combination, the support of all conditioned things, the cause of their combination, the cause of their union. It is a mindless entity, indestructible, omnipresent,

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las tha dad pa rnams kyi byed pa po de'i 'bras bu 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i za ba por yongs su rtog par byed do //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las tha dad pa rnams kyi byed pa po de'i 'bras bu 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i za ba por yongs su rtog par byed do //
translated: The self is imagined to be the experiencer of the results of those actions, whether desirable or undesirable, that are performed by the self.

original: de lta ma yin te gal te bdag med par 'gyur na de'i tshe shi nas las kyi 'bras bu la longs spyod pa de su yin /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te gal te bdag med par 'gyur na de'i tshe shi nas las kyi 'bras bu la longs spyod pa de su yin /
translated: If that were not so, if there were no self, then who would experience the results of actions after death?

original: gzhan gyis byas pa gzhan longs spyod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas pa gzhan longs spyod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that one person performs actions and another experiences the results.

original: de lta na ni ma byas pa dang phrad pa'i skyon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni ma byas pa dang phrad pa'i skyon du 'gyur te /
translated: If that were so, then one would experience the results of actions that one did not perform.

original: byed pa po ma yin pa nyid 'bras bu dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa po ma yin pa nyid 'bras bu dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is, one who is not the agent would be connected with the results.

original: byas pa chud gson par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: byas pa chud gson par yang 'gyur te /
translated: And one‚Äôs actions would perish.

original: byed pa po 'bras bu dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa po 'bras bu dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is, the agent would not be connected with the results.

original: de ltar 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But that is unacceptable.

original: de lta bas na gdon mi za bar gang kho na byed pa po de kho na za ba por khas blang bar bya ba yin no zhes yongs su rtog par byed do //
analyzed: de lta bas na gdon mi za bar gang kho na byed pa po de kho na za ba por khas blang bar bya ba yin no zhes yongs su rtog par byed do //
translated: Therefore, it is imagined that the self is the experiencer of the results of actions that are performed by the self.

original: des na byed pa po dang za ba po gang yin pa de ni bdag yin no //
analyzed: des na byed pa po dang za ba po gang yin pa de ni bdag yin no //
translated: Therefore, the one who is the agent and the one who is the experiencer is the self.

original: yang gal te 'di sems kyi ngo bo ma yin na de'i phyir ji ltar mi shes pa byed pa por rigs she na /
analyzed: yang gal te 'di sems kyi ngo bo ma yin na de'i phyir ji ltar mi shes pa byed pa por rigs she na /
translated: Moreover, if this self is not the nature of mind, then how could it be logical that the insentient is an agent?

original: sems 'brel phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sems 'brel phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúBecause it is related to mind.‚Äù

original: 'di sems dang 'brel ba'i phyir shes par byed pa yin pas sems yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di sems dang 'brel ba'i phyir shes par byed pa yin pas sems yin gyi /
translated: This self is known to be the agent because it is related to mind.

original: ji ltar ser skya pa skyes bu'i rang gi ngo bo sems can yin no zhes rjod par byed pa ltar sems kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bo ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar ser skya pa skyes bu'i rang gi ngo bo sems can yin no zhes rjod par byed pa ltar sems kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bo ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the nature of mind itself, because it is not the nature of mind itself, as in the case of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya assertion that the nature of the person is the primal substance.

original: 'o na gal te rtag pa 'di nyid ji ltar byed pa po dang zab po ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: 'o na gal te rtag pa 'di nyid ji ltar byed pa po dang zab po ma yin pa'am /
translated: If this self is permanent, then how could it be an agent and an experiencer?

original: ji ltar de'i skye ba'am /
analyzed: ji ltar de'i skye ba'am /
translated: Or how could it be born,

original: 'chi ba'am / gson pa rnam par 'jig ste /üîΩrtag pa dang gcig pu'i ngo bo la ni 'di thams cad rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'chi ba'am / gson pa rnam par 'jig ste / rtag pa dang gcig pu'i ngo bo la ni 'di thams cad rung ba ma yin te /
translated: die, or live?

original: dper na nam mkha' bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' bzhin no zhe na /
translated: None of this is possible for that which is permanent and singular, like space.

original: shes dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: shes dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúConsciousness, effort, desire, and so on are the characteristics of the agent.‚Äù

original: shes pa dang / 'bad pa dang / byed par 'dod pa la sogs pa rnams bdag de la 'du ba ni byed pa po nyid do //
analyzed: shes pa dang / 'bad pa dang / byed par 'dod pa la sogs pa rnams bdag de la 'du ba ni byed pa po nyid do //
translated: Consciousness, effort, desire, and so on are the characteristics of the agent because they are the characteristics of the one who is the agent.üîΩThe characteristics of the experiencer are the experience of pleasure and so on.

original: bde ba la sogs pa nyams su myong ba dang 'du ba ni za ba po nyid do //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa nyams su myong ba dang 'du ba ni za ba po nyid do //
translated: The characteristics of the one who is born are the connection with a special type of existence, a body, sense faculties, mind, and feelings that have not existed previously.üîΩThe connection with a special type of existence is the connection with a particular type of existence, such as a god, human, and so on.

original: ris mthun pa khyad par can dang / lus dang / dbang @193a * //
analyzed: ris mthun pa khyad par can dang / lus dang / dbang @193a * //
translated: The connection with a body is the connection with a body that is not a mere collection of elements, but is a body that is a special type of entity.üîΩThe connection with sense faculties is the connection with the five faculties of eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body.üîΩThe connection with mind is the connection with the mental faculty.üîΩThe connection with feelings is the connection with the feelings of pleasure, pain, and neither pleasure nor pain.

original: po dang / blo dang / tshor ba snga na med pa dag dang 'brel pa ni /üîΩbdag de'i skye ba yin par brjod do //
analyzed: po dang / blo dang / tshor ba snga na med pa dag dang 'brel pa ni / bdag de'i skye ba yin par brjod do //
translated: The connection with feelings is the connection with the feelings of pleasure, pain, and neither pleasure nor pain.

original: ris mthun pa ni lha dang mi la sogs pa'i bye brag go //üîΩtsher ba dag dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ris mthun pa ni lha dang mi la sogs pa'i bye brag go // tsher ba dag dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The connection with a body is the connection with a body that is not a mere collection of elements, but is a body that is a special type of entity.

original: dang gi sgras lus dang dbang po dag sdud par byed do //
analyzed: dang gi sgras lus dang dbang po dag sdud par byed do //
translated: The connection with sense faculties is the connection with the five faculties of eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body.üîΩThe connection with mind is the connection with the mental faculty.üîΩThe connection with feelings is the connection with the feelings of pleasure, pain, and neither pleasure nor pain.üîΩThe connection with feelings is the connection with the feelings of pleasure, pain, and neither pleasure nor pain.

original: de la lus dang dbang po dang yang dag par ldan pa'i mtshan nyid ni de'i 'brel pa'o //üîΩblo dang tshor ba dag ni 'du ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de la lus dang dbang po dang yang dag par ldan pa'i mtshan nyid ni de'i 'brel pa'o // blo dang tshor ba dag ni 'du ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The connection with a body is the connection with a body that is not a mere collection of elements, but is a body that is a special type of entity.üîΩThe connection with sense faculties is the connection with the five faculties of eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body.üîΩThe connection with mind is the connection with the mental faculty.üîΩThe connection with feelings is the connection with the feelings of pleasure, pain, and neither pleasure nor pain.

original: ji ltar ldan pa dang ldan zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar ldan pa dang ldan zhe na /
translated: The connection with feelings is the connection with the feelings of pleasure, pain, and neither pleasure nor pain.üîΩThe connection with a body is the connection with a body that is not a mere collection of elements, but is a body that is a special type of entity.

original: de la yang ldan pa dang ldan pa yod do //üîΩde'i ma mthong bas mngon par 'dus byas pa'i rna ba'i bu ga ni bdag dang ldan la /
analyzed: de la yang ldan pa dang ldan pa yod do // de'i ma mthong bas mngon par 'dus byas pa'i rna ba'i bu ga ni bdag dang ldan la /
translated: And it is also endowed with the ear, which is not seen.üîΩThe ear-cavity, which is formed by the action of the self,

original: de dang yang nam mkha'i bdag nyid kyi rna ba dang ldan no //üîΩsngar thob pa ste /
analyzed: de dang yang nam mkha'i bdag nyid kyi rna ba dang ldan no // sngar thob pa ste /
translated: is endowed with the ear, which is of the nature of space.

original: sngon nye bar blangs pa'i lus dang / dbang po dang / blo dang / tshor ba rnams dang bral ba ni 'di'i 'chi bar brjod do //
analyzed: sngon nye bar blangs pa'i lus dang / dbang po dang / blo dang / tshor ba rnams dang bral ba ni 'di'i 'chi bar brjod do //
translated: The self is said to die when it is separated from the body, the senses, the intellect, and the feelings that it previously appropriated.

original: de'i gson pa ni lus dang bcas pa chos dang chos ma yin pa la ltos pa'i yid dang ldan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gson pa ni lus dang bcas pa chos dang chos ma yin pa la ltos pa'i yid dang ldan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Its life is the mind that is associated with the body and that depends on virtue and vice.

original: 'tshe ba ni lus dang mig la sogs pa la gnod pa'i phyir bdag 'di la 'tshe bar rtog ste brjod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'tshe ba ni lus dang mig la sogs pa la gnod pa'i phyir bdag 'di la 'tshe bar rtog ste brjod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Injury is the harm to the body, the eyes, etc. The self is thought to be injured by that, and is said to be injured.

original: de bzhin du yang 'bras bu'i rten dang byed pa po la gnod pa ni 'tshe ba yin no zhes bya ba ni mdo yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang 'bras bu'i rten dang byed pa po la gnod pa ni 'tshe ba yin no zhes bya ba ni mdo yin no //
translated: The S≈´tra says the same thing: ‚ÄúInjury is the harm to the basis of the result and to the agent.‚Äù

original: 'bras bu'i rten ni lus te /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rten ni lus te /
translated: The body is the basis of the result,

original: bde ba la sogs pa 'bras bu'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa 'bras bu'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro//
translated: because pleasure and so on are the basis of the result.

original: byed pa po ni dbang po yin te /
analyzed: byed pa po ni dbang po yin te /
translated: The agent is the sense faculty,

original: yul dmigs pa'i byed pa po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul dmigs pa'i byed pa po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the agent that observes the object.

original: yang ji ltar bdag 'di yod pa nyid du shes par bya ba zhes bya ba 'di la /üîΩre zhig rna ma phug pa tshad ma byed pa ni bdag cag gi yod pa la sogs par khyad par med pa'i yul dang / yul ma yin pa'i shes bya'i yul can bdag gi mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang / nye bar 'jal ba dang /
analyzed: yang ji ltar bdag 'di yod pa nyid du shes par bya ba zhes bya ba 'di la / re zhig rna ma phug pa tshad ma byed pa ni bdag cag gi yod pa la sogs par khyad par med pa'i yul dang / yul ma yin pa'i shes bya'i yul can bdag gi mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang / nye bar 'jal ba dang /
translated: Now, how is this self known to exist?üîΩIn this regard, the non-Buddhist proponents of a self, such as the ·πö·π£is, the LokƒÅyatas, and so on, assert that the self is known to exist by means of the five valid means of knowledge: direct perception, inference, analogy, testimony, and logical possibility.

original: sgra dang / dran pa dang / ngo shes pa dang / grub pas mthong ba dang / gtsug lag dang / the tshom dang / phyin ci log dang / ma nges pa dang / rmi lam dang / rmi lam gyi mtha'i shes rab kyi khyad par rnams ni bdag gi lus la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i rig par byed pas rig par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: sgra dang / dran pa dang / ngo shes pa dang / grub pas mthong ba dang / gtsug lag dang / the tshom dang / phyin ci log dang / ma nges pa dang / rmi lam dang / rmi lam gyi mtha'i shes rab kyi khyad par rnams ni bdag gi lus la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i rig par byed pas rig par bya ba yin te /
translated: They assert that the self is known to exist by means of these five valid means of knowledge that are different from the body and so on, because they are the means of knowing the self.

original: rang gi rgyu la rag las pa dang / skye ba dang ldan pa dang / spyi dang khyad par dang ldan pa dang / rtogs pa'i bdag nyid dang / shin tu myur ba dang / 'jig pa nyid dang / 'dus byas skyed par byed pa nyid dang /
analyzed: rang gi rgyu la rag las pa dang / skye ba dang ldan pa dang / spyi dang khyad par dang ldan pa dang / rtogs pa'i bdag nyid dang / shin tu myur ba dang / 'jig pa nyid dang / 'dus byas skyed par byed pa nyid dang /
translated: because it depends on its own cause, because it possesses arising, because it possesses universals and particulars, because it is the nature of an object of knowledge, because it is very swift, because it is perishable, because it is the producer of conditioned states,

original: shes pa @193b nyid yin pa dag gi phyir skyes bu gzhan gyi shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: shes pa @193b nyid yin pa dag gi phyir skyes bu gzhan gyi shes pa bzhin no //
translated: and because it is consciousness, like the consciousness of another person.

original: chos mi mthun pas ni zhig pa'i bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pas ni zhig pa'i bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The dissimilar reason is like a destroyed pot, etc.

original: de la yod pa la sogs par khyad par med pa ni sngar bshad pa drug go //
analyzed: de la yod pa la sogs par khyad par med pa ni sngar bshad pa drug go //
translated: Among these, the six that are explained earlier are the non-difference of existence, etc.

original: yod pa la sogs pa drug po da dag gi yul ni rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las rnams so //
analyzed: yod pa la sogs pa drug po da dag gi yul ni rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las rnams so //
translated: The objects of the six, existence, etc., are substance, quality, and action.

original: yul ma yin pa ni spyi dang / khyad par dang / 'du ba rnams so //
analyzed: yul ma yin pa ni spyi dang / khyad par dang / 'du ba rnams so //
translated: The non-objects are universals, particulars, and inherence.

original: de gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyi shes bya'i yul can mngon sum la sogs pa'i shes rab kyi khyad par gang dag la yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyi shes bya'i yul can mngon sum la sogs pa'i shes rab kyi khyad par gang dag la yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Those who have the special insight of direct perception and so on, which is the subject that has the object of knowledge as its nature, are called ‚Äúthose who have the insight of direct perception and so on.‚Äù

original: mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / nye bar 'jal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni zlas dbye bar bstan to //
analyzed: mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / nye bar 'jal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni zlas dbye bar bstan to //
translated: Direct perception, inference, and analogy are taught as a contrast.

original: grub pas mthong ba ni gang skar ma shes pa'i bstan bcos la sogs pa ston pa ste /
analyzed: grub pas mthong ba ni gang skar ma shes pa'i bstan bcos la sogs pa ston pa ste /
translated: The insight of the accomplished is the teaching of the treatises on astronomy and so on.

original: de ni grub pa rnams kyi mthong ba'am /
analyzed: de ni grub pa rnams kyi mthong ba'am /
translated: That is the insight of the accomplished,

original: mthong ba grub pa yin pas grub pa mthong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mthong ba grub pa yin pas grub pa mthong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: or the insight of the accomplished, so it is called the insight of the accomplished.

original: gtsug lag ni spobs pa'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: gtsug lag ni spobs pa'i shes pa ste /
translated: The scriptures are the knowledge of eloquence.
