original: dper na sngar bdag gi spun zla'i ngo shes zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sngar bdag gi spun zla'i ngo shes zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, like the saying ‚ÄúI know my brother‚Äôs face.‚Äù

original: de yang phal cher drang srong rnams las 'byung bas gtsug lag ces bya'o //
analyzed: de yang phal cher drang srong rnams las 'byung bas gtsug lag ces bya'o //
translated: And since that also mostly comes from the sages, it is called the scriptures.

original: the tshom ni yid gnyis so //
analyzed: the tshom ni yid gnyis so //
translated: Doubt is having two minds.

original: phyin ci log ni bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log ni bzlog pa'o //
translated: Mistaken is the opposite.

original: ma nges pa ni yul ma nges pa'o //
analyzed: ma nges pa ni yul ma nges pa'o //
translated: Uncertain is the uncertain object.

original: dang po rmi lam gyi gnas skabs su byung ba'i shes pa ni rmi lam mo //
analyzed: dang po rmi lam gyi gnas skabs su byung ba'i shes pa ni rmi lam mo //
translated: First, the consciousness that occurs in the dream state is the dream.

original: rmi lam gyi mtha' ni de'i yul la rmi lam na yang shes pa gzhan 'byung ba gang yin pa de yin te /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi mtha' ni de'i yul la rmi lam na yang shes pa gzhan 'byung ba gang yin pa de yin te /
translated: The end of the dream is that which occurs when another consciousness arises in the dream state with respect to the object of the dream.

original: shes rab kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi khyad par ro //
translated: This is the difference in wisdom.

original: lhag ma ni go bla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go bla'o //
translated: The rest is easily understood.

original: tshad ma de don gyis bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshad ma de don gyis bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the meaning of that valid knowledge, he says:

original: bdag gi zhes bya ba'i shes pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bdag gi zhes bya ba'i shes pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe consciousness that is mine‚Äù and so on.

original: lus la sogs pa zhes bya ba 'di la sogs kyi sgras blo dang / dbang po dang / tshor ba rnams gzung ngo //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa zhes bya ba 'di la sogs kyi sgras blo dang / dbang po dang / tshor ba rnams gzung ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbody and so on‚Äù includes the mind, the sense faculties, and the feelings.

original: shes phyir zhes bya ba ni mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: shes phyir zhes bya ba ni mtshon pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of knowledge‚Äù is an illustration.

original: rgyu la rag las pa dang / skye ba dang ldan pa la sogs pa de las kyang gzhan pa dag kyang gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu la rag las pa dang / skye ba dang ldan pa la sogs pa de las kyang gzhan pa dag kyang gzung bar bya'o //
translated: One should also include that which is dependent on a cause, that which possesses arising, and so on.

original: bde byed bdag po yang tshad ma rnam pa gzhan du byed de /
analyzed: bde byed bdag po yang tshad ma rnam pa gzhan du byed de /
translated: BhƒÅviveka also treats the self as a valid knowledge in a different way.

original: 'dod pa la sogs pa ni 'ga' zhig la brten pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa la sogs pa ni 'ga' zhig la brten pa yin te /
translated: He says that desire and so on are based on something.

original: dngos po yod pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dngos po yod pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ste /
translated: because it is the effect of an existent thing, like form, etc.

original: de ston pa ni 'dod pa la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //üîΩdngos po smos pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas dngos po yod pa'i zhes bya ba'i khyad par 'bras bu dang bcas par ston par byed do //
analyzed: de ston pa ni 'dod pa la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // dngos po smos pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas dngos po yod pa'i zhes bya ba'i khyad par 'bras bu dang bcas par ston par byed do //
translated: The demonstration of that is ‚Äúdesire, etc.‚Äù

original: gsal byed pas tshad ma @194a * //
analyzed: gsal byed pas tshad ma @194a * //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause of the mention of an existent thing‚Äù and so on demonstrates the qualification ‚Äúof an existent thing‚Äù as having an effect.

original: sbyor ba ni lha spyin gyi gzugs dang / ro dang / dri dang / reg pa'i shes pa rnams ni gcig dang du ma rgyu mtshan can te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni lha spyin gyi gzugs dang / ro dang / dri dang / reg pa'i shes pa rnams ni gcig dang du ma rgyu mtshan can te /
translated: The application of the proof is as follows: The cognitions of form, taste, smell, and touch of Devadatta are based on a plurality of causes,

original: bdag gis zhes bya ba'i shes pas mtshams sbyor bar byed pa'i phyir dang / brda byas pa rnams gar mkhan gyi smin ma bskyod pa la cig car skyes bu du ma'i shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bdag gis zhes bya ba'i shes pas mtshams sbyor bar byed pa'i phyir dang / brda byas pa rnams gar mkhan gyi smin ma bskyod pa la cig car skyes bu du ma'i shes pa bzhin no //
translated: because they are connected by the cognition ‚ÄúI,‚Äù and because, like the cognition of many people simultaneously with respect to the movement of the eyebrows of an actor, they are connected by convention.

original: 'di'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

original: dper na gar mkhan smin ma bskyod ma thag tu kho bo cag gis gos 'phang par bya'o zhes bya ba de lta bu brdar byas pa mang po rnams kyi byed pa po du ma shes pa du mar gyur pa'i rgyu mtshan ni smin ma bskyod pa gcig yinüîΩpa'i phyir bdag gis mthong ngo //
analyzed: dper na gar mkhan smin ma bskyod ma thag tu kho bo cag gis gos 'phang par bya'o zhes bya ba de lta bu brdar byas pa mang po rnams kyi byed pa po du ma shes pa du mar gyur pa'i rgyu mtshan ni smin ma bskyod pa gcig yin pa'i phyir bdag gis mthong ngo //
translated: The cause of many cognitions is a single gesture.

original: bdag gis mthong ngo zhes mtshams sbyor bar byed do ;
analyzed: bdag gis mthong ngo zhes mtshams sbyor bar byed do ;
translated: ‚ÄúI see,‚Äù ‚ÄúI hear,‚Äù and so on are connected to a single cognition.

original: / de bzhin du 'di la yang sna tshogs pa'i yul can gyi shes pa'i rgyu mtshan gcig nyid kyi phyir mtshams sbyor ba yin te /
analyzed: / de bzhin du 'di la yang sna tshogs pa'i yul can gyi shes pa'i rgyu mtshan gcig nyid kyi phyir mtshams sbyor ba yin te /
translated: In the same way, in this world, a single cause of a cognition that has various objects is connected to ‚ÄúI see,‚Äù ‚ÄúI hear,‚Äù and so on.

original: rgyu mtshan gcig po gang yin pa de ni bdag ces bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gcig po gang yin pa de ni bdag ces bya'o //
translated: That single cause is called the self.

original: dang por mtshams sbyor ba ngas mthong ngo //
analyzed: dang por mtshams sbyor ba ngas mthong ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúI see‚Äù is connected to the first moment of seeing.üîΩ‚ÄúI hear‚Äù is connected to the first moment of hearing.

original: ngas thos so zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams shes pa gcig gi rgyu mtshan gyis byas pa yin la /
analyzed: ngas thos so zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams shes pa gcig gi rgyu mtshan gyis byas pa yin la /
translated: ‚ÄúI smell,‚Äù ‚ÄúI taste,‚Äù and ‚ÄúI touch‚Äù are connected to the first moment of each.

original: gar mkhan gyi smin ma bskyod pa ni shes pa rnams yul gcig pa nyid du bstan pa ni mtshams sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: gar mkhan gyi smin ma bskyod pa ni shes pa rnams yul gcig pa nyid du bstan pa ni mtshams sbyor ba yin no //
translated: The movement of the eyebrow of the dancer indicates the connection of the cognitions to a single object.

original: rnam pa thams cad du don gcig rgyu mtshan du byas pa gang yin pa shes pa rnams kyi 'brel pa ni mtshams sbyor ba zhes brjod do //üîΩtshad ma de 'di nyid kyis bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du don gcig rgyu mtshan du byas pa gang yin pa shes pa rnams kyi 'brel pa ni mtshams sbyor ba zhes brjod do // tshad ma de 'di nyid kyis bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The connection of the cognitions that have a single object as their ground is called their connection.üîΩIn order to demonstrate that very means of valid knowledge, he says:

original: gzugs sogs shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzugs sogs shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The cognition of form, etc.

original: go bar sla'o //
analyzed: go bar sla'o //
translated: is easy to understand.

original: 'di ni de'i sbyor ba gzhan yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni de'i sbyor ba gzhan yin te /
translated: This is another application of that:

original: bdag go zhes bya ba'i tshig ni lus dang / dbang po dang / yid dang / blo dang / tshor ba'i tshogs las ma gtogs pa rjod par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag go zhes bya ba'i tshig ni lus dang / dbang po dang / yid dang / blo dang / tshor ba'i tshogs las ma gtogs pa rjod par byed pa yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äúself‚Äù is used to refer to a collection of body, sense faculties, mind, intellect, and feelings.

original: rnam grangs nges pa las tha dad pa nyid yin pa na gcig gi tshig yin pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa'i sgra bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam grangs nges pa las tha dad pa nyid yin pa na gcig gi tshig yin pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa'i sgra bzhin no //
translated: Since it is different from the ascertainment of synonyms, it is a word for a single thing, like the word ‚Äúpot,‚Äù etc.

original: de 'chad pa ni 'di ltar bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de 'chad pa ni 'di ltar bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The explanation of that is as follows:

original: rnam grangs nges las tha dad na //
analyzed: rnam grangs nges las tha dad na //
translated: If it were different from the ascertainment of the categories,

original: zhes bya ba ni blo dang dbang po la sogs pa rnam grangs grub pa'i blo la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag las tha dad pa yin pa na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni blo dang dbang po la sogs pa rnam grangs grub pa'i blo la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag las tha dad pa yin pa na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the meaning is that it would be different from the ascertainment of the categories such as cognition, sense faculty, and so on.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i chos kyis ni //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i chos kyis ni //
translated: By the teaching as stated,

original: zhes bya ba ni blo la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i don brjod pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni blo la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i don brjod pa nyid kyis so //
translated: the meaning is that by the very expression of the object different from cognition and so on.

original: gang yang de ltar yongs nges pa //
analyzed: gang yang de ltar yongs nges pa //
translated: And that which is thus ascertained,

original: zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs nges pa las tha dad pa'i gcig gi tshig nyid kyis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs nges pa las tha dad pa'i gcig gi tshig nyid kyis so //
translated: the meaning is that by the very expression of the oneness different from the ascertainment of the categories.

original: yang de nyid ldog pa'i sgo nas bdag @194b grub par bya ba'i phyir gtan tshigs sbyor bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: yang de nyid ldog pa'i sgo nas bdag @194b grub par bya ba'i phyir gtan tshigs sbyor bar byed pa ni /
translated: Again, in order to establish the self by way of negation, he formulates a syllogism:

original: gson pa'i lus 'di ni bdag med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gson pa'i lus 'di ni bdag med pa ma yin te /
translated: This living body is not without a self,

original: srog la sogs pa dang mi ldan par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa dang mi ldan par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because it follows that it is devoid of life and so on, like a pot and so on.

original: de ston par byed pa ni /
analyzed: de ston par byed pa ni /
translated: And that is taught:

original: gson po yin ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gson po yin ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is alive‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di la bdag med ces bya ba ni gson po'i lus 'di la'am /
analyzed: 'di la bdag med ces bya ba ni gson po'i lus 'di la'am /
translated: Here, ‚Äúit is without self‚Äù means that this living body is without self,

original: yang na bdag 'di la bdag med pa dang rang bzhin med pa med kyi /
analyzed: yang na bdag 'di la bdag med pa dang rang bzhin med pa med kyi /
translated: or that this self is without self, without intrinsic nature.

original: 'on kyang yod par grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'on kyang yod par grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: But it is established as existing.

original: ci ste rtag pa nyid dang khyab bdag nyid du ji ltar rtogs par bya zhes bya ba 'di la /
analyzed: ci ste rtag pa nyid dang khyab bdag nyid du ji ltar rtogs par bya zhes bya ba 'di la /
translated: If one asks, ‚ÄúHow is it to be understood as permanent and all-pervading?‚Äù

original: re zhig rnam phug pa tshad ma ston pa ni /
analyzed: re zhig rnam phug pa tshad ma ston pa ni /
translated: First, the proof of the valid cognition of the self:

original: de ma yin pa'i dus su nga'i rab tu shes pa ni /
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i dus su nga'i rab tu shes pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúMy cognition at that time‚Äù

original: ma'i lto nas byung ma thag pa'i dus kyi bdag gi dang po'i rig par byed pa'i rab tu shes pa dag gis rig par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: ma'i lto nas byung ma thag pa'i dus kyi bdag gi dang po'i rig par byed pa'i rab tu shes pa dag gis rig par bya ba yin te /
translated: is to be known by the cognition of my first awareness immediately after emerging from my mother‚Äôs womb,

original: nga'i rab tu shes pa yin pa'i phyir bdag gi dang po'i rab tu shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: nga'i rab tu shes pa yin pa'i phyir bdag gi dang po'i rab tu shes pa bzhin no //
translated: because it is my cognition, like my first cognition.

original: de bzhin du sdug bsngal la sogs pa yang phyogs su bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sdug bsngal la sogs pa yang phyogs su bya'o //
translated: Suffering and so on should be treated in the same way.

original: 'di yang rtag pa nyid du rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yang rtag pa nyid du rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: This is an inference of permanence.

original: da 'di nyid ston par byed pa ni /
analyzed: da 'di nyid ston par byed pa ni /
translated: Now, this is taught:

original: shes pa phyi ma thams cad ni //
analyzed: shes pa phyi ma thams cad ni //
translated: All subsequent cognitions

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: are like the first.

original: de dang po bzhin zhes bya ba ni dus phyis byung ba'i shes pa de'i dang po ni de'i dang po'o //
analyzed: de dang po bzhin zhes bya ba ni dus phyis byung ba'i shes pa de'i dang po ni de'i dang po'o //
translated: The first of that is the first of that which arises later.

original: de nyid kyi khyab pa nyid bsgrub pa'i phyir tshad ma ston pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid kyi khyab pa nyid bsgrub pa'i phyir tshad ma ston pa ni /
translated: In order to establish just that pervasion, the proof is taught:

original: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / yid log par rtogs pa'i yul du gyur pa'i ches ring du gnas pa rnams ni nga'i bdag dang lhan cig 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / yid log par rtogs pa'i yul du gyur pa'i ches ring du gnas pa rnams ni nga'i bdag dang lhan cig 'brel pa yin te /
translated: Earth, water, fire, and mind, which are the objects of wrong cognition, are related to my self,

original: lus can nyid dang / shugs dang ldan pa dang / gzhan nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa nyid dang / phan tshun yang dag par sbyor ba dang / rnam par dbye ba dang ldan pa dag gi phyir nga'i lus po bzhin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus can nyid dang / shugs dang ldan pa dang / gzhan nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa nyid dang / phan tshun yang dag par sbyor ba dang / rnam par dbye ba dang ldan pa dag gi phyir nga'i lus po bzhin no zhes bya'o //
translated: because of being embodied, because of having force, because of being different, because of not being different, because of being connected with each other, and because of being separable, like my body.üîΩThat is taught:

original: de ston pa ni yul thag ring por 'jug pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ston pa ni yul thag ring por 'jug pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The object of a cognition that engages a distant object is not different from the object of a cognition that engages a near object, because of being a cognition, like the cognition of the near object.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas mjug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas mjug sdud pa'o //
translated: The summary is stated by ‚ÄúThus,‚Äù and so on.

original: de'i phyir re zhig ces bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir re zhig ces bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed do //
translated: The response is stated by ‚ÄúTherefore,‚Äù and so on.

original: sgrub byed dang po zhes bya ba ni nga'i zhes bya ba'i shes pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa de la grub pa la sgrub pa nyid de /üîΩkhyed cag gi shes pa rnams kho bo cag gis khyed kyi lus la sogs pa las tha dad pa thams cad mkhyen pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa dang / de las @195a * //
analyzed: sgrub byed dang po zhes bya ba ni nga'i zhes bya ba'i shes pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa de la grub pa la sgrub pa nyid de / khyed cag gi shes pa rnams kho bo cag gis khyed kyi lus la sogs pa las tha dad pa thams cad mkhyen pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa dang / de las @195a * //
translated: The first proof is stated by ‚ÄúThe cognition ‚Äòmine,‚Äô‚Äù and so on. There is no proof of that.

original: gzhan pha rol gyi sems shes pa rnams kyis nyams su myong bar khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan pha rol gyi sems shes pa rnams kyis nyams su myong bar khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because you accept that your cognitions are experienced by omniscient consciousnesses, ≈õrƒÅvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and so on, which are different from your bodies and so on, and by other consciousnesses of others.üîΩThe example of similarity, ‚Äúlike the consciousness of another person,‚Äù that you state is devoid of the probandum.

original: gang yang skyes bu gzhan gyi shes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i chos mthun pa'i dpe de bsgrub par bya ba dang bral ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang yang skyes bu gzhan gyi shes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i chos mthun pa'i dpe de bsgrub par bya ba dang bral ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says:

original: gsal bar byed pa ltos med par /
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa ltos med par /
translated: The illuminator is independent.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: This is what is meant by the above passage.

original: gang gi phyir skyes bu gzhan dang 'brel ba'i shes pa yang gsal bar byed pa gzhan la mi ltos par rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid du skye ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir skyes bu gzhan dang 'brel ba'i shes pa yang gsal bar byed pa gzhan la mi ltos par rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid du skye ste /
translated: Because the consciousness that is related to another person arises as the very essence of reflexive awareness, without depending on another illuminator.

original: des ni lus la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i rig par byed pas rig par bya ba nyid kyi bsgrub byas dpe 'di stong pa nyid yin no /
analyzed: des ni lus la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i rig par byed pas rig par bya ba nyid kyi bsgrub byas dpe 'di stong pa nyid yin no /
translated: Since it is the illuminator that is distinct from the body and so on, the example that proves the object of illumination is empty.

original: ci ste yang gzhan dag gis sems tsam dper brjod par mi 'dod mod kyi /
analyzed: ci ste yang gzhan dag gis sems tsam dper brjod par mi 'dod mod kyi /
translated: Now, although others do not wish to cite mind only as an example,

original: 'on kyang yul la sogs pa'i shes pa gang las yongs su 'dzin pa'i shes pa de'i rnam pa skye ba de 'dir dper brjod par 'dod do snyam na /üîΩde yi rnam par nyer bsgyur bas //
analyzed: 'on kyang yul la sogs pa'i shes pa gang las yongs su 'dzin pa'i shes pa de'i rnam pa skye ba de 'dir dper brjod par 'dod do snyam na / de yi rnam par nyer bsgyur bas //
translated: they may think that they wish to cite as an example the consciousness that apprehends the object and so on, from which the consciousness that apprehends arises.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to that, the text says, ‚ÄúThe transformation of that into the aspect of that object,‚Äù and so on.

original: de lta na yang gang rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis shes pa rig par byed pa'i shes pa gzhan dang bral ba skye la /
analyzed: de lta na yang gang rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis shes pa rig par byed pa'i shes pa gzhan dang bral ba skye la /
translated: Even so, the consciousness that is aware of itself by its very essence arises free from another consciousness that illuminates it.

original: des na the tshom du 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na the tshom du 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, there is doubt.

original: gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩci ste de yang rang las tha dad pa'i rig par byed pas rig par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // ci ste de yang rang las tha dad pa'i rig par byed pas rig par bya ba yin te /
translated: The reason is inconclusive.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos dang ldan pa nyid dang / gzhal bya nyid dang / dran par bya ba yin pa'i phyir yul bzhin no zhes bya bar 'dod na de'i phyir 'di la yang bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa la gnod par byed pa med pa'i phyir bzlog pa ma nges so //üîΩshes pa phyi ma phyi mas nyams su myong na yang thug pa med do //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos dang ldan pa nyid dang / gzhal bya nyid dang / dran par bya ba yin pa'i phyir yul bzhin no zhes bya bar 'dod na de'i phyir 'di la yang bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa la gnod par byed pa med pa'i phyir bzlog pa ma nges so // shes pa phyi ma phyi mas nyams su myong na yang thug pa med do //
translated: But if you maintain that it is an object of awareness because it is different from itself, like the object of awareness that is possessed of the attributes of origination and destruction, that is to be cognized, and that is to be remembered, then the reversal of the proposition is not established because there is no refutation of the reversal of the proposition.üîΩAnd if the latter awareness experiences the former, there is an infinite regress.

original: gsal ba mi gsal ba can ni yul du mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: gsal ba mi gsal ba can ni yul du mi 'grub ste /
translated: But if the latter awareness is not experienced by another awareness, then the former awareness is not experienced.üîΩAnd if the latter awareness is experienced by the former awareness, then there is mutual dependence.

original: de'i phyir yul gcig bsgrub pa'i phyir shes pa'i rgyud pa khas blangs na skyes bu'i tshe mtha' dag dgos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir yul gcig bsgrub pa'i phyir shes pa'i rgyud pa khas blangs na skyes bu'i tshe mtha' dag dgos so //
translated: Therefore, if you accept a continuum of awareness in order to establish a single object, then the entire life of a person is necessary.

original: ci ste yang thug pa med pas 'jig pas shes pa cung zad cig rang rig pa'i ngo bor skye'o zhes bya bar 'dod na /
analyzed: ci ste yang thug pa med pas 'jig pas shes pa cung zad cig rang rig pa'i ngo bor skye'o zhes bya bar 'dod na /
translated: But if you maintain that a little consciousness arises in the nature of reflexive awareness because of the absence of an infinite regress,

original: de'i tshe de dag nyid kyi skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs rnams ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe de dag nyid kyi skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs rnams ma nges pa yin no //
translated: then the reasonings such as ‚Äúbecause they possess the qualities of arising and disintegration‚Äù are not established.

original: de bzhin du shes pa gzhan dag la yang rang rig pa nyid khas lan pa la sdang du ci yod /
analyzed: de bzhin du shes pa gzhan dag la yang rang rig pa nyid khas lan pa la sdang du ci yod /
translated: So what is the point of rejecting reflexive awareness in other instances of consciousness?

original: ci ste yang de ni rig pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'dod na /
analyzed: ci ste yang de ni rig pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'dod na /
translated: But if you maintain that it is not by nature awareness,

original: de lta na yang ma grub pa na shes pa snga ma @195b snga ma thams cad la sgrub ste /
analyzed: de lta na yang ma grub pa na shes pa snga ma @195b snga ma thams cad la sgrub ste /
translated: then, since it is not established, it is established in all previous instances of consciousness.

original: gsal ba mi gsal ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba mi gsal ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the possessor of the unclear.

original: de lta yin dang yul yang 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang yul yang 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, objects would not be established.

original: rnam par shes par smra ba gang dag shes pa thams cad ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i phyir rang nyid gsal ba yin gyi /
analyzed: rnam par shes par smra ba gang dag shes pa thams cad ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i phyir rang nyid gsal ba yin gyi /
translated: The proponents of consciousness say that all consciousnesses are themselves clear because they are free from the apprehended and apprehender.

original: shes pa gzhan gyis rtogs par bya ba ni ma yin no zhes 'dod pa de la bsgrub par bya ba ma tshang pa'i nyes pa g-yo ba med pa nyid do //
analyzed: shes pa gzhan gyis rtogs par bya ba ni ma yin no zhes 'dod pa de la bsgrub par bya ba ma tshang pa'i nyes pa g-yo ba med pa nyid do //
translated: In this case, the fault of the incompleteness of the probandum is that it is unmoving.

original: da bzhin du rgyu la rag las pa dang / skye ba dang ldan pa la sogs pa'i sgrub par byad pa gzhan dag la yang grub pa la sgrub pa la sogs pa'i skyon brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: da bzhin du rgyu la rag las pa dang / skye ba dang ldan pa la sogs pa'i sgrub par byad pa gzhan dag la yang grub pa la sgrub pa la sogs pa'i skyon brjod par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, in the case of other proofs, such as ‚Äúdependent on a cause‚Äù and ‚Äúpossessing arising,‚Äù the fault of proving what is already established should be stated.

original: gang yang yod pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa chos can khyad par du byas pa de yang snga ma bzhin du don med pa yin no //
analyzed: gang yang yod pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa chos can khyad par du byas pa de yang snga ma bzhin du don med pa yin no //
translated: And that which is qualified as the subject, such as ‚Äúexisting,‚Äù etc., is also meaningless, as before.

original: 'di yang skabs su bab pa'i bsgrub bya sgrub pa la yan lag ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang skabs su bab pa'i bsgrub bya sgrub pa la yan lag ma yin te /
translated: And this is not a part of the proof of the probandum that is at issue.

original: 'di ltar nga'i mngon sum la sogs pa'i shes pa ni nga'i lus la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i rig par byed pas rig par bya ba yin te zhes bya ba 'di cam zhig gis ci zhig ma rtogs /
analyzed: 'di ltar nga'i mngon sum la sogs pa'i shes pa ni nga'i lus la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i rig par byed pas rig par bya ba yin te zhes bya ba 'di cam zhig gis ci zhig ma rtogs /
translated: Thus, what is not understood by just this much: ‚ÄúMy cognition such as perception is to be known by a knower that is different from my body, etc.‚Äù?

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye bas chos can rab tu dbye ba yang don med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye bas chos can rab tu dbye ba yang don med pa nyid yin te /
translated: The classification of the subject by way of the divisions of direct perception, inference, and so on is also meaningless,

original: nga'i shes pa zhes bya ba de tsam zhig kho nas rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nga'i shes pa zhes bya ba de tsam zhig kho nas rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is understood merely by saying ‚Äúmy consciousness.‚Äù

original: ji skad bshad pa'i khyad par gyis khyad par du byas pa'i chos can phyir rgol bdag lam grub pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs rnams gzhi ma grub pa kho na'o //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i khyad par gyis khyad par du byas pa'i chos can phyir rgol bdag lam grub pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs rnams gzhi ma grub pa kho na'o //
translated: Since the subject qualified by the distinctions explained above is established for the opponent himself, the reasons are simply not established bases.

original: ci ste yang 'bras bu med pa'i khyad par blangs nas /
analyzed: ci ste yang 'bras bu med pa'i khyad par blangs nas /
translated: But if, accepting a distinction that has no result,

original: de bsgrub pa'i don du sgrub byed gzhan nyid brjod pa de lta yin na /
analyzed: de bsgrub pa'i don du sgrub byed gzhan nyid brjod pa de lta yin na /
translated: you state another proof in order to establish that,

original: skabs kyi don las skabs ma yin pa ma 'brel pa'i don can don gzhan ni tshar gcad pa'i gnas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skabs kyi don las skabs ma yin pa ma 'brel pa'i don can don gzhan ni tshar gcad pa'i gnas su 'gyur ro //
translated: then, since the meaning of the other is irrelevant to the context, you will be subject to defeat.

original: gang yang 'dod pa la sogs pa //
analyzed: gang yang 'dod pa la sogs pa //
translated: And also, with regard to what you said, ‚ÄúDesire and so on,‚ÄùüîΩand so forth,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de la /
translated: we reply:

original: 'di ltar 'dod pa la sogs pa //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod pa la sogs pa //
translated: Desire and so on

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The root text says:

original: de la 'dod pa la sogs pa'i rten rgyu tsam zhig sgrub na /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa la sogs pa'i rten rgyu tsam zhig sgrub na /
translated: If you prove that the basis of desire and so on is merely a cause,

original: de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub ste /
translated: then you prove what is already established for us.

original: kho bo cag 'dod pa la sogs pa rgyu med par ni mi 'dod de /üîΩgzhi yi sems dang sems byung rnams //
analyzed: kho bo cag 'dod pa la sogs pa rgyu med par ni mi 'dod de / gzhi yi sems dang sems byung rnams //
translated: We do not assert that desire and so on are without a cause.üîΩBecause it is explained that the basis is the mind and mental factors.

original: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //üîΩyongs su rtog na ni zhes bya ba ni smra bar byed na zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩci ste gzhi'i mtshan nyid kyi rten sgrub na de'i tshe dam bcas pa'i don rjes su @196a * //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro // yongs su rtog na ni zhes bya ba ni smra bar byed na zhes bya ba'i don to // ci ste gzhi'i mtshan nyid kyi rten sgrub na de'i tshe dam bcas pa'i don rjes su @196a * //
translated: If you imagine that the basis is the cause of desire and so on,üîΩthen if you speak of it, the meaning of your thesis is undermined by inference.

original: dpag pas gnod pa'i phyir des gtan tshigs la khyab pa mi 'grub po zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: dpag pas gnod pa'i phyir des gtan tshigs la khyab pa mi 'grub po zhes ston pa ni /
translated: Therefore, you do not establish the pervasion of your reason.

original: gal te de rten ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te de rten ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: To demonstrate this, the root text says, ‚ÄúIf you say that the basis is the cause of desire and so on,‚Äù and so forth.

original: 'dod pa la sogs pa de dag gi gzhi ni de'i rten yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa la sogs pa de dag gi gzhi ni de'i rten yin no //
translated: The basis of those things such as desire is their basis.üîΩIf you imagine that the basis is the cause of desire and so on, then if you speak of it, the meaning of your thesis is undermined by inference.

original: dngos po lus can thur du ltung ba'i chos can yin na ltung ba'i gegs byas pas rten du brtag na /
analyzed: dngos po lus can thur du ltung ba'i chos can yin na ltung ba'i gegs byas pas rten du brtag na /
translated: If you imagine that the basis is the cause of desire and so on, then if you speak of it, the meaning of your thesis is undermined by inference.üîΩIf you imagine that the basis is the cause of desire and so on, then if you speak of it, the meaning of your thesis is undermined by inference.üîΩIf you imagine that the basis is the cause of desire and so on, then if you speak of it, the meaning of your thesis is undermined by inference.üîΩIf you imagine that the basis is the cause of desire and so on, then if you speak of it, the meaning of your thesis is undermined by inference.üîΩIf you imagine that the basis is the cause of desire and so on, then if you speak of it, the meaning of your thesis is undermined by inference.üîΩIf you imagine that the basis is the cause of desire and so on, then if you speak of it, the meaning of your thesis is undermined by inference.üîΩIf you imagine that the basis is the cause of desire and so on, then if you speak of it, the meaning of your thesis is undermined by inference.üîΩIf you imagine that the basis is the cause of desire and so on, then if you speak of it, the meaning of your thesis is undermined by inference.üîΩIf you imagine that the basis is the cause of desire and so on, then if you speak of it, the meaning of your thesis is undermined by inference.üîΩIf you imagine that the basis is the cause of desire and so on, then if you speak of it, the meaning of your thesis

original: gang dag bde ba la sogs pa ltung bas stong pa de dag la 'og tu ltung ba mi srid pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang dag bde ba la sogs pa ltung bas stong pa de dag la 'og tu ltung ba mi srid pa'i phyir /
translated: For those who are empty of falling into pleasure and so on, falling down is impossible.

original: ci zhig byed pa na bdag la sogs pa rten du 'gyur /
analyzed: ci zhig byed pa na bdag la sogs pa rten du 'gyur /
translated: What action is performed by the self and so on that would be their support?

original: 'on te dper na bum pa la sogs pa cung zad mi byed pa rnams kyang rgya shug la sogs pa'i rten ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te dper na bum pa la sogs pa cung zad mi byed pa rnams kyang rgya shug la sogs pa'i rten ma yin nam /
translated: But aren‚Äôt things like pots, which perform no function, the supports of jujubes and so on?

original: de bzhin du bde ba la sogs pa'i rten du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du bde ba la sogs pa'i rten du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: In the same way, they would be the supports of pleasure and so on.

original: rgya shug 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩltung ba'i gegs dag byed phyir ram //
analyzed: rgya shug 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / ltung ba'i gegs dag byed phyir ram //
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúThe jujube fruit and so on,‚Äù and so on.

original: zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma ma yin pa'i phyogs la'o //üîΩkhyad par skyed par byed phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma ma yin pa'i phyogs la'o // khyad par skyed par byed phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin order to prevent falling‚Äù is from the perspective of the nonmomentary position.

original: zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma'i phyogs la'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma'i phyogs la'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause they generate distinctions‚Äù is from the perspective of the momentary position.

original: khyad par skyed par byed pa ni nye bar len pa'i rgyu dang yul mtshungs par skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par skyed par byed pa ni nye bar len pa'i rgyu dang yul mtshungs par skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: Generating distinctions means generating a similar object that is a substantial cause.

original: 'dod pa la sogs pa de dag la rnam pa 'di gnyi g-yang mi srid pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dod pa la sogs pa de dag la rnam pa 'di gnyi g-yang mi srid pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is impossible for those such as pleasure to have these two aspects,

original: de dag la rten 'ga' yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag la rten 'ga' yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not logical for any support to exist for them.

original: gang yang dngos po yod pa'i zhes bya ba'i khyad par de ni don med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: gang yang dngos po yod pa'i zhes bya ba'i khyad par de ni don med pa nyid yin te /
translated: Moreover, that distinction ‚Äúof an existent thing‚Äù is meaningless,üîΩbecause there is no object of exclusion.

original: rnam par gcad par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par gcad par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says:

original: 'jig pa'i ngo bo med pa la //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i ngo bo med pa la //
translated: ‚ÄúThe nature of destruction does not exist‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: gal te 'jig pa'i 'bras bu yin par gyur na de'i tshe rnam par gcad par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te 'jig pa'i 'bras bu yin par gyur na de'i tshe rnam par gcad par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: If it were the effect of destruction, then, in order to exclude that,

original: dngos po yod pa'i zhes bya ba'i khyad par don dang bcas par 'gyur na /
analyzed: dngos po yod pa'i zhes bya ba'i khyad par don dang bcas par 'gyur na /
translated: the distinction ‚Äúof an existent thing‚Äù would have a point.

original: ji tsam du de dngos po med pa'i phyir rgyu dag gis cung zad kyang bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar rgyu dang ldan par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji tsam du de dngos po med pa'i phyir rgyu dag gis cung zad kyang bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar rgyu dang ldan par 'gyur /
translated: But to the extent that it is a non-thing, the causes do not do anything at all. So how could it be related to causes?

original: sbyor ba ni gang dngos po med ba de ni 'ga'i yang 'bras bu ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang dngos po med ba de ni 'ga'i yang 'bras bu ma yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is a non-thing is not the effect of anything,

original: dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no //
translated: like the horn of a donkey.

original: 'jig pa yang dngos po med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab byed 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa yang dngos po med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab byed 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: And the destruction of a thing is a non-entity. This is the observation of an incompatible pervasion.

original: 'bras bu yin na dngos po nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'bras bu yin na dngos po nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If it were an effect, it would follow, absurdly, that it was an entity,

original: bde ba la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni 'dir gnod pa can gyi tshad ma'o //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni 'dir gnod pa can gyi tshad ma'o //
translated: like pleasure and so on. This is the valid cognition that contradicts your position.

original: gzhan yang khyed cag khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba yang yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang khyed cag khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba yang yin te /
translated: Moreover, you contradict your own tenets.

original: 'di ltar 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni rang gi rgyu dang 'du bas sam /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni rang gi rgyu dang 'du bas sam /
translated: For you accept that what is called an effect is either an entity that is the inherence cause of its own effect or an entity that is the noninherence cause of its own effect.

original: yod pa dang 'du bas bdag thob pa zhes @196b brjod pa ni khyed cag gi nges pa yin no //üîΩrdzas la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'i 'jig pa la ni rang gi rgyu la 'du ba 'am /
analyzed: yod pa dang 'du bas bdag thob pa zhes @196b brjod pa ni khyed cag gi nges pa yin no // rdzas la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'i 'jig pa la ni rang gi rgyu la 'du ba 'am /
translated: You accept that what is called self is an entity that is the inherence cause of its own effect.üîΩBut destruction, which is devoid of the nature of a substance and so on, is not the inherence cause of its own effect.

original: de la yod pa dang med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de la yod pa dang med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the noninherence cause of its own effect, for it is not an entity.

original: de ni ngo bo med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni ngo bo med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For it is a nonentity.

original: de lta ma yin na 'di na 'di rdzas la sogs pa bzhin du ston pa dang dngos por yang 'gyur ba'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi khyad par gyis rnam par dpyad par bya ba cung zad du yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'di na 'di rdzas la sogs pa bzhin du ston pa dang dngos por yang 'gyur ba'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi khyad par gyis rnam par dpyad par bya ba cung zad du yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would be like substance, etc., and it would be a real entity, and it would not be subject to any analysis by the distinctions of the reason.

original: de'i phyir dngos po yod pa zhes bya ba'i khyad par don med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po yod pa zhes bya ba'i khyad par don med do //
translated: Therefore, the distinction ‚Äúexisting entity‚Äù is meaningless.

original: gzugs sogs shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gzugs sogs shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In the passage beginning ‚ÄúConsciousness of form, etc.,‚Äù

original: ma rig pa yis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ma rig pa yis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúBy ignorance, etc.‚Äù

original: ngas mthong ngo //
analyzed: ngas mthong ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúI see,‚Äù

original: ngas thos so zhes bya ba de lta bu'i shes pa po gcig gi rgyu mtshan gyis shes pa rnams sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid kyi mtshams sbyor ba gang yin pa de 'di ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: ngas thos so zhes bya ba de lta bu'i shes pa po gcig gi rgyu mtshan gyis shes pa rnams sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid kyi mtshams sbyor ba gang yin pa de 'di ma nges pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúI hear‚Äù‚Äîsuch a consciousness is the basis for the unity of the various consciousnesses, and that is not certain.

original: 'di ltar dngos po skad cig ma rnams la yang 'khrul pas byed pa po gcig tu mngon par rlom pas mtshams sbyor ba srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po skad cig ma rnams la yang 'khrul pas byed pa po gcig tu mngon par rlom pas mtshams sbyor ba srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For, even in the case of momentary things, there is the possibility of a connection by the activity of a single agent, because of the illusion of a single agent.

original: de lta bas na de lta bur gyur pa'i mtshams sbyor ba las dngos po rnam par 'jog par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na de lta bur gyur pa'i mtshams sbyor ba las dngos po rnam par 'jog par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to posit things as such on the basis of such a connection.

original: yang ji ltar skad cig ma mang bo mtshams sbyor ba'i rgyu mtshan du 'gro ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar skad cig ma mang bo mtshams sbyor ba'i rgyu mtshan du 'gro ba yin zhe na /
translated: Moreover, how does a multiplicity of moments become the basis for the connection?

original: nus pa'i dbye bas tha dad kyang //
analyzed: nus pa'i dbye bas tha dad kyang //
translated: Although different due to the difference in potency,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: etc.üîΩAlthough the object is not multiple, the connection of a single form, etc.,

original: nus pa'i khyad par las don du ma yin yang gcig gi rnam par mtshams sbyor ba la sogs pa 'bras bu gcig ni rgyu mtshan gyi rgyur 'gyur te /
analyzed: nus pa'i khyad par las don du ma yin yang gcig gi rnam par mtshams sbyor ba la sogs pa 'bras bu gcig ni rgyu mtshan gyi rgyur 'gyur te /
translated: is the basis for the effect, such as the connection of a single result, due to the difference in potency.üîΩFor example, it is said that long pepper, etc.,

original: dper na sle tres la sogs pas rims la sogs pa zhi bar byed do zhes bya ba 'og nas rgyas par ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na sle tres la sogs pas rims la sogs pa zhi bar byed do zhes bya ba 'og nas rgyas par ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: pacifies fever, etc.

original: ci ste yang 'di'i 'khrul pa nyid ji ltar nges she na /
analyzed: ci ste yang 'di'i 'khrul pa nyid ji ltar nges she na /
translated: Moreover, how is the error of this [position] ascertained?

original: gzugs dang sgra sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, form, sound, etc.

original: gal te bdag la sogs pa rtag pa gcig pu snga ma dang phyi ma'i dus su rjes su 'gro ba'i 'bras bu sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa de dag yin par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te bdag la sogs pa rtag pa gcig pu snga ma dang phyi ma'i dus su rjes su 'gro ba'i 'bras bu sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa de dag yin par gyur na /
translated: If consciousnesses such as the cognition of blue and so on are the effects that are subsequent to a permanent, unitary self, then

original: de'i tshe de dag gis rim gyis 'byung ba dang 'gal te /
analyzed: de'i tshe de dag gis rim gyis 'byung ba dang 'gal te /
translated: at that time they would be incompatible with gradual arising,

original: rgyu ma tshang ba med pa nyid kyis cig car kho nar skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu ma tshang ba med pa nyid kyis cig car kho nar skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that they would arise only simultaneously due to the completeness of the cause.

original: rtag pa ni gzhan la ltos pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rtag pa ni gzhan la ltos pa yang ma yin te /
translated: A permanent thing does not depend on another,

original: de ni 'ga' zhig gis phan gdags par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'ga' zhig gis phan gdags par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not something that can be benefited by anything else.

original: gzhan yang gal te spyir gcig rgyu sngon du 'gro ba tsam sgrub na /üîΩde'i tshe grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te spyir gcig rgyu sngon du 'gro ba tsam sgrub na / de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: Moreover, if you prove in general that a single thing is merely preceded by a cause,üîΩthen it is the proof of what is already established.

original: rnam @197a * //
analyzed: rnam @197a * //
translated: To demonstrate this, he says:

original: shes gcig gi mjug thogs su //
analyzed: shes gcig gi mjug thogs su //
translated: Immediately after a single consciousness,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: 'di ltar shes pa gcig gi mjug thogs su ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes pa gcig gi mjug thogs su ste /
translated: Thus, immediately after a single consciousness,

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gcig las mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa drug po skye ba gsal por shes te /
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gcig las mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa drug po skye ba gsal por shes te /
translated: It is clear that the six consciousnesses such as eye consciousness arise from a single equivalent immediately preceding condition.

original: 'di ltar gang kho na'i tshe gar mkhan gyi gzugs mthong ba de kho na'i tshe rnga zlum la sogs pa'i sgra thos shing /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang kho na'i tshe gar mkhan gyi gzugs mthong ba de kho na'i tshe rnga zlum la sogs pa'i sgra thos shing /
translated: Thus, when one sees the form of a dancer, one hears the sound of a drum or lute,

original: autpala la sogs pa'i dri snom pa dang / ga phur la sogs pa'i ro myang ba dang / bsil yab kyi rlung la sogs pa'i reg bya nyams su myong bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: autpala la sogs pa'i dri snom pa dang / ga phur la sogs pa'i ro myang ba dang / bsil yab kyi rlung la sogs pa'i reg bya nyams su myong bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: one smells the scent of a blue lotus, one tastes the flavor of a myrobalan fruit, one experiences the touch of a fan,

original: yid kyis gos spyin par bya'o snyam du sems par byed do //
analyzed: yid kyis gos spyin par bya'o snyam du sems par byed do //
translated: and one mentally thinks, ‚ÄúI will give cloth.‚Äù

original: mgal me'i 'khor lo mthong ba bzhin du mthong ba myur bar rgyu ba'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: mgal me'i 'khor lo mthong ba bzhin du mthong ba myur bar rgyu ba'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa yang mi rigs te /
translated: It is also illogical to say that it is because they are seen quickly, like the circle of a whirling firebrand,

original: mi gsal bar snang bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi gsal bar snang bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would then follow that they would appear unclearly.

original: 'di ltar khyed cag gis mthong ba la sogs pa rnams mtshams sbyor ba la cig car bzung bar mngon par rlom pa 'di brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyed cag gis mthong ba la sogs pa rnams mtshams sbyor ba la cig car bzung bar mngon par rlom pa 'di brjod pa yin te /
translated: Thus, you assume that what is seen and so on are apprehended all at once, but this is just a claim.

original: mtshams sbyor ba yang dran pas byas pa yin la /
analyzed: mtshams sbyor ba yang dran pas byas pa yin la /
translated: The connection is made by memory,

original: de yang 'das pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir mi gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'das pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir mi gsal ba yin no //
translated: and since memory has a past object, it is unclear.

original: cig car gzugs la sogs pa snang ba 'di ni gsal ba kho nar rig go //
analyzed: cig car gzugs la sogs pa snang ba 'di ni gsal ba kho nar rig go //
translated: But this appearance of form and so on is clearly known to be all at once.

original: gzhan yangs ral sogs pa yi ge 'dzin pa'i shes pa rnam skye ba yod pa'i phyir sa ra ras la sogs pa de la yang chos cig car 'dzin par 'gyur ro /
analyzed: gzhan yangs ral sogs pa yi ge 'dzin pa'i shes pa rnam skye ba yod pa'i phyir sa ra ras la sogs pa de la yang chos cig car 'dzin par 'gyur ro /
translated: And because there is a consciousness that arises that apprehends the letters of other words, such as sara, in that case too, the object is apprehended all at once.

original: de ltar yin dang 'ga' zhig bzung yang rim par nges pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yin dang 'ga' zhig bzung yang rim par nges pa ma yin te /
translated: If that were so, then even though some are apprehended, they would not be ascertained in order.

original: 'di yang 'go nas rgyas par 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di yang 'go nas rgyas par 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be explained in detail later.

original: 'di ni gsal ba zhes smos pas lan phyogs tsam zhig bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni gsal ba zhes smos pas lan phyogs tsam zhig bstan pa yin no //
translated: Since it is said that this is clear, this is just a partial response.

original: ci ste rtag pa dang / gcig pu'i dngos po'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ci ste rtag pa dang / gcig pu'i dngos po'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If it is said that the self is the cause of the entity of permanence and singularity,

original: 'di dag ni gcig gi rgyu mtshan nyid du sgrub par byed na de'i tshe khyab pa rjes su dpag pas gnod pa nyid du ston pa ni /
analyzed: 'di dag ni gcig gi rgyu mtshan nyid du sgrub par byed na de'i tshe khyab pa rjes su dpag pas gnod pa nyid du ston pa ni /
translated: If one were to prove the reason for this by one, then the pervasion is contradicted by inference.

original: rim bzhin pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rim bzhin pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: This is shown by the passage beginning with ‚ÄúThe order of sequence . . .‚Äù

original: de ma thag tu zhes bya ba ni gcig rjes shugs las zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: de ma thag tu zhes bya ba ni gcig rjes shugs las zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúImmediately‚Äù refers to the passage beginning with ‚ÄúOne . . .

original: de la gnod par byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la gnod par byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa 'di yin te /
translated: The inference that contradicts this is as follows:

original: gang dag rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa nye ba de dag ni cig car 'byung pa yin te /
analyzed: gang dag rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa nye ba de dag ni cig car 'byung pa yin te /
translated: Those that are causes whose power is unobstructed and are present arise simultaneously,

original: dper na tshogs pa tshang ba cig car 'byung ba'i myu gu la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na tshogs pa tshang ba cig car 'byung ba'i myu gu la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: like a sprout, etc., whose assemblage is complete and arises simultaneously.

original: lha spyin gyi gzugs la @197b sogs pa'i yul can gyi shes pa yang rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa nye ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: lha spyin gyi gzugs la @197b sogs pa'i yul can gyi shes pa yang rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa nye ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The consciousness that has as its object Devadatta‚Äôs form, etc., is a cause whose power is unobstructed and is present. This is a reason based on nature.

original: de ltar 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
translated: This is not the case,

original: de'i phyir bzlog pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bzlog pa yin no //
translated: so the opposite is true.

original: dpe yang bsgrub bya dang mi ldan pa yin no zhes ston pa ni /üîΩgar mkhan gyi smin ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //üîΩgar mkhan gyi smin ma bskyod pa la sogs pa ni gcig ma yin te /
analyzed: dpe yang bsgrub bya dang mi ldan pa yin no zhes ston pa ni / gar mkhan gyi smin ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // gar mkhan gyi smin ma bskyod pa la sogs pa ni gcig ma yin te /

analyzed: de ni rdul phra rab du ma 'dus pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // gal te de lta na ji ltar de sgra gcig gi yul du 'gyur zhe na /

analyzed: de la gcig tu btags pa'i phyir // zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The example is not endowed with the probandum.üîΩThe example is not endowed with the probandum.üîΩThe example is not endowed with the probandum.üîΩThe example is not endowed with the probandum.üîΩThe example is not endowed with the probandum.

analyzed: 'on te btags pa'i rgyu mtshan yang gang yin zhe na / 'bras bu gcig la nyer sbyor phyir //

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The example is not endowed with the probandum.üîΩThe example is not endowed with the probandum.üîΩThe example is not endowed with the probandum.

original: gang gi phyir smin ma bskyod pa 'di mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'bras bu gcig la nye bar sbyor te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir smin ma bskyod pa 'di mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'bras bu gcig la nye bar sbyor te /
translated: The example is not endowed with the probandum.

original: de lta bas na tha dad kyang sgra gcig gi yul du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na tha dad kyang sgra gcig gi yul du 'gyur ro //
translated: The example is not endowed with the probandum.üîΩThe example is not endowed with the pro

original: ci ste yang kho bo cag gis rnam pa de lta bu'i rtag pa gcig bsgrub par bya bar 'dod de /
analyzed: ci ste yang kho bo cag gis rnam pa de lta bu'i rtag pa gcig bsgrub par bya bar 'dod de /
translated: But if we assert that a permanent, unitary entity of that kind is to be established,

original: des na dpe bsgrub bya dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: des na dpe bsgrub bya dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then the example would not be devoid of the probandum.

original: gal te bsgrub bya yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te bsgrub bya yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If the probandum is also like that, etc.

original: de lta na ni grub pa la sgrub ste /
analyzed: de lta na ni grub pa la sgrub ste /
translated: In that case, it would establish what is already established,

original: shes pa gcig gi rgyu mtshan gyi 'du byed snga ma dang phyi mar gyur pa rnams gcig tu yod par gdags pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa gcig gi rgyu mtshan gyi 'du byed snga ma dang phyi mar gyur pa rnams gcig tu yod par gdags pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the prior and subsequent compositional factors that are the causal processes of a single consciousness are the objects designated as one.

original: gang yang ji ltar bdag ces bya ba'i tshig ces bya ba la sogs pa de la /
analyzed: gang yang ji ltar bdag ces bya ba'i tshig ces bya ba la sogs pa de la /
translated: Also, in the passage that begins, ‚ÄúThe word ‚Äòself‚Äô is a collective term,‚Äù

original: nged kyi blo dang sems sogs kyi //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: nged kyi blo dang sems sogs kyi // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúOur mind, thought, etc.‚Äù

original: tshig gcig yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: tshig gcig yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin te /
translated: The reason, ‚Äúbecause it is a single word,‚Äù is indeterminate.

original: 'di ltar blo dang / dbang po dang / tshor ba dang / lus kyi rnam grangs ni blo ni sems dang shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar blo dang / dbang po dang / tshor ba dang / lus kyi rnam grangs ni blo ni sems dang shes pa'o //
translated: This is because the synonyms of mind, sense faculty, feeling, and body are as follows: Mind is consciousness and thought.

original: dbang po ni aa kshi dang / tshor ba ni rig pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po ni aa kshi dang / tshor ba ni rig pa'o //
translated: The sense faculty is the eye, and the feeling is the consciousness.

original: lus ni sku dang lus so zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: lus ni sku dang lus so zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The body is the form and the body, and so on.

original: tshig gcig yin pa'i phyir na yang kho bo cag gi lugs la de las tha dad pa'i dang po'i dngos po brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshig gcig yin pa'i phyir na yang kho bo cag gi lugs la de las tha dad pa'i dang po'i dngos po brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: And because it is a single word, in our system, the first entity that is different from that is not to be expressed.

original: des na gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog par ma grub pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: des na gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog par ma grub pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, because the reason is not established as the opposite of the discordant class, it is indeed uncertain.

original: 'on te 'di nyid dogs par byas nas /
analyzed: 'on te 'di nyid dogs par byas nas /
translated: But if this is suspected,

original: rnam grangs nges par grub pa las tha dad pa zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i khyad par brjod pa ma @198a * //
analyzed: rnam grangs nges par grub pa las tha dad pa zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i khyad par brjod pa ma @198a * //
translated: isn't the reason because it is established as a specific enumeration expressed as a qualifier of that?

original: yin nam / de ji ltar ma nges par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yin nam / de ji ltar ma nges par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How could it be uncertain?

original: de lta bas na 'di la brjod pa /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di la brjod pa /
translated: Therefore, in response to this, it is said:

original: gtan tshigs kyi khyad par 'di ni ma grub po /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi khyad par 'di ni ma grub po /
translated: This qualifier of the reason is not established.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems kyi rnam grangs su gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems kyi rnam grangs su gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is included in the enumeration of the mind.

original: bdag ces bya ba'i tshig 'di sems kyi rnam grangs nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba'i tshig 'di sems kyi rnam grangs nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the word ‚Äúself‚Äù is established as a synonym of mind.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: sems nyid nga rgyal gyi rten yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems nyid nga rgyal gyi rten yin pa'i phyir /
translated: ‚ÄúThe mind itself is the basis of the conceit ‚ÄòI am,‚Äô

original: bdag ces btags pa yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: bdag ces btags pa yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: and therefore it is designated as the self.‚Äù

original: nye bar btags te tha snyad du byas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nye bar btags te tha snyad du byas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚Äú Designated‚Äù means ‚Äúconventionally designated.‚Äù

original: des na gang yang gsal byed pas dngos kyi don mi srid pa'i phyir nye bar btags par mi rigs so zhes bshad pa de ni bsam pa yongs su ma shes pa'i phyir ro zhes gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: des na gang yang gsal byed pas dngos kyi don mi srid pa'i phyir nye bar btags par mi rigs so zhes bshad pa de ni bsam pa yongs su ma shes pa'i phyir ro zhes gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, what was said, namely, that it is not reasonable to designate the self as a mere designation because it is impossible for it to be the referent of the word, should be understood as being said through not understanding the intention.

original: 'di nyid brjod ces bya ba 'dis gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: 'di nyid brjod ces bya ba 'dis gsal bar byed do //
translated: This is clarified by the words ‚ÄúThis is what is said.‚Äù

original: de lta bas na gtan tshigs kyi khyad par ma grub po /
analyzed: de lta bas na gtan tshigs kyi khyad par ma grub po /
translated: Therefore, the distinction in the reason is not established.

original: kun rdzob tu yul dang bcas pa nyid du khas blangs nas gtan tshigs 'di ma nges pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yul dang bcas pa nyid du khas blangs nas gtan tshigs 'di ma nges pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: Having accepted that the self has an object conventionally, he shows that the reason is not established.

original: gal te don dam par blo la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i don rjod par byed pa nyid du sgrub na /
analyzed: gal te don dam par blo la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i don rjod par byed pa nyid du sgrub na /
translated: If one were to prove that the meaning is different from the mind, etc.,

original: de'i tshe khyab pa rjes su dpag pas gnod pa'i phyir gtan tshigs 'di rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i tshe khyab pa rjes su dpag pas gnod pa'i phyir gtan tshigs 'di rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: then at that time, because the pervasion is undermined by inference, this reason is not correct.

original: don dam du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: don dam du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says, ‚Äúultimately,‚Äù etc.

original: sgra'i tha snyad thams cad kyi yul ni sgro btags pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro zhes 'og nas ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgra'i tha snyad thams cad kyi yul ni sgro btags pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro zhes 'og nas ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: The object of all verbal conventions is a superimposed meaning.

original: de'i phyir bdag gi sgra 'di yul med pa yin pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag gi sgra 'di yul med pa yin pas /
translated: Therefore, since this word ‚Äúself‚Äù is without an object,

original: ji ltar gtan tshigs bsgrub byas khyab par 'gyur snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gtan tshigs bsgrub byas khyab par 'gyur snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: how could the reason pervade the probandum?üîΩIn this way, he thinks.

original: khyad par dang bcas pa yin na yang gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩnam mkha'i dkyil gyi padma sogs //
analyzed: khyad par dang bcas pa yin na yang gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir / nam mkha'i dkyil gyi padma sogs //
translated: In order to demonstrate that even if it has a qualifier, the reason is indeterminate,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚Äúlike a lotus in the sky,‚Äù etc.

original: dper na nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa gtan med pa la 'ga' zhig gis byed pa po la sogs pa'i tshig sbyor ba de'i tshe gnyi ga la grub pa'i lus la sogs pa'i rjod par byed pa'i sgra tha dad pa yin na tshig gcig yod de /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa gtan med pa la 'ga' zhig gis byed pa po la sogs pa'i tshig sbyor ba de'i tshe gnyi ga la grub pa'i lus la sogs pa'i rjod par byed pa'i sgra tha dad pa yin na tshig gcig yod de /
translated: For example, when someone uses terms such as ‚Äúagent‚Äù in regard to something utterly nonexistent, such as a sky flower, if the terms are different terms that express a body, etc., that are established for both parties, then there is one term.

original: lus la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i dngos po'i yul nyid ma yin pas gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i dngos po'i yul nyid ma yin pas gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no //
translated: But since the object is not a thing that is different from the body, etc., the reason is indeterminate.

original: yang ji ltar nye bar brjod pa med pa la sogs pa'i tshig sbyor bar nus she na /üîΩbrda tsam gyis ni 'jug pa yi //
analyzed: yang ji ltar nye bar brjod pa med pa la sogs pa'i tshig sbyor bar nus she na / brda tsam gyis ni 'jug pa yi //
translated: Again, how can one use terms such as ‚Äúnonexistent‚Äù in regard to something that is not expressible?

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The response is ‚ÄúOne can engage in terms merely by convention.‚Äù

original: rang dbang can 'dod pa tsam gyis yod pa brda de tsam gyis 'byung ba'i @198b tshig 'di dag ji ltar de 'ga' zhig tu 'jug pa'i rgyun bzlog par 'gyur /
analyzed: rang dbang can 'dod pa tsam gyis yod pa brda de tsam gyis 'byung ba'i @198b tshig 'di dag ji ltar de 'ga' zhig tu 'jug pa'i rgyun bzlog par 'gyur /
translated: Since the existence of things is merely by convention, that is, by the mere convention of desire, how can one stop the use of these terms in regard to that?

original: ci ste yang gtan tshigs kyi don de yang rang bzhin gyi tshig gcig yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di brjod par 'dod do //
analyzed: ci ste yang gtan tshigs kyi don de yang rang bzhin gyi tshig gcig yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di brjod par 'dod do //
translated: But if you maintain that the meaning of the reason is ‚Äúbecause of the word ‚Äòinherently,‚Äô‚Äù

original: des na 'khrul par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /üîΩbdag la sogs pa'i tshig dag kyang //
analyzed: des na 'khrul par mi 'gyur ro zhe na / bdag la sogs pa'i tshig dag kyang //
translated: then there would be no error.üîΩThe words ‚Äúself,‚Äù etc.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The words ‚Äúself,‚Äù etc.

original: sgra rnams brda med par rang bzhin gyis don gsal bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra rnams brda med par rang bzhin gyis don gsal bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Words do not inherently clarify their meanings without conventions,

original: ma byang ba yang de las don rtogs par thal ba'i phyir dang / rang gi 'dod pas sbyor ba med par thal ba'i phyir dang / brda don med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma byang ba yang de las don rtogs par thal ba'i phyir dang / rang gi 'dod pas sbyor ba med par thal ba'i phyir dang / brda don med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that even the uninitiated would understand their meanings, because it would follow, absurdly, that one could employ them without wanting to, and because it would follow, absurdly, that conventions would be meaningless.

original: de lta bas na bdag la sogs pa'i tshig rnams ni ngo bo nyid kyis don gsal bar byed pa grub pa ma yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na bdag la sogs pa'i tshig rnams ni ngo bo nyid kyis don gsal bar byed pa grub pa ma yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, because the words ‚Äúself,‚Äù etc. are not established as inherently clarifying their meanings, the reason is not established.

original: ci ste snang bral gyis khyad par med pa'i gzhi'i dngos po gzhan du gyur pa'i shes bya'i yul yin pa zhes bya ba'i khyad par gzhan med par byed pa de lta na yang ji skad du bshad par khyad par ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa
analyzed: ci ste snang bral gyis khyad par med pa'i gzhi'i dngos po gzhan du gyur pa'i shes bya'i yul yin pa zhes bya ba'i khyad par gzhan med par byed pa de lta na yang ji skad du bshad par khyad par ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa
translated: But if you make the distinction that the basis is an object of knowledge that is a different thing from the appearance, and that is not distinguished by being free from appearance, then even in that case, the reason is not established because the distinction is not established as explained.

original: dang / khyab pa med pa'i phyir ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: dang / khyab pa med pa'i phyir ma nges pa yin no //
translated: And because there is no pervasion, it is indefinite.

original: gang yang gson po'i lus po 'di //
analyzed: gang yang gson po'i lus po 'di //
translated: And if you say, ‚ÄúThis living body,‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa de la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa de la /
translated: and so on,

original: gal te bdag dang lhan cig tu //
analyzed: gal te bdag dang lhan cig tu //
translated: then we say, ‚ÄúIf the self and so on,‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩgal te srog la sogs pa bdag dang lhan cig de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / gal te srog la sogs pa bdag dang lhan cig de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid dam /
translated: and so on.

original: de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa 'ga' zhig grub pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa 'ga' zhig grub pa yin zhe na /
translated: If the life-force and so on are related to the self in the sense that they are of the same nature or they are related in the sense that they arise from it,

original: de'i tshe bdag log pa na lus la srog la sogs pa ldog par thal ba rigs pa dang ldan par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de'i tshe bdag log pa na lus la srog la sogs pa ldog par thal ba rigs pa dang ldan par 'gyur gyi /
translated: then it follows that when the self is refuted, the life-force and so on are refuted.üîΩThis is a coherent argument.

original: de lta ma yin na 'brel pa med pa log na gzhan ldog par thal ba 'brel pa med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'brel pa med pa log na gzhan ldog par thal ba 'brel pa med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, if the absence of a relation were to be reversed, it would follow that the other, i.e., the presence of a relation, would be reversed.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is absurd.

original: mo gsham gyi bu log pa na de dang 'brel pa med pa srog la sogs pa ldog pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu log pa na de dang 'brel pa med pa srog la sogs pa ldog pa ni ma yin no //
translated: When the son of a barren woman is reversed, the absence of a relation, i.e., life force, etc., is not reversed.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar mo gsham gyi bu log pa na de dang 'brel pa med pa'i srog la sogs pa rnams kyang ldog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar mo gsham gyi bu log pa na de dang 'brel pa med pa'i srog la sogs pa rnams kyang ldog par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, just as when the son of a barren woman is reversed, the absence of a relation, i.e., life force, etc., is not reversed, like a pot, etc.,üîΩsince someone would prove the absurd consequence of this, it would be uncertain.

original: bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhes kha cig gis thal ba sgrub par byed pas na ma nges par 'gyur ba de bzhin du khyod la yang bdag log pa na srog la sogs pa ldog par thal ba ni ma nges pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhes kha cig gis thal ba sgrub par byed pas na ma nges par 'gyur ba de bzhin du khyod la yang bdag log pa na srog la sogs pa ldog par thal ba ni ma nges pa nyid yin no //
translated: Similarly, for you, the absurd consequence that when the self is reversed, life force, etc., are reversed is uncertain.

original: 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: The intended meaning is that the relation is not established.

original: yang ji ltar 'brel pa ma grub pa yin snyam @199a * //
analyzed: yang ji ltar 'brel pa ma grub pa yin snyam @199a * //
translated: Again, how is the relation not established?

original: na ; 'di la re zhig de'i bdag min //
analyzed: na ; 'di la re zhig de'i bdag min //
translated: Here, first, it is not its self.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Thus, it is said.

original: de dag tha dad khas len phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba ni bdag dang srog la sogs pa de dag la de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag tha dad khas len phyir // zhes bya ba ni bdag dang srog la sogs pa de dag la de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Because they accept that they are different.

original: rang bzhin tha dad par khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin tha dad par khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The self, life-force, etc. are not related by the nature of identity because they are accepted as having different natures.

original: 'di ltar srog la sogs pa ni mi rtag pa dang / ma khyab pa dang / lus can ma yin pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar srog la sogs pa ni mi rtag pa dang / ma khyab pa dang / lus can ma yin pa yin la /
translated: Thus, the life-force, etc. are impermanent, non-pervading, and non-embodiment,

original: bdag ni de dag las bzlog pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag ni de dag las bzlog pa yin no //
translated: while the self is the opposite of these.

original: de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is there the nature of origination from them,

original: srog la sogs pa rnams rgyu ma tshang ba med pa nyid kyis cig car bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa rnams rgyu ma tshang ba med pa nyid kyis cig car bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it follows that the life-force, etc. would occur simultaneously due to the completeness of their causes.

original: de dag las ma gtogs pa'i 'brel pa gzhan yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag las ma gtogs pa'i 'brel pa gzhan yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no other relation apart from these.

original: de'i phyir 'brel pa dang bral ba'i srog la sogs pa lus de gson pos khyad par du byas pa'i lus la ci'i phyir ldog ste mi ldog pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'brel pa dang bral ba'i srog la sogs pa lus de gson pos khyad par du byas pa'i lus la ci'i phyir ldog ste mi ldog pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, how could the life-force, etc., which are unrelated to the body, return to the body qualified by life? They could not return!

original: des na gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no snyam du dgongs pa yin no ;
analyzed: des na gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no snyam du dgongs pa yin no ;
translated: Thus, the reason is inconclusive.

original: /'dis ni 'dod pa dang / sdang ba dang / 'bad pa dang / sdug bsngal dang / bde ba dang / shes pa la sogs pa dag gi rtags nyid du gzhan dag gis smras pa gang yin pa de dag bkag par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: /'dis ni 'dod pa dang / sdang ba dang / 'bad pa dang / sdug bsngal dang / bde ba dang / shes pa la sogs pa dag gi rtags nyid du gzhan dag gis smras pa gang yin pa de dag bkag par blta bar bya ste /
translated: This refutes what others have said, namely, that desire, hatred, effort, pleasure, pain, cognition, etc., are the evidence of the self.

original: 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the relation is not established.

original: sbyor ba ni gang dag gang dang 'brel pa med pa de dag ni de'i go bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang dag gang dang 'brel pa med pa de dag ni de'i go bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The application of the reason is as follows: Those things that are unrelated to something else do not indicate it,

original: dper na til la sogs pa la chu skyar 'gro ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na til la sogs pa la chu skyar 'gro ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like a crow on a til plant, etc.

original: srog la sogs pa yang bdag la 'brel pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa yang bdag la 'brel pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: And the life-force, etc., are unrelated to the self. This is a non-observation of a more extensive property.

original: ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it unestablished,

original: 'brel pa rnam pa gnyis ka yang gong du bkag zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa rnam pa gnyis ka yang gong du bkag zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because both types of relation have already been refuted above.

original: ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it indeterminate,

original: thams cad thams cad kyi go bar byed pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad thams cad kyi go bar byed pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it follows that everything would be understood by everything.

original: 'gal ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gal ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it contradictory,

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because it exists in the similar class.

original: gang yang byed pa grub pa'i phyir byed pa po grub pa ma yin no zhes smras pa de yang ma grub pa ste /
analyzed: gang yang byed pa grub pa'i phyir byed pa po grub pa ma yin no zhes smras pa de yang ma grub pa ste /
translated: Also, the statement ‚ÄúThe agent is not established because the action is established‚Äù is not established.

original: mig la sogs pa rnams ni don dam par byed pa nyid du ma grub ste /
