analyzed: mig la sogs pa rnams ni don dam par byed pa nyid du ma grub ste /
translated: Eyes, etc. are not established as agents ultimately,

original: thams cad mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed pa la rgyu'i dngos por mtshungs pa'i phyir dang / byed pa po dang byed pa'i las kyi tha snyad ni rang gi 'dod pa tsam gyis yongs su @199b brtags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed pa la rgyu'i dngos por mtshungs pa'i phyir dang / byed pa po dang byed pa'i las kyi tha snyad ni rang gi 'dod pa tsam gyis yongs su @199b brtags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are equivalent in being causes that generate eye consciousness, and because the conventions of agent and action are imputed by mere wish.

original: byed pa po tsam sgrub na grub pa la sgrub ste /
analyzed: byed pa po tsam sgrub na grub pa la sgrub ste /
translated: If one establishes mere agent, one establishes what is already established.

original: lus la sogs pa brtags pa'i byed pa po 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa brtags pa'i byed pa po 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because you assert that the agent is the body, etc.

original: don dam pa'i byed pa po nyid sgrub par byed na ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: don dam pa'i byed pa po nyid sgrub par byed na ma nges pa yin te /
translated: If you prove that the ultimate agent exists, then it is indefinite,üîΩbecause the connection of the eye, etc. with such an agent is not established.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i byed pa po 'ba' zhig tu yang mig la sogs pa rnams 'brel par ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i byed pa po 'ba' zhig tu yang mig la sogs pa rnams 'brel par ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And also, what was said:

original: gang yang ; skyes ma thag pa'i dang po'i shes //
analyzed: gang yang ; skyes ma thag pa'i dang po'i shes //
translated: ‚ÄúThe first cognition at birth‚ÄùüîΩand so on,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de la /
translated: in response to that, it was said:

original: de ltar sgrub byed thams cad kyis //
analyzed: de ltar sgrub byed thams cad kyis //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that way, all proofs‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: dang po'i shes pa bzhin nga'i lus bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe smras pa gang yin pa de ji skad du bshad pa'i bsgrub bya'i chos dang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: dang po'i shes pa bzhin nga'i lus bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe smras pa gang yin pa de ji skad du bshad pa'i bsgrub bya'i chos dang bral ba yin te /
translated: The example that was stated, ‚Äúlike the first cognition, like my body,‚Äù is devoid of the property of the probandum, as was explained.

original: bdag ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the self is not established.

original: de bas na gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore the reason is indefinite.

original: gzhan dag ces bya ba las yang gsal bar byed pa dang / legs ldan pa la sogs pa'i lugs kyis dogs pa bsu ba yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag ces bya ba las yang gsal bar byed pa dang / legs ldan pa la sogs pa'i lugs kyis dogs pa bsu ba yin te /
translated: The phrase and others indicates that this is also a response to the qualms of the Bhadanta Srilata and others.

original: de dag 'di skad ces smra ste /
analyzed: de dag 'di skad ces smra ste /
translated: They say the following:

original: bdag mngon sum nyid kyis grub ste /üîΩ'di ltar rtags dang rtags can gyi 'brel pa dran pa la ltos pa med par nga'o snyam pa'i shes pa ni /
analyzed: bdag mngon sum nyid kyis grub ste / 'di ltar rtags dang rtags can gyi 'brel pa dran pa la ltos pa med par nga'o snyam pa'i shes pa ni /
translated: The self is established by direct perception.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin du mngon sum yin no //üîΩ'di yang gzugs la sogs pa'i yul can ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin du mngon sum yin no // 'di yang gzugs la sogs pa'i yul can ma yin te /
translated: This is because the cognition that thinks, I, like the cognition of form and so on, is a direct perception that does not depend on the memory of the relation between the reason and the property possessor.

original: de'i shes pa las tha dad du snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i shes pa las tha dad du snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not a subject that has form and so on as its object because it appears as distinct from the cognition of those.

original: de lta bas na bdag kho na yul yin no snyam na /
analyzed: de lta bas na bdag kho na yul yin no snyam na /
translated: Therefore the self alone is the object.

original: de ni mi rigs zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed do //üîΩbdag nga rgyal gyi yul nyid du ma grub ste /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed do // bdag nga rgyal gyi yul nyid du ma grub ste /
translated: The response to that is that it is illogical and so on.

original: de'i rnam pas stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rnam pas stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The self is not established as the object of the conception of I because it is empty of the aspect of that.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi rnam pas stong pa de ni de'i yul can ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi rnam pas stong pa de ni de'i yul can ma yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is empty of the aspect of something is not a subject that has that as its object.

original: dper na mig gi shes pa sgra'i yul can ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mig gi shes pa sgra'i yul can ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, a visual consciousness is not a consciousness that has sound as its object.

original: nga'o snyam pa'i shes pa yang bdag gi rnam pas stong pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: nga'o snyam pa'i shes pa yang bdag gi rnam pas stong pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: And the consciousness that thinks ‚ÄúI am‚Äù is empty of the aspect of self. This is the non-observation of a pervader.üîΩThe reason is not unestablished.

original: gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa yang ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa yang ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says:

original: de la rtag dang khyab byed sogs //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la rtag dang khyab byed sogs // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Permanence, pervasion, and so on.

original: 'di ltar bdag ni rtag ba dang / khyab pa dang / sems pa med pa can la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan par 'dod la /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag ni rtag ba dang / khyab pa dang / sems pa med pa can la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan par 'dod la /
translated: Thus, the self is asserted to have the qualities of permanence, pervasiveness, and unconsciousness.

original: nga'o snyam pa'i shes pa 'di la rtag pa la sogs par snang ba yang mi mngon no //
analyzed: nga'o snyam pa'i shes pa 'di la rtag pa la sogs par snang ba yang mi mngon no //
translated: But the appearance of permanence and so on in the consciousness that thinks ‚ÄúI am‚Äù is not evident.

original: 'on kyang tha dad par bdag dkar sham mo //
analyzed: 'on kyang tha dad par bdag dkar sham mo //
translated: However, the self appears as different, as white,
as a man,üîΩas thin,

original: gzhan ba'o // rid pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ba'o // rid pa'o //
translated: and so on.

original: tshor ba drag pos gzir ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa lus kyi gnas skabs kyi reg pas bskyed pa'i phyir kha dog dkar sham la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du snang ba'i rnam pa'i nga rgyal can 'dir shes te /
analyzed: tshor ba drag pos gzir ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa lus kyi gnas skabs kyi reg pas bskyed pa'i phyir kha dog dkar sham la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du snang ba'i rnam pa'i nga rgyal can 'dir shes te /
translated: It is the pride that appears in the form of the characteristics of a pale complexion, etc., generated by the contact with the condition of the body, as in the statement, ‚ÄúIt is the oppression by a powerful feeling.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir lus la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi reg pas bskyed pa'i nga rgyal lus la sogs pa la dmigs pa yin no zhes bya bar shes so //
analyzed: de'i phyir lus la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi reg pas bskyed pa'i nga rgyal lus la sogs pa la dmigs pa yin no zhes bya bar shes so //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that the pride generated by the contact with the condition of the body, etc., has the body, etc., for its object.

original: gsal bar zhes bya ba ni gsal por te 'khrul pa med par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal bar zhes bya ba ni gsal por te 'khrul pa med par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúClearly‚Äù means ‚Äúdistinctly,‚Äù because it functions without confusion.

original: de lta yin dang gang yang gsal byed pa la sogs pa rnams kyis longs spyod pa'i gnas kyi lus la bdag 'di nye bar 'dogs te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang gang yang gsal byed pa la sogs pa rnams kyis longs spyod pa'i gnas kyi lus la bdag 'di nye bar 'dogs te /
translated: If that is so, then the body, which is the basis of enjoyment, is designated as the self by those who are clear about it.

original: dper na rjes su mthun pa'i g-yog la rgyal pos smras pa nga gang yin pa de kho na bdag gi g-yog po 'di yin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes smras pa de gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: dper na rjes su mthun pa'i g-yog la rgyal pos smras pa nga gang yin pa de kho na bdag gi g-yog po 'di yin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes smras pa de gsal ba yin no //
translated: For example, a king says to his retinue, ‚ÄúHe who is my self is my servant.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar gal te 'di phal pa yin par gyur na de'i tshe 'khrul pas 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te 'di phal pa yin par gyur na de'i tshe 'khrul pas 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: If it were a conventional entity, then it would be engaged by error.

original: 'jig rten na seng ge dang bram ze'i khye'u dag la dngos dang btags pas de gnyi ga yang seng ge'o snyam du blo mi 'khrul par 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten na seng ge dang bram ze'i khye'u dag la dngos dang btags pas de gnyi ga yang seng ge'o snyam du blo mi 'khrul par 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In the world, with respect to a lion and a lion cub, the mind does not engage them without error, thinking that both are lions, because of the real and the nominal.

original: nga'i lus la sogs pa zhes tha dad par mthong ba'i phyir lus la sogs pa la nga'o snyam pa ni 'khrul pas 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: nga'i lus la sogs pa zhes tha dad par mthong ba'i phyir lus la sogs pa la nga'o snyam pa ni 'khrul pas 'jug pa yin te /
translated: The thought ‚ÄúI am‚Äù with regard to the body, etc., is engaged by error, because of the perception of difference, ‚Äúmy body,‚Äù etc.

original: bdag la yang 'khrul pas 'jug pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag la yang 'khrul pas 'jug pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And it follows that the self also is engaged by error,

original: de la yang nga'i bdag ces tha dad par mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: de la yang nga'i bdag ces tha dad par mthong ba yin no //
translated: because it is perceived as different, ‚Äúmy self.‚Äù

original: 'di la btags pa'i tha dad pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di la btags pa'i tha dad pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the difference is nominal,

original: gcig shes pa la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: gcig shes pa la yang mtshungs so //
translated: then the same is true of the cognition of the one.

original: 'o na bdag dkar sham mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i shes pa 'di dngos yin la rag mod /
analyzed: 'o na bdag dkar sham mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i shes pa 'di dngos yin la rag mod /
translated: Well then, it is certainly the case that the cognition ‚ÄúI am white,‚Äù etc., is real,

original: de lta na yang ci'i phyir bdag 'di'i yul du mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang ci'i phyir bdag 'di'i yul du mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But why wouldn‚Äôt it be the object of this self?

original: de'i ngo bor zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i ngo bor zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIts nature is not that of form, etc.‚Äù

original: dkar sham la sogs pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: dkar sham la sogs pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The nature of white, etc.

original: de la gzugs la sogs pa'i yon tan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la gzugs la sogs pa'i yon tan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because form, etc., do not exist in it.

original: de ltar re zhig de'i rnam pas stong pa'i phyir nga rgyal gyi yul bdag yin par mi rigs par bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig de'i rnam pas stong pa'i phyir nga rgyal gyi yul bdag yin par mi rigs par bstan to //
translated: Thus, it has been demonstrated that the self is not the object of the pride ‚ÄúI‚Äù because it is empty of the nature of that .

original: de la rtsod pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir yang mi rigs so zhes ston pa ni /üîΩgal te skyes bu yang bdag tu //
analyzed: de la rtsod pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir yang mi rigs so zhes ston pa ni / gal te skyes bu yang bdag tu //
translated: It is unreasonable because it would follow, absurdly, that there would be no dispute about it.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: To demonstrate this he says, ‚ÄúIf the person were the self, etc.‚Äù

original: de yod sogs zhes bya ba ni bdag de'i yod pa dang rtag pa dang khyab pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de yod sogs zhes bya ba ni bdag de'i yod pa dang rtag pa dang khyab pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Its existence, etc.‚Äù refers to the self‚Äôs existence, permanence, ubiquity, etc.

original: 'di snya ma  du ji ltar @200b khyed cag gis mngon sum du byas kyang sngon po la sogs pa de'i rang bzhin las tha mi dad pa'i skad cig ma la sogs pa la rtsod pa 'jug pa de bzhin du bdag la yang 'gyur ro snyam du sems
analyzed: 'di snya ma  du ji ltar @200b khyed cag gis mngon sum du byas kyang sngon po la sogs pa de'i rang bzhin las tha mi dad pa'i skad cig ma la sogs pa la rtsod pa 'jug pa de bzhin du bdag la yang 'gyur ro snyam du sems
translated: You think, ‚ÄúEven though you have made it evident, just as you argue about the momentariness, etc., which is not different from the nature of blue, etc., so too it would be for the self.‚Äù

original: na / 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: na / 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To respond:

original: sngon po la sogs pa mngon sum gyis gzung na yang de las tha mi dad pa'i skad cig ma la sogs pa rtsod pa rigs te /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa mngon sum gyis gzung na yang de las tha mi dad pa'i skad cig ma la sogs pa rtsod pa rigs te /
translated: Even though blue, etc. are apprehended by direct perception, it is reasonable to argue about the momentariness, etc. which are not different from that.

original: mngon sum de ni rtog pa med pa nyid kyis ma nges pa'i bdag nyid yin pas skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum de ni rtog pa med pa nyid kyis ma nges pa'i bdag nyid yin pas skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that direct perception, by being nonconceptual, has the nature of nonascertainment, since momentariness, etc. are not ascertained.

original: khyed kyi phyogs la ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: khyed kyi phyogs la ni mi rigs te /
translated: But it is unreasonable for your position.

original: nga'o snyam pa'i shes pa rtogs pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis nges pa'i bdag nyid yin pas bdag nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nga'o snyam pa'i shes pa rtogs pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis nges pa'i bdag nyid yin pas bdag nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the self is ascertained, since the consciousness thinking ‚ÄúI am‚Äù has the nature of ascertainment, due to being conceptual.

original: gang gis rtsod par 'gyur ba nges pas yul du byas pa'i dngos po la ni de las bzlog pa'i rnam pa 'dzin pa'i sgro 'dogs pa'i shes pa 'jug pa yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gis rtsod par 'gyur ba nges pas yul du byas pa'i dngos po la ni de las bzlog pa'i rnam pa 'dzin pa'i sgro 'dogs pa'i shes pa 'jug pa yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: There is no conceptual consciousness apprehending the opposite that engages in regard to the object that is ascertained by the valid knowledge that engages it.üîΩ

original: de dag ni lhan cig mi gnas pa nyid kyis gnod par bya ba dang / gnod par byed pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni lhan cig mi gnas pa nyid kyis gnod par bya ba dang / gnod par byed pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And there is no occurrence of a superimposing cognition that apprehends the opposite form in regard to the thing that is the object of ascertainment, because they are mutually exclusive, like light and darkness.

original: de nges pa gang yin pa 'di nyid nges pa rnams kyi rang rang gi don rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nges pa gang yin pa 'di nyid nges pa rnams kyi rang rang gi don rtogs pa yin no //
translated: And that ascertainment is the understanding of the meaning of each of the ascertainments.

original: gal te de dag nges pa dang ldan pa ma yin nam ma bzung ba kho nar 'gyur ro //üîΩde'i phyir de ltar gzhan gyi phyogs bsal bas rang gi phyogs gzhag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te de dag nges pa dang ldan pa ma yin nam ma bzung ba kho nar 'gyur ro // de'i phyir de ltar gzhan gyi phyogs bsal bas rang gi phyogs gzhag pa'i phyir /
translated: If they are not endowed with ascertainment, then they would not be apprehended at all.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //üîΩsbyor ba ni gang dag rim gyis skye ba de dag ni bdag dang 'du ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // sbyor ba ni gang dag rim gyis skye ba de dag ni bdag dang 'du ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, in order to posit one‚Äôs own position by way of eliminating the position of the other, he says, ‚ÄúTherefore . . .‚Äù and so on.

original: dper na sa bon dang myu gu la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sa bon dang myu gu la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: The syllogism is: Those that arise sequentially are not a unity, like, for example, a seed and a sprout.

original: bde ba la sogs pa yang rim gyis skye ba yin no zhes bya ba ni 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa yang rim gyis skye ba yin no zhes bya ba ni 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa'o //
translated: The pervasion by contradiction is: pleasure, etc. are also produced in sequence.

original: bdag dang 'du ba nyid dang 'gal ba bdag med pa dang 'du bas rim gyis skye ba la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag dang 'du ba nyid dang 'gal ba bdag med pa dang 'du bas rim gyis skye ba la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The contradiction of the self and the collection is pervaded by the selflessness and the collection being produced in sequence.

original: rgyu ma tshang ba med pa nye ba'i phyir cig car skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba ni bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma'o //
analyzed: rgyu ma tshang ba med pa nye ba'i phyir cig car skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba ni bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma'o //
translated: The inference based on the evidence of the non-deviation of the effect is: it follows that the effect is produced all at once because the non-deficient cause is present.

original: yang na gang dag dngos po nyid dang / byas pa nyid dang / skye ba dang ldan ba nyid la sogs pa'i chos dang ldan pa de dag thams cad ni bdag med pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na gang dag dngos po nyid dang / byas pa nyid dang / skye ba dang ldan ba nyid la sogs pa'i chos dang ldan pa de dag thams cad ni bdag med pa yin te /
translated: Or, the inference based on the evidence of the contradiction of the pervasion is: whatever is endowed with the attributes of being a thing, being produced, and being produced and ceasing is selfless,

original: dper na phyi rol gyi bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na phyi rol gyi bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like, for example, an external pot, etc.

original: nang gi srog dang lus dang / yid dang blo dang sdug bsngal dang / bde ba la sogs pa yang dngos po nyid la sogs pa'i chos cang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan @201a * //
analyzed: nang gi srog dang lus dang / yid dang blo dang sdug bsngal dang / bde ba la sogs pa yang dngos po nyid la sogs pa'i chos cang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan @201a * //
translated: This is the natural argument.

original: tshigs so // yang ji ltar 'di la khyab ba grub ce na /
analyzed: tshigs so // yang ji ltar 'di la khyab ba grub ce na /
translated: Moreover, how is the pervasion established here?

original: bdag bcas nyid na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bdag bcas nyid na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIf it is endowed with self,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te bdag dang bcas pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: gal te bdag dang bcas pa nyid yin te /
translated: If it is endowed with self,

original: lus la sogs pa bdag gis byin gyis brlabs pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa bdag gis byin gyis brlabs pa nyid yin na /
translated: then the body and so on are empowered by the self.

original: de'i tshe 'di dag gi rgyu bdag yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di dag gi rgyu bdag yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, the self would be the cause of these.

original: rgyu ma yin pa ni byin gyis rlob pa bor rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu ma yin pa ni byin gyis rlob pa bor rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not logical that a noncause is empowered,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would lead to absurd consequences.

original: de lta yin dang de'i rgyu can te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang de'i rgyu can te /
translated: If that were so, then the self would be the cause of these.

original: bdag gi rgyu can gyi lus la sogs pa rnams rgyu ma tshang ba med pa nyid kyis rtag pa nyid dang / rim can ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro gal te 'di snyam du 'di dag rtag pa nyid du thal ba yin mod kyi /
analyzed: bdag gi rgyu can gyi lus la sogs pa rnams rgyu ma tshang ba med pa nyid kyis rtag pa nyid dang / rim can ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro gal te 'di snyam du 'di dag rtag pa nyid du thal ba yin mod kyi /
translated: But if you think that although it is a consequence that they are permanent,

original: 'on kyang dngos po nyid la sogs pa mi ldog pa kho na'o snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'on kyang dngos po nyid la sogs pa mi ldog pa kho na'o snyam du sems na /
translated: they are definitely not reversed as entities and so on,

original: rtag pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rtag pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains: Even if they are permanent, they are not entities.üîΩThe context is that it is a consequence that permanent bodies and so on are not able to perform functions.

original: rtag par yod pa'i lus la sogs pa rnams don byed nus pa ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i skabs ni shugs kyis tshig yongs su bsgyur nas sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: rtag par yod pa'i lus la sogs pa rnams don byed nus pa ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i skabs ni shugs kyis tshig yongs su bsgyur nas sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: The words are to be rearranged implicitly:

original: rtag pa ni rim dang cig car dag gis don byed par 'gal ba'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa ni rim dang cig car dag gis don byed par 'gal ba'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: It is thought that it is contradictory for permanent things to perform functions either gradually or instantaneously.

original: don byed par nus pa log na yang dngos po nyid ldog ste /
analyzed: don byed par nus pa log na yang dngos po nyid ldog ste /
translated: If the ability to perform a function is reversed, then entity itself is reversed,

original: dngos po'i mtshan nyid ni don byed nus pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i mtshan nyid ni don byed nus pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the definition of an entity is that which is able to perform a function.

original: dngos po nyid log na dngos po'i chos yod pa la sogs pa yang ldog pa'i phyir khyab pa grub po //
analyzed: dngos po nyid log na dngos po'i chos yod pa la sogs pa yang ldog pa'i phyir khyab pa grub po //
translated: If the thing itself is refuted, then the properties of the thing, such as existence, are also refuted.

original: gsal byed pas 'on te yang bdag med pa zhes bya ba'i don ci zhig bsgrub bya nyid du 'dod /
analyzed: gsal byed pas 'on te yang bdag med pa zhes bya ba'i don ci zhig bsgrub bya nyid du 'dod /
translated: But if you are trying to prove the nonexistence of the self, what is the object of the verb ‚Äúto be‚Äù in the proposition ‚Äúthe self does not exist‚Äù?

original: gal te re zhig bdag la phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yin na dpe med de /
analyzed: gal te re zhig bdag la phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yin na dpe med de /
translated: If the proposition is ‚Äúthe self does not benefit itself,‚Äù then there is no example.

original: bdag la phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag la phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is nothing that does not benefit itself.

original: 'on te lus bdag ma yin no zhes bdag 'gegs na su zhig gis lus bdag tu 'dod /
analyzed: 'on te lus bdag ma yin no zhes bdag 'gegs na su zhig gis lus bdag tu 'dod /
translated: If the proposition is ‚Äúthe body is not the self,‚Äù then who is the self that you think the body is?

original: med pa ni tshig phyi ma'i yul can yin pa'i phyir bdag dang bcas pa zhes bya ba yang gang zhig yin pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: med pa ni tshig phyi ma'i yul can yin pa'i phyir bdag dang bcas pa zhes bya ba yang gang zhig yin pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: And if the proposition is ‚Äúthe self does not exist,‚Äù then you must say what the self is that does not exist.

original: dper na sbrang bu med do zhes bya ba lta bur med pa'i sbyor pa tshig phyi ma med par ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: dper na sbrang bu med do zhes bya ba lta bur med pa'i sbyor pa tshig phyi ma med par ma mthong ngo //
translated: We never see the negative used without an object, as in ‚Äúthere is no bee.‚Äù

original: ci ste lus la bdag 'gegs na grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: ci ste lus la bdag 'gegs na grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
translated: If the proposition is ‚Äúthe self does not exist in the body,‚Äù then you are proving what is already established.

original: lus la bdag yod par su zhig 'dod /
analyzed: lus la bdag yod par su zhig 'dod /
translated: Who would maintain that the body is the self?

original: yang lus bdag dang 'brel pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yin na yang dpe yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang lus bdag dang 'brel pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yin na yang dpe yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But if you maintain that the body is not related to the self, then there is no example.

original: 'di thams @201b cad ni khyad par bkag pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di thams @201b cad ni khyad par bkag pa yin la /
translated: All of these are negations of distinctions.

original: khyad par bkag na yang spyi rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khyad par bkag na yang spyi rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: But when a distinction is negated, the universal is not understood.

original: de lta yin na gang dgag bar bya ba de rjes su gnang ba byas par 'gyur ro //üîΩci ste bdag gi sgra ni mi rtag pa'i yul can yin te sgra yin pa'i phyir ro zhes sgrub pa de lta na yang rtag pa'i sgras ma nges pa yin no //üîΩlus la sogs pa rnams ni nye bar btags nas bdag gi sgras brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin na gang dgag bar bya ba de rjes su gnang ba byas par 'gyur ro // ci ste bdag gi sgra ni mi rtag pa'i yul can yin te sgra yin pa'i phyir ro zhes sgrub pa de lta na yang rtag pa'i sgras ma nges pa yin no // lus la sogs pa rnams ni nye bar btags nas bdag gi sgras brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
translated: If that were so, then the object of negation would be affirmed.üîΩBut if you prove that the word ‚Äúself‚Äù has an impermanent object, because it is sound, then it is not established by the word ‚Äúpermanent.‚ÄùüîΩBecause the body, etc., are designated as the object of the word ‚Äúself,‚Äù it is established that the word ‚Äúself‚Äù is not a permanent entity.

original: gal te lus la sogs pa las tha dad pa mi rtag pa'i dngos po yin pa nyid kyis bdag gi sgra'i yul mi rtag pa yin par sgrub par byed na /
analyzed: gal te lus la sogs pa las tha dad pa mi rtag pa'i dngos po yin pa nyid kyis bdag gi sgra'i yul mi rtag pa yin par sgrub par byed na /
translated: If you prove that the object of the word ‚Äúself‚Äù is impermanent because it is a thing different from the body, etc.,

original: de lta na yang gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i yul khas blangs pa'i phyir 'gal ba yin no zhes smras pa /
analyzed: de lta na yang gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i yul khas blangs pa'i phyir 'gal ba yin no zhes smras pa /
translated: Still, since you accept that the object is different from form and so on, you contradict your own tenets.

original: de 'di la lan 'debs par byed pa ni /
analyzed: de 'di la lan 'debs par byed pa ni /
translated: To respond to this, the Autocommentary states:

original: bum sogs la yang mtshungs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bum sogs la yang mtshungs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The same would apply to pots and so on.

original: klan ka de 'di ni khyed la yang mtshungs te /
analyzed: klan ka de 'di ni khyed la yang mtshungs te /
translated: This fault is the same for you.

original: 'di ltar khyed cag gis kyang phyi rol gyi bum pa la sogs pa rnams la bdag gis byin gyis brlabs pa med pa nyid dang / de nye bar longs spyod pa'i gzhi ma yin pa nyid kyis bdag med par 'dod pa kho na'o //üîΩde lta ma yin na gson po'i lus ni bdag med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyed cag gis kyang phyi rol gyi bum pa la sogs pa rnams la bdag gis byin gyis brlabs pa med pa nyid dang / de nye bar longs spyod pa'i gzhi ma yin pa nyid kyis bdag med par 'dod pa kho na'o // de lta ma yin na gson po'i lus ni bdag med pa ma yin te /
translated: For you also assert that external pots and so on are selfless because they are not empowered by a self and they are not the basis for enjoying objects.üîΩIf that were not so, then a living body would not be selfless because it would follow that it would not possess life and so on.

original: srog la sogs pa dang mi ldan par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i thal bar 'gyur ba'i dpe nyid du de dag mi len par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa dang mi ldan par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i thal bar 'gyur ba'i dpe nyid du de dag mi len par 'gyur ro //
translated: You would not accept that as an example of a reductio

original: de lta yin dang bum pa la sogs pa de la yang ji ltar de dag bdag med pa yin /
analyzed: de lta yin dang bum pa la sogs pa de la yang ji ltar de dag bdag med pa yin /
translated: If that is so, then how could a pot, etc. be selfless?

original: gal te re zhig bdag la phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa la klan ka mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te re zhig bdag la phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa la klan ka mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúIt is not a self because it does not benefit itself,‚Äù etc., then the same objection applies to you.

original: de'i phyir bdag gis byin gyis brlabs pas sam /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag gis byin gyis brlabs pas sam /
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that the self is not established.

original: de nye bar longs spyod pa'i gzhi ma yin pa'i rnam pa gang gis phyi rol gyi bum pa la sogs pa de dag thams cad la khyed cag dang yang bdag med pa nyid thun mong du grub la /
analyzed: de nye bar longs spyod pa'i gzhi ma yin pa'i rnam pa gang gis phyi rol gyi bum pa la sogs pa de dag thams cad la khyed cag dang yang bdag med pa nyid thun mong du grub la /
translated: Thus, by the power of the self‚Äôs blessing or by the power of the self‚Äôs enjoyment, all external things such as pots, etc. are established as being selfless in the same way for you and for us.

original: gang yang gson po'i lus 'di ni bdag med pa ma yin te zhes khyed cag gis gson po'i lus la 'gegs te /
analyzed: gang yang gson po'i lus 'di ni bdag med pa ma yin te zhes khyed cag gis gson po'i lus la 'gegs te /
translated: You say, ‚ÄúThis living body is not selfless.‚ÄùüîΩBy what is it refuted?

original: gang zhig bkag pas gson po'i lus kho na bdag dang bcas par rtogs kyi /
analyzed: gang zhig bkag pas gson po'i lus kho na bdag dang bcas par rtogs kyi /
translated: It is understood that only the living body has a self,

original: shi ba'i lus dang bum pa la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shi ba'i lus dang bum pa la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but a dead body and a pot, etc. do not.

original: de nyid kho bo cag gis gson po'i lus ni bdag med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kho bo cag gis gson po'i lus ni bdag med pa ma yin te /
translated: We say, ‚ÄúThe living body is not selfless.‚Äù

original: dngos po nyid la sogs pa'i phyir ro zhes sgrub par byed @202a * //
analyzed: dngos po nyid la sogs pa'i phyir ro zhes sgrub par byed @202a * //
translated: because of being an entity, etc.

original: do ; / de lta bas na bdag la phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gzhi med pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: do ; / de lta bas na bdag la phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gzhi med pa kho na yin te /
translated: Therefore, the conceptual thought ‚Äúit does not benefit the self‚Äù and so on is groundless,

original: khyed cag la yang med par rab tu grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyed cag la yang med par rab tu grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is well established that it does not exist for you.

original: gzhan yang re zhig bdag la phan mi 'dogs par grub pa'i dpe med do zhes gang smras pa de yang yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang re zhig bdag la phan mi 'dogs par grub pa'i dpe med do zhes gang smras pa de yang yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is not the case that an example is not established of something that does not benefit the self, as you have claimed.

original: 'di ltar sgrub par nus pa kho na ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar sgrub par nus pa kho na ste /
translated: It is possible to establish this,

original: gang zhig gang gis rang bzhin gyi khyad par skyed par byed pa ma yin pa de ni de'i phan 'dogs par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gis rang bzhin gyi khyad par skyed par byed pa ma yin pa de ni de'i phan 'dogs par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: because that which does not generate a specific nature is not capable of benefiting it,

original: dper na gangs can dang 'bigs byed dag lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gangs can dang 'bigs byed dag lta bu'o //
translated: like the Himalayas and Vindhya mountains.

original: lus la sogs pa yang bdag rtag pa dang gcig pu'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par skyed par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa yang bdag rtag pa dang gcig pu'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par skyed par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is a non-observation of the pervader.

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the reason unestablished,

original: rang bzhin gyi khyad par ni bdag las tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi khyad par ni bdag las tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the special qualities are not different from the self.

original: de byed na bdag kho na'i byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de byed na bdag kho na'i byed par 'gyur te /
translated: If they were produced, they would be the production of the self alone,

original: de lta na mi rtag par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na mi rtag par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and in that case, it would follow, absurdly, that the self is impermanent.

original: rang bzhin gyi khyad par tha dad pa yin na yang 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir de'i 'di zhes bya ba'i 'brel bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi khyad par tha dad pa yin na yang 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir de'i 'di zhes bya ba'i 'brel bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if the special qualities were different, there would be no connection between them and the self, because there would be no reason for a connection.

original: de lta bas na rtag pa la cung zad kyang phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na rtag pa la cung zad kyang phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, the self is not in the least helped by anything,

original: des de la cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des de la cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not do anything to it.

original: gang yang su zhig gis lus bdag tu 'dod ces smras pa de yang yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yang su zhig gis lus bdag tu 'dod ces smras pa de yang yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: Also, the statement, ‚ÄúWho is it that desires the body to be the self?‚Äù is not correct.

original: de skad du smra ba kha cig kyang yod de /
analyzed: de skad du smra ba kha cig kyang yod de /
translated: There are some who say this,

original: dper na rig byed smra ba rnams ltar gang dag lus la sogs pa rnams ni bdag yongs su 'gyur ba'i ngo bo yin par smra bar byed do //
analyzed: dper na rig byed smra ba rnams ltar gang dag lus la sogs pa rnams ni bdag yongs su 'gyur ba'i ngo bo yin par smra bar byed do //
translated: just as the VedƒÅntins say that the body, etc. are the self in the state of transformation.

original: de lta bas na de la brten nas dgag pa byed do //
analyzed: de lta bas na de la brten nas dgag pa byed do //
translated: Therefore, we refute that.

original: gang yang med pa ni tshig phyi ma'i yul can yin pa'i phyir bdag dang bcas pa yang gang zhig yin pa brjod par bya'o zhes smras pa de yang 'brel pa mad de /
analyzed: gang yang med pa ni tshig phyi ma'i yul can yin pa'i phyir bdag dang bcas pa yang gang zhig yin pa brjod par bya'o zhes smras pa de yang 'brel pa mad de /
translated: And what you said, ‚ÄúYou must explain what the self is that is associated with the subsequent statement, since the subsequent statement is about something that exists,‚Äù is irrelevant.

original: tshig phyi ma'i don yod pa kho na dgag par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: tshig phyi ma'i don yod pa kho na dgag par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: The meaning of the subsequent statement is not just the negation of existence.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: sgro btags pa yin te /
analyzed: sgro btags pa yin te /
translated: It is superimposition.

original: yod pa dgag par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa dgag par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible to negate existence.

original: de lta pas na gzhan gyis 'khrul pas sgro btags pa'i don gang yin pa de nyid tshig phyi ma'i don yin no //
analyzed: de lta pas na gzhan gyis 'khrul pas sgro btags pa'i don gang yin pa de nyid tshig phyi ma'i don yin no //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the subsequent statement is just the meaning of the superimposition that is the error of others.

original: 'di lung de nyid rjes su brjod nas gzhan gyi log pa'i shes pa nyid du brjod par bya ba 'gegs par byed do //
analyzed: 'di lung de nyid rjes su brjod nas gzhan gyi log pa'i shes pa nyid du brjod par bya ba 'gegs par byed do //
translated: Having quoted that scripture, he refutes the assertion that the other‚Äôs cognition is erroneous.

original: de lta ma yin na sgron ma la sogs pa skad cig ma ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs par sangs rgyas pas kun du @202b btags pa'i skad cig ma nyid khyed kyis 'gegs par byed na dgag pa'i sbyor ba tshig phyi ma med pa la mthongüîΩngo zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa 'di 'byung ba kho na'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na sgron ma la sogs pa skad cig ma ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs par sangs rgyas pas kun du @202b btags pa'i skad cig ma nyid khyed kyis 'gegs par byed na dgag pa'i sbyor ba tshig phyi ma med pa la mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa 'di 'byung ba kho na'o //
translated: Otherwise, if you refute the momentariness imputed by the Buddhist, saying that the lamp and so on are not momentary, then this debate would occur: ‚ÄúWhy do you not see that your refutation is without a final word?‚Äù

original: gang yang lus la bdag yod par su zhig 'dod ces smras pa de yang yang dag pa ma yin te /üîΩ'di ltar gang dag gi lta ba la bdag ces bya ba mthe bo'i ri mo sngo bsangs 'dra ba'i 'bras bu phyed kyi tshad yin pa de dag gi lugs kyis bdag lus can yin pa'i phyir lus la gnas par yod pa nyid yin pas de dgag par rigs
analyzed: gang yang lus la bdag yod par su zhig 'dod ces smras pa de yang yang dag pa ma yin te / 'di ltar gang dag gi lta ba la bdag ces bya ba mthe bo'i ri mo sngo bsangs 'dra ba'i 'bras bu phyed kyi tshad yin pa de dag gi lugs kyis bdag lus can yin pa'i phyir lus la gnas par yod pa nyid yin pas de dgag par rigs
translated: Also, the statement ‚ÄúWho asserts that the self exists in the body?‚Äù is not correct.üîΩThis is because those who hold the view that the self is the size of a thumb joint, the color of a dark sesame seed, it is correct to refute them,

original: pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: pa nyid yin no //
translated: since they hold that the self is embodied and therefore resides in the body.

original: gang yang lus bdag dang 'brel pa 'gegs na dpe med do zhes bya ba yang ma grub ste /
analyzed: gang yang lus bdag dang 'brel pa 'gegs na dpe med do zhes bya ba yang ma grub ste /
translated: Also, the example of the body is not established as being without a self.

original: phan tshun phan gdags par bya ba dang phan 'dogs par byed pa med pa'i phyir gangs can dang 'bigs byed bzhin du bdag dang lus gnyis 'brel pa med do zhes snga ma bzhin du bsgrub par nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun phan gdags par bya ba dang phan 'dogs par byed pa med pa'i phyir gangs can dang 'bigs byed bzhin du bdag dang lus gnyis 'brel pa med do zhes snga ma bzhin du bsgrub par nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no mutual benefit, like the Himalaya and Vindhya mountains, it can be established as before that the self and the body are not related.

original: gang yang khyad par bkag na spyi rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba de ni ma nges te /üîΩkhyed cag gis sgron ma la sogs pa rnams skad cig ma nyid yin pa bkag na yang skad cig ma'i spyi 'ga' zhig khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang yang khyad par bkag na spyi rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba de ni ma nges te / khyed cag gis sgron ma la sogs pa rnams skad cig ma nyid yin pa bkag na yang skad cig ma'i spyi 'ga' zhig khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, the claim that the understanding of a universal is blocked when a particular is refuted is not certain.üîΩBecause, although you refute the momentariness of lamps and so on, you do not accept any universal of momentariness.

original: ci ste yang kho bo cag gis dus yun mi ring bar gnas pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis sgron ma la sogs pa skad cig ma'i sgra 'jug par 'dod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: ci ste yang kho bo cag gis dus yun mi ring bar gnas pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis sgron ma la sogs pa skad cig ma'i sgra 'jug par 'dod pa kho na yin te /
translated: But if you assert that the term momentariness is used because of the reason that lamps and so on endure for a short time, then it is not tenable that they are momentary.

original: de lta bas na spyir skad cig ma nyid grub pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: de lta bas na spyir skad cig ma nyid grub pa yin no snyam na /
translated: Therefore, in general, momentariness is established.

original: gal te de ltan bdag gi sgra 'jug pa yang kho bo cag gi nga rgyal gyi rten sems yin par 'dod pa nyid yin pas spyir bdag grub po //
analyzed: gal te de ltan bdag gi sgra 'jug pa yang kho bo cag gi nga rgyal gyi rten sems yin par 'dod pa nyid yin pas spyir bdag grub po //
translated: If that is so, then the term ‚Äúself‚Äù is also used in the sense of the mind, which is the basis of our pride. Therefore, in general, the self is established.

original: gang yang ci ste bdag gi sgra ni mi rtag pa'i yul can yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa phyogs gnyis smras ba de yang 'brel pa med pa nyid de /
analyzed: gang yang ci ste bdag gi sgra ni mi rtag pa'i yul can yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa phyogs gnyis smras ba de yang 'brel pa med pa nyid de /
translated: Also, the two positions that you have stated, ‚ÄúThe term ‚Äòself‚Äô has as its referent the impermanent‚Äù and so on, are not related to each other.

original: khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrang gis 'khrul par 'gyur ba bdag gi sgra la don dam par yul 'ga' zhig kyang khas ma blangs la /
analyzed: khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro // rang gis 'khrul par 'gyur ba bdag gi sgra la don dam par yul 'ga' zhig kyang khas ma blangs la /
translated: Because we do not accept them.

original: gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad pa yang ma yin no //
translated: We do not accept that the term ‚Äúself‚Äù has as its referent any object ultimately, nor do we accept that it is not different from form and so on.

original: rtag pa'i sgra yang don dam par dngos po rtag pa 'ga' zhig la 'jug par grub pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa'i sgra yang don dam par dngos po rtag pa 'ga' zhig la 'jug par grub pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Also, the term ‚Äúpermanent‚Äù is not established as referring to any permanent thing ultimately.

original: lus la sogs pa la bdag gi sgra nye bar brtags nas 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa la bdag gi sgra nye bar brtags nas 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: The term ‚Äúself‚Äù is not used in the sense of the body and so on after designating it as the self.

original: 'khrul pa med par rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan te /
analyzed: 'khrul pa med par rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan te /
translated: Because it is realized without error.

original: des na grub pa la sgrub pa ma yin no //üîΩde'i phyir de ltar na bdag ces bya ba'i chos can tshad mas gnod pa nyid kyis ma grub pa'i phyir de la khyed kyis byed pa po nyid dang za ba bo @203a * //
analyzed: des na grub pa la sgrub pa ma yin no // de'i phyir de ltar na bdag ces bya ba'i chos can tshad mas gnod pa nyid kyis ma grub pa'i phyir de la khyed kyis byed pa po nyid dang za ba bo @203a * //
translated: Therefore, it is not an establishment of what is already established.

original: nyid kyi tha snyad btags pa gang yin pa de mo gsham gyi bu bzhin du rten med pa yin pa'i phyir 'di'i sun 'byin pa logs shig tu mi byed de //
analyzed: nyid kyi tha snyad btags pa gang yin pa de mo gsham gyi bu bzhin du rten med pa yin pa'i phyir 'di'i sun 'byin pa logs shig tu mi byed de //
translated: Thus, since the subject called ‚Äúself‚Äù is not established because it is undermined by valid cognition, whatever designation you make of it as an agent or as an experiencer is like the son of a barren woman, because it has no basis. Therefore, we do not refute it separately.

original: rten bkag pa nyid kyis 'di dag spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten bkag pa nyid kyis 'di dag spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is refuted by refuting its basis.

original: byas pa chud zos pa dang ma byas pa dang phrad pa'i skyon yang ji ltar mi 'byung ba de ltar las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa brtag par ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byas pa chud zos pa dang ma byas pa dang phrad pa'i skyon yang ji ltar mi 'byung ba de ltar las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa brtag par ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: We will show in the examination of the relation between action and effect how the errors of the exhaustion of action and the encountering of what has not been done do not arise.

original: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel las rigs pa can dang bye brag pas kun du brtags pa'i skyes bu brtag pa ste bdun pa'o /
analyzed: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel las rigs pa can dang bye brag pas kun du brtags pa'i skyes bu brtag pa ste bdun pa'o /
translated: The Compendium of Principles commentary on the difÔ¨Åculties states that this is the seventh chapter, the examination of the person imagined by the logicians and the Vai≈õe·π£ikas.

original: // / dpyod pa pas yongs su brtags pa'i bdag gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: // / dpyod pa pas yongs su brtags pa'i bdag gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to clarify the self imagined by the Mƒ´mƒÅ·πÉsakas,

original: gzhan dag kyang ni ldog pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang ni ldog pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúOthers say that it is the reverse and the forward order . . . ‚Äù

original: ldog pa ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i gnas skabs dag gi phan tshun tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: ldog pa ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i gnas skabs dag gi phan tshun tha dad pa'o //
translated: The reverse order is the mutual difference of the states of pleasure, pain, and so on.üîΩThe forward order is the forward progression of the existence of the substance that has an intellect and so on.

original: rjes su 'jug pa ni sems pa can gyi rdzas dang / yod pa la sogs pa rjes su 'gro ba'o zhes pa dang / rjes su 'jug pa 'di dag bdag gi ngo bo gang la yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'jug pa ni sems pa can gyi rdzas dang / yod pa la sogs pa rjes su 'gro ba'o zhes pa dang / rjes su 'jug pa 'di dag bdag gi ngo bo gang la yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The meaning of the passage is to be connected as follows: ‚ÄúThese forward and reverse orders exist in the nature of the self.‚Äù

original: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is the teaching:

original: gzhan dag rgyal dpog pa rnams ni bdag ba de bal sogs pa'i ngo bos ldog cing /
analyzed: gzhan dag rgyal dpog pa rnams ni bdag ba de bal sogs pa'i ngo bos ldog cing /
translated: The LokƒÅyatas say that the self is the reverse and forward order of the nature of the elements and so on.

original: yod pa la sogs pa'i ngo bos rjes su 'jug pa sems pa can gyi ngo bor rjod par byed do //
analyzed: yod pa la sogs pa'i ngo bos rjes su 'jug pa sems pa can gyi ngo bor rjod par byed do //
translated: and it is said to be the nature of the conscious entity, which is engaged in the nature of existence, etc.

original: sems pa can de yang ji ltar grangs can pas 'dod pa ltar blo las tha dad pa gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems pa can de yang ji ltar grangs can pas 'dod pa ltar blo las tha dad pa gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: And that conscious entity is not different from cognition, as the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas assert.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is it?

original: sems pa can blo'i mtshan nyid yin zhes bya bas blo nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sems pa can blo'i mtshan nyid yin zhes bya bas blo nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is cognition, as is indicated by the phrase ‚Äúthe conscious entity is characterized by cognition.‚Äù

original: blo'i mtshan nyid ni blo'i rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: blo'i mtshan nyid ni blo'i rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúcharacterized by cognition‚Äù is ‚Äúhaving the nature of cognition.‚Äù

original: blo las tha dad pa'i sems kyi ngo bo gzhan ma gtogs so snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: blo las tha dad pa'i sems kyi ngo bo gzhan ma gtogs so snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: The meaning is that there is no other nature of the conscious entity that is different from cognition.

original: yang ji ltar bdag gcig pu la ldog pa dang rjes su 'jug pa'i bdag nyid kyi phan tshun 'gal ba'i rang bzhin gnyis rigs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar bdag gcig pu la ldog pa dang rjes su 'jug pa'i bdag nyid kyi phan tshun 'gal ba'i rang bzhin gnyis rigs pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it tenable for a single self to have two mutually exclusive natures, that of being withdrawn and that of being engaged?

original: dper na sbrul bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dper na sbrul bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: For example, it is like the case of a snake, etc.

original: ji ltar sbrul gcig yin na yang 'khyil pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs log nas drang po'i gnas skabs 'byung ba'i gnas skabs gnyi ga la yang sbrul nyid rjes su 'jug pa de bzhin du bdag kyang sems pa can gyi rang bzhin rtag nga gcig pu yin na
analyzed: ji ltar sbrul gcig yin na yang 'khyil pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs log nas drang po'i gnas skabs 'byung ba'i gnas skabs gnyi ga la yang sbrul nyid rjes su 'jug pa de bzhin du bdag kyang sems pa can gyi rang bzhin rtag nga gcig pu yin na
translated: Just as a single snake has different states such as coiled and uncoiled, and the state of being a snake continues in both states, so too the self is the nature of the sentient being that is permanent and singular.

original: yang rang bzhin ma lus pa dang bral ba ma yin na //
analyzed: yang rang bzhin ma lus pa dang bral ba ma yin na //
translated: But it is not devoid of all natures.

original: rigs pa can la sogs pas kun du brtags pa'i bdag bzhin du rang @203b bzhin ma lus pa rjes su 'jug pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rigs pa can la sogs pas kun du brtags pa'i bdag bzhin du rang @203b bzhin ma lus pa rjes su 'jug pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not that the nature of the sentient being is not present in all states, as it is in the self imputed by logicians and so on.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /üîΩbde ba la sogs ba'i gnas skabs ldog pa dang 'jug pa yang yin la /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na / bde ba la sogs ba'i gnas skabs ldog pa dang 'jug pa yang yin la /
translated: What is it then?üîΩIt is the state of pleasure and so on that is reversed and engaged and the nature of the sentient being that pervades all states.

original: sems pa can gyi ngo bo ni thams cad du rjes su 'gro ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di mi 'gal lo zhes grag ste bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: sems pa can gyi ngo bo ni thams cad du rjes su 'gro ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di mi 'gal lo zhes grag ste bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the summary.

original: yan lag gi don yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: yan lag gi don yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: The meaning of the branches should be stated.

original: sems pa can rtag pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni sems pa can gyi rang bzhin rtag pa gang la yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: sems pa can rtag pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni sems pa can gyi rang bzhin rtag pa gang la yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The compound ‚Äúhaving the nature of a permanent sentient being‚Äù is to be analyzed as ‚Äúhaving the nature of a permanent sentient being.‚Äù

original: kun gyi zhes bya ba la ngo bo zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: kun gyi zhes bya ba la ngo bo zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: ‚Äú Of all‚Äù is to be connected with ‚Äúentity.‚Äù

original: rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya ba la ma yin zhes skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya ba la ma yin zhes skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: ‚Äú Not‚Äù is to be connected with ‚Äúfollows.‚Äù

original: de dag ces bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i gnas skabs so //üîΩci ste yang ci'i phyir ji ltar sangs rgyas ba rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i 'jig pa smra ba dag gis 'dod pa bzhin du gcig tu nges par gcig tu ldog pa'i phyogs sam /
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i gnas skabs so // ci ste yang ci'i phyir ji ltar sangs rgyas ba rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i 'jig pa smra ba dag gis 'dod pa bzhin du gcig tu nges par gcig tu ldog pa'i phyogs sam /
translated: ‚Äú Those‚Äù refers to the states of pleasure, pain, and so on.

original: ji ltar rigs pa can la sogs pa rnams kyis rten pa bzhin du gcig tu nges par mtha' gcig tu rjes su 'gro ba la mi rten ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar rigs pa can la sogs pa rnams kyis rten pa bzhin du gcig tu nges par mtha' gcig tu rjes su 'gro ba la mi rten ce na /
translated: But why do you not accept, as the annihilationists do, that there is no continuation, or that there is a single, definite reversal, as the Mƒ´mƒÅ·πÉsakas and so on do, and that there is a single, definite continuation?

original: gtan du 'jig na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gtan du 'jig na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If there is permanent annihilation, then there is no continuation.

original: gal te 'jig pa rjes su 'gro ba med pa yin na de'i tshe las byas pa chud zos par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te 'jig pa rjes su 'gro ba med pa yin na de'i tshe las byas pa chud zos par 'gyur te /
translated: If cessation were not a universal, then the karma that is done would be wasted,

original: byed pa po 'bras bu dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa po 'bras bu dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the agent would not be related to the result.

original: ma byas pa dang phrad par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma byas pa dang phrad par yang 'gyur te /
translated: And one would encounter the result of karma not done,

original: byed pa po ma yin pa 'bras bu dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa po ma yin pa 'bras bu dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nonagent would be related to the result.

original: bdag ngo bo gcig nyid yin na bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa longs spyod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag ngo bo gcig nyid yin na bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa longs spyod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If the self were a single entity, it would not experience pleasure and pain,

original: nam mkha' bzhin du za ba po ma yin pa'i gnas skabs las za ba po'i gnas skabs la khyad bar med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin du za ba po ma yin pa'i gnas skabs las za ba po'i gnas skabs la khyad bar med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there would be no difference between the state of the experiencer and the state of the nonexperiencer, just as space does not experience.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: gzhon nu ma len gyis ;
analyzed: gzhon nu ma len gyis ;
translated: Kumarila

original: de phyir gnyig dor nas ni //üîΩldog dang rjes 'jug bdag nyid can //
analyzed: de phyir gnyig dor nas ni // ldog dang rjes 'jug bdag nyid can //
translated: Therefore, abandoning both,

original: skyes bu zhig ni khas blang bya //üîΩ'khyil pa sogs la sprul bzhin no //
analyzed: skyes bu zhig ni khas blang bya // 'khyil pa sogs la sprul bzhin no //
translated: one should accept a person who has the nature of reversal and engagement,

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //
translated: just as one does an emanation in the emanation and so on.

original: 'on te gnyi ga'i ngo bo'i skyes bu'i gnas skabs byed pa po gang yin pa de za ba po ma yin pa'i phyir byas pa chud zos pa dang ma byas pa dang phrad pa de dag 'di la 'ang 'ong ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gnyi ga'i ngo bo'i skyes bu'i gnas skabs byed pa po gang yin pa de za ba po ma yin pa'i phyir byas pa chud zos pa dang ma byas pa dang phrad pa de dag 'di la 'ang 'ong ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But if the person who is the agent in one state and the experiencer in another state is not the experiencer, then the faults of the destruction of karma and the contact with the results of karma not committed would apply to this doctrine as well.

original: skyes bu'i byed po za po ni //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: skyes bu'i byed po za po ni // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The person is the agent and the experiencer.üîΩThe person is the agent and the experiencer.

original: skyes bu byed pa po dang za ba po dag gnas skabs la rten pa ma yin gyi //
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa po dang za ba po dag gnas skabs la rten pa ma yin gyi //
translated: The person is not the agent and the experiencer in dependence on a state.

original: 'on kyang skyes bu nyid la'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang skyes bu nyid la'o //
translated: Rather, the person himself is the agent and the experiencer.

original: 'di ltar skyes bu nyid byed pa dang longs spyod pa yin gyi /üîΩgnas @204a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes bu nyid byed pa dang longs spyod pa yin gyi / gnas @204a * //
translated: Thus, the person himself is the agent and the experiencer,

original: skabs ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skabs ni ma yin no //
translated: not a state.

original: de'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i phyir te /
translated: Therefore,

original: de lta bas na gnas skabs can skyes bu ni /üîΩde nyid phyir te /üîΩsngar gyi ngo bo yongs su ma btang ba'i phyir /üîΩbyed po nyid kyis de'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na gnas skabs can skyes bu ni / de nyid phyir te / sngar gyi ngo bo yongs su ma btang ba'i phyir / byed po nyid kyis de'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: the person who possesses a stateüîΩis the experiencer of the result of that action.

original: las de'i 'bras bu thob ba de'i phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: las de'i 'bras bu thob ba de'i phyir skyon med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault.

original: yang 'di la bdag 'di yod pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma ci yod ce na /
analyzed: yang 'di la bdag 'di yod pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma ci yod ce na /
translated: Now, what is the valid cognition that establishes the existence of this self?

original: ngo shes pa yi ngo bo'i phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs ba smos te //üîΩnga kho nas shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngo shes pa yi ngo bo'i phyir // zhes bya ba la sogs ba smos te // nga kho nas shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of the nature of recognition.üîΩBecause of the nature of the subject, recognition.

original: nga kho nas rig par byed do zhes bya ba de lta bu byed pa po gcig nyid kyis yul can ngo shes pa'i ngo bo'i phyir te /
analyzed: nga kho nas rig par byed do zhes bya ba de lta bu byed pa po gcig nyid kyis yul can ngo shes pa'i ngo bo'i phyir te /
translated: It is I who knows, it is I who is aware. In this way, the nature of the subject is that of a single agent.

original: yod pa'i phyir te bdag grub po //
analyzed: yod pa'i phyir te bdag grub po //
translated: Because of the existence of that, the self is established.

original: 'di nyid kyis te /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyis te /
translated: By this very fact,

original: ngo shes pas sangs rgyas pa la sogs pas kun brtags pa'i bdag med par smra ba la gnod pa yang grub po //
analyzed: ngo shes pas sangs rgyas pa la sogs pas kun brtags pa'i bdag med par smra ba la gnod pa yang grub po //
translated: the refutation of the non-Buddhist and Buddhist assertions of selflessness is also established.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: des na ngo shes pa tshad mar bsgrubs pa des na 'jig rten thams cad kyis nges par bzung ba'i ngo shes pa 'dis bdag med par smra ba la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: des na ngo shes pa tshad mar bsgrubs pa des na 'jig rten thams cad kyis nges par bzung ba'i ngo shes pa 'dis bdag med par smra ba la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, by establishing recognition as valid cognition, this recognition ascertained by all worldly people refutes the assertion of selflessness.

original: yang ji ltar ngo shes pa'i shes pas 'di gnyis ka grub par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar ngo shes pa'i shes pas 'di gnyis ka grub par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is it that the cognition of recognition establishes both of these?

original: ngas rig ces bya'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ngas rig ces bya'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúI know‚Äù and so on.

original: ngas rig go zhes bya ba 'di nga'i shes pas shes pa po 'di rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di la rtsod pa med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: ngas rig go zhes bya ba 'di nga'i shes pas shes pa po 'di rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di la rtsod pa med pa nyid yin te /
translated: There is no dispute about this: ‚ÄúI know‚Äù means that the knower is understood by my consciousness.

original: ngas rig go zhes bya ba byed pa bo'i rkyen gzhi mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩshes pa po de yang yin na bdag tu gyur ba zhig gam /
analyzed: ngas rig go zhes bya ba byed pa bo'i rkyen gzhi mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // shes pa po de yang yin na bdag tu gyur ba zhig gam /
translated: Because ‚ÄúI know‚Äù is a case of the same basis for the action and the condition.üîΩBut is the knower the self or is it the momentary consciousness imagined by you?

original: khyed cag gis kun brtags pa'i gcig tu 'jig pa'i dang can skad cig ma'i shes ba yin zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtogs pa gnyis so //
analyzed: khyed cag gis kun brtags pa'i gcig tu 'jig pa'i dang can skad cig ma'i shes ba yin zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtogs pa gnyis so //
translated: There are two alternatives.

original: de la gal te bdag ces bya ba'i phyogs yin na de'i tshe thams cad 'tshams te thams cad mdzes so zhes bya ba'i don te mngon par 'dod pa grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la gal te bdag ces bya ba'i phyogs yin na de'i tshe thams cad 'tshams te thams cad mdzes so zhes bya ba'i don te mngon par 'dod pa grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the position is that it is the self, then everything is appropriate, that is, everything is fine, because the desired conclusion is established.

original: 'on te shes pa'i phyogs yin na de'i tshe thams cad shin tu 'brel par dka' ste /
analyzed: 'on te shes pa'i phyogs yin na de'i tshe thams cad shin tu 'brel par dka' ste /
translated: But if the position is that it is consciousness, then everything is very difficult to relate.

original: 'di ltar ngas shes par gyur to //üîΩngas da ltar rig go zhes ngo shes pa'i byed ba po gcig la brten nas ba'i blo gang yin pa 'di 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar ngas shes par gyur to // ngas da ltar rig go zhes ngo shes pa'i byed ba po gcig la brten nas ba'i blo gang yin pa 'di 'byung ste /
translated: I know it now.üîΩThis cognition arises in dependence on a single cognizer.

original: de'i yul shes pa'i skad cig yin par rtog pa na /üîΩris 'ga' 'das pa'am /üîΩyang na da ltar te da ltar byung ba'am /üîΩgnyi ga'am te /
analyzed: de'i yul shes pa'i skad cig yin par rtog pa na / ris 'ga' 'das pa'am / yang na da ltar te da ltar byung ba'am / gnyi ga'am te /
translated: When one conceives of the object of that cognition as being momentary,üîΩthere are four possibilities:üîΩit is past,

original: 'das pa dang / da ltar dag gam /
analyzed: 'das pa dang / da ltar dag gam /
translated: it is present,üîΩit is both,

original: yang na rgyun yin zhes bya ba phyogs bzhi'o //üîΩde la dang po ste 'das @204b pa'i shes pa'i yul nyid du rtog par byed na shes bar gyur to zhes bya ba de ltar rnam pa'i nges pa 'di rigs te /
analyzed: yang na rgyun yin zhes bya ba phyogs bzhi'o // de la dang po ste 'das @204b pa'i shes pa'i yul nyid du rtog par byed na shes bar gyur to zhes bya ba de ltar rnam pa'i nges pa 'di rigs te /
translated: or it is a continuum.

original: des sngar shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des sngar shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If one conceives of it as the object of past cognition, then it is reasonable to say, ‚ÄúI knew it in this way,‚Äù because it was cognized previously.

original: da ltar shes so zhes bya ba 'di mi rigs te /üîΩ'das pa'i shes pa'i skad cig 'di ni da ltar te /
analyzed: da ltar shes so zhes bya ba 'di mi rigs te / 'das pa'i shes pa'i skad cig 'di ni da ltar te /
translated: It is unreasonable to say, ‚ÄúI know it now,‚ÄùüîΩbecause this moment of past cognition is not present.

original: da ltar byung ba'i dus na rig pa ma yin te //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i dus na rig pa ma yin te //
translated: It is not present now,

original: de ni sngar 'gags zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni sngar 'gags zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has already ceased previously.

original: ci ste da ltar yul yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs gnyis pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: ci ste da ltar yul yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs gnyis pa de'i tshe /
translated: But if you maintain the second position that it is an object of the present,

original: ngas rig go zhes bya ba 'di rigs te /
analyzed: ngas rig go zhes bya ba 'di rigs te /
translated: then it is not logical to say ‚ÄúI cognize it‚Äù

original: da ltar de rig par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ltar de rig par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is cognized in the present.

original: shes par 'gyur zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rnam par 'dzin par ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: shes par 'gyur zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rnam par 'dzin par ni mi rigs so //
translated: It is not logical to apprehend it in the form ‚ÄúIt will be cognized.‚Äù

original: gang phyir 'di ni sngar yod min //
analyzed: gang phyir 'di ni sngar yod min //
translated: Because it does not exist previously.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni da ltar byung ba'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni da ltar byung ba'i shes pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú It‚Äù refers to the present consciousness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir blo 'di sgo gnyis nas 'jug pa'i phyir 'das pa dang / da ltar ba'i shes pa 'dis ma bzung ngo zhes bya bar rigs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir blo 'di sgo gnyis nas 'jug pa'i phyir 'das pa dang / da ltar ba'i shes pa 'dis ma bzung ngo zhes bya bar rigs so //
translated: Therefore it is logical to say that this consciousness is not apprehended by the past and present consciousnesses because this consciousness engages in two ways.

original: da ltar dang 'das pa gnyis ka'i shes pa'i skad cig shes par gyur pa ma yin la /
analyzed: da ltar dang 'das pa gnyis ka'i shes pa'i skad cig shes par gyur pa ma yin la /
translated: The moment of consciousness that is both present and past is not cognized.

original: da ltar shes pa yang ma yin no ;
analyzed: da ltar shes pa yang ma yin no ;
translated: It is not present consciousness.

original: /'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: /'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: shes par gyur pa gcig yin la /
analyzed: shes par gyur pa gcig yin la /
translated: It is a single consciousness that has become.

original: gzhan ni shes pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni shes pa yin no //
translated: The other is consciousness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rgyun yang nga'i blo de nyid kyis gzung bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rgyun yang nga'i blo de nyid kyis gzung bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the continuum also is not apprehended by that very cognition of ‚ÄúI.‚Äù

original: gnyis pa ste 'das pa dang da ltar gyi shes pa'i bya ba gnyis med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis pa ste 'das pa dang da ltar gyi shes pa'i bya ba gnyis med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no second action of cognition, namely, past and present.

original: 'di ltar rgyun 'di sngar shes par gyur pa ma yin zhing ;
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyun 'di sngar shes par gyur pa ma yin zhing ;
translated: In this way, this continuum is not previously cognized,

original: da ltar shes pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: da ltar shes pa yang ma yin te /
translated: and it is not cognized in the present.

original: de ni brtags pa nyid kyis dngos po ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni brtags pa nyid kyis dngos po ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not a thing, since it is merely imagined.

original: dngos po med pa'i shes pa po yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i shes pa po yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: And there is no cognizer of a non-thing,

original: de ni dngos po'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dngos po'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is a property of a thing.

original: de lta bas na ji skad du bshad pa'i shes pa ma gtogs par yul gang la nga rgyal 'di 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni bdag yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: de lta bas na ji skad du bshad pa'i shes pa ma gtogs par yul gang la nga rgyal 'di 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni bdag yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: Therefore, except for the cognition that has been explained, it is established that whatever object this pride engages in is the self.

original: ci ste 'di dag shes pa'i ngo bor ji ltar 'grub ce na /
analyzed: ci ste 'di dag shes pa'i ngo bor ji ltar 'grub ce na /
translated: But how is this established as the nature of cognition?

original: 'das pa'i nga rgyal gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos nye /
analyzed: 'das pa'i nga rgyal gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos nye /
translated: He says, ‚Äúby the pride of the past, etc.‚Äù

original: gang zhig nga'i shes par rtogs par bya ba de ni da dung yang 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig nga'i shes par rtogs par bya ba de ni da dung yang 'jug pa yin te /
translated: That which is to be known by my cognition is still engaged,

original: dper na da ltar ba'i rtogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na da ltar ba'i rtogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like the cognition of the present.

original: 'das pa'i nga rgyal gyi yul rtogs pa yang nga'i shes pas rtogs par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: 'das pa'i nga rgyal gyi yul rtogs pa yang nga'i shes pas rtogs par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The cognition of the object of past pride is also to be known by my cognition. This is a natural inference.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na gang zhig shes pa po yin pa'am /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na gang zhig shes pa po yin pa'am /
translated: In one way, that which is the knower,

original: nga'i shes pas gzung bar bya ba de ni 'das pa'i nga rgyal gyis gzung bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: nga'i shes pas gzung bar bya ba de ni 'das pa'i nga rgyal gyis gzung bar bya ba yin te /
translated: or that which is to be apprehended by my cognition, is to be apprehended by past pride.

original: khar tshang gi shes pa po bzhin no //üîΩda ltar @205a * //
analyzed: khar tshang gi shes pa po bzhin no // da ltar @205a * //
translated: Like the knower of the crow's nest.

original: ba'i blo 'di yang shes pa po dang nga'i shes pas rtogs par bya ba yin no zhes bya ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: ba'i blo 'di yang shes pa po dang nga'i shes pas rtogs par bya ba yin no zhes bya ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: This present cognition is also the knower and is to be known by my cognition. This is a natural inference.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba'i rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba'i rtogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase this refers to the cognition of the present.

original: de nyid las sam zhes bya ba ni nga'i shes pas rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid las sam zhes bya ba ni nga'i shes pas rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase from that itself means because it is to be known by my cognition.

original: de ltar shes pa po chos can du byas nas sbyor ba gnyis bstan te //
analyzed: de ltar shes pa po chos can du byas nas sbyor ba gnyis bstan te //
translated: Thus, having taken the knower as the subject, two syllogisms have been taught.

original: da ni nga'i shes pa bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can du byas nas sbyor ba gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni nga'i shes pa bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can du byas nas sbyor ba gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach another syllogism, taking my consciousness as the subject to be proven,

original: shes pa de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: shes pa de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThose consciousnesses,‚Äù and so on.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni 'das pa dang / da ltar gyi nga'i shes pa bsgrub bya ste /
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni 'das pa dang / da ltar gyi nga'i shes pa bsgrub bya ste /
translated: ‚Äú Those‚Äù refers to my past and present consciousnesses, which are the subject to be proven.

original: bsgrub bya'i chos can nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsgrub bya'i chos can nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are the subject to be proven.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: rgyud gcig dang 'brel zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rgyud gcig dang 'brel zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúconnected to a single continuum,‚Äù and so on.

original: khar tshang dang ni di ring yod pa kun gyi nga'i shes pa zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub bya'i chos can ston pa'o //
analyzed: khar tshang dang ni di ring yod pa kun gyi nga'i shes pa zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub bya'i chos can ston pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú My consciousness‚Äù of yesterday and today is the subject to be proven.

original: don mtshungs can zhes bya ba ni bsgrub bya'i chos te /
analyzed: don mtshungs can zhes bya ba ni bsgrub bya'i chos te /
translated: ‚Äú Having a similar object‚Äù is the predicate to be proven.

original: yul gcig pa can zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yul gcig pa can zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is ‚Äúhaving a single object.‚Äù

original: lha spyin la sogs pa'i rgyud gcig dang 'brel pa'i shes pa po'i don bdun pa der ram /
analyzed: lha spyin la sogs pa'i rgyud gcig dang 'brel pa'i shes pa po'i don bdun pa der ram /
translated: The subject to be proven is the knower connected to a single continuum, such as Devadatta.

original: de'i nga'i shes pa gang yin pa de dag ni rgyud gcig dang 'brel pa'i shes pa po'i nga'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i nga'i shes pa gang yin pa de dag ni rgyud gcig dang 'brel pa'i shes pa po'i nga'i shes pa'o //
translated: The cognition of that is the cognition of the self that is related to a single continuum.

original: de'i dngos po ni de nyid de /
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni de nyid de /
translated: The entity of that is just that.

original: 'di yang gtan tshigs ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yang gtan tshigs ston pa'o //
translated: This also shows the reason.

original: da'i shes pa nyid tsam ni skyes bu gzhan gying rgyal la 'jug pas de'i phyir ma nges pa spang ba'i don du rgyud gcig dang 'brel pa'i shes pa po'i yul nyid gtan tshigs kyis khyad par du byas so //
analyzed: da'i shes pa nyid tsam ni skyes bu gzhan gying rgyal la 'jug pas de'i phyir ma nges pa spang ba'i don du rgyud gcig dang 'brel pa'i shes pa po'i yul nyid gtan tshigs kyis khyad par du byas so //
translated: The mere cognition of that is engaged in the self of another person. Therefore, in order to eliminate the uncertain, the object of the cognition that is related to a single continuum is distinguished by the reason.

original: blo gcig bzhin zhes byas ba ni dpe ste /
analyzed: blo gcig bzhin zhes byas ba ni dpe ste /
translated: ‚ÄúLike a single cognition‚Äù is the example.

original: nga'i shes pa de dag nyid kyi nang nas blo gcig tu brjod par 'dod pa bzhin zhes bya ba'i don te //
analyzed: nga'i shes pa de dag nyid kyi nang nas blo gcig tu brjod par 'dod pa bzhin zhes bya ba'i don te //
translated: The meaning is that it is like the desire to express a single cognition from among those cognitions of the self.

original: de'i phyir 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyogs phyi ma rtsom par byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyogs phyi ma rtsom par byed do //
