translated: Therefore, in this regard, etc., he begins the next position.

original: gal te rtag pa dang gcig bu'i ngo bo sems pa can khas len par byed na /
analyzed: gal te rtag pa dang gcig bu'i ngo bo sems pa can khas len par byed na /
translated: If one accepts a permanent and unitary nature that is sentient,

original: de'i cho blo yang sems pa can gyi ngo bo las tha mi dad pa'i phyir rtag pa dang gcig bu'i ngo bor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i cho blo yang sems pa can gyi ngo bo las tha mi dad pa'i phyir rtag pa dang gcig bu'i ngo bor 'gyur ro //
translated: And the cognition would be permanent and unitary, because it is not different from the nature of the conscious being.

original: de ltar yang mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de ltar yang mi 'dod de /
translated: But that is not accepted.

original: de'i phyir dam bca' ba khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba yin no ;
analyzed: de'i phyir dam bca' ba khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba yin no ;
translated: Therefore, the thesis contradicts what is accepted.

original: /'di ltar bshad sbyar byed pas /
analyzed: /'di ltar bshad sbyar byed pas /
translated: It is explained in this way:

original: de ni skad cig ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni skad cig ma yin te /
translated: It is momentary,

original: blo gzhan gyi dus na mi gnas so zhes bshad do //
analyzed: blo gzhan gyi dus na mi gnas so zhes bshad do //
translated: because it does not remain at the time of another cognition.

original: de bzhin rgyal dpog pas kyang yod pa dang 'brel pa na skyes bu'i dbang po'i blo skye ba de ni mngon sum mo zhes bshad de /
analyzed: de bzhin rgyal dpog pas kyang yod pa dang 'brel pa na skyes bu'i dbang po'i blo skye ba de ni mngon sum mo zhes bshad de /
translated: Similarly, the Vai≈õe·π£ika says that when there is a connection with existence, the cognition of the sense faculty of a person arises, and that is perception.

original: rtag pa nyid yin na skye bar mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid yin na skye bar mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if it were permanent, it would not be suitable to arise.

original: gzhon nu @205b ma len gyi yang rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: gzhon nu @205b ma len gyi yang rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba yin te /
translated: The young KumƒÅrila also contradicts his own words.

original: ji skad du de nyid kyis /
analyzed: ji skad du de nyid kyis /
translated: As he says:

original: gang gis phyi nas don 'dzin par //
analyzed: gang gis phyi nas don 'dzin par //
translated: That which later apprehends objects

original: dbang po bzhin du bya byed pa //
analyzed: dbang po bzhin du bya byed pa //
translated: and functions like a sense faculty,

original: de ni skad cig kyang 'dod la //
analyzed: de ni skad cig kyang 'dod la //
translated: that is accepted as momentary,

original: tshad ma med par skye ba min //
analyzed: tshad ma med par skye ba min //
translated: but not without a valid cognition.

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //
translated: Thus he explains.

original: blo gcig yin pa'i phyir tshad ma drug khas blangs ba dang yang 'gal lo //
analyzed: blo gcig yin pa'i phyir tshad ma drug khas blangs ba dang yang 'gal lo //
translated: And it contradicts the acceptance of six means of valid knowledge, because the cognition is one.

original: de bzhin du mngon sum dang 'gal ba yang yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du mngon sum dang 'gal ba yang yin te /
translated: Likewise, it contradicts direct perception,

original: bar med par sgro 'dogs pa rnam pa du ma sems pa na skye ba dang 'jig pa dang 'brel pa'i blo rnams shin tu gsal bar nyams su myong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bar med par sgro 'dogs pa rnam pa du ma sems pa na skye ba dang 'jig pa dang 'brel pa'i blo rnams shin tu gsal bar nyams su myong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because when one imagines the many superimpositions without interval, the cognitions related to origination and destruction are very clearly experienced.

original: gzhon nu ma len gyis 'gal ba'i phung po 'di thams cad mthong nas /
analyzed: gzhon nu ma len gyis 'gal ba'i phung po 'di thams cad mthong nas /
translated: Having seen this entire mass of contradictions,üîΩKumarila states, ‚ÄúThe cognitions . . .

original: blo dag kyang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: blo dag kyang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚Äù and so on.

original: blo rnams dang skyes bu ni rtag pa nyid dang / gcig pa nyid du 'dod de /
analyzed: blo rnams dang skyes bu ni rtag pa nyid dang / gcig pa nyid du 'dod de /
translated: He asserts that the cognitions and the person are permanent and one.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: sems ba can gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems ba can gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have the nature of being conscious.

original: skyes bu ni blo'i mtshan nyid kyi sems pa can gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skyes bu ni blo'i mtshan nyid kyi sems pa can gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The person has the nature of being conscious, which is characterized by cognition.

original: kho bo cag ste /
analyzed: kho bo cag ste /
translated: ‚Äú We‚Äù means

original: nged kyi lugs kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nged kyi lugs kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚Äúour system.‚Äù

original: 'o na ji ltar gzugs kyi blo ro'i blo zhes bya ba la sogs pa tha dad du rtogs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar gzugs kyi blo ro'i blo zhes bya ba la sogs pa tha dad du rtogs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Well then, how is it that the cognition of form, the cognition of taste, etc. are understood to be different?

original: yul rten tha dad yin zhe na //
analyzed: yul rten tha dad yin zhe na //
translated: If you say that the difference is due to the difference in the object and the basis,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: etc.

original: zhe na'i sgra ni gzhan gyi lugs khas len pa ste /
analyzed: zhe na'i sgra ni gzhan gyi lugs khas len pa ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúif‚Äù indicates the acceptance of the opponent‚Äôs view.

original: gal te de ltar rtog na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gal te de ltar rtog na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is ‚Äúif you think in this way.‚Äù

original: 'di snyam du gal te blo rtag pa dang gcig pu yin na de'i tshe ci'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rim gyis rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gal te blo rtag pa dang gcig pu yin na de'i tshe ci'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rim gyis rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: If the cognition is permanent and one, then why is it that the object, form, etc. are cognized in sequence?

original: gang gi phyir cig car kho nar rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir cig car kho nar rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: Because it would be cognized all at once,

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems na /
translated: since there would be no difference.

original: dper na rang gi ngo bos me //
analyzed: dper na rang gi ngo bos me //
translated: For example, fire, by its own nature,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: etc.

original: dper na me rtag tu sreg pa'i bdag nyid yin par grag na yang thams cad thams cad kyi tshe sreg pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na me rtag tu sreg pa'i bdag nyid yin par grag na yang thams cad thams cad kyi tshe sreg pa ni ma yin no //
translated: For example, although fire is renowned as always having the nature of burning, it does not burn everything all the time.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Well then, what does it burn?

original: nye ba ste bsnyen pa kho na sreg go / de la yang bsreg par bya ba gang kho na sreg par nus pa de kho nas sreg gi / sprin la sogs pas ni ma yin pa'i phyir bsreg bya zhes smos so //
analyzed: nye ba ste bsnyen pa kho na sreg go / de la yang bsreg par bya ba gang kho na sreg par nus pa de kho nas sreg gi / sprin la sogs pas ni ma yin pa'i phyir bsreg bya zhes smos so //
translated: And since only that which is to be burned is capable of being burned, and not a cloud, for example, the expression ‚Äúthat which is to be burned‚Äù is used.

original: dper na me long zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpe gzhan bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: dper na me long zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpe gzhan bshad pa yin te /
translated: Another example is explained by the words ‚Äúlike a mirror,‚Äù etc.

original: dri ma can la gzugs brnyan snang ba med pa'i phyir dang ba zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: dri ma can la gzugs brnyan snang ba med pa'i phyir dang ba zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The word ‚Äúclear‚Äù is used because a reflection does not appear in a dirty mirror.

original: nyer gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni drung du bzhag pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyer gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni drung du bzhag pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúPlaced near‚Äù means placed in front.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni don la nye bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni don la nye bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúJust so‚Äù indicates the similarity to the example.

original: skyes bu khyab par byed pa yin mod kyi /üîΩ'on kyang ma mthong ba'i @206a * //
analyzed: skyes bu khyab par byed pa yin mod kyi / 'on kyang ma mthong ba'i @206a * //
translated: Although the person is the pervader,

original: dbang gis lus 'di nyid la 'jug pa na mig la sogs pa'i dbang pos byas pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i yul 'dzin pa yin gyi /
analyzed: dbang gis lus 'di nyid la 'jug pa na mig la sogs pa'i dbang pos byas pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i yul 'dzin pa yin gyi /
translated: nevertheless, because he is not seen, when he enters this body, he apprehends objects such as form, etc., through the activity of the sense faculties such as the eyes, etc.,

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: but not otherwise.

original: sems pa can gang yin pa de nyid kho bo cag gi blo ste /
analyzed: sems pa can gang yin pa de nyid kho bo cag gi blo ste /
translated: Whatever is a sentient being is just our cognition.

original: blo gros yin gyi grangs can gyi ba zhin du sems pa can las tha dad pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: blo gros yin gyi grangs can gyi ba zhin du sems pa can las tha dad pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is intelligence, not different from a sentient being, as in the case of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya.

original: gal te de lta na ji ltar 'di'i blo 'jig pa zhes bya bar 'grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di dogs par byas nas bshad pa /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ji ltar 'di'i blo 'jig pa zhes bya bar 'grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di dogs par byas nas bshad pa /
translated: If that is so, how is it established that its cognition is destroyed?

original: de'i phyir dbang po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgyu ston pa nyid nye bar bstan pa na blo 'jig pa nyid sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgyu ston pa nyid nye bar bstan pa na blo 'jig pa nyid sgrub par byed do //
translated: Thus, when he demonstrates that the cause is just the sense faculty, etc., he proves that cognition is destroyed.

original: dbang po ste gzugs la sogs pa'i yul thob par byed pa mig la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po ste gzugs la sogs pa'i yul thob par byed pa mig la sogs pa'o //
translated: The sense faculty is the eye, etc., which obtains the object such as form.

original: de dag gi rtsom pa ni bya ba ste /üîΩde 'jig phyir te /
analyzed: de dag gi rtsom pa ni bya ba ste / de 'jig phyir te /
translated: Its activity is its function.üîΩBecause of its destruction,

original: rnam par 'jig pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par 'jig pa'i phyir /
translated: because of its destruction.

original: blo 'jig par mngon gyi /
analyzed: blo 'jig par mngon gyi /
translated: It is evident that cognition is destroyed.

original: 'di rang las 'jig pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di rang las 'jig pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not destroyed from itself.

original: gal te rang las 'jig pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te rang las 'jig pa ma yin na /
translated: If it is not destroyed from itself,

original: de'i tshe'o na don thams cad rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i klan ka'i gnas skabs de nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe'o na don thams cad rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i klan ka'i gnas skabs de nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: At that time, it is the very occasion of the fault that all objects would be cognized.

original: de'i phyir / dper na rtag tu sreg byed me //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / dper na rtag tu sreg byed me // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúFor example, fire always burns,üîΩbut it does not burn everything.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du blo ni rtag tu don thams cad dmigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du blo ni rtag tu don thams cad dmigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Likewise, the mind does not always observe all objects,

original: dus thams cad du mi nye ba'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: dus thams cad du mi nye ba'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: because it does not approach all objects at all times.

original: ci ste 'di'i blo rtag pa nyid ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste 'di'i blo rtag pa nyid ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
translated: But how is the permanence of the mind to be understood?

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIn that case, etc.‚Äù

original: de la zhes bya ba ni ngag nye bar dgod pa'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni ngag nye bar dgod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case‚Äù introduces the statement.

original: rtogs pa'i bdag nyid yin pas blo blo zhes bya bar ngo shes par bya ba yin pa'i phyir sgra bzhin du blo rtag pa yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i bdag nyid yin pas blo blo zhes bya bar ngo shes par bya ba yin pa'i phyir sgra bzhin du blo rtag pa yin no //
translated: The mind is permanent like the word ‚Äúmind,‚Äù because it is recognized as having the nature of understanding.

original: gal te de lta na 'di ni glang po che'i blo 'o //
analyzed: gal te de lta na 'di ni glang po che'i blo 'o //
translated: But if that is so, then the minds ‚Äúthis is an elephant,‚Äù

original: shing rta'i blo 'o zhes bya ba blo rnams mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'o //
analyzed: shing rta'i blo 'o zhes bya ba blo rnams mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'o //
translated: ‚Äúthis is a horse,‚Äù and ‚Äúthis is a chariot‚Äù are not similar.

original: 'di ci ste 'jig rten na rtogs pa gzhan du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ci ste 'jig rten na rtogs pa gzhan du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúWhy is this not a different cognition in the world?‚Äù

original: bum pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bum pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúA pot, etc.,‚Äù

original: de'i dbye bas zhes bya ba ni glang po la sogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dbye bas zhes bya ba ni glang po la sogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBy its divisions‚Äù means by the differences of elephant, etc.

original: 'di nyid don tha dad pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: 'di nyid don tha dad pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsal bar byed do //
translated: He makes this clear with ‚Äúbecause of the difference in objects,‚Äù etc.

original: don tha dad pa'i rjes 'brang bas //
analyzed: don tha dad pa'i rjes 'brang bas //
translated: ‚ÄúFollowing the difference in objects‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa po rnams kyis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa po rnams kyis so //
translated: means by the cognizers.

original: 'dis ni blo'i blo tha dad pa ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog ba dag gis don tha dad pa nyid kyis byas pa yin no zhes ston par byed de /
analyzed: 'dis ni blo'i blo tha dad pa ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog ba dag gis don tha dad pa nyid kyis byas pa yin no zhes ston par byed de /
translated: This shows that the difference in cognitions is made by the difference in objects through their following and ceasing.

original: ngo shes pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ngo shes pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that recognition does not exist.

original: 'on te glang po zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: 'on te glang po zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: Or, he answers with ‚ÄúAn elephant, etc.,‚Äù etc.

original: gal te blo tha dad pas byas pa kho na yin na de'i tshe gang dag glang po la @206b sogs pas stong pa'i sar rim gyis rta dang glang po la sogs ba mi gnas pa'i sgro 'dogs par byed pa'i shes pa rnams 'jug pa de dag la tha
analyzed: gal te blo tha dad pas byas pa kho na yin na de'i tshe gang dag glang po la @206b sogs pas stong pa'i sar rim gyis rta dang glang po la sogs ba mi gnas pa'i sgro 'dogs par byed pa'i shes pa rnams 'jug pa de dag la tha
translated: If it is only the activity of distinct minds, then the conceptual consciousnesses that superimpose the gradual nonexistence of horses and elephants on the site devoid of horses and elephants and so on would be mistaken consciousnesses.üîΩ

original: dad par rtogs pa ci la rten bar 'gyur /
analyzed: dad par rtogs pa ci la rten bar 'gyur /
translated: If they are produced by different minds, then how could those who engage in the consciousness that superimposes horses and elephants in sequence on the ground that is devoid of elephants and so on rely on the realization of difference?üîΩIt is impossible to posit difference.

original: tha dad pa rnam par gzhag pa'i rten 'ga' yang yod pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tha dad pa rnam par gzhag pa'i rten 'ga' yang yod pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: 'di ltar rang las tha dad pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rang las tha dad pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In this way, difference does not exist from itself,

original: blo thams cad gcig nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo thams cad gcig nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because you accept that all minds are the same.

original: khyad par du byed par 'gyur ba'i yul sna tshogs pa'i phyir yang ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par du byed par 'gyur ba'i yul sna tshogs pa'i phyir yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it because of the variety of objects that are distinguished,

original: der khyad par du byed pa'i don 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der khyad par du byed pa'i don 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no object that is distinguished there.

original: 'di snyam du don gyis stong pa nyid ma grub ste /
analyzed: 'di snyam du don gyis stong pa nyid ma grub ste /
translated: If you think that the emptiness of objects is not established,

original: de skad du yang gzhon nu ma len gyis /
analyzed: de skad du yang gzhon nu ma len gyis /
translated: KumƒÅrila says:

original: rmi lam la sogs shes ba la //
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs shes ba la //
translated: And in the case of dream cognition, etc.,

original: phyi rol rnam kun med mi 'dod //
analyzed: phyi rol rnam kun med mi 'dod //
translated: We do not accept that external objects are totally absent.

original: yul dus gzhan gyi bdag nyid can //
analyzed: yul dus gzhan gyi bdag nyid can //
translated: They are objects of a different time and place,

original: phyi rol kun la dmigs pa yin //
analyzed: phyi rol kun la dmigs pa yin //
translated: And are perceived as external.

original: zhes bshad do zhes bya ba de'i dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bshad do zhes bya ba de'i dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: The following is a response to the above objection:

original: gal te yul sogs gzhan yod pa'i //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

analyzed: rgyu mtshan yin zhes bya ba ni blo rnam par gzhag pa la rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i den to //

original: yul dang dus rnam pa gzhan gyi bdag nyid de /
analyzed: yul dang dus rnam pa gzhan gyi bdag nyid de /

original: yul de dang yul gzhan dang dus gzhan gnas pa rnams 'brel pa med pa nyid ma yin zhing /
analyzed: yul de dang yul gzhan dang dus gzhan gnas pa rnams 'brel pa med pa nyid ma yin zhing /
translated: It is not the case that those objects, other objects, and other times are not related.

original: de bzhin du rim pa nges yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rim pa nges yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And in the same way, there is no definite order.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na ;
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na ;
translated: Why is that?

original: rang gi 'dod pas sgro btags pa'i ngo bo des snang gi //
analyzed: rang gi 'dod pas sgro btags pa'i ngo bo des snang gi //
translated: It is because they appear by the nature that is imputed by their own wish.

original: gzhan ngo bo gzhan gyis snang bar ni rigs pa ma yin te /üîΩha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan ngo bo gzhan gyis snang bar ni rigs pa ma yin te / ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not reasonable that one nature appears as another.

original: de lta yin na thams cad shes pa thams cad kyi yul du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na thams cad shes pa thams cad kyi yul du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it would follow, absurdly, that everything would be the object of every consciousness.

original: de lta yin dang so sor nges pa'i don gyi rnam par gzhag pa chad pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang so sor nges pa'i don gyi rnam par gzhag pa chad pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were the case, then the presentation of the objects of individual consciousnesses would be completely undermined.

original: gzhan yang khyed cag spyod pa'i lugs kyis snang bzhin pa'i rnam pa de ni blo ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang khyed cag spyod pa'i lugs kyis snang bzhin pa'i rnam pa de ni blo ma yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, according to your system of interpretation, the aspect that appears is not the mind.

original: 'on kyang 'di phyi rol gyi don gyi rang bzhin du brjod de /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di phyi rol gyi don gyi rang bzhin du brjod de /
translated: Rather, it is said to be the nature of an external object.

original: rnam pa dang ldan ba ni phyi rol gyi don yin la /
analyzed: rnam pa dang ldan ba ni phyi rol gyi don yin la /
translated: That which possesses the aspect is the external object.

original: blo ni rnam pa med pa yin no zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgal te de ltar gyur na de las @207a * //
analyzed: blo ni rnam pa med pa yin no zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro // gal te de ltar gyur na de las @207a * //
translated: because it has been explained that cognition is devoid of aspects.

original: cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If that is so, what follows from that?

original: brjod par 'dod pa'i yul na ni //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa'i yul na ni //
translated: The object that is intended to be expressed
